name: Hyperleucinemia
description: An increased concentration of leucine in the blood.

name: Cutaneous finger syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two fingers that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal joint of the adjacent fingers.

name: Loss of eyelashes
description: This term refers to the loss of eyelashes that were previously present.

name: Progressive microcephaly
description: Progressive microcephaly is diagnosed when the head circumference falls progressively behind age- and gender-dependent norms.

name: Elevated urinary collagen degradation products
description: Increased level in the urine of a metabolite that results from collagen degradation, e.g., a fragment of a collagen produced by a collagenase or serine protease.

name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset
description: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset is a focal-onset seizure which progresses into a bilateral tonic-clonic phase.
synonyms: Generalised tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset
Generalised tonic-clonic seizure with partial onset
Generalised tonic-clonic seizures with focal onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizure with focal onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizure with partial onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizures with focal onset

name: Maturity-onset diabetes of the young
description: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistance, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells.
synonyms: Maturity onset diabetes of the young

name: Muscle flaccidity
description: A type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching, which results from loss of all or practically all peripheral motor nerves that innervated the muscle. Muscle tone is reduced and the affected muscles undergo extreme atrophy within months of the loss of innervation.

name: Splanchnic vein thrombosis
description: The term splanchnic vein thrombosis encompasses Budd-Chiari syndrome (hepatic vein thrombosis), extrahepatic portal vein obstruction (EHPVO), and mesenteric vein thrombosis; the word splanchnic is used to refer to the visceral organs (of the abdominal cavity).

name: Abnormal nonverbal communicative behavior
description: Abnormalities in eye contact, communicative facial expressions, gesture use, or the use of others' bodies to communicate convey shared meanings within a culture that replace or supplement verbal communication.

name: Abnormality of the gingiva
description: Any abnormality of the gingiva (also known as gums).

name: Bruxism
description: Bruxism is characterized by the grinding of the teeth including the clenching of the jaw and typically occur during sleep.

name: Cytochrome C oxidase-negative muscle fibers
description: An abnormally reduced activity of the enzyme cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue.
synonyms: Cytochrome c oxidase deficiency in skeletal muscle
Decreased activity of cytochrome C oxidase in muscle tissue
Decreased skeletal muscle cytochrome c oxidase activity

name: Conical tooth
description: An abnormal conical form of the teeth, that is, a tooth whose sides converge or taper together incisally.

name: Abnormal erythrocyte enzyme concentration or activity
description: An altered level of any enzyme to act as catalysts within erythrocytes. This term includes changes due to altered activity of an enzyme.

name: Tetraparesis
description: Weakness of all four limbs.

name: Abnormal corneal reflex
description: An anomaly of the corneal reflex that normally induces involuntary blinking of the eyelids following contact of the cornea.

name: Decreased corneal sensation
description: Reduced ability of the cornea to respond to stimulation.

name: Proboscis
description: A fleshy, tube-like structure usually located in the midline of the face or just to one side of the midline.

name: Abnormal uterine cervix morphology
description: An anomaly of the neck of the uterus (lower part of the uterus), called the uterine cervix.

name: Corneal dystrophy
description: The term corneal dystrophy embraces a heterogenous group of bilateral genetically determined non-inflammatory corneal diseases that are restricted to the cornea.

name: Thin ribs
description: Ribs with a reduced diameter.

name: Pedal edema
description: An abnormal accumulation of excess fluid in the lower extremity resulting in swelling of the feet and extending upward to the lower leg.

name: Anterior subcapsular cataract
description: A type of cataract affecting the anterior pole of lens immediately adjacent to ('beneath') the lens capsule.

name: Proximal symphalangism of hands
description: The term proximal symphalangism refers to a bony fusion of the middle and proximal phalanges of the digits of the hand, in other words the proximal interphalangeal joint (PIJ) is missing which can be seen either on x-rays or as an absence of the proximal interphalangeal finger creases.

name: Facial tics
description: Sudden, repetitive, nonrhythmic motor movements (spasms), involving the eyes and muscles of the face.

name: Alopecia universalis
description: Loss of all hair on the entire body.

name: Cor pulmonale
description: Right-sided heart failure resulting from chronic hypertension in the pulmonary arteries and right ventricle.

name: Ventilator dependence with inability to wean
Corneal guttata
description: Corneal guttata are droplet-like accumulations of non-banded collagen on the posterior surface of Descemet's membrane. The presence of focal thickenings of Descemet's membrane histologically named guttae. Cornea guttata can be easily diagnosed in vivo and ex vivo by means of specular microscopy as it gives dark areas where no endothelial cells are visible.

name: Decreased LDL cholesterol concentration
description: An decreased concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Non-convulsive status epilepticus without coma
description: A type of status epilepticus without prominent motor symptoms in the absence of coma.

name: Finger aplasia
description: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of fingers (i.e., aplasia of one or more fingers).

name: Ear pain
description: Pain in the ear can be a consequence of otologic disease (primary or otogenic otalgia), or can arise from pathologic processes and structures other than the ear (secondary or referred otalgia).

name: Abnormal pulmonary valve physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the pumonary valve.

name: Peripheral demyelination
description: A loss of myelin from the internode regions along myelinated nerve fibers of the peripheral nervous system.

name: Neoplasm of the inner ear
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the inner ear.

name: Abnormal circulating thyroglobulin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of thyroglobulin, a protein produced in the thyroid gland that acts as a precursor to thyrroid hormones.

name: Corneal ulceration
description: Disruption of the epithelial layer of the cornea with involvement of the underlying stroma.

name: Heterotaxy
description: An abnormality in which the internal thoraco-abdominal organs demonstrate abnormal arrangement across the left-right axis of the body.

name: EEG with focal spike waves
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Pancreatic islet cell adenoma
description: The presence of an adenoma of the pancreas with origin in a pancreatic B cell.

name: Abnormal coronary artery origin
description: Isolated abnormalities of the coronary artery origins. This may be in associated with other structural heart malformations but not the patterns of complex structural heart malformations which result in abnormal course of the coronary arteries.

name: Abnormal neuron morphology
description: A structural anomaly of a neuron. Neurons are electrically excitable cells that transmit signals throughout the body. Neurons employ both electrical and chemical components in the transmission of information. Neurons are connected to other neurons at synapses and connected to effector organs or cells at neuroeffector junctions.

name: Ankle pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the ankle.

name: Platyspondyly
description: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates.

name: Impaired mastication
description: An abnormal reduction in the ability to masticate (chew), i.e., in the ability to crush and ground food in preparation for swallowing.

name: Perineal hypospadias
description: Hypospadias with location of the urethral meatus in the perineal region.

name: Vasculitis by anatomical site
description: Vasculitis categorized according to the anatomical site where the finding is localized.

name: Premature ovarian insufficiency
description: Amenorrhea due to loss of ovarian function before the age of 40. Primary ovarian insuficiency (POI) is a state of female hypergonadotropic hypogonadism. It can manifest as primary amenorrhea with onset before menarche or secondary amenorrhea.

name: Eye poking
description: Repetitive pressing, poking, and/or rubbing in the eyes.

name: Unusual fungal infection
description: An unusual fungal infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection by a fungal agent.

name: Dysphonia
description: Difficulty in speaking due to a physical disorder of the mouth, tongue, throat, or vocal cords. Associated with a known physical or neurological cause.

name: Muscle abnormality related to mitochondrial dysfunction
Upper eyelid edema
description: Edema in the region of the upper eyelid.

name: Increased sensitivity to ionizing radiation
description: An abnormally increased sensitivity to the effects of ionizing radiation.

name: Sclerocornea
description: A congenital anomaly in which a part or the whole of the cornea acquires the characteristics of sclera, resulting in clouding of the cornea.
synonyms: Hardening of skin and connective tissue

name: Blurred vision
description: Lack of sharpness of vision resulting in the inability to see fine detail.

name: Periventricular leukomalacia
description: Periventricular leukomalacia is characterized by diffuse injury of deep cerebral white matter, accompanied in its most severe form by focal necrosis. The neuropathologic hallmarks of PVL are microglial activation and focal and diffuse periventricular depletion of premyelinating oligodendroglia.

name: Protrusio acetabuli
description: Intrapelvic bulging of the medial acetabular wall.

name: Abnormal total B cell count
description: The absolute number of B cells in the blood, per microliter is above or below the upper limits of normal of the reference range for the appropriate sex and age-group.

name: Complete atrioventricular canal defect
description: A congenital heart defect characterized by a specific combination of heart defects with a common atrioventricular valve, primum atrial septal defect and inlet ventricular septal defect.

name: Abnormal olfactory lobe morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the olfactory lobe, the structure within the brain that receives neural input from the nasal cavity and thereby processes the sense of smell.

name: Postaxial foot polydactyly
description: Polydactyly of the foot most commonly refers to the presence of six toes on one foot. Postaxial polydactyly affects the lateral ray and the duplication may range from a well-formed articulated digit to a rudimentary digit.
synonyms: Extra toe attached near the little toe

name: Slender finger
description: Fingers that are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.

name: Primary hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in the thyroid gland.

name: Slender long bones with narrow diaphyses
description: Reduced diameter of a long bone with a more pronounced reduction of the diameter of the diaphysis of the long bones.
synonyms: Slender long bones with narrow shaft

name: Wide distal femoral metaphysis
description: Increased width of the distal part of the shaft (metaphysis) of the femur.
synonyms: Broad outermost wide portion of thighbone

name: Finger swelling
description: Enlargement of the soft tissues of one or more fingers.

name: Renal salt wasting
description: A high concentration of one or more electrolytes in the urine in the presence of low serum concentrations of the electrolyte(s).

name: Combined immunodeficiency
description: A group of phenotypically heterogeneous genetic disorders characterized by profound deficiencies of T- and B-cell function, which predispose the patients to both infectious and noninfectious complications.

name: Finger agnosia
description: The examiner identified the inability to name, move, or touch specific fingers.

name: Abnormality of prothrombin
description: An anomaly of clotting factor II, which is known as prothrombin, a vitamin K-dependent proenzyme that functions in the blood coagulation cascade.

name: Follicular hyperplasia
description: Lymphadenopathy (enlargement of lymph nodes) owing to hyperplasia of follicular (germinal) centers.

name: Abnormal tissue enzyme concentration or activity
description: Concentration of an enyzme in a tissue is above or between the limit of normal. This term is intended to be used for enzymes that can be measured in multiple tissues other than blood.

name: Delayed gross motor development
description: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the large muscles of the body for walking, running, sitting, and crawling.
synonyms: Delayed attainment of gross motor milestones
Delayed attainment of gross motor skills
Delayed development of gross motor milestones
Delayed development of gross motor skills

name: Abnormal calcification of the carpal bones
synonyms: Abnormal calcification of the wrist bones

name: Diarrhea
description: Abnormally increased frequency (usually defined as three or more) loose or watery bowel movements a day.

name: Hypertension
description: The presence of chronic increased pressure in the systemic arterial system.

name: Acute hepatic failure
description: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as acute if there is onset of encephalopathy within 8 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Macrodontia of permanent maxillary central incisor
description: Increased size of the maxillary central secondary incisor tooth.
synonyms: Hyperplasia of permanent maxillary central incisor
Hypertrophy of permanent maxillary central incisor
Increased size of permanent maxillary central incisor
Increased size of permanent upper central incisor
Increased width of permanent maxillary central incisor
Increased width of permanent upper central incisor

name: Macular hyperpigmentation
description: Increased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

name: Flattened epiphysis
description: Abnormal flatness (decreased height) of epiphyses.

name: Absent pubertal growth spurt
description: The abrupt and transient increase in the annual growth rate normally observed in adolescent individuals does not occur.

name: Pancreatitis
description: The presence of inflammation in the pancreas.

name: Nuchal rigidity
description: Resistance of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated.

name: Abnormal 4th metacarpal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the fourth metacarpal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 4th long bone of hand

name: Abnormality of the anterior commissure
description: An anomaly of the anterior commissure, a bundle of nerve fibers that connect the two cerebral hemispheres across the midline. The anterior commissure plays a role in pain sensation and contains decussating fibers from the olfactory tracts.

name: Enlarged cerebellum
description: An abnormally increased size of the cerebellum compared to other brain structures.

name: Acute infectious pneumonia
description: Acute inflammation of the lung due to an infection.

name: Digestive system neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the digestive system.

name: Polymorphic ventricular tachycardia
description: A type of ventricular tachycardia that is characterized by variable QRS complexes within each lead (i.e., QRS complexes may be different from beat to beat).

name: Receptive language delay
description: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to understand the speech of others.

name: Impotence
description: Inability to develop or maintain an erection of the penis.

name: Pes planus
description: A foot where the longitudinal arch of the foot is in contact with the ground or floor when the individual is standing; or, in a patient lying supine, a foot where the arch is in contact with the surface of a flat board pressed against the sole of the foot by the examiner with a pressure similar to that expected from weight bearing; or, the height of the arch is reduced.

name: Neck muscle weakness
description: Decreased strength of the neck musculature.

name: Abnormal femoral torsion
description: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degrees at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion deviates from this range.

name: Abnormal intrahepatic bile duct morphology
description: An abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct.
synonyms: Abnormality of the intrahepatic bile duct

name: Abnormal ear morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the ear.

name: Anterior uveitis
description: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the anterior chamber.

name: Abnormal morphology of the limbic system
description: Any structural anomaly of the limbic system, a set of midline structures surrounding the brainstem of the mammalian brain, originally described anatomically, e.g., hippocampal formation, amygdala, hypothalamus, cingulate cortex. Although the original designation was anatomical, the limbic system has come to be associated with the system in the brain subserving emotional functions. As such, it is very poorly defined and doesn't correspond closely to the anatomical meaning any longer. [BirnLex].

name: Emotional lability
description: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or disproportionate to events and circumstances.

name: Muscle fiber cytoplasmatic inclusion bodies
description: The presence of inclusion bodies within the cytoplasm of muscle cells. Inclusion bodies are aggregates (deposits) or stainable material, usually misfolded proteins.

name: Absence of stomach bubble on fetal sonography
description: By the 14th week of gestation it is nearly always possible to visualized the fluid-filled fetal stomach bubble on prenatal sonography. This term refers to the absence of a normal fetal stomach bubble on fetal ultrasonography performed at around 16 to 20 weeks' gestation.
synonyms: Absence of stomach bubble on foetal sonography

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex II
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex II, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Abnormality of pain sensation
description: Pain is an unpleasant sensation that can range from mild, localized discomfort to agony, whereby the physical part of pain results from nerve stimulation and is often accompanied by an emotional component. This term groups abnormalities in pain sensation presumed to result from abnormalities related to the specific nerve fibers that carry the pain impulses to the brain.

name: Anterior encephalocele
description: A type of congenital malformation in which brain tissue protrudes through a defect in the anterior (front) part of the skull.

name: Atrial flutter
description: A type of atrial arrhythmia characterized by atrial rates of between 240 and 400 beats per minute and some degree of atrioventricular node conduction block. Typically, the ventricular rate is half the atrial rate. In the EKG; atrial flutter waves are observed as sawtooth-like atrial activity. Pathophysiologically, atrial flutter is a form of atrial reentry in which there is a premature electrical impulse creates a self-propagating circuit.

name: Death in adolescence
description: Death during adolescence, the period between childhood and adulthood (roughly between the ages of 10 and 16 years).

name: Abnormal pineal morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the pineal gland.

name: Iris melanoma
description: Malignant tumor of melanocytes affecting the iris.

name: Hand apraxia
description: Inability to perform purposeful (learned) movements with the hand upon command, even though the command is understood and there is a willingness to perform the movement. Hand apraxia includes the inability to grasp, pick up, and hold large and small objects.

name: Rhizomelic arm shortening
description: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of the arm (i.e. the humerus).

name: Axillary pterygium
description: Presence of a cutaneous membrane (flap) in the armpit.

name: Fingerprint intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a trabecular or fingerprint-like pattern.

name: Abnormality of the intrinsic pathway
description: An abnormality of the intrinsic pathway (also known as the contact activation pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

name: Angulated muscle fibers
description: Normal muscle fibers are polygonal-shaped in cross section, are multinucleated, and have minimal amounts of endomysial connective tissue. In contrast, angulated (also known as angular) muscle fibers have long and narrow vertices (corners) with sharp edges and a pointed tip.

name: Seborrheic dermatitis
description: Seborrheic dermatitis is a form of eczema which is closely related to dandruff. It causes dry or greasy peeling of the scalp, eyebrows, and face, and sometimes trunk.

name: Resting tremor
description: A resting tremor occurs when muscles are at rest and becomes less noticeable or disappears when the affected muscles are moved. Resting tremors are often slow and coarse.

name: Chiari malformation
description: Chiari malformation consists of a downward displacement of the cerebellar tonsils and the medulla through the foramen magnum, sometimes causing hydrocephalus as a result of obstruction of CSF outflow.

name: Poor fine motor coordination
description: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of small muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Fine motor skills are required to mediate movements of the wrists, hands, fingers, feet, and toes.

name: Muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of muscles.

name: Abnormal auditory evoked potentials
description: An abnormality of the auditory evoked potentials, which are used to trace the signal generated by a sound, from the cochlear nerve, through the lateral lemniscus, to the medial geniculate nucleus, and to the cortex.

name: Intestinal lymphangiectasia
description: Angiectasia of lymph vessels (i.e., dilatation of lymphatic vessels) in the intestines.

name: Laryngeal edema
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling in the tissues of the larynx.

name: Scaphocephaly
description: Scaphocephaly is a subtype of dolichocephaly where the anterior and posterior aspects of the cranial vault are pointed (boat-shaped). Scaphocephaly is caused by a precocious fusion of sagittal suture without other associated synostosis.

name: Abnormal mean corpuscular volume
description: A deviation from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells, usually taken to be 80 to 100 femtoliters.

name: Vascular calcification
description: Abnormal calcification of the vasculature.

name: Narrow naris
description: Slender, slit-like aperture of the nostril.

name: Saccadic smooth pursuit
description: An abnormality of tracking eye movements in which smooth pursuit is interrupted by an abnormally high number of saccadic movements.

name: Chorioretinal coloboma
description: Absence of a region of the retina, retinal pigment epithelium, and choroid.
synonyms: Birth defect that causes a hole in the innermost layer at the back of the eye

name: Deformed rib cage
description: Malformation of the rib cage.

name: Severe global developmental delay
description: A severe delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

name: Simple febrile seizure
description: A short generalized seizure, of a duration of <15 min, not recurring within 24 h, occurring during a febrile episode not caused by an acute disease of the nervous system intracranial infection or severe metabolic disturbance.

name: Barrett esophagus
description: An abnormal change (metaplasia) in the cells of the inferior portion of the esophagus. The normal squamous epithelium lining of the esophagus is replaced by metaplastic columnar epithelium. Columnar epithelium refers to a cell type that is typically found in more distal parts of the gastrointestinal system.

name: Abnormal external nose morphology
description: An abnormality of the external nose.

name: Abnormal proximal femoral metaphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of the metaphysis of the proximal femur (close to the hip).
synonyms: Abnormal wide portion of innermost thighbone

name: Abnormal lateral ventricle morphology
description: A morphological anomaly of the lateral ventricle.

name: Small for gestational age
description: Smaller than normal size according to sex and gestational age related norms, defined as a weight below the 10th percentile for the gestational age.

name: Protein-losing enteropathy
description: Abnormal loss of protein from the digestive tract related to excessive leakage of plasma proteins into the lumen of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Abnormal number of teeth
description: The presence of an altered number of of teeth.

name: Polyuria
description: An increased rate of urine production.

name: Highly arched eyebrow
description: Increased height of the central portion of the eyebrow, forming a crescent, semicircular, or inverted U shape.

name: Pancreatic pseudocyst
description: Cyst-like space not lined by epithelium and contained within the pancreas. Pancreatic pseudocysts are often associated with pancreatitis.

name: Abnormal motor evoked potentials
description: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs). MEPs are measured following single-pulse or repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation and can be used for the assessment of the excitability of the motor cortex and the integrity of conduction along the central and peripheral motor pathways.

name: Abnormal cerebellar cortex morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the cortex of the cerebellum.
synonyms: Abnormal morphology of the cerebellar cortex

name: Clumsiness
description: Lack of physical coordination resulting in an abnormal tendency to drop items or bump into objects.

name: Abnormal seventh cranial physiology
description: Abnormality of the seventh cranial nerve sometimes also referred to as the facial nerve.

name: Dysregulated negative emotional state
description: An emotional state characterized by excessive, persistent, or contextually inappropriate negative inner experiences involving emotional arousal and valence. These experiences are often associated with negative perceptions of the self, the future, the past, or the surrounding environment, and may include affective bias such as interpreting neutral or ambiguous stimuli as negative. The intensity, duration, or impact of the state exceeds what would be expected for the individual based on their baseline emotional functioning, the context, cultural norms, or situational triggers, or when it persists despite efforts at self-regulation.

name: Hyperisoleucinemia
description: An increased concentration of isoleucine in the blood.

name: Color vision defect
description: An anomaly in the ability to discriminate between or recognize colors.

name: Abnormal eosinophil morphology
description: An abnormal count or structure of eosinophils.

name: Abnormally increased volition
description: An excessive increase in motivated and goal directed as well as non-goal directed behaviors that are usually accompanied by elevated energy and interest that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action. The increase is often disruptive and typically results in unfavorable consequences.

name: Abnormal activity of mitochondrial respiratory chain
description: An increased or decreased activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain.

name: Abnormality of the plantar skin of foot
description: An abnormality of the plantar part of foot, that is of the soles of the feet.

name: Hypoglycemic coma
description: Coma induced by low blood sugar.
synonyms: Coma caused by low blood sugar
Loss of consciousness due to hypoglycemia

name: Abnormality of endocrine pancreas physiology
description: A function abnormality of the endocrine pancreas.

name: Bradycardia
description: A slower than normal heart rate (in adults, slower than 60 beats per minute).

name: Abnormal circulating nucleobase concentration
description: An abnormality of a nucleobase metabolic process.

name: Abnormal circulating IgM concentration
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgM immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Enterocolitis
description: An inflammation of the colon and small intestine. However, most conditions are either categorized as Enteritis (inflammation of the small intestine) or Colitis (inflammation of the large intestine).

name: Transiently decreased total neutrophil count
description: Abnormal decrease of the absolute number of neutrophils in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group, which persists for less than 3 months and then spontaneously recovers, but does not recur cyclically.

name: Abnormal blood gas level
description: An abnormality of the partial pressure of oxygen or carbon dioxide in the arterial blood.

name: Knee contracture
description: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the knee joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

name: Methylmalonic aciduria
description: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the urine.

name: Severe intrauterine growth retardation
description: Intrauterine growth retardation that is 4 or more standard deviations below average, corrected for sex and gestational age.

name: Hypouricemia
description: An abnormally low level of uric acid in the blood.

name: Neoplasm of the anterior pituitary
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adenohypophysis, which is also known as the anterior lobe of the pituitary gland.

name: Premature arteriosclerosis
description: Arteriosclerosis occurring at an age that is younger than usual.

name: Mottled pigmentation
description: Patchy and irregular skin pigmentation.

name: Demyelinating peripheral neuropathy
description: Demyelinating neuropathy is characterized by slow nerve conduction velocities with reduced amplitudes of sensory/motor nerve conduction and prolonged distal latencies.

name: Low anterior hairline
description: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between the hairline and the glabella.

name: Flat face
description: Absence of concavity or convexity of the face when viewed in profile.

name: Hemihypertrophy
description: Overgrowth of only one side of the body.

name: Abnormal periungual morphology
description: An abnormality of the region around the nails of the fingers or toes.

name: Scleroderma
description: A chronic autoimmune phenomenon characterized by fibrosis (or hardening) and vascular alterations of the skin.

name: Bowing of the vocal cords
description: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the vocal folds.

name: Increased circulating androgen concentration
description: An elevation of the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

name: Macular scar
description: Scar tissue in the macula.

name: Spherocytosis
description: The presence of erythrocytes that are sphere-shaped.

name: Abnormal blood urea nitrogen concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of urea nitrogen in the blood.

name: Focal impaired awareness seizure
description: Focal impaired awareness seizure (or focal seizure with impaired or lost awareness) is a type of focal-onset seizure characterized by some degree (which may be partial) of impairment of the person's awareness of themselves or their surroundings at any point during the seizure.
synonyms: Focal seizure with impairment of awareness
Focal seizure with loss of awareness
Focal seizures with impairment of consciousness or awareness
Localised seizure with loss of awareness
Localized seizure with loss of awareness
Partial seizure with impairment of awareness
Partial seizure with loss of awareness

name: Abnormal hemoglobin concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of hemoglobin in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating isoleucine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of isoleucine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal sperm tail morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the sperm tail.

name: Persistently decreased total neutrophil count
description: Abnormal decrease of the absolute number of neutrophils in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group, which persists for 3 or more months.

name: Methemoglobinemia
description: Abnormally increased levels of methemoglobin in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues.

name: Coronary artery aneurysm
description: Enlargement of the diameter (cross-section) of a coronary artery as defined by a focal dilation of a segment at least 1.5 times larger than the reference vessel.

name: Episodic metabolic acidosis
description: Repeated transient episodes of metabolic acidosis, that is, of the buildup of acid or depletion of base due to accumulation of metabolic acids.

name: Abnormal duodenum morphology
description: An abnormality of the duodenum, i.e., the first section of the small intestine.

name: Profound global developmental delay
description: A profound delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

name: Scarring alopecia of scalp
synonyms: Hair loss on scalp from scarring condition

name: Metabolic alkalosis
description: Metabolic alkalosis is defined as a disease state where the pH is elevated to greater than 7.45 secondary to some metabolic process.

name: Bifid ureter
description: Incomplete duplication of the ureter.

name: Increased circulating aldosterone concentration
description: Overproduction of the mineralocorticoid aldosterone by the adrenal cortex.

name: Cerebellar atrophy
description: Cerebellar atrophy is defined as a cerebellum with initially normal structures, in a posterior fossa with normal size, which displays enlarged fissures (interfolial spaces) in comparison to the foliae secondary to loss of tissue. Cerebellar atrophy implies irreversible loss of tissue and result from an ongoing progressive disease until a final stage is reached or a single injury, e.g. an intoxication or infectious event.

name: Subdural hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the arachnoid mater.

name: Adrenocortical carcinoma
description: A malignant neoplasm of the adrenal cortex that may produce hormones such as cortisol, aldosterone, estrogen, or testosterone.

name: Broad phalanges of the hand
description: Increased width of the phalanges of the hand.
synonyms: Widening of phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormal lower limb epiphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of one or both legs.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of end part of lower limb end bone
Abnormality involving the epiphyses of the lower limbs
Abnormality of lower limb epiphysis morphology

name: Abnormal shoulder morphology
description: An abnormality of the shoulder, which is defined as the structures surrounding the shoulder joint where the humerus attaches to the scapula.

name: Myocarditis
description: Inflammation of the myocardium.

name: Mixed hearing impairment
description: A type of hearing loss resulting from a combination of conductive hearing impairment and sensorineural hearing impairment.

name: Small placenta
description: Reduced size of the placenta.

name: Dynein arm defect of respiratory motile cilia
description: An anomaly of the dynein arms of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Focal sensory seizure
description: A focal sensory seizure is a type seizure beginning with a subjective sensation.

name: Enlarged kidney
description: An abnormal increase in the size of the kidney.

name: Albinism
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of skin, hair and eye (iris and retina).

name: Osseous finger syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones.

name: Tall chin
description: Increased vertical distance from the vermillion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.

name: Myotonia
description: An involuntary and painless delay in the relaxation of skeletal muscle following contraction or electrical stimulation.
synonyms: Delayed relaxation of muscle fibers after contraction
Delayed relaxation of muscle fibres after contraction

name: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth
description: An abnormality of the fetus or the birth of the fetus, excluding structural abnormalities.
synonyms: Abnormality of prenatal development or birth

name: Humeroradial synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the humerus.
synonyms: Fusion of upper and lower arm bones

name: Split foot
description: A condition in which middle parts of the foot (toes and metatarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe over absent 2nd or 3rd toes as far as oligo- or monodactyl feet.

name: Acetabular spurs
description: The presence of osteophytes (bone spurs), i.e., of bony projections originating from the acetabulum.

name: Abnormal exteroceptive sensation
description: A type of somatic sensory dysfunction characterized by abnormality of superficial sensation that is mediated by receptors in skin and mucous membranes.

name: Abnormal metabolic brain imaging by MRS
description: An anomaly of metabolism in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Hypovolemic shock
description: A state of shock characterized by decreased circulating blood volume in relation to total vascular capacity. This type of shock is characterized by a reduction of diastolic filling pressures.

name: Dermal translucency
description: An abnormally increased ability of the skin to permit light to pass through (translucency) such that subcutaneous structures such as veins display an increased degree of visibility.

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal cortex
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the adrenal cortex.

name: Abnormal renal morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the kidney.
synonyms: Structural anomalies of the renal tract

name: Enlarged posterior fossa
description: Abnormal increased size of the posterior cranial fossa.

name: Abnormal abdomen morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the abdomen ('belly'), that is, the part of the body between the pelvis and the thorax.

name: Hematochezia
description: The passage of fresh (red) blood per anus, usually in or with stools. Most rectal bleeding comes from the colon, rectum, or anus.

name: Lumbar hyperlordosis
description: An abnormal accentuation of the inward curvature of the spine in the lumbar region.
synonyms: Excessive inward curvature of lower spine

name: Phocomelia
description: Missing or malformed long bones of the extremities with the distal parts (such as hands and/or feet) connected to the variably shortened or even absent extremity, leading to a flipper-like appearance, as opposed to other forms of limb malformations were either the hole limb is missing (such as amelia), or the distal part of a limb is absent (peromelia).

name: Premature pubarche
description: The onset of growth of pubic hair at an earlier age than normal.

name: Widened cerebellar subarachnoid space
description: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebellum.

name: Cerebral visual impairment
description: A form of loss of vision caused by damage to the visual cortex rather than a defect in the eye.

name: Abnormality of the lower urinary tract
description: An abnormality of the lower urinary tract.

name: Abnormal retinal vascular morphology
description: A structural abnormality of retinal vasculature.

name: Hypoketotic hypoglycemia
description: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood associated with a reduced concentration of ketone bodies.

name: Chronic rhinitis
description: Chronic inflammation of the nasal mucosa.

name: Prominent forehead
description: Forward prominence of the entire forehead, due to protrusion of the frontal bone.

name: Fibroadenoma of the breast
description: A benign biphasic tumor of the breast with epithelial and stromal components.

name: Nail dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the nail.

name: Abnormal energy expenditure
description: Any anomaly in the utilization of energy (calories).

name: Abnormality of humoral immunity
description: An abnormality of the humoral immune system, which comprises antibodies produced by B cells as well as the complement system.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial mottling
description: Mottling (spots or blotches with different shades) of the retinal pigment epithelium, i.e., localized or generalized fundal pigment granularity associated with processes at the level of the retinal pigment epithelium.
synonyms: Focal hypopigmentation of the retinal pigment epithelium

name: Dilated third ventricle
description: An increase in size of the third ventricle.

name: Abnormal phalangeal joint morphology of the hand
synonyms: Abnormality of phalangeal joints of the hand
Abnormality of the small joints of the hand

name: Abnormal urine sodium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of sodium in the urine.

name: Abnormal toe phalanx morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of the long bones of the toes
Abnormality of the phalanges of the toes

name: Pica
description: An appetite for and the persistent ingestion of non-food substances such as clay. In order to diagnose pica, this behavior must have persisted over a period of at least one month.

name: Abnormal joint morphology
description: An abnormal structure or form of the joints, i.e., one or more of the articulations where two bones join.

name: Short greater sciatic notch
description: The sacroiliac joint in the bony pelvis connects the sacrum and the ilium of the pelvis, which are joined by strong ligaments. The notch is located directly superior to the joint. This term refers to a reduction in the height of the notch.

name: Abnormal circulating carboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Skin appendage neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from the hair follicles, sebaceous glands, or sweat glands.

name: Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue in limbs
description: Loss (disappearance) of previously present subcutaneous fat tissue in arm or leg.
synonyms: Loss of fat tissue below the skin in limbs
Loss of subcutaneous adipose tissue from extremities

name: Membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
description: A type of glomerulonephritis characterized by diffuse mesangial cell proliferation and the thickening of capillary walls due to subendothelial extension of the mesangium. The term membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis is often employed to denote a general pattern of glomerular injury seen in a variety of disease processes that share a common pathogenetic mechanism, rather than to describe a single disease entity

name: Failure of eruption of permanent teeth
description: Lack of tooth eruption of the secondary dentition.
synonyms: Failure of eruption of adult teeth

name: Action tremor
description: A tremor present when the limbs are active, either when outstretched in a certain position or throughout a voluntary movement.

name: Achromatopsia
description: A condition where the retina contains no functional cone cells, so that in addition to the absence of color discrimination, vision in lights of normal intensity is difficult.

name: Limitation of knee mobility
description: An abnormal limitation of knee joint mobility.

name: Exaggerated median tongue furrow
description: Increased depth of the median tongue furrow.

name: Multiple myeloma
description: A malignant plasma cell tumor growing within soft tissue or within the skeleton.

name: Neoplasm of fatty tissue
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of adipose tissue.

name: Lateral clavicle hook
description: An excessive upward convexity of the lateral clavicle.

name: Abnormal pituitary gland morphology
description: An anomaly of the pituitary gland.

name: Insulin resistance
description: Increased resistance towards insulin, that is, diminished effectiveness of insulin in reducing blood glucose levels.
synonyms: Body fails to respond to insulin

name: Oroticaciduria
description: An increased concentration of orotic acid in the urine.

name: Abnormal QRS complex
description: An anomaly of the complex formed by the Q, R, and S waves, which occur in rapid succession on the electrocardiogram.

name: Epididymitis
description: The presence of inflammation of the epididymis.

name: Poor appetite
description: A reduced desire to eat.

name: Abnormality of the neck
description: An abnormality of the neck.

name: Abnormal sleep architecture
description: Interruptions during the various stages of sleep.

name: Upper limb postural tremor
description: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding an arm in a fixed position.

name: Cachexia
description: Severe weight loss, wasting of muscle, loss of appetite, and general debility related to a chronic disease.

name: Macular thickening
description: Abnormal increase in retinal thickness in the macular area observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.

name: Short 1st metacarpal
description: A developmental defect characterized by reduced length of the first metacarpal (long bone) of the hand.

name: Digenic inheritance
description: A type of multifactorial inheritance governed by the simultaneous action of two gene loci.

name: Autoimmune thrombocytopenia
description: The presence of thrombocytopenia in combination with detection of antiplatelet antibodies.

name: Flat acetabular roof
description: Flattening of the superior part of the acetabulum, which is a cup-shaped cavity at the base of the hipbone into which the ball-shaped head of the femur fits. The acetabular roof thereby appears horizontal rather than arched, as it normally does.

name: Cafe-au-lait spot
description: Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.

name: Tongue muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the tongue musculature, resulting in difficulties moving the tongue and possible accompanied by dysarthria or dysphagia.

name: Submucous cleft soft palate
description: A cleft of the muscular (soft) portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane. Soft-palate submucous clefts are characterized by a midline deficiency or lack of muscle tissue.

name: Thin upper lip vermilion
description: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).
synonyms: Decreased height of upper lip vermilion
Decreased volume of upper lip vermilion
Thin vermilion border of upper lip
Thin red part of the upper lip

name: Menometrorrhagia
description: Prolonged/excessive menses and bleeding at irregular intervals.

name: Broad nail
description: Increased width of nail.

name: Acephalic spermatozoa
description: Spermatozoa with very small cranial ends devoid of any nuclear material, that is, lacking a typical sperm head.

name: Abnormal head blood vessel morphology
description: An abnormality of a blood vessel of the head, including branches of the arterial and venous systems of the head.
synonyms: Abnormality of blood vessel of head

name: Positional foot deformity
description: A foot deformity resulting due to an abnormality affecting the muscle and soft tissue. In contrast if the bones of the foot are affected the term structural foot deformity applies.

name: Abnormal morphology of the musculature of the neck
description: An abnormality of the neck musculature.
synonyms: Abnormality of the musculature of the neck

name: Abnormal foot morphology
description: An abnormality of the skeleton of foot.

name: Elevated urinary delta-aminolevulinic acid
description: An increased concentration of 5-aminolevulinic acid (CHEBI:17549) in the urine.

name: Restrictive behavior
description: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to a few interests and activities.

name: Psychotic episodes
description: Periods of time during which an individual experiences significant disturbances in their thoughts, perceptions, emotions, and behavior, resulting in a loss of touch with reality. These episodes are hallmark features of psychotic disorders such as schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, and certain forms of bipolar disorder.

name: Hypoplastic aortic arch
description: Underdevelopment of the arch of aorta.

name: Hamartomatous polyposis
description: Polyp-like protrusions which are histologically hamartomas. These can occur throughout the gastrointestinal tract. Hamartomatous polyps are composed of the normal cellular elements of the gastrointestinal tract, but have a markedly distorted architecture.

name: Wide femoral metaphysis
synonyms: Broad wide portion of thigh bone

name: Dental malocclusion
description: Dental malocclusion refers to an abnormality of the occlusion, or alignment, of the teeth and the way the upper and lower teeth fit together, resulting in overcrowding of teeth or in abnormal bite patterns.
synonyms: Incorrect relation between upper and lower dental arches
Malalignment of upper and lower dental arches
Misalignment of upper and lower dental arches

name: Adrenocortical cytomegaly
description: The presence of large polyhedral cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and enlarged nuclei in the adrenal cortex.

name: Aplasia of the bladder
description: Aplasia (absence) of the urinary bladder.

name: Cleft upper lip
description: A gap or groove in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development.

name: Flat cornea
description: Cornea plana is an abnormally flat shape of the cornea such that the normal protrusion of the cornea from the sclera is missing. The reduced corneal curvature can lead to hyperopia, and a hazy corneal limbus and arcus lipoides may develop at an early age.

name: Ridged fingernail
description: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the fingernail plate.

name: Pill-rolling tremor
description: A type of resting tremor characterized by simultaneous rubbing movements of thumb and index fingers against each other.

name: Bilateral superior vena cava
description: The presence of a left and a right superior vena cava.

name: Bilateral renal hypoplasia
description: Two sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

name: Recurrent aspiration pneumonia
description: Increased susceptibility to aspiration pneumonia, defined as pneumonia due to breathing in foreign material, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of aspiration pneumonia.

name: Dolichocephaly
description: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a increased anterior-posterior diameter, i.e., an increased antero-posterior dimension of the skull. Cephalic index less than 76%. Alternatively, an apparently increased antero-posterior length of the head compared to width. Often due to premature closure of the sagittal suture.

name: Sinus bradycardia
description: Bradycardia related to a mean resting sinus rate of less than 50 beats per minute.

name: Abnormal scrotal rugation
description: Anomaly of the folded ridges (wrinkles) of skin of the scrotum.

name: Reduced forced expiratory volume in one second
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can forcefully expel in one second.

name: Insulinoma
description: A type of tumor of the pancreatic beta cells that secretes excess insulin and can result in hypoglycemia.

name: Abnormal prosody
description: Prosody refers to the patterns of rhythm, stress, and intonation in spoken language. Abnormal prosody refers to abnormalities in the patterns of rhythm, stress, or intonation of speech or vocalization that can be heard by the observer. In general, this refers to overt and clear deviations in patterns from culturally accepted norms but many also include differences noted in comparison to the usual patterns of the individual (a quiet person suddenly becomes loud or vice versa).

name: Delayed epiphyseal ossification
synonyms: Delayed maturation of end part of long bone

name: Few cafe-au-lait spots
description: The presence of two to five cafe-au-lait macules.

name: Lower eyelid coloboma
description: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower eyelid.
synonyms: Full thickness defect of the lower eyelid

name: Cerebellar dentate nucleus calcification
description: Pathological deposition of calcium salts in the dentate nucleus of the cerebellum.

name: EEG with photoparoxysmal response
description: EEG abnormalities (epileptiform discharges) evoked by flashing lights or black and white striped patterns.

name: Exercise-induced rhabdomyolysis
description: Rhabdomyolysis induced by exercise.

name: Preauricular hair displacement
description: An tongue-like extension of hair towards the cheeks, in which hair growth extends in front of the ear to the lateral cheekbones.
synonyms: Hair displacement, preauricular, towards lateral cheekbone
Projection of scalp hair onto lateral cheek

name: Abnormal drinking behavior
description: Abnormal consumption of fluids with excessive or insufficient consumption of fluid or any other abnormal pattern of fluid consumption.

name: Entrapment neuropathy
description: Malfunction of a peripheral nerve resulting from mechanical compression of the nerve roots from internal or external causes and leading to a conduction block or axonal loss.

name: Hallux varus
description: Medial deviation of the great toe owing to a deformity of the great toe joint causing the hallux to deviate medially.

name: 3-Methylglutaric aciduria
description: An abnormally increased level of 3-hydroxy-3-methylglutaric acid in the urine.

name: Fulminant hepatic failure
description: Hepatic failure refers to the inability of the liver to perform its normal synthetic and metabolic functions, which can result in coagulopathy and alteration in the mental status of a previously healthy individual. Hepatic failure is defined as fulminant if there is onset of encephalopathy within 4 weeks of the onset of symptoms in a patient with a previously healthy liver.

name: Abnormal pulmonary valve morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the pulmonary valve.

name: Y-shaped metacarpals
description: Y-shaped metacarpals are the result of a partial fusion of two metacarpal bones, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen in combination with polydactyly.

name: Fetal akinesia sequence
description: Decreased fetal activity associated with multiple joint contractures, facial anomalies and pulmonary hypoplasia. Ultrasound examination may reveal polyhydramnios, ankylosis, scalp edema, and decreased chest movements (reflecting pulmonary hypoplasia).

name: Tessier cleft
description: A congenital malformation with a cleft (gap or opening) in the face.

name: Lymphangioma
description: Lymphangiomas are rare congenital malformations consisting of focal proliferations of well-differentiated lymphatic tissue in multi cystic or sponge like structures. Lymphangioma is usually asymptomatic due to its soft consistency but compression of adjacent structures can be seen due to the mass effect of a large tumor.

name: Large placenta
description: Increased size of the placenta.

name: Distal peripheral sensory neuropathy
description: Peripheral sensory neuropathy affecting primarily distal sensation.

name: Cholangitis
description: Inflammation of the biliary ductal system, affecting the intrahepatic or extrahepatic portions, or both.

name: 4-5 toe cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 4 and 5.

name: Prenatal death
description: Death of a fetus in the uterus.

name: Acute myeloid leukemia
description: A form of leukemia characterized by overproduction of an early myeloid cell.

name: Lacrimal duct aplasia
description: A congenital defect resulting in absence of the lacrimal duct.

name: Vasculitis
description: Inflammation of blood vessel.

name: Aspiration
description: Inspiration of a foreign object into the airway.

name: Pheochromocytoma
description: Pheochromocytomas (also known as chromaffin tumors) produce, store, and secrete catecholamines. Pheochromocytomas usually originate from the adrenal medulla but may also develop from chromaffin cells in or about sympathetic ganglia. A common symptom of pheochromocytoma is hypertension owing to release of catecholamines.

name: Sinus tachycardia
description: Heart rate of greater than 100 beats per minute.

name: Abnormality iris morphology
description: An abnormality of the iris, which is the pigmented muscular tissue between the cornea and the lens, that is perforated by an opening called the pupil.

name: Sclerotic vertebral endplates
description: Sclerosis (increased density) affecting vertebral end plates.

name: Hypoplastic sacrum
description: A developmental defect characterized by undergrowth of the sacrum, which is a large, triangular bone at the base of the spine that forms by the fusing of the sacral vertebrae (S1-S5).

name: Swollen lip
description: Enlargement of the lip typically due to fluid buildup or inflammation.

name: Naevus flammeus of the eyelid
description: Naevus flammeus localized in the skin of the eyelid.

name: Acromelia
description: Shortening of the extremities affecting primarily the distal parts of the limbs (hands and feet) in relation to the other segments of the limbs.

name: Multiple renal cysts
description: The presence of many cysts in the kidney.

name: Frequent temper tantrums
description: Temper tantrums that occur more frequently compared to the temper tantrums that are a part of the normal developmental process.

name: Carotid artery tortuosity
description: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the carotid arteries.

name: Shoulder dislocation
description: A displacement or misalignment of the humerus with respect to the other bones of the should joint. Note that a subluxation is a partial dislocation.

name: Weakness of long finger extensor muscles
Hand muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the musculature of the hand.

name: Iris hypopigmentation
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation of the iris.

name: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract
description: An abnormality of the upper urinary tract.
synonyms: Abnormality of the upper urinary tract

name: Tissue ischemia
description: Ischemia is defined as a restriction of arterial blood supply to a tissue associated with insufficient oxygenation to support the metabolis requirements of the tissue. Depending on the involved tissues, clinical manifestations may include pain, pallor, lack of pulse, coldness, paresthesia, and paralysis. Additional associated manifestations include hemodynamic parameters (reduced blood pressure distal to the site of restricted arterial supply) and angiographic evidence of arterial occclusion.

name: Small vessel vasculitis
description: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects blood vessels that are smaller than arteries, i.e., arterioles, venules, and capilllaries.

name: Narrow mouth
description: Distance between the commissures of the mouth more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

name: Large fontanelles
description: In newborns, the two frontal bones, two parietal bones, and one occipital bone are joined by fibrous sutures, which form a small posterior fontanelle, and a larger, diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle. These regions allow for the skull to pass the birth canal and for later growth. The fontanelles gradually ossify, whereby the posterior fontanelle usually closes by eight weeks and the anterior fontanelle by the 9th to 16th month of age. Large fontanelles are diagnosed if the fontanelles are larger than age-dependent norms.

name: Inflammation of the large intestine
description: Inflammation, or an inflammatory state in the large intestine.

name: Severe temper tantrums
description: Temper tantrums, which occur with more severe symptomatology compared to a temper tantrum that occurs as a part of normal developmental process.

name: Stiff skin
description: An induration (hardening) of the skin

name: Rhinitis
description: Inflammation of the nasal mucosa with nasal congestion.

name: Abnormal liver physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the liver.

name: Decreased circulating parathyroid hormone level
description: An abnormally decreased concentration of parathyroid hormone.

name: Microphallus
description: Length of penis more than 2 SD below the mean for age accompanied by hypospadias.

name: Chondrocalcinosis
description: Radiographic evidence of articular calcification that represent calcium pyrophosphate depositions in soft tissue surrounding joints and at the insertions of tendons near joints (Entheses/Sharpey fibers) .

name: Urinary incontinence
description: Loss of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination.

name: Abnormal sternal ossification
description: Any anomaly in the formation of the bony substance of the sternum.

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd toe
synonyms: Abnormality of the bones of the 3rd toe

name: Absent patellar reflexes
description: Absence of the knee jerk reflex, which can normally be elicited by tapping the patellar tendon with a reflex hammer just below the patella.

name: Decreased total granulocyte count
description: Abnormal decrease of absolute number of granulocytes in the blood, per microliter, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Short face
description: Facial height (length) is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparent decrease in the height (length) of the face (subjective).

name: Venous malformation
description: A vascular malformation resulting from a developmental error of venous tissue composed of dysmorphic channels lined by flattened endothelium and exhibiting slow turnover. A venous malformation may present as a blue patch on the skin ranging to a soft blue mass. Venous malformations are easily compressible and usually swell in thewhen venous pressure increases (e.g., when held in a dependent position or when a child cries). They may be relatively localized or quite extensive within an anatomic region.

name: Ectopic anterior pituitary gland
description: Abnormal anatomic location of the anterior pituitary gland.

name: Complete right bundle branch block
description: A conduction block of the right branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a prolongation of the QRS complex (greater than 0.12 s) with delayed activation of the right ventricle and terminal delay on the EKG.

name: Congenital giant melanocytic nevus
description: The giant congenital nevus is greater than 8 cm in size, pigmented and often hairy. A giant congenital nevus is smaller in infants and children, but it usually continues to grow with the child.

name: EEG with generalized polyspikes
description: EEG with repetitive generalized sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: Skin erosion
description: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting incomplete loss of the epidermis, a lesion that is moist, circumscribed, and usually depressed.

name: Single naris
description: The presence of only a single nostril.

name: Decreased head circumference
description: An abnormally reduced head circumference in a growing child. Head circumference is measured with a nonelastic tape and comprises the distance from above the eyebrows and ears and around the back of the head. The measured HC is then plotted on an appropriate growth chart. Microcephaly is defined as a head circumference (HC) that is great than two standard deviations below the mean of age- and gender-matched population based samples. Severe microcephaly is defined with an HC that is three standard deviations below the mean.

name: Diffuse optic disc pallor
description: A pale yellow discoloration of the entire optic disc.

name: Late-onset proximal muscle weakness
description: Lack of strength of the proximal musculature occurring late in the clinical course.

name: Abnormal larynx physiology
description: Any anomaly of the function of the larynx.

name: Delirium
description: A state of sudden and severe confusion.

name: Conjunctival hyperemia
description: Dilatation of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva leading to a red appearance of the sclera.

name: Chiari type I malformation
description: Arnold-Chiari type I malformation refers to a relatively mild degree of herniation of the posteroinferior region of the cerebellum (the cerebellar tonsils) into the cervical canal with little or no displacement of the fourth ventricle. It is characterized by one or both pointed (not rounded) cerebellar tonsils that project 5 mm below the foramen magnum, measured by a line drawn from the basion to the opisthion (McRae Line)

name: Pulmonary lymphangiectasia
description: Abnormal dilatation of the pulmonary lymphatic vessels. Lymphatic fluid in the lung is derived from normal leakage of fluid out of the blood capillaries in the lung. In pulmonary lymphangiectasia, the pulmonary lymphatics are not properly connected and become dilated with fluid.

name: Hypoplastic philtrum
description: Underdevelopment of the philtrum.

name: Perseverative thought
description: The repetitive production of the same response to different commands.

name: Upper limb hyperreflexia
description: Increased intensity of the a reflex in the arm.

name: Left ventricular hypertrophy
description: Enlargement or increased size of the heart left ventricle.

name: X-linked inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome.

name: Epicanthus
description: A fold of skin starting above the medial aspect of the upper eyelid and arching downward to cover, pass in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

name: Facial hypotonia
description: Reduced muscle tone of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Thenar muscle atrophy
description: Wasting of thenar muscles, which are located on palm of the hand at the base of the thumb.

name: 2-hydroxyglutarate aciduria
description: The concentration of 2-hydroxyglutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Atrophic scars
description: Scars that form a depression compared to the level of the surrounding skin because of damage to the collagen, fat or other tissues below the skin.
synonyms: Sunken or indented skin due to damage

name: Retrobulbar optic neuritis
description: Optic neuritis that occurs in the section of the optic nerve located behind the eyeball.

name: Dimple chin
description: A persistent midline depression of the skin over the fat pad of the chin.

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 2nd finger
description: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 2nd (index) finger.

name: Cigarette-paper scars
description: Thin (atrophic) and wide scars.

name: Multiple suture craniosynostosis
description: Craniosynostosis involving at least 2 cranial sutures, where the exact pattern of sutures fused has not been precisely specified.

name: Hypermethioninemia
description: An increased concentration of methionine in the blood.

name: Sagittal craniosynostosis
description: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the sagittal suture.
synonyms: Early closure of midline skull joint

name: Abnormal circulating aspartate family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of an aspartate family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Amaurosis fugax
description: A transient visual disturbance that is typically caused by a circulatory, ocular or neurological underlying condition.

name: Osteopathia striata
description: A lamellar pattern visible on radiographs and mainly localized at the metaphyses of the long tubular bones. Pathologic-anatomical studies revealed that these benign signs on x-rays are the result of a juvenile metaphyseal bone necrosis. Calcifications in the necrotic marrow lead to this lamellar or lattice-like appearance.

name: Diffuse cerebellar atrophy
description: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebellum.

name: Femur fracture
description: A break or crush injury of the thigh bone (femur).

name: Abnormal hallux morphology
description: This term applies for all abnormalities of the big toe, also called hallux.

name: Abnormality of the first metatarsal bone
description: An anomaly of the first metatarsal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 1st long bone of foot

name: Patellar dislocation
description: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar dislocation occurs if the patella fully dislocates out of the groove.

name: Organic aciduria
description: Excretion of non-amino organic acids in urine.

name: Shoulder girdle muscle weakness
description: The shoulder, or pectoral, girdle is composed of the clavicles and the scapulae. Shoulder-girdle weakness refers to lack of strength of the muscles attaching to these bones, that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders.

name: Severe viral infection
description: An unusually severe viral infection.

name: Abnormal parotid gland morphology
description: Any abnormality of the parotid glands, which are the salivary glands that are located in the subcutaneous tissues of the face overlying the mandibular ramus and anterior and inferior to the external ear.

name: Silver-gray hair
description: Hypopigmented hair that appears silver-gray.

name: Hypopigmentation of the skin
description: A reduction of skin color related to a decrease in melanin production and deposition.

name: Glucocortocoid-insensitive primary hyperaldosteronism
description: A form of primary hyperaldosteronism in which the overproduction of aldosterone cannot be suppressed by the administration of dexamethasone or similar glucocorticoids.

name: Phenotypic variability
description: A variability of phenotypic features.
synonyms: Highly variable phenotype, even within families

name: Abnormal tongue physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the tongue.

name: Abnormality of blood circulation
description: An abnormality of blood circulation.

name: Progressive hearing impairment
description: A progressive form of hearing impairment.

name: Facial hemangioma
description: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells, occurring in the face.

name: Secundum atrial septal defect
description: A kind of atrial septum defect arising from an enlarged foramen ovale, inadequate growth of the septum secundum, or excessive absorption of the septum primum.
synonyms: Atrial septal defect, ostium secundum type

name: Vascular granular osmiophilic material deposition
description: Accumulation of granular osmiophilic material in blood vessel walls. Osmiophilic material becomes black upon staining with osmium tetroxide. Deposition of granular osmiophilic material (GOM) is the vascular pathological hallmark of CADASIL, which is the most prevalent hereditary small vessel disease and is caused by missense mutations in the NOTCH3 gene. GOM have been shown to contain NOTCH3 ectodomain (NOTCH3ECD) and extracellular matrix proteins, and can be visualized ultrastructurally in the tunica media of small arteries and capillaries. These electron dense GOM deposits are located in the basement membrane of mural cells, i.e. vascular smooth muscle cells and pericytes. In both manifest and pre-manifest CADASIL patients, GOM deposits are present not only in brain vessels, but also in vessels of other organs, such as the skin.

name: Hip dislocation
description: Displacement of the femur from its normal location in the hip joint.

name: Recurrent long bone fractures
description: An increased tendency to fractures of the long bones (Mainly, the femur, tibia, fibula, humerus, radius, and ulna).

name: Abnormality of chromosome segregation
description: An abnormality of chromosome segregation.

name: Lymph node hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the lymph nodes.

name: Portal fibrosis
description: Fibroblast proliferation and fiber expansion from the portal areas to the lobule.

name: Generalized dystonia
description: A type of dystonia that affects all or most of the body.

name: Infra-orbital fold
description: Elevated ridge(s) of skin starting well below the medial aspect of the lower lid that curves gradually upward toward and/or across the nasal bridge.

name: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia
description: Juvenile myelomonocytic leukemia (JMML) is a lethal myeloproliferative disease of young childhood characterized clinically by overproduction of myelomonocytic cells and by the in vitro phenotype of hematopoietic progenitor hypersensitivity to granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.

name: Gangrene
description: A serious and potentially life-threatening condition that arises when a considerable mass of body tissue dies (necrosis).
synonyms: Death of body tissue due to lack of blood flow or infection

name: Ankyloblepharon
description: Partial fusion of the upper and lower eyelid margins by single or multiple bands of tissue.

name: Absent inner dynein arms
description: Absence of the inner dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated within the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal circulating lysine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of lysine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal anatomic location of the heart
description: Developmental defect characterized by an anomalous anatomic location of the heart.

name: Intervertebral disk degeneration
description: The presence of degenerative changes of intervertebral disk.

name: Peroneal muscle atrophy
description: Atrophy of the peroneous muscles, peroneus longus (also known as Fibularis longus), Peroneus brevis (also known as fibularis brevis, and Peroneus tertius (also known as fibularis tertius).

name: Abnormal mastoid morphology
description: An abnormality of the mastoid process, which is the conical prominence projecting from the undersurface of the mastoid portion of the temporal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of mastoid process of temporal bone

name: Vomiting
description: Forceful ejection of the contents of the stomach through the mouth by means of a series of involuntary spasmic contractions.

name: Recurrent cutaneous fungal infections
description: Increased susceptibility to cutaneous fungal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of cutaneous fungal infections.

name: Leukoencephalopathy
description: This term describes abnormality of the white matter of the cerebrum resulting from damage to the myelin sheaths of nerve cells.

name: Abnormality of fibrinolysis
description: Clinical phenotype characterized by delayed bleeding accelerated break down of blood clot (fibrinolysis)

name: Neoplasm of the thymus
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thymus.

name: Deep philtrum
description: Accentuated, prominent philtral ridges giving rise to an exaggerated groove in the midline between the nasal base and upper vermillion border.

name: Angina pectoris
description: Paroxysmal chest pain that occurs with exertion or stress and is related to myocardial ischemia.

name: Cervical kyphosis
