description: Exaggerated convexity of the cervical vertebral column, causing the cervical spine to bow outwards and take on a rounded appearance.

name: Abnormal femur morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the femur.

name: Muscle fiber tubular inclusions
description: Unusual regions of densely packed membranous tubules known as tubular aggregates which present as membranous inclusions, derived from membranes of sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondria, containing miscellaneous proteins with a variety of enzymatic activities.

name: Central heterochromia
description: The presence of distinct colors in the central (pupillary) zone of the iris than in the mid-peripheral (ciliary) zone.

name: Vestibular hyporeflexia
description: A general descriptive term that describes impaired functioning of the vestibular apparatus that leads to manifestations such as dizziness or postural imbalance

name: Abnormal circulating atrial natriuretic peptide pro-hormone concentration
description: The concentration in the blood circulation of atrial natriuretic peptide pro-hormone or one of its processed fragments is outside of the range of normal.

name: Athetosis
description: A slow, continuous, involuntary writhing movement that prevents maintenance of a stable posture. Athetosis involves continuous smooth movements that appear random and are not composed of recognizable sub-movements or movement fragments. In contrast to chorea, in athetosis, the same regions of the body are repeatedly involved. Athetosis may worsen with attempts at movement of posture, but athetosis can also occur at rest.
synonyms: Involuntary writhing movements in fingers, hands, toes, and feet

name: Pigmentary retinopathy
description: An abnormality of the retina characterized by pigment deposition. It is typically associated with migration and proliferation of macrophages or retinal pigment epithelial cells into the retina; melanin from these cells causes the pigmentary changes. Pigmentary retinopathy is a common final pathway of many retinal conditions and is often associated with visual loss.

name: Microscopic hematuria
description: Microscopic hematuria detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine.
synonyms: Small amount of blood in urine

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
description: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: B-cell lymphoma
description: A type of lymphoma that originates in B-cells.

name: Lower limb hyperreflexia
description: Increased intensity of the a reflex in the leg.
synonyms: Increased deep tendon reflexes in the lower limbs

name: Spontaneous hematomas
description: Spontaneous development of hematomas (hematoma) or bruises without significant trauma.

name: Dialeptic seizure
description: A dialeptic seizure is a type of seizure characterized predominantly by reduced responsiveness or awareness and with subsequent at least partial amnesia of the event.
synonyms: Behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset
Behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness irrespective of onset
Unknown onset behavioral arrest seizure with impairment of awareness
Unknown onset behavioural arrest seizure with impairment of awareness

name: Chronic CSF lymphocytosis
description: Chronic cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) lymphocytosis is defined as the finding, in at least two serial CSF examinations, of more than 5 cells per cubic millimeter.

name: Skeletal dysplasia
description: A general term describing features characterized by abnormal development of bones and connective tissues.

name: Wide mouth
description: Distance between the oral commissures more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased width of the oral aperture (subjective).

name: Short clavicles
description: Reduced length of the clavicles.

name: Abnormality of venous physiology
description: An anomaly of venous function.

name: Midline hand movements
description: Hand stereotypies within the medial plane of the body.

name: Lacrimal duct stenosis
description: Narrowing of a tear duct (lacrimal duct).

name: Abnormal circulating globulin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of globulins in the blood. Albumin makes up more than half of the total protein present in serum. The remaining blood proteins except albumin and fibrinogen (which is not in serum) are referred to as globulins. The globulin fraction includes hundreds of serum proteins including carrier proteins, enzymes, complement, and immunoglobulins. Most of these are synthesized in the liver, although the immunoglobulins are synthesized by plasma cells. Globulins are divided into four groups by electrophoresis. The four fractions are alpha1, alpha2, beta and gamma, depending on their migratory pattern between the anode and the cathode.

name: Abnormal brain lactate level by MRS
description: A deviation from normal of the level of lactate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
synonyms: Abnormal lactate level by magnetic resonance spectroscopy

name: Abnormally folded helix
description: Any structural anomaly of the border of the helix, which usually forms a rolled rim but is highly variable in shape.

name: Prolonged partial thromboplastin time
description: Increased time to coagulation in the partial thromboplastin time (PTT) test, a measure of the intrinsic and common coagulation pathways. Phospholipid, and activator, and calcium are mixed into an anticoagulated plasma sample, and the time is measured until a thrombus forms.

name: Nausea
description: A sensation of unease in the stomach together with an urge to vomit.

name: Abnormality of the breast
description: An abnormality of the breast.

name: Ventriculomegaly
description: An increase in size of the ventricular system of the brain.

name: Abnormal globus pallidus morphology
description: An abnormality of the globus pallidus.

name: Gingival recession
description: The loss of gum tissue. The result is that gum tissue is recessed and its position on the tooth is lowered, exposing the roots of the teeth.

name: Abnormal dental root morphology
description: An abnormality of the dental root.

name: Decreased circulating renin concentration
description: An decreased level of renin in the blood.

name: Fetal pericardial effusion
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid in which the heart is partially or completely surrounded by fluid that is seen in all views and the thickness of the fluid as observed by prenatal ultrasound is above age-dependent norms.

name: Upper motor neuron dysfunction
description: A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements. Dysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs.

name: Thickened cortex of bones
description: An Abnormality of cortical bone leading to an abnormal thickness of the cortex of affected bones.

name: Deficient excision of UV-induced pyrimidine dimers in DNA
Osteolytic defects of the distal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: Osteolytic defects of the outermost finger bone of the hand

name: Hyperactivity
description: Hyperactivity is a condition characterized by constant and unusually high levels of activity, even in situations where it is deemed inappropriate.

name: Abnormal circulating C-reactive protein concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of C-reactive protein in the blood circulation.

name: Prominent ear helix
description: Abnormally prominent ear helix.

name: Hypoglycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan
description: A reduction in the degree of glycosylation of alpha-dystroglycan in muscle tissue.

name: Toe joint contracture
description: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of a toe joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

name: Abnormality of pineal physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the pineal gland.

name: Abnormal acetabulum morphology
description: An abnormality of the acetabulum, i.e., the Acetabular part of hip bone, which together with the head of the femur forms the hip joint.

name: Abnormality of the fifth metatarsal bone
description: An anomaly of the fifth metatarsal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 5th long bone of foot

name: Corneal erosion
description: An erosion or abrasion of the cornea's outermost layer of epithelial cells.
synonyms: Damage to outer layer of the cornea of the eye

name: Scarring
description: A scar refers to a lesion in which wound, burn, or sore has not healed completely and fibrous connective tissue has developed.

name: Lower limb asymmetry
description: A difference in length or diameter between the left and right leg.
synonyms: Left and right leg differ in length or width

name: Hyperprostaglandinuria
description: An increased concentration of prostaglandin in the urine.

name: Patent ductus arteriosus after birth at term
description: Abnormal persistent patency of the ductus arteriosus in postnatal life when birth was at 37 completed weeks of gestation or greater.

name: Ulnar deviation of the hand
description: Divergence of the longitudinal axis of the hand at the wrist in a posterior (ulnar) direction (i.e., towards the little finger).

name: Increased circulating hemoglobin concentration
description: Concentration of hemoglobin in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

name: EEG with focal epileptiform discharges
description: EEG discharges recorded in particular areas of a localized (focal) abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Abnormal leukocyte enzyme concentration or activity
description: Concentration or activity of an enzyme as measured in leukocytes is above or below the limits of normal.

name: Bifid epiglottis
description: A midline anterior-posterior cleft of the epiglottis that involves at least two-thirds of the epiglottic leaf. It is a useful feature for clinical diagnosis because it appears to be very rare in syndromes other than Pallister-Hall-Syndrome and is also rare as an isolated malformation.

name: Parasomnia
description: A clinically observable or self-reported abnormal behavior, experience, or physiological event that occurs in association with sleep, specific sleep stages, or sleep-wake transitions.

name: Ulnar deviation of finger
description: Bending or curvature of a finger toward the ulnar side (i.e., away from the thumb). The deviation is at the metacarpal-phalangeal joint, and this finding is distinct from clinodactyly.

name: Small face
description: A face that is short and narrow.

name: Abnormality of the urethra
description: An abnormality of the urethra, i.e., of the tube which connects the urinary bladder to the outside of the body.

name: Pancreatic cysts
description: A cyst of the pancreas that possess a lining of mucous epithelium.

name: Aortic aneurysm
description: Aortic dilatation refers to a dimension that is greater than the 95th percentile for the normal person age, sex and body size. In contrast, an aneurysm is defined as a localized dilation of the aorta that is more than 150 percent of predicted (ratio of observed to expected diameter 1.5 or more). Aneurysm should be distinguished from ectasia, which represents a diffuse dilation of the aorta less than 50 percent of normal aorta diameter.
synonyms: Bulge in wall of large artery that carries blood away from heart

name: Fatigable weakness of bulbar muscles
description: A type of weakness of the bulbar muscles (muscles of the mouth and throat responsible for speech and swallowing) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Peroneal muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the peroneal muscles.

name: Decreased hip abduction
description: Reduced ability to move the femur outward to the side.

name: Increased circulating lactate dehydrogenase concentration
description: An elevated level of the enzyme lactate dehydrogenase in the blood circulation.

name: Thumb contracture
description: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the thumb joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin. The term camptodactyly is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Hypoplasia of the uterus
description: Underdevelopment of the uterus.

name: Recurrent systemic pyogenic infections
description: Increased susceptibility to systemic pyogenic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of systemic pyogenic infections.

name: Elbow contracture
description: A limitation in the passive range of motion of the elbow resulting from loss of elasticity in the periarticular tissues owing to structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules or skin.

name: Abnormal urine carbohydrate level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carbohydrate in the urine.

name: Abnormal corticospinal tract morphology
description: Abnormality of the corticospinal tract, which is the chief element of the pyramidal system (the principle motor tract) and is the only direct connection between the cerebrum and the spinal cord.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the corticospinal tract

name: Abnormal immune serum protein physiology
description: An abnormality of the concentration or function of circulating immune proteins.
synonyms: Abnormality of immune serum protein physiology

name: Muscle stiffness
description: A condition in which muscles cannot be moved quickly without accompanying pain or spasm.

name: Proximal hyperreflexia
description: Hyperactive stretch reflexes of muscles that move proximal joints (elbow, knee).

name: Abnormal double-negative T cell proportion
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of double-negative (DN) CD3+CD4-CD8- T cells, measured either as percentage of total CD3+ T cells in the blood, or as absolute number per microliter of blood, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group. These are usually measured within the TCR alpha/beta positive population.
synonyms: Abnormal CD4-negative, CD8-negative regulatory T cell distribution
Abnormal double-negative regulatory T cell distribution
Abnormal proportion of double-negative regulatory T cell

name: Disturbance of facial expression
description: An abnormality of the gestures or movements executed with the facial muscles with which emotions such as fear, joy, sadness, surprise, and disgust can be expressed.

name: Recurrent viral infections
description: Increased susceptibility to viral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of viral infection.

name: Gonadotropin deficiency
description: A reduced ability to secrete gonadotropins, which are protein hormones secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary gland, including the hormones follitropin (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

name: Neuroinflammation
description: Activation of the brain's innate immune system in response to an inflammatory challenge and is characterized by a host of cellular and molecular changes within the brain.

name: Asymmetric septal hypertrophy
description: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an asymmetrical pattern of hypertrophy, with a predilection for the interventricular septum and myocyte disarray.

name: Abnormal peer relationships
description: The state of having abnormal relationships with others. This does not describe specific aspects of one's social aptitudes but rather a state which may come about from these aptitudes, such as lacking peer relationships or lacking close friends.

name: Gingivitis
description: Inflammation of the gingiva.

name: Atresia of the external auditory canal
description: Absence or failure to form of the external auditory canal.
synonyms: Atresia of the external auditory canals

name: Abnormal tricuspid valve physiology
description: Any functional defect of the tricuspid valve.

name: Sudden episodic apnea
description: Recurrent bouts of sudden, severe apnea that may be life-threatening.

name: Mandibular aplasia
description: Absence of the mandible.
synonyms: Aplasia of the lower jaw bone
Failure of development of lower jaw

name: Patellar aplasia
description: Absence of the patella.

name: Acute rhabdomyolysis
description: An acute form of rhabdomyolysis.

name: Temporal pattern
description: The speed at which disease manifestations appear and develop.

name: Bilateral choanal atresia
description: Bilateral absence (atresia) of the posterior nasal aperture (choana).
synonyms: Bilateral blockage of the rear opening of the nasal cavity
Bilateral obstruction of the rear opening of the nasal cavity

name: Abnormal fontanelle morphology
description: An abnormality of the fontanelle.

name: Acute otitis media
description: Acute otitis media is a short and generally painful infection of the middle ear.

name: Abnormal electroretinogram
description: Any abnormality of the electrical responses of various cell types in the retina as measured by electroretinography.

name: Cutaneous melanoma
description: The presence of a melanoma of the skin.

name: Failure to thrive in infancy
synonyms: Failure to thrive in first year of life

name: Lack of insight
description: Lack of insight (Anosognosia) is a neurological condition in which an individual is unaware of his or her own neurological deficit or psychiatric condition. Anosognosia can be associated with mental illness, dementia, and structural brain lesions and can affect an individual's conscious awareness of deficits involving judgment, emotions, memory, executive function, language skills, and motor ability.

name: Reduced pancreatic beta cells
description: Reduced number of beta cells in the pancreatic islets of Langerhans.

name: Nail pits
description: Small (typically about 1 mm or less in size) depressions on the dorsal nail surface.

name: Abnormal T cell apoptosis
description: Abnormal apoptosis by peripheral blood T cells in an in vitro culture, compared to a healthy control sample. May be either spontaneous, induced by UV, X-ray, FasL or other agens. Commonly measured by surface expression of phosphatidyl serine labelled by Annexin V, but other methods such as staning of cleaved Caspases may be used by different laboratories.

name: Left ventricular noncompaction cardiomyopathy
description: Left ventricular non-compaction (LVNC) is characterized by prominent left ventricular trabeculae and deep inter-trabecular recesses. The myocardial wall is often thickened with a thin, compacted epicardial layer and a thickened endocardial layer. In some patients, LVNC is associated with left ventricular dilatation and systolic dysfunction, which can be transient in neonates.

name: Elevated circulating growth hormone concentration
description: Acromegaly is a condition resulting from overproduction of growth hormone by the pituitary gland in persons with closed epiphyses, and consists chiefly in the enlargement of the distal parts of the body. The circumference of the skull increases, the nose becomes broad, the tongue becomes enlarged, the facial features become coarsened, the mandible grows excessively, and the teeth become separated. The fingers and toes grow chiefly in thickness.

name: Abnormal bowel sounds
description: An anomaly of the amount or nature of abdominal sounds. Abdominal sounds (bowel sounds) are made by the movement of the intestines as they promote passage of abdominal contents by peristalsis.

name: Abnormal endocrine morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of an organ ofthe endocrine system.

name: Pterygium
description: Pterygia are 'winglike' triangular membranes occurring in the neck, eyes, knees, elbows, ankles or digits.

name: Camptodactyly of toe
description: Camptodactyly is a painless flexion contracture of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint that is usually gradually progressive. This term refers to camptodactyly of one or more toes.

name: Broad forehead
description: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently increased distance between the two sides of the forehead.

name: Hypochloremia
description: An abnormally decreased chloride concentration in the blood.

name: Abnormal morphology of ulna
description: Any structural anomaly of the ulna, a bone of the forearm the extends from the elbow to the little finger.

name: Abnormality of the menstrual cycle
description: An abnormality of the ovulation cycle.

name: Renal cortical microcysts
description: Cysts of microscopic size confined to the cortex of the kidney.

name: Abnormal enzyme concentration or activity
description: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal.

name: Desquamation of skin soon after birth
Chronic leukemia
description: A slowly progressing leukemia characterized by a clonal (malignant) proliferation of maturing and mature myeloid cells or mature lymphocytes. When the clonal cellular population is composed of myeloid cells, the process is called chronic myelogenous leukemia. When the clonal cellular population is composed of lymphocytes, it is classified as chronic lymphocytic leukemia, hairy cell leukemia, or T-cell large granular lymphocyte leukemia.

name: Tongue thrusting
description: Pressing forward of the tongue in the mouth, a retained motoric habit from infantile swallowing patterns

name: Abnormal brain positron emission tomography
description: A functional brain anomaly detectable by positron emission tomography (PET). PET scanning is a method for functional brain imaging, and its measurements reflect the amount of brain activity in the various regions of the brain.

name: Hydrometrocolpos
description: Hydrometrocolpos is an accumulation of uterine and vaginal secretions as well as menstrual blood in the uterus and vagina.

name: Ocular albinism
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of pigmentation (reduced or absent) of the iris and retina.

name: Neonatal alloimmune thrombocytopenia
description: Low platelet count associated with maternal platelet-specific alloantibodies.

name: Aplasia of the nasal bone
description: Absence of the nasal bone.
synonyms: Failure of development of the nasal bone
Lack of development of the nasal bone

name: BCGitis
description: Local or regional infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination.

name: Anti-thyroglobulin antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react to thyroglobulin.

name: Aortic arch aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic arch.

name: Ureteral duplication
description: A developmental anomaly characterized by the presence of two, instead of one, ureter connecting a kidney to the bladder.

name: Abnormal fetal genitourinary system morphology
description: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal genitourinary system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Hypocalcemia
description: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the blood.

name: Oromotor apraxia
description: Oral-motor apraxia is the inability to volitionally sequence oral movements of the speech structure for nonspeech tasks in the absence of neuromuscular deficits such as paralysis or muscle weakness. Oral-motor apraxia is diagnosed when, despite intact sensory motor function an individual is unable to use these effector systems under voluntary control.

name: Meningioma
description: The presence of a meningioma, i.e., a benign tumor originating from the dura mater or arachnoid mater.
synonyms: Noncancerous growth of membranes covering brain

name: Tarsal synostosis
description: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the tarsus (calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, cuneiiform bones).

name: Primary hyperaldosteronism
description: A form of hyperaldosteronism caused by a defect within the adrenal gland.

name: Agyria
description: A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere characterized by lack of gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex. Agyria is defined as cortical regions lacking gyration with sulci great than 3 cm apart and cerebral cortex thicker than 5 mm.

name: Anosmia
description: An inability to perceive odors. This is a general term describing inability to smell arising in any part of the process of smelling from absorption of odorants into the nasal mucous overlying the olfactory epithelium, diffusion to the cilia, binding to olfactory receptor sites, generation of action potentials in olfactory neurons, and perception of a smell.

name: Abnormal cerebrospinal fluid morphology
description: An abnormality of the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF).

name: Abnormal cerebral vein morphology
description: An anomaly of cerebral veins.

name: Abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level
description: An abnormality of alkaline phosphatase level.

name: Teratoma
description: The presence of a teratoma.

name: Abnormal change in sexual drive
description: An abnormal change in libido (sexual desire), typically accompanied by an altered frequency of sexual activity compared to from a person's previous norm.

name: Iron accumulation in brain
description: An abnormal build up of iron (Fe) in brain tissue.

name: Anorectal anomaly
description: An abnormality of the anus or rectum.

name: Ectopia pupillae
description: A malposition of the pupil owing to a developmental defect of the iris.

name: Diffuse palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: Diffuse abnormal thickening of the skin on the palms and soles.

name: Abnormal labia majora morphology
description: An anomaly of the outer labia.

name: Chilblains
description: Chilblains, also called perniosis, are an inflammatory skin condition related to an abnormal vascular response to the cold. We are unaware of a reliable estimate of incidence. It typically presents as tender, pruritic red or bluish lesions located symmetrically on the dorsal aspect of the fingers, toes, ears and nose. Less commonly, reports describe involvement of the thighs and buttocks. The lesions present hours after exposure to cold and usually resolve spontaneously in one to three weeks.

name: Embryonal renal neoplasm
description: The presence of an embryonal neoplasm of the kidney that primarily affects children.

name: Parathyroid hyperplasia
description: Hyperplasia of the parathyroid gland.

name: Abnormal uterus morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the uterus

name: Acquired abnormal hair pattern
description: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth that is acquired during the course of life.

name: Atypical behavior
description: Atypical behavior is an abnormality in a person's actions that can be controlled or modulated by the will of the individual. While abnormal behaviors can be difficult to control, they are distinct from other abnormal actions that cannot be affected by the individual's will.

name: Primary microcephaly
description: Head circumference below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender at birth.
synonyms: Small head circumference present at birth
Decreased head circumference present at birth
Head circumference small for gestational age

name: Abnormal systemic arterial morphology
description: An abnormality of the systemic arterial tree, which consists of the aorta and other systemic arteries.
synonyms: Abnormality of the systemic arterial tree

name: Abnormal iris pigmentation
description: Abnormal pigmentation of the iris.

name: Absent brainstem auditory responses
description: Lack of measurable response to stimulation of auditory evoked potentials.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber morphology
description: Any abnormality of the skeletal muscle cell. Muscle fibers are subdivided into two types. Type I fibers are fatigue-resistant and rich in oxidative enzymes (they stain light with the myosin ATPase reaction), and type II fibers are fast-contracting, fatigue-prone, and rich in glycolytic enzymes (these fibers stain darkly). Normal muscle tissue has a random distribution of type I and type II fibers.

name: Abnormal circulating citrulline concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of citrulline in the blood circulation.

name: Macular purpura
description: Purpura that is flat (non-palpable, not raised).

name: Systolic heart murmur
description: A heart murmur limited to systole, i.e., between the first and second heart sounds S1 and S2.

name: Abnormal corneal thickness
description: An abnormal anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

name: Decreased miniature endplate potentials
description: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the miniature endplate potentials, i.e. the postsynaptic response to transmitter released from an individual vesicle at the neuromuscular junction.

name: Abnormal temper tantrums
description: Temper tantrums are brief episodes of extreme, unpleasant, and sometimes aggressive behaviors in response to frustration or anger, which are a normal part of development in toddlers. Temper tantrums that occur more frequently in a given time and/or are more severe in symptomatology and/or longer in duration and/or inappropriate for the given age compared to a temper tantrum that naturally occurs as a part of the developmental process are classified as abnormal temper tantrums.

name: Cranial asymmetry
description: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull.

name: Aqueductal stenosis
description: Stenosis of the cerebral aqueduct (also known as the mesencephalic duct, aqueductus mesencephali, or aqueduct of Sylvius), which connects the third cerebral ventricle in the diencephalon to the fourth ventricle, which is between the pons and cerebellum.

name: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei
description: An excessive division of the lobes of the nucleus of a neutrophil.
synonyms: Hypersegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in peripheral blood

name: Broad ischia
description: Increased width of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Intermittent episodes of respiratory insufficiency due to muscle weakness
Generalized edema
description: Generalized abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin, or in one or more cavities of the body.

name: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
description: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.

name: Abnormal left ventricular end-diastolic volume
description: Any deviation from the normal range of end-diastolic volume of the left ventricle, which is the volume of blood in the left ventricle at the end of diastole (just before systole).

name: Abnormality of fluid regulation
description: An abnormality of the regulation of body fluids.

name: Ulnar deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
Localized skin lesion
description: A lesion of the skin that is located in a specific region rather than being generalized.

name: Blindness
description: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as a profound reduction in visual perception. On the 6m visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 3/60. On the 20ft visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 20/400. On the decimal visual acuity scale, blindness is defined as less than 0.05. Blindness is typically characterized by a visual field of no greater than 10 degrees in radius around central fixation.

name: Abnormal lacrimal duct morphology
description: An abnormality of the lacrimal duct, a duct that drain tears from the conjunctiva, via the lacrimal puncta, into the lacrimal sac.

name: Muscle spasm
description: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles.

name: Abnormality of neutrophils
description: A neutrophil abnormality.

name: Congenital hypoplastic anemia
description: A type of hypoplastic anemia with congenital onset.

name: Weight loss
description: Reduction of total body weight.

name: Abnormal branching pattern of the aortic arch
description: A deviance from the norm of the origin or course of the right brachiocephalic artery, the left common carotid artery, the left subclavian artery or the proximal vertebral arteries.

name: Tibial torsion
description: Twisted position of the tibia (shin bone) associated with pathological rotation of the leg.

name: Stapes ankylosis
description: Stapes ankylosis refers to congenital or acquired fixation of the stapes (the stirrup-shaped small bone or ossicle in the middle ear), which is associated with conductive hearing resulting from impairment of the sound-conduction mechanism (the external auditory canal, tympanic membrane, and/or middle-ear ossicles).

name: Increased mean platelet volume
description: Average platelet volume above the upper limit of the normal reference interval.

name: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: Total anomalous pulmonary venous return refers to a congenital malformation in which all four pulmonary veins do not connect normally to the left atrium, but instead drain abnormally to the right atrium.

name: Pectoralis amyotrophy
description: Wasting of the pectoral muscles, i.e., of the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor. This finding is often manifested by prominent axillary creases or double axillary creases.

name: Intraventricular hemorrhage
description: Bleeding into the ventricles of the brain.

name: Decreased circulating copper concentration
description: A reduced concentration of copper in the blood.

name: Abnormality of connective tissue
description: Any abnormality of the soft tissues, including both connective tissue (tendons, ligaments, fascia, fibrous tissues, and fat).

name: Limb-girdle muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the limb-girdle muscles (also known as the pelvic and shoulder girdles), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the shoulders and the pelvis.

name: Single transverse palmar crease
description: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease.

name: Ulcerative colitis
description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that includes characteristic ulcers, or open sores, in the colon. The main symptom of active disease is usually constant diarrhea mixed with blood, of gradual onset and intermittent periods of exacerbated symptoms contrasting with periods that are relatively symptom-free. In contrast to Crohn's disease this special form of colitis begins in the distal parts of the rectum, spreads continually upwards and affects only mucose and submucose tissue of the colon.

name: Ebstein anomaly of the tricuspid valve
description: Ebstein's anomaly refers to an abnormally placed and deformed tricuspid valve characterized by apical displacement of the septal and posterior tricuspid valve leaflets, leading to atrialization of the right ventricle with a variable degree of malformation and displacement of the anterior leaflet.
synonyms: Ebstein's anomaly of the tricuspid valve

name: 11 pairs of ribs
description: Presence of only 11 pairs of ribs.

name: Blepharophimosis
description: A fixed reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids with short palpebral fissures.

name: Renal tubular dysfunction
description: Abnormal function of the renal tubule. The basic functional unit of the kidney, the nephron, consists of a renal corpuscle attached to a renal tubule, with roughly 0.8 to 1.5 nephrons per adult kidney. The functions of the renal tubule include reabsorption of water, electrolytes, glucose, and amino acids and secretion of substances such as uric acid.
synonyms: Abnormal function of filtrating structures in kidney

name: Increased corneal thickness
description: A increased anteroposterior thickness of the cornea.

name: Type II diabetes mellitus
description: A type of diabetes mellitus initially characterized by insulin resistance and hyperinsulinemia and subsequently by glucose interolerance and hyperglycemia.

name: Choreoathetosis
description: Involuntary movements characterized by both athetosis (inability to sustain muscles in a fixed position) and chorea (widespread jerky arrhythmic movements).

name: Abnormal circulating gonadotropin concentration
description: An anomaly of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

name: Abnormal phagocytosis
description: An abnormal functioning of phagocytosis. Phagocytosis is an elegant but complex process for the ingestion and elimination of pathogens, but it is also important for the elimination of apoptotic cells and hence fundamental for tissue homeostasis. Phagocytosis can be divided into four main steps: (i) recognition of the target particle, (ii) signaling to activate the internalization machinery, (iii) phagosome formation, and (iv) phagolysosome maturation.

name: Epileptic spasm
description: A sudden flexion, extension, or mixed extension-flexion of predominantly proximal and truncal muscles that is usually more sustained than a myoclonic movement but not as sustained as a tonic seizure. Limited forms may occur: Grimacing, head nodding, or subtle eye movements. Epileptic spasms frequently occur in clusters. Infantile spasms are the best known form, but spasms can occur at all ages

name: Abnormal peripheral nervous system morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the peripheral nervous system, which is composed of the nerves that lead to or branch off from the central nervous system. This includes the cranial nerves (olfactory and optic nerves are technically part of the central nervous system).

name: Coldness
description: Relative coldness of a body part to palpitation, often acccompanied by feelings of coldness.

name: Abnormality of the uterus
description: An abnormality of the uterus.

name: Duane anomaly
description: A condition associated with a limitation of the horizontal ocular movement with retraction of the globe and narrowing of the palpebral fissure on adduction
synonyms: Limited eye motility from Duane anomaly
Limited eye movement from Duane anomaly
Globe retraction and deviation on adduction

name: Abnormally ossified vertebrae
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of one or more vertebrae.

name: Abnormal liver enzyme activity or concentration
description: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal in liver tissue.
synonyms: Abnormal hepatic enzyme activity or concentration

name: Digital flexor tenosynovitis
description: Inflammation of the flexor digitorum tendon, often associated with the Kanavel signs: (i) finger held in slight flexion, (ii) fusiform swelling, (iii) tenderness along the flexor tendon sheath, and (iv) pain with passive extension of the digit.

name: Poor suck
description: An inadequate sucking reflex, resulting in the difficult of newborns to be breast-fed.

name: Impaired oropharyngeal swallow response
description: Delay or absence of the swallow response, reflexes triggered by the contact the food bolus makes with the anterior faucial pillars.

name: Encephalocele
description: A neural tube defect characterized by sac-like protrusions of the brain and the membranes that cover it through openings in the skull.

name: Aplasia of the 2nd finger
description: Absent 2nd (index) finger.

name: Increased circulating ACTH level
description: An abnormal increased in the concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), in the blood.

name: Erysipelas
description: Increased susceptibility to erysipelas, as manifested by a medical history of repeated episodes of erysipelas, which is a superficial infection of the skin, typically involving the lymphatic system.

name: Abnormal posturing
description: Involuntary flexion or extension of the arms and legs.

name: Delayed ossification of carpal bones
description: Ossification of carpal bones occurs later than age-adjusted norms.

name: Chondrosarcoma
description: A slowly growing malignant neoplasm derived from cartilage cells.

name: Abnormality of ocular abduction
description: An abnormality involving the movement of the eye outwards.

name: Hydrocephalus
description: Hydrocephalus is an active distension of the ventricular system of the brain resulting from inadequate passage of CSF from its point of production within the cerebral ventricles to its point of absorption into the systemic circulation.
synonyms: Too much cerebrospinal fluid in the brain

name: EEG with frontal focal spikes
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec in the frontal region.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex III
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex III, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Enlarged metaphyses
description: Abnormal increase in size of one or more metaphyses.
synonyms: Enlarged wide portion of a long bone

name: Abnormal preputium morphology
description: An abnormality of the retractable fold of skin that covers the tip of the penis.

name: Abnormal visual fixation
description: Any anomaly in the process of ocular fixation, which is the maintaining of the visual gaze on a single location.

name: Multiple prenatal fractures
description: The presence of bone fractures in the prenatal period that are diagnosed at birth or before.
synonyms: Numerous multiple fractures present at birth
Numerous multiple fractures that are present at birth

name: Abnormal stomach morphology
description: An abnormality of the stomach.

name: Abnormal leukocyte physiology
description: A functional abnormality of a white blood cell.

name: Splenic infarction
description: Ischemia and necrosis of part or all of the spleen resulting from compromise of blood supply resulting from arterial or venous occlusion.

name: Macrovesicular hepatic steatosis
description: A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of large, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.

name: Abnormal bronchus physiology
description: Any anomaly of the function of the bronchi.

name: Broad-based gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern in which persons stand and walk with their feet spaced widely apart. This is often a component of cerebellar ataxia.

name: Uveal ectropion
description: Presence of iris pigment epithelium on the anterior surface of the iris.

name: Broad clavicles
description: Increased width (cross-sectional diameter) of the clavicles.

name: Lipoma
description: Benign neoplasia derived from lipoblasts or lipocytes of white or brown fat. May be angiomatous or hibernomatous.

name: Metaphyseal dysplasia
description: The presence of dysplastic regions in metaphyseal regions.

name: Abnormal total neutrophil count
description: A deviation from the normal range of neutrophil cell counts in the circulation.

name: Pyoderma gangrenosum
description: A deep skin ulcer with a well defined border, which is usually violet or blue. The ulcer edge is often undermined (worn and damaged) and the surrounding skin is erythematous and indurated. The ulcer often starts as a small papule or collection of papules, which break down to form small ulcers with a so called cat's paw appearance. These coalesce and the central area then undergoes necrosis to form a single ulcer.

name: Functional abnormality of male internal genitalia
Abdominal mass
description: An abnormal enlargement or swelling in the abdomen.

name: Bilateral cleft lip
description: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on the left and right sides.

name: Decreased circulating IgE concentration
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin E (IgE) in blood.

name: Papillary thyroid carcinoma
description: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Abnormal arterial physiology
description: An anomaly of arterial function.

name: Osteoporosis
description: Osteoporosis is a systemic skeletal disease characterized by low bone density and microarchitectural deterioration of bone tissue with a consequent increase in bone fragility. According to the WHO criteria, osteoporosis is defined as a BMD that lies 2.5 standard deviations or more below the average value for young healthy adults (a T-score below -2.5 SD).

name: Abnormal blood phosphate concentration
description: An abnormality of phosphate homeostasis or concentration in the body.

name: Angiokeratoma
description: Angiokeratomas are hyperkeratotic papules that are characterized histologically by superficial ectatic (i.e., dilated) blood vessels with epidermal proliferation. Clinically, angiokeratoma presents as a small, raised, dark-red spot.

name: Axial muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the axial musculature (i.e., of the muscles of the head and neck, spine, and ribs).

name: Inspiratory stridor
description: Inspiratory stridor is a high pitched sound upon inspiration that is generally related to laryngeal abnormalities.

name: Limb-girdle muscular dystrophy
description: Muscular dystrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle (the hips and shoulders).

name: Wide intermamillary distance
description: A larger than usual distance between the left and right nipple.

name: Abnormal foveal morphology
description: An abnormality of the fovea centralis, the central area of the macula that mediates central, high resolution vision and contains the largest concentration of cone cells in the retina.

name: Recurrent corneal erosions
description: The presence of recurrent corneal epithelial erosions. Although most corneal epithelial defects heal quickly, some may show recurrent ulcerations.
synonyms: Recurrent breakdown of clear protective layer of eye

name: Neonatal short-limb short stature
description: A type of short-limbed dwarfism that is manifest beginning in the neonatal period.
synonyms: Short limb dwarfism recognisable at birth
Short limb dwarfism recognizable at birth

name: Abnormal circulating potassium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of potassium.

name: Decreased total monocyte count
description: Abnormal decrease of absolute number of monocytes in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Quadriceps muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the quadriceps muscle (that is, of the muscle fasciculus of quadriceps femoris).

name: Oligodontia
description: The absence of six or more teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
synonyms: Failure of development of more than six teeth
Number of teeth decreased by more than six

name: Increased circulating iron concentration
description: The concentration of iron in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Subsarcolemmal accumulations of abnormally shaped mitochondria
description: An abnormally increased number of mitochondria in the cytoplasma adjacent to the sarcolemma (muscle cell membrane), whereby the mitochondria also possess an abnormal morphology.

name: Low-set ears
description: Upper insertion of the ear to the scalp below an imaginary horizontal line drawn between the inner canthi of the eye and extending posteriorly to the ear.

name: Oligoarthritis
description: A type of arthritis that affects up to four joints in the first six months of disease.

name: Urethrovesical occlusion
description: Blockage of the flow of urine from the bladder into the urethra.

name: Disordered formal thought process
description: An abnormality in the dynamic mode, rate, or form of thought processes as recognized from the flow of ideas expressed in speech. Successive thoughts and speech are easily diverted by external stimuli or internal superficial associations. Unable to maintain a constant train of thought and loose themselves in side issues, losing the thread and are unable to recover it. Superficial connections appear to drive the subject matter.

name: Upper limb amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the upper limbs.

name: Brushfield spots
description: The presence of whitish spots in a ring-like arrangement at the periphery of the iris.

name: Hyperglutaminemia
description: An increased concentration of glutamine in the blood.

name: Fasting hyperinsulinemia
description: An increased concentration of insulin in the blood in the fasting state, i.e., not as the response to food intake.
synonyms: High blood insulin levels while fasting

name: Steroid-resistant nephrotic syndrome
description: A form of nephrotic syndrome that does not respond to treatment with steroid medication, defined as persistent proteinuria despite 60mg/m2 or 2mg/kg for 8 weeks, after insuring no infection or non-adherence to medication.

name: Dyschromatopsia
description: A form of colorblindness in which only two of the three fundamental colors can be distinguished due to a lack of one of the retinal cone pigments.

name: Hypoplastic fifth toenail
description: Underdeveloped nails of the fifth toes.

name: Restricted or repetitive behaviors or interests
description: A broad range of compulsive behaviors are repeated, including simple motor stereotypies and tics, as well as more complex repetitive movements or compulsions.

name: Abnormal aortic valve cusp morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the aortic valve leaflets.

name: Hypoautofluorescent retinal lesion
description: Decreased amount of autofluorescence in the retina as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

name: Childhood onset sensorineural hearing impairment
description: Sensorineural hearing impairment with childhood onset.

name: Abnormal cortical gyration
description: An abnormality of the gyri (i.e., the ridges) of the cerebral cortex of the brain.

name: Dilatated internal auditory canal
description: The presence of a dilated inner part of external acoustic meatus.

name: Mutism
description: Complete lack of speech or verbal communication in a person despite attempts to engage in conversation. Mutism as a phenomena assumes the individual has previous capacity for speech and in the pediatric population it assumes that the person is past the age of typical language development.

name: Thin clavicles
description: Abnormally reduced diameter (cross section) of the clavicles.

name: Vaginal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula of the vagina.

name: Centrally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
description: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally central localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells).

name: Cone-shaped epiphysis
description: Cone-shaped epiphyses (also known as coned epiphyses) are epiphyses that invaginate into cupped metaphyses. That is, the epiphysis has a cone-shaped distal extension resulting from increased growth of the central portion of the epiphysis relative to its periphery.

name: Autoamputation
description: Auto-amputation is the spontaneous detachment of an appendage from the body due to long standing pathology.

name: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation
description: Pulmonary arteriovenous malformation, a condition most commonly associated with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia, is an abnormal communication between the pulmonary artery and pulmonary vein without an intervening capillary communication. HRCT images usually show a coarse spidery appearance of the peripheral vascular markings in the lungs. More specific findings are obtained in the pulmonary angiogram where the normally invisible capillary phase is replaced by irregular vascular channels bridging the peripheral branches of pulmonary arteries and veins.

name: Elevated urinary monocarboxylic acid level
description: Abnormally increased amount of a monocarboxylic acid in the urine. Monocarboxylic acids are molecules with one COOH functional group.

name: Pituitary adenoma
description: A benign epithelial tumor derived from intrinsic cells of the adenohypophysis (anterior pituitary).

name: Uric acid nephrolithiasis
description: The presence of uric acid-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Megaloblastic anemia
description: Anemia characterized by the presence of erythroblasts that are larger than normal (megaloblasts).

name: Impaired antigen-specific response
description: An impaired immune response mediated by cells expressing specific receptors for antigen produced through a somatic diversification process, and allowing for an enhanced secondary response to subsequent exposures to the same antigen (immunological memory).

name: Broad eyebrow
description: Regional increase in the width (height) of the eyebrow.

name: Abnormal adipose tissue morphology
description: An abnormality of adipose tissue, which is loose connective tissue composed of adipocytes.

name: Hypertelorism
description: Interpupillary distance more than 2 SD above the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an increased interpupillary distance or widely spaced eyes).

name: Developmental regression
description: Loss of developmental skills, as manifested by loss of developmental milestones.

name: Angioedema
description: Rapid swelling (edema) of the dermis, subcutaneous tissue, mucosa and submucosal tissues of the skin of the face, normally around the mouth, and the mucosa of the mouth and/or throat, as well as the tongue during a period of minutes to several hours. The swelling can also occur elsewhere, typically in the hands. Angioedema is similar to urticaria, but the swelling is subcutaneous rather than on the epidermis.

name: Periventricular nodular heterotopia
description: Nodules of heterotopia along the ventricular walls. There can be a single nodule or a large number of nodules, they can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, they can be small or large, single or multiple.

name: Blue irides
description: A markedly blue coloration of the iris.

name: Congenital nystagmus
description: Nystagmus dating from or present at birth.

name: Telangiectasia
description: Telangiectasias refer to small dilated blood vessels located near the surface of the skin or mucous membranes, measuring between 0.5 and 1 millimeter in diameter. Telangiectasia are located especially on the tongue, lips, palate, fingers, face, conjunctiva, trunk, nail beds, and fingertips.

name: Subvalvular aortic stenosis
description: A fixed form of obstruction to blood flow across the left-ventricular outflow tract related to stenosis (narrowing) below the level of the aortic valve.
synonyms: Narrowing of blood vessel below aortic heart valve

name: Cerebral berry aneurysm
description: A small, sac-like aneurysm (outpouching) of a cerebral blood vessel.

name: Cyanosis
description: Bluish discoloration of the skin and mucosa due to poor circulation or inadequate oxygenation of arterial or capillary blood.

name: Budd-Chiari syndrome
description: Budd-Chiari syndrome (BCS) is caused by obstruction of hepatic venous outflow at any level from the small hepatic veins to the junction of the inferior vena cava (IVC) with the right atrium, 1 and occurs in 1/100,000 of the general population worldwide. The most common presentation is with ascites, but can range from fulminant hepatic failure (FHF) to asymptomatic forms. Obstruction of hepatic venous outflow is mainly caused by primary intravascular thrombosis, which can occur suddenly or be repeated over time, accompanied by some revascularization, accounting for the variable parenchymal hepatic damage and histologic presentation. Budd-Chiari syndrome is thus a disease, but since it occurs as a manifestation of several other diseases, this term is kept for the present for convenience.

name: Oval face
description: A face with a rounded and slightly elongated outline.

name: Triangular shaped phalanges of the hand
Paroxysmal dystonia
description: A form of dystonia characterized by episodes of dystonia (often hemidystonia or generalized) lasting from minutes to hours. There are no dystonic symptoms between episodes.

name: Short long bone
description: One or more abnormally short long bone.

name: Carpal synostosis
description: Synostosis (bony fusion) involving one or more bones of the carpus (scaphoid, lunate, triquetrum, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate, pisiform).

name: Metamorphopsia
description: A visual anomaly in which images appear distorted. A grid of straight lines appears wavy and parts of the grid may appear blank.

name: Persistent CMV viremia
description: Lasting (uncontrolled) presence of cytomegalovirus in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating vitamin B12 concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of cobalamin (vitamin B12) in the blood. Vitamin B12 is one of the eight B vitamins.

name: Abnormal renal pelvis morphology
description: An abnormality of the renal pelvis.

name: Erythema
description: Redness of the skin, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.
synonyms: Redness of skin or mucous membrane

name: Recurrent skin infections
description: Infections of the skin that happen multiple times.

name: Hyperconvex nail
description: When viewed on end (with the digit tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the nail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

name: Increased circulating pyruvate concentration
description: The concentration of pyruvate in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Abnormal aortic morphology
description: An abnormality of the aorta.

name: Abnormal macrophage morphology
description: An abnormality of macrophages.

name: Cardiogenic shock
description: Severely decreased cardiac output with evidence of inadequate end-organ perfusion (i.e., tissue hypoxia) in the presence of adequate intravascular volume.

name: Thickened calvaria
description: The presence of an abnormally thick calvaria.

name: Retinal fold
description: A wrinkle of retinal tissue projecting outward from the surface of the retina and visible as a line on fundoscopy.

name: Hamartoma of tongue
description: A benign (noncancerous) tumorlike malformation made up of an abnormal mixture of cells and tissues that originates in the tongue.

name: Thin bony cortex
description: Abnormal thinning of the cortical region of bones.

name: Papillary renal cell carcinoma
description: The presence of renal cell carcinoma in the renal papilla.

name: Symphalangism of middle phalanx of finger
description: Fusion of a middle phalanx of a finger with another bone.

name: Thick hair
description: Increased density of hairs, i.e., and elevated number of hairs per unit area.

name: Microdontia
description: Decreased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD below mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased maximum width of tooth.

name: Obstructive sleep apnea
description: Obstructive Sleep Apnea is a condition characterized by the obstruction of the airway and pauses in breathing during sleep, which occur multiple times throughout the night. It is related to the relaxation of muscle tone that typically happens during sleep, leading to a partial collapse of the soft tissues in the airway and causing airflow obstruction.

name: Abdominal distention
description: Distention of the abdomen.

name: Stage 5 chronic kidney disease
description: A degree of kidney failure severe enough to require dialysis or kidney transplantation for survival characterized by a severe reduction in glomerular filtration rate (less than 15 ml/min/1.73 m2) and other manifestations including increased serum creatinine.

name: Abnormal renal vascular morphology
description: Anomalous structure of a blood vessel in the kidney.

name: Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration
description: An elevated level of circulating N-terminal part of the prohormone of B-type natriuretic peptide (BNP).

name: Cortical myoclonus
description: Cortical myoclonus mainly affects the distal upper limbs and face, which reflects the largest cortical representations of these body areas. It is often focal, but may be multifocal, bilateral or generalized, as a consequence of intracortical and transcallosal spreading of abnormal activity. It typically occurs on voluntary action and may affect speech and gait. Cortical myoclonic jerks are stimulus sensitive, typically to touch, but sensitivity to visual stimuli is also described. Most patients with cortical myoclonus have both positive myoclonus and NM, occurring either independently or together as a complex of the two kinds of myoclonus. If cortical myoclonus is prolonged and lasts for hours, days or weeks, it is called epilepsia partials continua and is considered to be a rare form of focal epileptic status. Focal cortical myoclonus almost always points to an underlining lesion of the sensori-motor cortex, which produces hyperexcitability (e.g. vascular, inflammatory or neoplastic).

name: Constitutional symptom
description: A symptom or manifestation indicating a systemic or general effect of a disease and that may affect the general well-being or status of an individual.

name: Rimmed vacuoles
description: Presence of abnormal vacuoles (membrane-bound organelles) in the sarcolemma. On histological staining with hematoxylin and eosin, rimmed vacuoles are popcorn-like clear vacuoles with a densely blue rim. The vacuoles are often associated with cytoplasmic and occasionally intranuclear eosinophilic inclusions.

name: Sea-blue histiocytosis
description: An abnormality of histiocytes, in which the cells take on a sea blue appearance due to abnormally increased lipid content. Histiocytes are a type of macrophage. Sea-blue histiocytes are typically large macrophages from 20 to 60 micrometers in diameter with a single eccentric nucleus whose cytoplasm if packed with sea-blue or blue-green granules when stained with Wright-Giemsa.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber protein expression
description: An anomalous amount of protein present in or on the surface of muscle fibers. This feature may be appreciate upon immunohistochemical investigation of muscle biopsy tissue.

name: Abnormal renal collecting system morphology
description: An abnormality of the renal collecting system.
synonyms: Abnormality of the renal collecting system

name: Goiter
description: An enlargement of the thyroid gland.

name: Ureteral obstruction
description: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the ureter.

name: Renal potassium wasting
description: High urine potassium in the presence of hypokalemia.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the little finger
Abnormality of the outermost little finger bone
Abnormality of the outermost pinkie finger bone
Abnormality of the outermost pinky finger bone
Abnormality of the terminal phalanx of the little finger

name: Recurrent opportunistic infections
description: Increased susceptibility to opportunistic infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by opportunistic agents, i.e., by microorganisms that do not usually cause disease in a healthy host, but are able to infect a host with a compromised immune system.

name: Hypoplasia of the phalanges of the toes
Neuroma
description: A tumor made up of nerve cells and nerve fibers.

name: Dumbbell-shaped long bone
description: An abnormal appearance of the long bones with resemblance to a dumbbell, a short bar with a weight at each end. That is, the long bone is shortened and displays flaring (widening) of the metaphyses.
synonyms: Dumbbell widening of long bone metaphyses

name: Myocardial fibrosis
description: Myocardial fibrosis is characterized by dysregulated collagen turnover (increased synthesis predominates over unchanged or decreased degradation) and excessive diffuse collagen accumulation in the interstitial and perivascular spaces as well as by phenotypically transformed fibroblasts, termed myofibroblasts.

name: Abnormal atrioventricular conduction
description: An impairment of the electrical continuity between the atria and ventricles.

name: Fine hair
description: Hair that is fine or thin to the touch.

name: Antimitochondrial antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against mitochondria.

name: Sensory behavioral abnormality
description: Abnormal sensory behavior, including avoiding or seeking sensory input or difficulty modulating sensory stimuli.

name: Tics
description: Repeated, individually recognizable, intermittent movements or movement fragments that are almost always briefly suppressible and are usually associated with awareness of an urge to perform the movement.

name: Anal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the epithelialised surface of the anal canal and the perianal skin.

name: Respiratory failure requiring assisted ventilation
description: A state of respiratory distress that requires a life saving intervention in the form of gaining airway access and instituting positive pressure ventilation.

name: Urethral valve
description: The presence of an abnormal membrane obstructing the urethra.

name: Slurred speech
description: Abnormal coordination of muscles involved in speech.

name: Infantile sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment with infantile onset.

name: C1-C2 subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joints.

name: Calcium nephrolithiasis
description: The presence of calcium-containing calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Reduced sperm motility
description: An abnormal reduction in the mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Neoplasm of the gallbladder
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the gallbladder.

name: Broad distal phalanx of finger
description: Abnormally wide (broad) distal phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Broad distal phalanges of the hand
Broad, square ends of distal phalanges

name: Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome
description: A disorder of the cardiac conduction system of the heart characterized by ventricular preexcitation due to the presence of an abnormal accessory atrioventricular electrical conduction pathway.

name: Neoplasm of striated muscle
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) originating in striated muscle, either skeletal muscle or cardiac muscle.

name: Short phalanx of the thumb
description: Hypoplastic (short) thumb phalanx.

name: Abnormal CNS myelination
description: An abnormality of myelination of nerves in the central nervous system.

name: Distal joint hypermobility
description: Lack of stability of a distal joint (e.g., finger).

name: Sensory ataxia
description: Incoordination of movement caused by a deficit in the sensory nervous system. Sensory ataxia can be distinguished from cerebellar ataxia by asking the patient to close his or her eyes. Persons with cerebellar ataxia show only a minimal worsening of symptoms, whereas persons with sensory ataxia show a marked worsening of symptoms.

name: Immune dysregulation
description: Altered immune function characterized by lymphoid proliferation, immune activation, and excessive autoreactivity often leading to autoimmune/inflammatory complications.

name: Painless fractures due to injury
description: An increased tendency to fractures following trauma, with fractures occurring without pain.

name: Hip pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the hip.

name: Hippocampal atrophy
description: Partial or complete wasting (loss) of hippocampus tissue that was once present.

name: Congenital ichthyosiform erythroderma
description: An ichthyosiform abnormality of the skin with congenital onset.

name: Metatarsus adductus
description: The metatarsals are deviated medially (tibially), that is, the bones in the front half of the foot bend or turn in toward the body.
synonyms: Front half of foot turns inward

name: Abnormal thoracic spine morphology
description: An abnormality of the thoracic vertebral column.

name: Atypical absence seizure
description: An atypical absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterized by interruption of ongoing activities and reduced responsiveness. In comparison to a typical absence seizure, changes in tone may be more pronounced, onset and/or cessation may be less abrupt, and the duration of the ictus and post-ictal recovery may be longer. Although not always available, an EEG often demonstrates slow (<3 Hz), irregular, generalized spike-wave activity.

name: Hypoargininemia
description: A decreased concentration of arginine in the blood.

name: Clitoral hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the clitoris.

name: Increased serum estradiol
description: An elevation above normal limits of the concentration of estradiol in the circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating estrogen level
description: A deviation from normal concentration of the hormone estrogen in the blood circulation.

name: Hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia
description: An increased concentration of insulin combined with a decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Reduced delayed hypersensitivity
description: Decreased ability to react to a delayed hypersensitivity skin test.
synonyms: Decreased reactivity to skin test antigens

name: Body odor
description: A perceived unpleasant smell given off by the body.

name: Reduced number of intrahepatic bile ducts
description: The presence of reduced numbers of intrahepatic bile duct than normal.

name: Fatigable weakness of distal limb muscles
description: A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of distal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Abnormal upper motor neuron morphology
description: Any structural anomaly that affects the upper motor neuron.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of upper motor neuron

name: Freckling
description: The presence of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

name: Hemolytic-uremic syndrome
description: A thrombotic microangiopathy with presence of non-immune, intravascular hemolytic anemia, thrombocytopenia and acute kidney injury. A vicious cycle of complement activation, endothelial cell damage, platelet activation, and thrombosis is the hallmark of the disease.

name: Decreased distal sensory nerve action potential
description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential in distal nerve segments. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Hyperintensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
description: A brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

name: Vertical supranuclear gaze palsy
description: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a vertical direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

name: Laryngomalacia
description: Laryngomalacia is a congenital abnormality of the laryngeal cartilage in which the cartilage is floppy and prolapses over the larynx during inspiration.

name: Lethargy
description: A state of fatigue, either physical or mental slowness and sluggishness, with difficulties in initiating or performing simple tasks. Distinguished from apathy which implies indifference and a lack of desire or interest in the task. A person with lethargy may have the desire, but not the energy to engage in personal or socially relevant tasks.

name: Tricuspid atresia
description: Failure to develop of the tricuspid valve and thus lack of the normal connection between the right atrium and the right ventricle.

name: Wide anterior fontanel
description: Enlargement of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Abnormal heart valve morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac valve.

name: Fetal onset
description: Onset prior to birth but after 8 weeks of embryonic development (corresponding to a gestational age of 10 weeks).

name: Fused cervical vertebrae
description: A congenital anomaly characterized by a joining (fusion) of two or more cervical vertebral bodies with one another.

name: Elevated bronchoalveolar lavage fluid neutrophil proportion
description: Usually, Neutrophils make up less than 3% of all cells found in the broncho-alveloar lavage fluid. In children, standard value of neutrophils is higher depending on their age (children under the age of 5 show a maximum value of 10%). This elevated cell proportion is a sign for acute and chronic infections (HP:0012387, HP:0006538) and can be associated to specific diseases.
synonyms: Elevated level of neutrophils in broncho-alveolar lavage fluid

name: Blistering by anatomical location
description: Blistering (presence of multiple fluid filled blisters) categorized according to the body site where they occur.

name: Impaired neutrophil chemotaxis
description: An impairment of the migration of neutrophils towards chemoattractants as part of the innate immune response

name: Septo-optic dysplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the optic nerve and absence of the septum pellucidum.

name: Abnormal CSF pyruvate family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of pyruvate-family amino acids in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: Abnormal pyruvate-family amino acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid

name: Pancytopenia
description: An abnormal reduction in numbers of all blood cell types (red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets).

name: Postnatal growth retardation
description: Slow or limited growth after birth.

name: Bloody diarrhea
description: Passage of many stools containing blood.

name: Dilatation of the ventricular cavity
description: A localized outpouching of ventricular cavity that is generally associated with dyskinesia and paradoxical expansion during systole.

name: Tongue fasciculations
description: Fasciculations or fibrillation affecting the tongue muscle.

name: Hyperlipoproteinemia
description: An abnormal increase in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Psychomotor deterioration
description: Loss of previously present mental and motor abilities.

name: Dystonia
description: An abnormally increased muscular tone that causes fixed abnormal postures. There is a slow, intermittent twisting motion that leads to exaggerated turning and posture of the extremities and trunk.

name: Fibular aplasia
description: Absence of the fibula.

name: Abnormal connection of the cardiac segments
description: A deviance in the normal connections between two cardiac segments.
synonyms: Abnormal connexion of the cardiac segments
Discordant connection of the cardiac segments

name: Erratic myoclonus
description: A type of myoclonus in which the myoclonias shift from body region to another in a random and asynchronous fashion. Erratic myoclonus can affect the face or limbs, are brief, single or repetitive, very frequent and nearly continuous.

name: Motor tics
description: Movement-based tics affecting discrete muscle groups.

name: Recurrent gram-negative bacterial infections
description: Increased susceptibility to infection by gram-negative bacteria, as manifested by a medical history of repeated or frequent infections by these agents.

name: Abnormality of the coagulation cascade
description: An abnormality of the coagulation cascade, which is comprised of the contact activation pathway (also known as the intrinsic pathway) and the tissue factor pathway (also known as the extrinsic pathway) as well as cofactors and regulators.

name: Astigmatism
description: A type of refraction error associated with abnormal curvatures on the anterior and/or posterior surface of the cornea.
synonyms: Abnormal curving of the cornea or lens of the eye

name: Vegetative state
description: The absence of wakefulness and consciousness, but in contrast to a coma, there is involuntary opening of the eyes and movements such as teeth grinding, yawning, or thrashing of the extremities.

name: Abnormal oocyte morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the female germ cell (egg cell).

name: Episodic tachypnea
description: Episodes of very rapid breathing.

name: Abnormal retinal nerve fiber layer morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the retinal nerve fiber layer
synonyms: Abnormal retinal nerve fibre layer morphology

name: Primary hyperparathyroidism
description: A type of hyperparathyroidism caused by a primary abnormality of the parathyroid glands (e.g., adenoma, carcinoma, hyperplasia). Primary hyperparathyroidism is associated with hyercalcemia.

name: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy
description: Sudden unexpected death in epilepsy (SUDEP) is a sudden, unexpected, witnessed or unwitnessed, non-traumatic and non-drowning death, occurring in benign circumstances, in an individual with epilepsy, with or without evidence for a seizure and excluding documented status epilepticus, in which postmortem examination has not revealed a cause of death.

name: Erythematous papule
description: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid that is reddish (erythematous) in color.

name: Slender toe
description: Toes that are disproportionately narrow (reduced girth) for the hand/foot size or build of the individual.

name: Hemophagocytosis
description: Phagocytosis by macrophages of erythrocytes, leukocytes, platelets, and their precursors in bone marrow and other tissues.

name: Prolonged bleeding after surgery
description: Bleeding that persists longer than the normal time following a surgical procedure.

name: Akathisia
description: A state of motor restlessness, usually in the lower extremities, that is often but not always accompanied by a subjective sense of inner restlessness, an urge to move, and anxiety or dysphoria.

name: Unilateral cleft lip
description: A non-midline cleft of the upper lip on one side only.

name: Increased circulating prolactin concentration
description: The presence of abnormally increased levels of prolactin in the blood. Prolactin is a peptide hormone produced by the anterior pituitary gland that plays a role in breast development and lactation during pregnancy.

name: Hypomethioninemia
description: A decreased concentration of methionine in the blood.

name: Abnormal ossification of the pubic bone
description: Abnormal ossification (bone tissue formation) affecting the pubic bone, also known as the pubis.
synonyms: Abnormal maturation of the pubic bone

name: Nephrotic syndrome
