description: Nephrotic syndrome is a collection of findings resulting from glomerular dysfunction with an increase in glomerular capillary wall permeability associated with pronounced proteinuria. Nephrotic syndrome refers to the constellation of clinical findings that result from severe renal loss of protein, with Proteinuria and hypoalbuminemia, edema, and hyperlipidemia.

name: Retinal telangiectasia
description: Dilatation of small blood vessels of the retina.

name: Neonatal seizure with electrographic correlate
description: Neonatal seizure is a seizure type that occurs in neonatal period and is characterized by an electrographic event with sudden, repetitive, evolving stereotyped waveforms with a beginning and an end. This event can be associated or not with a clinical manifestation.

name: Episodic hyperhidrosis
description: Intermittent episodes of abnormally increased perspiration.

name: Shuffling gait
description: A type of gait (walking) characterized by by dragging one's feet along or without lifting the feet fully from the ground.

name: Abnormal mitral valve physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the mitral valve.

name: Telecanthus
description: Distance between the inner canthi more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparently increased distance between the inner canthi.

name: Increased cup-to-disc ratio
description: An elevation in the ratio of the diameter of the cup of the optic disc to the total diameter of the disk. The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale center (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefore may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells.

name: Pulverulent cataract
description: A kind of congenital cataract that is characterized by a hollow sphere of punctate opacities involving the fetal nucleus and that usually occurs bilaterally.

name: Anemic pallor
description: A type of pallor that is secondary to the presence of anemia.

name: Agenesis of lateral incisor
synonyms: Failure of development of lateral incisor

name: Stridor
description: Stridor is a high pitched sound resulting from turbulent air flow in the upper airway.

name: Biliary cirrhosis
description: Progressive destruction of the small-to-medium bile ducts of the intrahepatic biliary tree, which leads to progressive cholestasis and often end-stage liver disease.

name: Sudden loss of visual acuity
description: Severe loss of visual acuity within hours or days. This is characteristic of Leber hereditary optic neuropathy.

name: Irregular epiphyses
description: An alteration of the normally smooth contour of the epiphysis leading to an irregular appearance.
synonyms: Irregular end part of long bone

name: Eyelid myoclonus
description: Marked, involuntary jerking of the eyelids.

name: Airway obstruction
description: Obstruction of conducting airways of the lung.

name: Caesarean section
description: Delivery of a fetus through surgical incisions made through the abdominal wall (laparotomy) and the uterine wall (hysterotomy).

name: Functional abnormality of the gastrointestinal tract
description: Abnormal functionality of the gastrointestinal tract.
synonyms: Functional abnormality of the GI tract

name: Avascular necrosis
description: A disease where there is cellular death (necrosis) of bone components due to interruption of the blood supply.
synonyms: Death of bone due to decreased blood supply

name: Megacolon
description: Persistent and substantial increase in diameter diameter and length of the colon.

name: Iris coloboma
description: A coloboma of the iris.

name: Difficulty running
description: Reduced ability to run.

name: Paresis of extensor muscles of the big toe
Frontal cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy of the frontal cortex.

name: Abnormal metatarsal morphology
description: Abnormalities of the metatarsal bones (i.e. of five tubular bones located between the tarsal bones of the hind- and mid-foot and the phalanges of the toes).
synonyms: Abnormality of the long bone of foot

name: Abnormal ST segment
description: An electrocardiographic anomaly of the ST segment, which is the segment that connects the QRS complex and the T wave. The ST segment normally has a duration of 80 to 120 ms, is flat and at the same level (isoelectric) as the PR and TP segment.

name: Hallucinations
description: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state that, in the absence of external stimuli, have qualities of real perception. These perceptions are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space.

name: Poor gross motor coordination
description: An abnormality of the ability (skills) to perform a precise movement of large muscles with the intent to perform a specific act. Gross motor skills are required to mediate movements of the arms, legs, and other large body parts.

name: Viral encephalitis
description: An inflammation of brain parenchyma due to infection with a virus. Viral encephalitis can occur as a rare complication of common infections (eg, herpes virus infections) or can occur as a characteristic presentation of rare viruses (eg, rabies virus infection). Encephalitis may be the only neurologic manifestation of infection, or may occur in association with meningitis, myelitis, radiculitis, or neuritis. Viral encephalitis is associated with neurological dysfunction.

name: Esophageal ulceration
description: Defect in the epithelium of the esophagus, essentially an open sore in the lining of the esophagus.

name: Connective tissue nevi
description: Connective tissue nevi are hamartomas in which one or several components of the dermis is altered.

name: Facial asymmetry
description: An abnormal difference between the left and right sides of the face.
synonyms: Asymmetry of right and left side of face

name: Absent nipple
description: Congenital failure to develop, and absence of, the nipple.

name: Abnormality of dermal melanosomes
description: An abnormality of the melanosomes, i.e., of the cellular organelles in which melanin pigments are synthesized and stored within melanocytes (the cells that produce pigment in the dermis).

name: Severe demyelination of the white matter
description: A severe loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

name: Acute phase response
description: Presence of one or more manifestations of the acute phase response. Acute phase proteins (APP) are blood proteins primarily synthesized by hepatocytes as part of the acute phase response (APR). The APR is part of the early-defense or innate immune system, which is triggered by different stimuli including trauma, infection, stress, neoplasia, and inflammation. The APR results in a complex systemic reaction with the goal of reestablishing homeostasis and promoting healing.

name: Atypical scarring of skin
description: Atypically scarred skin .

name: Abnormal pupillary light reflex
description: An abnormality of the reflex that controls the diameter of the pupil, in response to the intensity of light that falls on the retina of the eye.

name: Thin lower lip vermilion
description: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lower lip more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).
synonyms: Decreased height of lower lip vermilion
Decreased volume of lower lip vermilion
Thin vermilion border of lower lip
Thin red part of the lower lip

name: Left ventricular outflow tract obstruction
description: Left ventricular outflow tract (LVOT) obstruction can occur at the valvular, subvalvular, or supravalvular level. In general, there is an obstruction to forward flow which increases afterload, and if untreated, can result in hypertrophy, dilatation, and eventual failure of the left ventricle.

name: Agenesis of central incisor
description: Agenesis of one or more central incisors, i.e., of lower secondary incisor, lower primary incisor, upper secondary incisor, or of upper central primary incisor.
synonyms: Failure of development of central incisor

name: Abnormal circulating adrenocorticotropin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of corticotropin in the blood.
synonyms: Abnormality of circulating adrenocorticotropic hormone level

name: Missing ribs
description: A developmental anomaly with absence of one or more ribs.

name: High-pitched cry
description: A type of crying in an abnormally high-pitched voice.

name: Increased pulmonary vascular resistance
description: Pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) more than 3 wood units, as defined by the current definition of pulmonary hypertension. 95% of individuals have a PVR of less than 2.4 wood units.

name: Bruising susceptibility
description: An ecchymosis (bruise) refers to the skin discoloration caused by the escape of blood into the tissues from ruptured blood vessels. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising. The corresponding phenotypic abnormality is generally elicited on medical history as a report of frequent ecchymoses or bruising without adequate trauma.

name: Anterior rib cupping
description: Wide, concave anterior rib end.

name: Anasarca
description: An extreme form of generalized edema with widespread and massive edema due to effusion of fluid into the extracellular space.

name: Abnormal oral frenulum morphology
description: An abnormality of the lingual frenulum, that is of the small fold of mucous membrane that attaches the tongue to the floor of the mouth, or the presence of accessory frenula in the oral cavity.

name: Male pseudohermaphroditism
description: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In male pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is male (XY) and the external genitalia are imcompletely virilized, ambiguous, or complete female. If gonads are present, they are testes.

name: Social disinhibition
description: A tendency to violate social norms because of a failure to resist temptations or urges in social settings.

name: Panhypogammaglobulinemia
description: A reduction in the circulating levels of all the major classes of immunoglobulin. is characterized by profound decreases in all classes of immunoglobulin with an absence of circulating B lymphocytes.

name: Pulmonary fibrosis
description: Replacement of normal lung tissues by fibroblasts and collagen.

name: Arterial stenosis
description: Narrowing or constriction of the inner surface (lumen) of an artery.

name: Leukocoria
description: An abnormal white reflection from the pupil rather than the usual black reflection.

name: Abnormal hip joint morphology
description: An abnormality of the hip joint.

name: Absence of renal corticomedullary differentiation
description: A lack of differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.

name: Abnormal erythrocyte physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).

name: Fragile skin
description: Skin that splits easily with minimal injury.

name: Moderately reduced visual acuity
description: Moderate reduction of the ability to see. On the 6m visual acuity scale, moderate reduction is defined as less than 6/18 but at least 6/60. On the 20ft visual acuity scale, moderate reduction is defined as less than 20/70 but at least 20/200. On the decimal visual acuity scale, moderate reduction is defined as less than 0.3 but at least 0.1.

name: Calf muscle hypertrophy
description: Muscle hypertrophy affecting the calf muscles.
synonyms: Muscular hypertrophy of the calf muscles

name: Aplasia of the middle phalanx of the hand
description: Absence of one or more middle phalanx of a finger.

name: Noncompaction cardiomyopathy
description: A type of cardiomyopathy characterized anatomically by deep trabeculations in the ventricular wall, which define recesses communicating with the main ventricular chamber.

name: Intermittent diarrhea
description: Repeated episodes of diarrhea separated by periods without diarrhea.

name: Scanning speech
description: An abnormal pattern of speech in which the words are as if measured or scanned; there is a pause after every syllable, and the syllables themselves are pronounced slowly.

name: Abnormal circulating amylase concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of amylase in the blood, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

name: Mucosal telangiectasiae
description: Telangiectasia of the mucosa, the mucous membranes which are involved in absorption and secretion that line cavities that are exposed to the external environment and internal organs.

name: Cerebral arteriovenous malformation
description: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the brain.

name: Abnormal preoccupation
description: Preoccupations refers to being absorbed in any particular thought, activity, or concern that captures the attention of the individual. It may have a positive or negative connotation.

name: Brisk reflexes
description: Tendon reflexes that are noticeably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examination). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal.

name: Spinal dysraphism
description: A heterogeneous group of congenital spinal anomalies that result from defective closure of the neural tube early in fetal life.
synonyms: Incomplete closure of the vertebral arch

name: Lobar holoprosencephaly
description: A type of holoprosencephaly in which most of the right and left cerebral hemispheres and lateral ventricles are separated but the most rostral aspect of the telencephalon, the frontal lobes, are fused, especially ventrally.

name: Abnormal renal insterstitial morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the interstitium of the kidney. The renal interstitium is defined as the intertubular, extraglomerular, extravascular space of the kidney. It is bounded on all sides by tubular and vascular basement membranes and is filled with cells, extracellular matrix, and interstitial fluid.

name: Chronic axonal neuropathy
description: An abnormality characterized by chronic impairment of the normal functioning of the axons.

name: Ketonuria
description: High levels of ketone bodies (acetoacetic acid, beta-hydroxybutyric acid, and acetone) in the urine. Ketone bodies are insignificant in the blood and urine of normal individuals in the postprandial or overnight-fasted state.

name: Antinuclear antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against nuclei or nuclear components.

name: Carcinoid tumor
description: A tumor formed from the endocrine (argentaffin) cells of the mucosal lining of a variety of organs including the stomach and intestine. These cells are from neuroectodermal origin.

name: Distal muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the musculature of the distal extremities.
synonyms: Muscle weakness, distal limbs, due to neuronopathy
Distal limb muscle weakness due to peripheral neuropathy

name: Typically de novo
description: Description of conditions that are exclusively or predominantly observed to display de novo variants. In some cases, this may be due to the limited reproductive fitness of affected individuals.
synonyms: Autosomal dominant germline de novo mutation

name: Bifid nasal tip
description: A splitting of the nasal tip. Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal tip.

name: Narrow greater sciatic notch
description: A narrowing of the sacrosciatic notch, i.e., the deep indentation in the posterior border of the hip bone at the point of union of the ilium and ischium.

name: Flaring of rib cage
description: The presence of wide, concave anterior rib ends.

name: Talipes equinovalgus
description: A deformity of foot and ankle in which the foot is bent down and outwards.

name: Abnormality of folate metabolism
description: An abnormality of the metabolism of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

name: Language impairment
description: Language impairment is a deficit in comprehension or production of language that includes reduced vocabulary, limited sentence structure, or impairments in written or spoken communication. Language abilities are substantially and quantifiably below age expectations.

name: Small intestinal dysmotility
description: Abnormal small intestinal contractions, such as spasms and intestinal paralysis related to the loss of the ability of the gut to coordinate muscular activity because of endogenous or exogenous causes.

name: Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
description: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

name: Abnormal myeloid leukocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of myeloid leukocytes.

name: Syncope
description: Syncope is a syndrome in which loss of consciousness is of relatively sudden onset, temporary (usually less than 1 to 2 minutes), self-terminating, and of usually rapid recovery. Syncope leads to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow.

name: Fatty replacement of skeletal muscle
description: Muscle fibers degeneration resulting in fatty replacement of skeletal muscle fibers

name: Transposition of the great arteries
description: A complex congenital heart defect in which the aorta arises from the morphologic right ventricle and the pulmonary artery arises from the morphologic left ventricle.

name: Periventricular white matter hyperintensities
description: Areas of brighter than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter that surrounds the cerebral ventricles.

name: Upper limb pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the arm.

name: Widely spaced teeth
description: Increased spaces (diastemata) between most of the teeth in the same dental arch.

name: Abnormality of DNA repair
description: An abnormality of the process of DNA repair, that is, of the process of restoring DNA after damage.

name: Supernumerary maxillary incisor
description: The presence of a supernumerary, i.e., extra, maxillary incisor, either the primary maxillary incisor or the permanent maxillary incisor.

name: Delusion
description: A delusion is a fixed false belief held despite evidence to the contrary. The term delusion broadly encompasses all false judgments that possess the following external characteristics to a significant, albeit unspecified, extent: (1) they are held with an exceptional level of conviction, accompanied by an unparalleled subjective certainty; (2) there is an inability to consider alternative experiences or compelling counter-arguments; (3) the content of the belief is impossible.

name: Chronic acidosis
description: Longstanding abnormal acid accumulation or depletion of base.

name: Hydroxyprolinuria
description: An increased concentration of 4-hydroxy-L-proline in the urine.

name: Biliary tract abnormality
description: An abnormality of the biliary tree.

name: Thyroid dysgenesis
description: Thyroid dysgenesis is a descriptive term that should be avoided if more precise information is available. However, the HPO keeps retains this term because it is commonly used in the medical literature. In humans, the process of thyroid morphogenesis occurs from the 3rd to 16th week of gestation. Alterations occurring during this period may result in a thyroid gland that is absent (thyroid agenesis or athyreosis), hypoplastic (thyroid hypoplasia), or located in an unusual position (thyroid ectopy). All these entities are grouped under the term thyroid dysgenesis.

name: Abnormal intestine morphology
description: An abnormality of the intestine. The closely related term enteropathy is used to refer to any disease of the intestine.

name: Impaired distal vibration sensation
description: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the distal portions of the limbs.

name: Mitochondrial myopathy
description: A type of myopathy associated with mitochondrial disease and characterized by findings on biopsy such as ragged red muscle fibers.

name: Abnormal cellular composition of bronchoalveolar fluid
description: Deviation from the commonly in healthy people observe cellular distribution. Normal ranges are macrophages over 80%, lymphocytes less than 15%, neutrophils less than 3%, eosinophils less than 0.5%, mast cells less than 0.5%.
synonyms: Abnormal cell differential of broncho-alveolar fluid

name: Angiofibromas
description: Angiofibroma consist of many often dilated vessels.

name: Focal dystonia
description: A type of dystonia that is localized to a specific part of the body.

name: Glossitis
description: Inflammation of the tongue.

name: Hamartoma
description: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that is native to the site of origin, e.g., exostoses, nevi and soft tissue hamartomas. Although most hamartomas are benign, some histologic subtypes, e.g., neuromuscular hamartoma, may proliferate aggressively such as mesenchymal cystic hamartoma, Sclerosing epithelial hamartoma, Sclerosing metanephric hamartoma.

name: Cone-shaped epiphyses of the middle phalanges of the hand
synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of the middle hand bones

name: Congenital hemolytic anemia
description: A form of hemolytic anemia with congenital onset.

name: Palpebral edema
description: Edema in the region of the eyelids.

name: Pursed lips
description: An abnormality of the appearance of the face caused by constant contraction of the lips leading to a puckered or pursed appearance.

name: Abnormality of masseter muscle
description: An abnormality of a masseter muscle.

name: Spondyloepiphyseal dysplasia
description: A disorder of bone growth affecting the vertebrae and the ends of the long bones (epiphyses).

name: Very low visual acuity
description: A reduction in visual acuity with best corrected visual acuity between 1.40 (20/500) and 1.89 logMAR (up to roughly 20/1590).

name: Abnormality of the umbilical cord
description: An abnormality of the umbilical cord, which is the cord connecting the developing embryo or fetus to the placenta.

name: Diffuse cerebral atrophy
description: Diffuse unlocalised atrophy affecting the cerebrum.

name: Peripheral edema
description: An abnormal accumulation of interstitial fluid in the soft tissues of the limbs.

name: Decreased serum zinc
description: A reduced concentration of zinc in the blood.

name: Dystrophic fingernails
description: The presence of misshapen or partially destroyed nail plates, often with accumulation of soft, yellow keratin between the dystrophic nail plate and nail bed, resulting in elevation of the nail plate.

name: Recurrent shingles
description: Repeated episodes of a localized, painful cutaneous eruption related to reactivation of varicella zoster virus (VZV) and characterized by a characteristic rash in one or two adjacent dermatomes.

name: Alacrima
description: Absence of tear secretion.
synonyms: Absence of tears in the eyes

name: Gastrostomy tube feeding in infancy
description: Feeding problem necessitating gastrostomy tube feeding.

name: Renal interstitial fibrosis
description: The accumulation of collagen and related extracellular matrix (ECM) molecules in the interstitium of the kidney. The interstitium is expanded by the presence of collagen that stain blue on trichrome. Tubules are not back to back, but rather separated by fibrosis and can be atrophic.

name: Esodeviation
description: A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate nasally.

name: Round face
description: The facial appearance is more circular than usual as viewed from the front.

name: Abnormal cerebral artery morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a cerebral artery. The cerebral arteries comprise three main pairs of arteries and their branches, which supply the cerebrum of the brain. These are the anterior cerebral artery, the middle cerebral artery, and the posterior cerebral artery.

name: Fibular bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the fibula.

name: Elevated circulating aldolase concentration
description: Concentration of fructose 1,6-bisphosphate aldolase in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

name: Tiger tail banding
description: An abnormal appearance of hair under polarizing microscopy (using crossed polarizers), whereby hair shafts show striking alternating bright and dark bands, often referred to as tiger tail banding.

name: Reduced factor IX activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor IX. Factor IX, which itself is activated by factor Xa or factor VIIa to form factor IXa, activates factor X into factor Xa.

name: Sleep-related breathing disorders
description: Conditions of abnormal and difficult respiration during sleep, including chronic snoring and sleep apnea.

name: Abnormal cardiovascular system physiology
description: Abnormal functionality of the cardiovascular system.

name: Episodic hypokalemia
description: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood occurring periodically with a return to normal between the episodes.

name: Type 1 muscle fiber atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 1 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

name: 4-5 toe cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 4 and 5.

name: Congenital onset
description: A phenotypic abnormality that is present at birth.

name: Spastic paraplegia
description: Complete loss of the ability to move the lower limbs accompanied by spasticity of the lower limbs.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. That is, the PIP joint of a fourth finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Hyperhidrosis
description: Abnormal excessive perspiration (sweating) despite the lack of appropriate stimuli like hot and humid weather.

name: Abnormality of mouth shape
description: An abnormality of the outline, configuration, or contour of the mouth.

name: Atopic dermatitis
description: Atopic dermatitis (AD) or atopic eczema is an itchy, inflammatory skin condition with a predilection for the skin flexures. It is characterized by poorly defined erythema with edema, vesicles, and weeping in the acute stage and skin thickening (lichenification) in the chronic stage.

name: Skin plaque
description: A plaque is a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter.

name: Increased endomysial connective tissue
description: An increased volume of the endomysium, which is a connective tissue sheath that surrounds each muscle fiber. Together, bundles of muscle fibers form a fasciculus, surrounded by another layer of connective tissue called the perimysium.

name: Ecchymosis
description: A purpuric lesion that is larger than 1 cm in diameter.

name: Nevus
description: A nevus is a type of hamartoma that is a circumscribed stable malformation of the skin.

name: Pulmonary interstitial thickening
description: Pathological thickening of the pulmonary interstitium visualized radiographically and divided into interlobular and intralobular septal thickening.

name: Intermittent jaundice
description: Jaundice that is sometimes present, sometimes not.

name: Decreased circulating complement C3 concentration
description: Concentration of the complement component C3 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Colpocephaly
description: Colpocephaly is an anatomic finding in the brain manifested by occipital horns that are disproportionately enlarged in comparison with other parts of the lateral ventricles.

name: Flexion contracture of digit
description: A bent (flexed) finger or toe joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement of joints.

name: Narrow nose
description: Interalar distance more than 2 SD below the mean for age, or alternatively, an apparently decreased width of the nasal base and alae.

name: Vertebral hypoplasia
description: Small, underdeveloped vertebral bodies.

name: Abnormal vertebral morphology
description: An abnormality of one or more of the vertebrae.

name: Linear arrays of macular hyperkeratoses in flexural areas
Hyperlordosis
description: Abnormally increased curvature (anterior concavity) of the lumbar or cervical spine.

name: Duodenal ulcer
description: An erosion of the mucous membrane in a portion of the duodenum.

name: Lamina lucida cleavage
description: The formation of bullae (blisters) with cleavage in the lamina lucida layer of the skin.
synonyms: Subepidermal blistering with cleavage in the lamina lucida

name: Hyperplastic callus formation
description: Increased growth of callus, the bony and cartilaginous material that forms a connecting bridge across a bone fracture during fracture healing.

name: Cerebral dysmyelination
description: Defective structure and function of myelin sheaths of the white matter of the brain.

name: Abnormality of pulmonary circulation
description: A functional anomaly of that portion of the cardiosvascular system that carries deoxygenated blood from the heart to the lungs and returns oxygenated blood back to the heart.

name: Kinked brainstem
description: A kinked appearance of the brainstem, i.e., an exaggerated flexure.

name: Tendon xanthomatosis
description: The presence of xanthomas (intra-and extra-cellular accumulations of cholesterol) extensor tendons (typically over knuckles, Achilles tendon, knee, and elbows).

name: Abnormal waist to hip ratio
description: A deviation from normal of the waist to hip ratio, defined as the waist measurement divided by hip measurement.

name: Autoimmune hemolytic anemia
description: An autoimmune form of hemolytic anemia.

name: Miscarriage
description: A pregnancy that ends at a stage in which the fetus is incapable of surviving on its own, defined as the spontaneous loss of a fetus before the 22th week of pregnancy.

name: Abnormal nasal mucosa morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of mucous membrane of nose

name: Delayed somatosensory central conduction time
description: An abnormal increase (delay) in the somatosensory central conduction time (CCT), which can be measured from the peak of N13 to the peak of N20 (peak CCT) or from the onset of N11 to the onset of N20 (onset CCT).

name: Inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion
description: A state of increased circulating antidiuretic hormone despite hyponatremia and hypo-osmolality with normal or increased plasma volume.
synonyms: Syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone secretion

name: Chronic bronchitis
description: Chronic inflammation of the bronchi.

name: Chronic otitis media
description: Chronic otitis media refers to fluid, swelling, or infection of the middle ear that does not heal and may cause permanent damage to the ear.
synonyms: Chronic infections of the middle ear

name: Delayed ability to roll over
description: Delayed achievement of the ability to roll front to back and back to front.

name: Abnormal speech discrimination
description: A type of hearing impairment prominently characterized by a difficulty in understanding speech, rather than an inability to hear speech. Poor speech discrimination is a very common symptom of high frequency hearing loss.

name: Abnormality of the pancreas
description: An abnormality of the pancreas.

name: Adrenal insufficiency
description: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands.

name: Distal arthrogryposis
description: An inherited primary limb malformation disorder characterized by congenital contractures of two or more different body areas and without primary neurologic and/or muscle disease that affects limb function.

name: Parietal bossing
description: Parietal bossing is a marked prominence in the parietal region.

name: Periodic paralysis
description: Episodes of muscle weakness.

name: Abnormality of the tarsal bones
description: An abnormality of the tarsus are the cluster of seven bones in the foot between the tibia and fibula and the metatarsus, including the calcaneus (heel) bone and the talus (ankle) bone.

name: Nevus sebaceous
description: A congenital, hairless plaque consisting of overgrown epidermis, sebaceous glands, hair follicles, apocrine glands and connective tissue. They are a variant of epidermal naevi. Sebaceous naevi most often appear on the scalp, but they may also arise on the face, neck or forehead. At birth, a sevaceous nevus typically appears as a solitary, smooth, yellow-orange hairless patch. Sebaceous naevi become more pronounced around adolescence, often appearing bumpy, warty or scaly.

name: Abnormal forearm morphology
description: An abnormality of the lower arm.

name: Tracheoesophageal fistula
description: An abnormal connection (fistula) between the esophagus and the trachea.
synonyms: Abnormal connection between trachea and esophagus
Abnormal connection between trachea and oesophagus

name: Abnormal form of the vertebral bodies
description: Abnormal morphology of vertebral body.

name: Hashimoto thyroiditis
description: A chronic, autoimmune type of thyroiditis associated with hypothyroidism.

name: Short distal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the fifth finger.
synonyms: Hypoplastic/small terminal phalanx of the little finger
Short distal phalanx of the fifth finger

name: Vaginal neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the vagina.

name: Hepatic encephalopathy
description: Central nervous system dysfunction in association with liver failure and characterized clinically (depending on degree of severity) by lethargy, confusion, nystagmus, decorticate posturing, spasticity, and bilateral Babinski reflexes.

name: Elevated pulmonary artery pressure
description: An abnormally elevated blood pressure in the circulation of the pulmonary artery.

name: Medullary nephrocalcinosis
description: The deposition of calcium salts in the parenchyma of the renal medulla (innermost part of the kidney).

name: Viral hepatitis
description: Inflammation of the liver due to infection with a virus.

name: Speech articulation difficulties
description: Impairment in the physical production of speech sounds.

name: Speech apraxia
description: A type of apraxia that is characterized by difficulty or inability to execute speech movements because of problems with coordination and motor problems, leading to incorrect articulation. An increase of errors with increasing word and phrase length may occur.

name: Spontaneous pain sensation
description: Spontaneous pain is a kind of neuropathic pain which occurs without an identifiable trigger.

name: Increased nuchal translucency
description: Nuchal translucency is the sonographic appearance of subcutaneous accumulation of liquid in the back of the fetal neck in the first trimester of pregnancy (11-14 gestational weeks of pregnancy).

name: Abnormal number of incisors
description: The presence of an altered number of the incisor teeth.

name: Bone marrow maturation arrest
description: Interruption of the procecss of diffferentiation of hematopoietic cells in the bone marrow, manifested by an increased proportion of immature cells in the bone marrow.

name: Limb muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength and weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

name: Status epilepticus with prominent motor symptoms
description: Status epilepticus with prominent motor signs during the prolonged seizure.

name: Broad long bones
description: Increased cross-section (diameter) of the long bones. Note that widening may primarily affect specific regions of long bones (e.g., diaphysis or metaphysis), but this should be coded separately.

name: Abnormal pericardium morphology
description: An abnormality of the pericardium, i.e., of the fluid filled sac that surrounds the heart and the proximal ends of the aorta, vena cava, and the pulmonary artery.

name: Renal atrophy
description: Atrophy of the kidney.

name: Anteriorly placed anus
description: Anterior malposition of the anus.

name: Urogenital fistula
description: The presence of a fistula affecting the genitourinary system.

name: Sleep onset insomnia
description: Difficulty initiating sleep, that is, increased sleep onset latency, refers to the condition where it takes 30 minutes or more to fall asleep.

name: Irregular menstruation
description: Abnormally high variation in the amount of time between periods.

name: Renal malrotation
description: An abnormality of the normal developmental rotation of the kidney leading to an abnormal orientation of the kidney.

name: Narrow forehead
description: Width of the forehead or distance between the frontotemporales is more than two standard deviations below the mean (objective); or apparently narrow intertemporal region (subjective).

name: Cervical lymphadenopathy
description: Enlarged lymph nodes in the neck.
synonyms: Swollen lymph nodes in the neck

name: Basal cell carcinoma
description: The presence of a basal cell carcinoma of the skin.

name: Eosinophilic infiltration of the esophagus
description: Infiltration of numerous eosinophils (usually greater than 15 per high power field) into the squamous epithelium of the esophagus, and layering of eosinophils on the surface layer of the esophagus.

name: Hyperplasia of midface
description: Abnormally anterior positioning of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased convexity of the face, or increased nasolabial angle. The midface includes the maxilla, the cheeks, the zygomas, and the infraorbital and perialar regions of the face

name: Ileus
description: Acute obstruction of the intestines preventing passage of the contents of the intestines.

name: Papillary cystadenoma of the epididymis
description: A cystadenoma, an epithelial tumor, that originates within the head of the epididymis.

name: Sandal gap
description: A widely spaced gap between the first toe (the great toe) and the second toe.
synonyms: Gap between first and second toe
Increased space between first and second toes
Sandal gap between first and second toes
Space between great toe and second toe
Wide space between first and second toes
Widely spaced first and second toes
Widened gap first and second toe

name: Areflexia of lower limbs
description: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the lower limbs.

name: Profound sensorineural hearing impairment
description: Complete loss of hearing related to a sensorineural defect.

name: Stereotypic whole-body movements
description: Abnormal movements of the whole body.

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the limbs
synonyms: Muscle issues in the arms and/or legs

name: Limbal dermoid
description: A benign tumor typically found at the junction of the cornea and sclera (limbal epibullar dermoid).

name: Sleep-wake cycle disturbance
description: Any abnormality of an individual's circadian rhythm that affects the timing of sleeping and being awake is referred to as a sleep-wake disorder.

name: Elevated urinary homovanillic acid
description: An increased concentration of homovanillic acid in the urine.

name: Prolonged bleeding following circumcision
description: Bleeding that persists for a longer than usual time following circumcision.

name: Abnormality of the gallbladder
description: An abnormality of the gallbladder.

name: Abnormal forehead morphology
description: An anomaly of the forehead.
synonyms: Abnormality of the frontal region of the face

name: Decreased palmar creases
description: Poorly defined or shallow palmar creases.

name: Fetal polyuria
description: Abnormally increased production of urine by the fetus resulting in polyhydramnios.

name: Inguinal freckling
description: The presence in the inguinal region (groin) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

name: Abnormality of the vertebral endplates
description: Any abnormality of the vertebral end plates, which are the top and bottom portions of the vertebral bodies that interface with the vertebral disks.

name: Redundant neck skin
description: Excess skin around the neck, often lying in horizontal folds.

name: Phthisis bulbi
description: Atrophy of the eyeball with blindness and decreased intraocular pressure due to end-stage intraocular disease.

name: Tibialis muscle weakness
description: Muscle weakness affecting the tibialis anterior muscle.

name: Short lower limbs
description: Shortening of the legs related to developmental hypoplasia of the bones of the leg.

name: Increased circulating insulin-like growth factor 1 concentration
description: An elevated level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

name: Epidermal nevus
description: Epidermal naevi are due to an overgrowth of the epidermis and may be present at birth (50%) or develop during childhood.

name: Intracerebral periventricular calcifications
description: The presence of calcium deposition in the cerebral white matter surrounding the cerebral ventricles.

name: Cogwheel rigidity
description: A type of rigidity in which a muscle responds with cogwheellike jerks to the use of constant force in bending the limb (i.e., it gives way in little, repeated jerks when the muscle is passively stretched).

name: Punctate opacification of the cornea
description: Punctate opacification (reduced transparency) of the corneal stroma.

name: Feeding difficulties in infancy
description: Impaired feeding performance of an infant as manifested by difficulties such as weak and ineffective sucking, brief bursts of sucking, and falling asleep during sucking. There may be difficulties with chewing or maintaining attention.

name: Hand clenching
description: An abnormal hand posture in which the hands are clenched to fists. All digits held completely flexed at the metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints. In prenatal sonography of the fetal clenched hand, the index finger overlaps a clenched fist formed by the other digits. The proximal interphalangeal articulation of the index finger is flexed and ulnarly deviated, and the thumb is adducted.

name: Abnormality of the ureter
description: An abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

name: Intrahepatic bile duct dilatation
description: Increased diameter (caliber) of intrahepatic bile ducts (bile ducts that transport bile between the Canals of Hering and the interlobar bile ducts).

name: Tongue atrophy
description: Wasting of the tongue.

name: Decreased lacrimation
description: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced tear production.

name: Enlarged epiphyses
description: Increased size of epiphyses.

name: Shallow anterior chamber
description: Reduced depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is decreased.

name: Small epiphyses
description: Reduction in the size or volume of epiphyses.

name: Abnormal tendon morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure or form of the tendons, also often called sinews.

name: Cone-shaped metacarpal epiphyses
description: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphyses of the metacarpal bones, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: Cone-shaped end part of long bone

name: Hyperchloremic acidosis
description: Acidosis (pH less than 7.35) that develops with an increase in ionic chloride.

name: Nocturia
description: Abnormally increased production of urine during the night leading to an unusually frequent need to urinate.

name: Ocular anterior segment dysgenesis
description: Abnormal development (dysgenesis) of the anterior segment of the eye globe. These structures are mainly of mesenchymal origin.

name: Sparse scalp hair
description: Decreased number of hairs per unit area of skin of the scalp.
synonyms: Reduction in the number of scalp follicles

name: Primary adrenal insufficiency
description: Insufficient production of steroid hormones (primarily cortisol) by the adrenal glands as a result of a primary defect in the glands themselves.

name: Split nail
description: A nail plate that has a longitudinal separation and the two sections of the nail share the same lateral radius of curvature.

name: Collectionism
description: Excessive or pathological tendency to save and collect possessions.

name: Wide nasal bridge
description: Increased breadth of the nasal bridge (and with it, the nasal root).
synonyms: Increased breadth of bridge of nose
Increased width of bridge of nose

name: Abnormality of hair texture
description: An abnormality of the texture of the hair.

name: Hypoplasia of the bladder
description: Underdevelopment of the urinary bladder.

name: Hemoglobinuria
description: The presence of free hemoglobin in the urine.

name: Thick lower lip vermilion
description: Increased thickness of the lower lip, leading to a prominent appearance of the lower lip. The height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the midline is more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the lower lip in the frontal view (subjective).
synonyms: Increased height of lower lip vermilion
Increased volume of lower lip vermilion
Thick vermilion border of lower lip
Thick red part of the lower lip

name: EEG with focal sharp slow waves
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.

name: Retrognathia
description: An abnormality in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

name: Skin pit
description: A small, skin-lined tract that leads from the surface to deep within the tissues.

name: Hypointensity of cerebral white matter on MRI
description: A darker than expected signal on magnetic resonance imaging emanating from the cerebral white matter.

name: Opsoclonus
description: Bursts of large-amplitude multidirectional saccades without intersaccadic interval

name: Anti-smooth muscle antibody positivity
description: The presence in serum of antibodies against smooth muscle.

name: Motor neuron atrophy
description: Wasting involving the motor neuron.

name: Narrow palm
description: For children from birth to 4 years of age, the palm width is more than 2 SD below the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is below the 5th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

name: Hydrops fetalis
description: The abnormal accumulation of fluid in two or more fetal compartments, including ascites, pleural effusion, pericardial effusion, and skin edema.

name: Short tibia
description: Underdevelopment (reduced size) of the tibia.

name: Cerebral edema
description: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the brain.

name: Hypoplastic toenails
description: Underdevelopment of the toenail.

name: Onychogryphosis of fingernail
description: Thickened fingernails.

name: Abnormal retinal morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the retina.

name: Hematemesis
description: The vomiting of blood.

name: Increased total leukocyte count
description: An abnormal increase in the number of leukocytes in the blood.

name: Thick corpus callosum
description: Increased vertical dimension of the corpus callosum. This feature can be visualized by sagittal sections on magnetic resonance tomography imaging of the brain.

name: Anarthria
description: A defect in the motor ability that enables speech.

name: Abnormal T cell activation
description: Any abnormality in the activation of T cells, i.e. the change in morphology and behavior of a mature or immature T cell resulting from exposure to a mitogen, cytokine, chemokine, cellular ligand, or an antigen for which it is specific.

name: Maternal hypertension
description: Increased blood pressure during a pregnancy.

name: Branchial anomaly
description: Congenital developmental defect arising from the primitive branchial apparatus.

name: Abnormality of peripheral nerve conduction
description: An abnormality of the conduction of electrical impulses by peripheral (motor or sensory) nerves. This finding is elicited by a nerve conduction study (NCS).
synonyms: Sensory and motor nerve conduction abnormalities

name: Abnormal experience of reality
description: Subjective phenomena or perceptions that deviate from what is considered correct or are outside the range of normal human experiences.

name: Decreased corneal reflex
description: An abnormally reduced response to stimulation of the cornea (by touch, foreign body, blowing air). The corneal reflex (also known as the blink reflex, normally results in an involuntary blinking of the eyelids.

name: Laryngeal hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the larynx.

name: Ependymoma
description: The presence of an ependymoma of the central nervous system.

name: Giant cell hepatitis
description: Chronic hepatitis characterized by parenchymal inflammation with formation of large multinucleated hepatocytes in response to a variety of insults to the liver.
synonyms: Giant cell hepatitis on liver biopsy
Giant cell hepatitis shown on biopsy

name: Abnormal circulating sulfur amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sulfur amino acid in the blood circulation.
synonyms: Abnormal circulating sulphur amino acid concentration

name: Renal hamartoma
description: A disordered proliferation of mature tissues that are native to the kidneys.

name: Geographic atrophy
description: Sharply demarcated area of partial or complete depigmentation of the fundus reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss. The margins of the de-pigmented area are usually scalloped and the large choroidal vessels are visible through the atrophic retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Muscular ventricular septal defect
description: The trabecular septum is the largest part of the interventricular septum. It extends from the membranous septum to the apex and superiorly to the infundibular septum. A defect in the trabecular septum is called muscular VSD if the defect is completely rimmed by muscle.

name: Decreased transferrin saturation
description: A below normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

name: Cardiomegaly
description: Increased size of the heart, clinically defined as an increased transverse diameter of the cardiac silhouette that is greater than or equal to 50% of the transverse diameter of the chest (increased cardiothoracic ratio) on a posterior-anterior projection of a chest radiograph or a computed tomography.

name: Abnormal urine carboxylic acid level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Giant platelets
description: Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers. The term giant platelet is used when the platelet is larger than the size of the average red cell in the field. (Description adapted from College of American Pathologists, Hematology Manual, 1998).

name: Reduced total natural killer cell count
description: The absolute count of natural killer cells in the blood, per microlitre, is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints, or a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits that lies significantly distal to the flexion crease that overlies the metacarpophalangeal or metatarsophalangeal joint of the adjacent digits.

name: Synostosis of joints
description: The abnormal fusion of neighboring bones across a joint.

name: Metaphase I oocyte maturation arrest
description: Failure of oocytes to proceed through the stages of meiosis with stoppage at the first metaphase stage.
synonyms: Oocyte meiotic arrest at metaphase I

name: Broad femoral neck
description: An abnormally wide femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Overlapping toe
description: Describes a foot digit resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the foot is at rest. Initially clawing may be dynamic and only noticeable on walking. Over time the plantar plate tears, subluxation occurs at the metatarsophalangeal joint (MTPJ), and the deformity becomes permanent.

name: EEG with continuous slow activity
description: EEG showing diffuse slowing without interruption.

name: Decreased circulating total IgM
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin M (IgM) in blood.

name: Abnormality of cardiovascular system electrophysiology
description: An anomaly of the electrical conduction physiology of the heart.

name: Large sella turcica
description: An abnormal enlargement of the sella turcica.

name: Monochromacy
description: Complete color blindness, a complete inability to distinguish colors. Affected persons cannot perceive colors, but only shades of gray.

name: Female pseudohermaphroditism
description: Hermaphroditism refers to a discrepancy between the morphology of the gonads and that of the external genitalia. In female pseudohermaphroditism, the genotype is female (XX) and the gonads are ovaries, but the external genitalia are virilized.

name: Abnormal ureter morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

name: Pallor
description: Abnormally pale skin.

name: Popliteal pterygium
description: A pterygium (or pterygia) occurring in the popliteal region (the back of the knee).

name: Enlarged vestibular aqueduct
description: Increased size of the vestibular aqueduct.

name: Pericardial effusion
description: Accumulation of fluid within the pericardium.

name: Hypochromic microcytic anemia
description: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes and lower than normal size of the erythrocytes.

name: Dysphagia
description: Difficulty in swallowing.

name: Neonatal omphalitis
description: An infection of the umbilicus and/or surrounding tissues occurring in the neonatal period.

name: Tented upper lip vermilion
description: Triangular appearance of the oral aperture with the apex in the midpoint of the upper vermilion and the lower vermilion forming the base.

name: Abnormal response to insulin tolerance test
description: An anomalous response to the insulin tolerance test (ITT), in which insulin is administered intravenously and blood glucose and potentially other compounds are measured at intervals. Insulin administration is intended to induce extreme hypoglycemia (bloodgluoce below 40 mg/dl), which in turn induces release of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). ACTH induces the adrenal gland to release cortisol, which together with GH opposes the action of insulin on the blood glucose level.

name: Abnormal cervical curvature
description: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Generalized joint hypermobility
description: Joint hypermobility (ability of a joint to move beyond its normal range of motion) affecting many or all joints of the body. In individuals with Joint hypermobility at multiple sites (usually five or more), the term generalized joint hypermobility is preferred.

name: Dysgenesis of the cerebellar vermis
description: Defective development of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Renal tubular acidosis
description: Acidosis owing to malfunction of the kidney tubules with accumulation of metabolic acids and hyperchloremia, potentially leading to complications including hypokalemia, hypercalcinuria, nephrolithiasis and nephrocalcinosis.
synonyms: Accumulation of acid in body due to kidney problem

name: Abnormal 1st metacarpal morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the first metacarpal.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 1st long bone of hand

name: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
description: Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.

name: Small scrotum
description: Apparently small scrotum for age.
synonyms: Smaller than typical growth of scrotum

name: Abnormal gastric mucosa morphology
description: An abnormality of the gastric mucous membrane.
synonyms: Abnormality of the mucous membrane layer of stomach

name: Abnormal enzyme activity in muscle tissue
description: Deviation from the normal activity of an enzyme in muscle tissue.

name: Decreased circulating IgA concentration
description: Decreased levels of immunoglobulin A (IgA).

name: Gaze-evoked horizontal nystagmus
description: Horizontal nystagmus made apparent by looking to the right or to the left.

name: Simple ear
description: The pinna has fewer folds and grooves than usual.

name: Hematological neoplasm
description: Neoplasms located in the blood and blood-forming tissue (the bone marrow and lymphatic tissue).

name: Increased density of long bones
description: An abnormal increase in the bone density of the long bones.

name: Triceps weakness
description: A lack of strength in the triceps muscle, which normally is responsible for extending (straightening) the elbow and mediating certain shoulder movements.

name: White eyebrow
description: White color (lack of pigmentation) of the eyebrow.

name: Proportionate short stature
description: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to a comparable extent.

name: Hemianopia
description: Partial or complete loss of vision in one half of the visual field of one or both eyes.

name: Dysgraphia
description: A writing disability in the absence of motor or sensory deficits of the upper extremities, resulting in an impairment in the ability to write regardless of the ability to read and not due to intellectual impairment.

name: Optic nerve misrouting
description: Abnormal decussation of the visual pathways, typically identified using visual evoked potentials (VEP) (asymmetrical distribution of the VEP over the posterior scalp).

name: Abnormal knee physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the knee joint.

name: Abnormal lower limb bone morphology
synonyms: Abnormal morphology of bones of the lower limbs
Abnormal shape of bones of the lower limbs

name: Meningocele
description: Protrusion of the meninges through a defect of the skull or vertebral column.

name: Abnormal liver metabolite concentration
description: The concentration of a metabolite in the liver is above or below the limits of normal.

name: Infectious encephalitis
description: A disorder of the brain caused by an infectious agent that presents with fever, headache, and an altered level of consciousness. There may also be focal or multifocal neurologic deficits, and focal or generalized seizure activity.

name: Urogenital sinus anomaly
description: A rare birth defect in women where the urethra and vagina both open into a common channel.

name: Fever
description: Body temperature elevated above the normal range.

name: Slender build
description: Asthenic habitus refers to a slender build with long limbs, an angular profile, and prominent muscles or bones.

name: Oligodactyly
description: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of digits.

name: Bowed forearm bones
description: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting either the radius, the ulna, or both.

name: Abnormality of the elbow
description: An anomaly of the joint that connects the upper and the lower arm.

name: Chronic constipation
description: Constipation for longer than three months with fewer than 3 bowel movements per week, straining, lumpy or hard stools, and a sensation of anorectal obstruction or incomplete defecation.

name: Fasciculations
description: Fasciculations are observed as small, local, involuntary muscle contractions (twitching) visible under the skin. Fasciculations result from increased irritability of an axon (which in turn is often a manifestation of disease of a motor neuron). This leads to sporadic discharges of all the muscle fibers controlled by the axon in isolation from other motor units.

name: Abnormal pancreas size
description: A deviation from the normal size of the pancreas.

name: Abnormality of the calcaneus
description: An abnormality of the calcaneus, also known as the heel bone, one of the or heel bone, one of the components of the tarsus of the foot which make up the heel.

name: Femoral bowing
description: Bowing (abnormal curvature) of the femur.

name: Oligozoospermia
description: Reduced count of spermatozoa in the semen, defined as a sperm count below 20 million per milliliter semen.

name: Increased circulating free fatty acid level
description: A higher than normal levels of the fatty acids which can occur in plasma as a result of lipolysis in adipose tissue or when plasma triacyglycerols are taken into tissues.

name: Decreased facial expression
description: A reduced degree of voluntary and involuntary facial movements involved in responded to others or expressing emotions.

name: Cryptophthalmos
description: Cryptophthalmos is a condition of total absence of eyelids and the skin of forehead is continuous with that of cheek, in which the eyeball is completely concealed by the skin, which is stretched over the orbital cavity.

name: Synostosis involving bones of the upper limbs
description: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the upper limbs.
synonyms: Fusion involving bones of the upper limbs

name: Ring scotoma
description: An annular field defect centered on fixation.

name: Short proximal phalanx of finger
description: Congenital hypoplasia of one or more proximal phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Hypoplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Sensory neuropathy
description: Peripheral neuropathy affecting the sensory nerves.
synonyms: Damage to nerves that sense feeling

name: Personality changes
description: An abnormal shift in patterns of thinking, acting, or feeling.

name: Abnormal number of erythroid precursors
description: A deviation from the normal count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.

name: Female hypogonadism
description: Decreased functionality of the female gonads, i.e., of the ovary.

name: Hepatic necrosis
description: The presence of cell death (necrosis) affecting the liver.

name: Open operculum
description: Underdevelopment of the operculum.

name: Genital neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genital system.

name: Cutaneous cyst
description: A hollow mass located in the skin that is surrounded by an epithelium-lined wall and is well demarcated from the adjacent tissue. Cysts are often said to be sac-like and may contain serous liquid or semisolid material.

name: Abnormal circulating aromatic amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a aromatic amino acid in the blood circulation.
synonyms: Abnormality of aromatic amino acid family metabolism

name: Reduced blood folate concentration
description: A reduced circulating concentration of folic acid, which is also known as vitamin B9.

name: Multifocal epileptiform discharges
description: An abnormality in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG) and being identified at multiple locations (foci).

name: Distal lower limb amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy of distal leg muscles.

name: Ventricular hypertrophy
description: Enlargement of the cardiac ventricular muscle tissue with increase in the width of the wall of the ventricle and loss of elasticity. Ventricular hypertrophy is clinically differentiated into left and right ventricular hypertrophy.

name: Increased total T cell count
description: The absolute number of T cells per volume is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Upgaze palsy
description: A limitation of the ability to direct one's gaze above the horizontal meridian.

name: Abnormal scalp morphology
description: Any anomaly of the scalp, the skin an subcutaneous tissue of the head on which head hair grows.

name: Lymphadenitis
description: Inflammation of a lymph node.

name: Postnatal macrocephaly
description: The postnatal development of an abnormally large skull (macrocephaly).

name: High hypermetropia
description: A severe form of hypermetropia with over +5.00 diopters.

name: Thymoma
description: A tumor originating from the epithelial cells of the thymus.

name: Abnormal cornea morphology
description: Any abnormality of the cornea, which is the transparent tissue at the front of the eye that covers the iris, pupil, and anterior chamber.

name: Metaphyseal striations
description: Longitudinal densities on radiographs located in a metaphysis (the narrow region of a long bone between the epiphysis and the diaphysis).

name: Abnormality of globe location
description: An abnormality in the placement of the ocular globe (eyeball).

name: Erythrocyte inclusion bodies
description: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of substances in red blood cells.

name: Cold-induced muscle cramps
description: Sudden and involuntary contractions of one or more muscles brought on by exposure to cold temperatures.

name: Oral mucosal blisters
description: Blisters arising in the mouth.

name: Vertebral arch anomaly
description: A morphological abnormality of the vertebral arch, i.e., of the posterior part of a vertebra.

name: Myelofibrosis
description: Replacement of bone marrow by fibrous tissue.

name: Abnormality of the abdominal organs
description: An abnormality of the viscera of the abdomen.

name: Junctional ectopic tachycardia
description: Junctional ectopic tachycardia (JET) is a unique type of supraventricular arrhythmia defined by narrow QRS complex and atrioventricular (AV) dissociation or retrograde atrial conduction in a 1:1 pattern.

name: Decreased body mass index
description: Abnormally decreased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of underweight compared to averages.

name: Impaired smooth pursuit
description: An impairment of the ability to track objects with the ocular smooth pursuit system, a class of rather slow eye movements that minimizes retinal target motion.

name: Homocystinuria
description: An increased concentration of homocystine in the urine.

name: Impacted tooth
description: A tooth that has not erupted because of local impediments (overcrowding or fibrous gum overgrowth).

name: Amegakaryocytic thrombocytopenia
description: Thrombocytopenia related to lack of or severe reduction in the count of megakaryocytes.

name: Macular hypopigmentation
description: Decreased amount of pigmentation in the macula lutea.

name: Velopharyngeal insufficiency
description: Inability of velopharyngeal sphincter to sufficiently separate the nasal cavity from the oral cavity during speech.

name: Advanced ossification of carpal bones
description: Ossification of carpal bones at an abnormally early age.

name: Abnormal circulating protein concentration
description: An abnormal level of a circulating protein in the blood.

name: Olivopontocerebellar atrophy
description: Neuronal degeneration in the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

name: Mental deterioration
description: Loss of previously present mental abilities, generally in adults.

name: Premature ventricular contraction
description: Premature ventricular contractions (PVC) or ventricular extrasystoles are premature contractions of the heart that arise in response to an impulse in the ventricles rather than the normal impulse from the sinoatrial (SA) node.

name: Supranuclear ophthalmoplegia
description: A vertical gaze palsy with inability to direct the gaze of the eyes downwards.

name: Bone fracture
description: A partial or complete breakage of the continuity of a bone.

name: Abnormal circulating vitamin A concentration
description: Concentration of vitamin A in the blood circulation outside limits of normal.

name: Episodic vomiting
description: Paroxysmal, recurrent episodes of vomiting.

name: Genu varum
description: A positional abnormality marked by outward bowing of the legs in which the knees stay wide apart when a person stands with the feet and ankles together.

name: Typical absence seizure
description: A typical absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterized by its sudden onset, interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare, possibly a brief upward deviation of the eyes. Usually the patient will be unresponsive when spoken to. Duration is a few seconds to half a minute with very rapid recovery. Although not always available, an EEG would usually show 3 Hz generalized epileptiform discharges during the event.

name: Decreased serum insulin-like growth factor 1
description: A reduced level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal wrist physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the wrist.

name: Aplasia of the ulna
description: Missing ulna bone associated with congenital failure of development.

name: Shallow orbits
description: Reduced depth of the orbits associated with prominent-appearing ocular globes.

name: Proximal tubulopathy
description: Dysfunction of the proximal tubule, which is the portion of the duct system of the nephron of the kidney which leads from Bowman's capsule to the loop of Henle.

name: Reduced tendon reflexes
description: Diminution of tendon reflexes, which is an invariable sign of peripheral nerve disease.
synonyms: Absent or decreased deep tendon reflexes
Decreased to absent deep tendon reflexes
Diminished or absent deep tendon reflexes
Hypoactive to absent deep tendon reflexes
Weak or absent deep tendon reflexes

name: Abnormal esophagus morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the esophagus.

name: Papule
description: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

name: Abnormal talus morphology
description: An abnormality of the talus.

name: Peripapillary chorioretinal atrophy
description: Chorioretinal atrophy concentrated around the optic papilla (i.e., the optic nerve head).

name: Horseshoe kidney
description: A connection of the right and left kidney by an isthmus of functioning renal parenchyma or fibrous tissue that crosses the midline.

name: Congenital muscular torticollis
description: A congenital form of torticollis resulting from shortening of the sternocleidomastoid muscle and leading to a limited range of motion in both rotation and lateral bending.

name: Stenosis of the external auditory canal
description: An abnormal narrowing of the external auditory canal.
synonyms: Narrowing of passageway from outer ear to middle ear

name: Coxa vara
description: Coxa vara includes all forms of decrease of the femoral neck shaft angle (the angle between the neck and the shaft of the femur) to less than 120 degrees.

name: Abnormality of urine calcium concentration
description: An abnormality of calcium concentration in the urine.

name: Appendicular spasticity
description: A type of spasticity that affects one or more limbs (arms or legs).

name: Sunken cheeks
description: Lack or loss of the soft tissues between the zygomata and mandible.

name: Complete or near-complete absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
description: The inability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Abnormality of lipoprotein cholesterol concentration
description: An abnormal increase or decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.
synonyms: Abnormality of the level of lipoprotein cholesterol

name: Severe Epstein Barr virus infection
description: An unusually severe Epstein Barr virus (EBV) infection.

name: Abnormal fear-induced behavior
description: An abnormal fear-induced behavior includes observable actions. This behavior is characterized by abnormal responses to fear or abnormal fear levels. Examples of such behavior include avoiding fear-inducing situations.

name: Chronic fatigue
description: Subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation that persists for six months or longer.

name: Distal upper limb muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the arms.

name: Interosseus muscle atrophy
description: Atrophy of the interosseus muscles (including the palmar interossei that lie on the anterior aspect of the metacarpals, the dorsal interosseus muscles of the hand, which lie between the intercarpals, the plantar interosseus muscles, which lie underneath the metatarsal bones, and the dorsal interossei, which are located between the metatarsal bones.

name: Nontuberculous mycobacterial pulmonary infection
description: An infection of the lung caused by environmental mycobacteria. Such infections can occur in individuals with predisposing lung disease or immune disease.

name: Abnormal rib cage morphology
description: A morphological anomaly of the rib cage.

name: Abnormal circulating beta-C-terminal telopeptide concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of beta-C-terminal telopeptide of type I collagen in the blood circulation, a marker of the rate of bone turnover.

name: Axial dystonia
description: A type of dystonia that affects the midline muscles, i.e., the chest, abdominal, and back muscles.

name: Bronchiectasis
description: Persistent abnormal dilatation of the bronchi owing to localized and irreversible destruction and widening of the large airways.
synonyms: Permanent enlargement of the airways of the lungs

name: Platybasia
description: A developmental malformation of the occipital bone and upper end of the cervical spine, in which the latter appears to have pushed the floor of the occipital bone upward such that there is an abnormal flattening of the skull base.
synonyms: Increased basal angle of skull base
Obtuse basal angle of skull base

name: Low-set nipples
description: Placement of the nipples at a lower than normal location.

name: Mania
description: A state of abnormally elevated or irritable mood, arousal, and/or energy levels.

name: Overweight
description: Increased body weight with a body mass index of 25-29.9 kg per square meter.

name: Radioulnar synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the radius and the ulna.

name: Oral aversion
description: Reluctance or refusal of a child to be breastfed or eat, manifested as gagging, vomiting, turning head away from food, or avoidance of sensation in or around the mouth (i.e. toothbrushing or face-washing).

name: Atlantoaxial instability
description: Abnormally increased movement at the junction between the first cervical (atlas) and the second cervical (axis) vertebrae as a result of either a bony or ligamentous anomaly.

name: Absent testis
description: Testis not palpable in the scrotum or inguinal canal.

name: Pes valgus
description: An outward deviation of the foot at the talocalcaneal or subtalar joint.

name: Erectile dysfunction
description: A multidimensional but common male sexual dysfunction that involves an alteration in any of the components of the erectile response, including organic, relational and psychological.

name: Congenital finger flexion contractures
description: Multiple bent (flexed) finger joints that cannot be straightened actively or passively.

name: Subungual hyperkeratosis
description: A thickening of the stratum corneum in the region beneath the nails.

name: Advanced eruption of teeth
description: Premature tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD earlier than the mean eruption age.

name: Abnormal spermatogenesis
description: Incomplete maturation or aberrant formation of the male gametes.

name: Elevated circulating aspartate aminotransferase concentration
description: The concentration of aspartate aminotransferase (AST) in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Enchondroma
description: A solitary, benign, intramedullary cartilage tumor that is often found in the short tubular bones of the hands and feet, distal femur, and proximal humerus.

name: Cough
description: A sudden, audible expulsion of air from the lungs through a partially closed glottis, preceded by inhalation.

name: Abnormality of the shoulder girdle musculature
Abnormal periosteum morphology
description: An anomalous structure of the periosteum, i.e., of the membrane that covers the outer surface of bones.

name: Clonic seizure
description: A clonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking, that is regularly repetitive.

name: Hyperpigmentation of the fundus
description: Increased pigmentation of the fundus

name: Overriding aorta
description: An overriding aorta is a congenital heart defect where the aorta is positioned directly over a ventricular septal defect, instead of over the left ventricle. The result is that the aorta receives some blood from the right ventricle, which reduces the amount of oxygen in the blood. It is one of the four conditions of the Tetralogy of Fallot. The aortic root can be displaced toward the front (anteriorly) or directly above the septal defect, but it is always abnormally located to the right of the root of the pulmonary artery. The degree of override is quite variable, with 5-95% of the valve being connected to the right ventricle.

name: Progressive distal muscular atrophy
description: Progressive muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.

name: Abnormal monocyte morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a myeloid mononuclear recirculating leukocyte that can act as a precursor of tissue macrophages, osteoclasts and some populations of tissue dendritic cells.

name: Ectropion
description: An outward turning (eversion) or rotation of the eyelid margin.

name: Cutis marmorata
