description: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather.

name: Increased femoral anteversion
description: An increased degree of femoral version, which is defined as the angular difference between axis of femoral neck and transcondylar axis of the knee. Thus, femoral anteversion is an inward twisting of the femur that causes the knees and feet to turn inward.

name: Truncal obesity
description: Obesity located preferentially in the trunk of the body as opposed to the extremities.

name: Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
description: A decrease in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
synonyms: MR Spectroscopy: N-acetylaspartate low in brain
Reduced brain N-acetyl aspartate level by magnetic resonance spectroscopy

name: Abnormal internal genitalia
description: An anomaly of the adnexa, uterus, and vagina (in female) or seminal tract and prostate (in male).

name: Quadriceps muscle atrophy
description: Muscular atrophy involving the quadriceps muscle.

name: Multiple rib fractures
description: More than one fracture of the ribs. Callus formation around multiple rib fractures can produce a row of multiple rounded expansions (beadlike prominences) giving the appearance of beaded ribs. Note that rachitic rosary would have one bead per rib (a swelling at the costochondral junction), while beaded ribs in the context of multiple rib fractures have multiple beads (fractures) along the same rib.

name: Hemiatrophy
description: Undergrowth of the limbs that affects only one side.

name: Clitoral hypertrophy
description: Hypertrophy of the clitoris.

name: Abnormal salivary gland morphology
description: Any abnormality of the salivary glands, the exocrine glands that produce saliva.

name: Impaired executive functioning
description: A disturbance of executive functioning, which is broadly defined as the set of abilities that allow for the planning, executing, monitoring, and self-correcting of goal-directed behavior while inhibiting task-irrelevant behavior. At least some degree of executive skill is needed to complete most cognitive tasks, and deficits in executive abilities are central to many clinical conditions, including fronto-temporal dementia.

name: Small intestinal stenosis
description: The narrowing or partial blockage of a portion of the small intestine.

name: Increased female libido
description: Elevated sexual desire in female

name: Tendon rupture
description: Breakage (tear) of a tendon.

name: Prominent nasal bridge
description: Anterior positioning of the nasal root in comparison to the usual positioning for age.

name: Oral ulcer
description: Erosion of the mucous mebrane of the mouth with local excavation of the surface, resulting from the sloughing of inflammatory necrotic tissue.

name: Abnormal vocal cord morphology
description: An abnormality of the vocal cord.

name: Abnormality of the premaxilla
description: An abnormality of the premaxilla, the most anterior part of the maxilla that usually bears the central and lateral incisors and includes the anterior nasal spine and inferior aspect of the piriform rim. The premaxilla contains the bone and teeth of the primary palate.
synonyms: Abnormality of the intermaxillary segment of the maxilla
Abnormality of the primary palate bone

name: Abnormal dermatoglyphics
description: An abnormality of dermatoglyphs (fingerprints), which are present on fingers, palms, toes, and soles.

name: Cherry red spot of the macula
description: Pallor of the perifoveal macula of the retina with appearance of a small circular reddish choroid shape as seen through the fovea centralis due to relative transparency of the macula.

name: Keratosis pilaris
description: An anomaly of the hair follicles of the skin that typically presents as small, rough, brown folliculocentric papules distributed over characteristic areas of the skin, particularly the outer-upper arms and thighs.

name: Central opacification of the cornea
description: Reduced transparency of the central portion of the corneal stroma.

name: Delayed ability to walk
description: A failure to achieve the ability to walk at an appropriate developmental stage. Most children learn to walk in a series of stages, and learn to walk short distances independently between 12 and 15 months.

name: Abnormal pupil morphology
description: An abnormality of the pupil.

name: Abnormality of the male genitalia
description: Abnormality of the male genital system.

name: Dental enamel pits
description: The presence of small depressions in the dental enamel.

name: Long palm
description: For children from birth to 16 years of age the length of the palm is more than the 97th centile; or, the length of the palm appears relatively long compared to the finger length or the limb length.

name: Pulmonary edema
description: Fluid accumulation in the lungs.

name: Abnormal ankle physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the ankle.

name: Macrocytic anemia
description: A type of anemia characterized by increased size of erythrocytes with increased mean corpuscular volume (MCV) and increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH).

name: Ovarian cyst
description: The presence of one or more cysts of the ovary.

name: Supernumerary bones of the axial skeleton
Abnormal metacarpal epiphysis morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of end part of long bone of hand

name: Short sperm flagella
description: Sperm cells with abnormally short flagella.

name: True hermaphroditism
description: The presence of both ovarian and testicular tissues either in the same or in opposite gonads. Affected persons have ambiguous genitalia and may have 46,XX or 46,XY karyotypes or 46,XX/XY mosaicism.

name: Metaphyseal chondrodysplasia
description: An abnormality of skeletal development characterized by a disturbance of the metaphysis and its histological structure with relatively normal epiphyses and vertebrae.

name: Abulia
description: Abulia is characterized by difficulty in initiating and sustaining spontaneous movements; the person often appears frozen but will move hesitantly on request. There are frequently substantial reductions in emotional responsiveness, spontaneous speech, and social interaction. The individual appears to be content to remain still and inactive with minimal movement, but moves or reacts hesitantly in response to interactions.

name: Head titubation
description: A head tremor of moderate speed (3 to 4 Hz) in the anterior-posterior direction.

name: Abnormal diencephalon morphology
description: An abnormality of the Diencephalon, which together with the cerebrum (telencephalon) makes up the forebrain.

name: Abnormal dental morphology
description: An abnormality of the morphology of the tooth.

name: Paraganglioma
description: A carotid body tumor (also called paraganglionoma or chemodectoma) is a tumor found in the upper neck at the branching of the carotid artery. They arise from the chemoreceptor organ (paraganglion) located in the adventitia of the carotid artery bifurcation.

name: Mediastinal lymphadenopathy
description: Swelling of lymph nodes within the mediastinum, the central compartment of the thoracic cavities that contains the heart and the great vessels, the esophagus, and trachea and other structures including lymph nodes.
synonyms: Swollen lymph nodes in center of chest
Swollen lymph nodes in centre of chest

name: Aortic valve calcification
description: Deposition of calcium salts in the aortic valve.

name: Short middle phalanx of toe
description: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of middle phalanx of toe.

name: Abnormal cerebral cortex morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the cerebral cortex.

name: Cervical spine instability
description: An abnormal lack of stability of the cervical spine.

name: Adducted thumb
description: In the resting position, the tip of the thumb is on, or near, the palm, close to the base of the fourth or fifth finger.

name: Increased circulating IgE concentration
description: An abnormally increased overall level of immunoglobulin E in blood.

name: Status epilepticus without prominent motor symptoms
description: There is inconclusive evidence to precisely define the duration of the seizure; however, based on current evidence an operational threshold of 10 minutes is appropriate as beyond this a seizure is likely to be more prolonged. The individual may or may not be aware or in coma.

name: Productive cough
description: A cough that produces phlegm or mucus.

name: Long fingers
description: The middle finger is more than 2 SD above the mean for newborns 27 to 41 weeks EGA or above the 97th centile for children from birth to 16 years of age AND the five digits retain their normal length proportions relative to each other (i.e., it is not the case that the middle finger is the only lengthened digit), or, Fingers that appear disproportionately long compared to the palm of the hand.

name: Abnormal T cell subset distribution
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of any T cell subpopulation, measured as percentage of total CD3+ T cells in the blood, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Abnormality of adrenal physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the adrenal glands.

name: Hypoplastic fingernail
description: Underdevelopment of a fingernail.

name: Abnormal circulating aldolase concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of aldolase in the serum. Aldolase is an enzyme responsible for converting fructose 1,6-bisphosphate into the triose phosphates dihydroxyacetone phosphate and glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate.

name: Osteolysis involving bones of the feet
Sleep-wake transition abnormality
description: A parasomnia that occurs with awareness and recollection during the transition between sleep and and awake states.
synonyms: Disturbance during transitions between sleep and wake states

name: Periorbital fullness
description: Increase in periorbital soft tissue.

name: Involuntary movements
description: Involuntary contractions of muscle leading to involuntary movements of extremities, neck, trunk, or face.

name: Macular hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the macula lutea.

name: Arterial rupture
description: Sudden breakage of an artery leading to leakage of blood from the circulation.

name: Eruptive xanthomas
description: Eruptive xanthomas are yellow-orange-to-red-brown papules that are often surrounded by an erythematous halo. They appear in crops on the buttocks, extensor surfaces of the extremities, and flexural creases. Acutely, variable amounts of pruritus and pain occur.

name: Renal magnesium wasting
description: High urine magnesium in the presence of hypomagnesemia.

name: Herpes simplex encephalitis
description: Infection of the brain parenchyma with herpes simplex virus, resulting in inflammation of the brain parenchyma with neurologic dysfunction.

name: Severe short stature
description: A severe degree of short stature, more than -4 SD from the mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Abnormality of bone mineral density
description: This term applies to all changes in bone mineral density which (depending on severity) can be seen on x-rays as a change in density and or structure of the bone. Changes may affect all bones of the organism, just certain bones or only parts of bones and include decreased mineralisation as may be seen in osteoporosis or increased mineralisation and or ossification as in osteopetrosis, exostoses or any kind of atopic calicfications of different origin and distribution. The overall amount of mineralization of the bone-organ can be measured as the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones, usually measured by densitometry of the lumbar spine or hip. The measurements are usually reported as g/cm3 or as a Z-score (the number of standard deviations above or below the mean for the patient's age and sex). Note that measurement with this method does not reflect local changes in other bones, and as such might not be correct with regard the hole bone-organ.
synonyms: Abnormality of bone mineralisation and ossification

name: Abnormal rib ossification
description: An anomaly of the process of rib bone formation.

name: Abnormal brainstem white matter morphology
description: An anomaly of the white matter of brainstem.
synonyms: Abnormality of the brainstem white matter

name: Cervical cord compression
description: Compression of the spinal cord in the cervical region, generally manifested by paresthesias and numbness, weakness, difficulty walking, abnormalities of coordination, and neck pain or stiffness.

name: Abscess
description: An abscess is a localized collection of purulent material surrounded by inflammation and granulation.

name: Transient global amnesia
description: A paroxysmal, transient loss of memory function with preservation of immediate recall and remote memory but with a severe impairment of memory for recent events and ability to retain new information.

name: Abnormal labia minora morphology
description: An anomaly of the labia minora, the folds of skin between the outer labia.
synonyms: Abnormality of the inner vaginal lips

name: Decreased vigilance
description: A decrease in the ability to maintain sustained attention is characterized by reduced alertness.

name: Abnormal palm morphology
description: An abnormality of the palm, that is, of the front of the hand.

name: Elevated transferrin saturation
description: An above normal level of saturation of serum transferrin with iron.

name: Abnormal toe morphology
description: An anomaly of a toe.

name: Abnormal peristalsis
description: An anomaly of the wave-like muscle contractions of the digestive tract.

name: White lesion of the oral mucosa
description: White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps or surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white.

name: Continuous spike and waves during slow sleep
description: Diffuse, bilateral and recently also unilateral or focal localization spike-wave occurring in slow sleep or non-rapid eye movement sleep.
synonyms: Electrical status epilepticus during slow-wave sleep

name: Left-to-right shunt
description: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system from the left side of the heart to the right.

name: Hyperthyroidism
description: An abnormality of thyroid physiology characterized by excessive secretion of the thyroid hormones thyroxine (i.e., T4) and/or 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine zwitterion (i.e., triiodothyronine or T3).

name: Abnormal fetal gastrointestinal system morphology
description: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal gastrointestinal system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Albuminuria
description: Increased concentration of albumin in the urine.

name: Large forehead
synonyms: Increased size of frontal region of face

name: Abnormal thalamic MRI signal intensity
description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the thalamus.

name: Axonal regeneration
description: The presence of axonal regeneration following a previous axonal lesion.

name: Abnormal soft palate morphology
description: An abnormality of the soft palate.

name: Multifocal seizures
description: Seizures that start from several different areas of the brain (i.e., with multiple ictal onset locations).

name: Neuropathic spinal arthropathy
description: A progressive disorder of vertebral joint degeneration that occurs in the setting of any condition characterized by decreased afferent innervation, involving loss of deep pain and proprioceptive sensation in the vertebral column. Patients most commonly present with symptoms of lower back pain, sitting imbalance, progressive spinal deformity (usually kyphosis), and an audible clicking sound on changing postures.

name: Dacryocystitis
description: Inflammation of the nasolacrimal sac.

name: Stiff neck
description: A sensation of tightness in the neck when attempting to move it, especially after a period of inactivity. Neck stiffness often involves soreness and difficulty moving the neck, especially when trying to turn the head to the side.

name: Abnormality of the autonomic nervous system
description: An abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Cerebral venous thrombosis
description: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a cerebral vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

name: Decreased class-switched memory B cell proportion
description: A reduction in the normal proportion of class-switched memory B cells (CD19+/CD27+/IgM+/IgD+) relative to the total number of B cells. Marginal zone B cells undergo limited somatic hypermutation and produce high-affinity IgM and some IgG, whereas class-switched memory B cells synthetize IgG, IgM, and IgA.
synonyms: Decreased proportion of class-switched memory B cells

name: Peripheral hypermyelination
description: Increased amount of peripheral myelination.

name: Abnormal iliac wing morphology
description: An anomaly of the ilium ala. This is the large expanded portion of the ilum which bounds the greater pelvis laterally.
synonyms: Abnormality of the wing of the ilium

name: Interstitial cardiac fibrosis
description: A type of myocardial fibrosis characterized by excessive diffuse collagen accumulation concentrated in interstitial spaces.

name: Aortic regurgitation
description: An insufficiency of the aortic valve, leading to regurgitation (backward flow) of blood from the aorta into the left ventricle.

name: Thin nail
description: Nail that appears thin when viewed on end.

name: Bile duct proliferation
description: Proliferative changes of the bile ducts.

name: Multiple impacted teeth
description: The presence of multiple impacted teeth.

name: Myalgia
description: Pain in muscle.

name: EEG with multifocal slow activity
description: Multifocal slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Abnormality of multiple cell lineages in the bone marrow
Functional abnormality of the middle ear
description: An abnormality of the function of the middle ear.
synonyms: Functional abnormality of the middle ear

name: Atypical nevi in non-sun exposed areas
Abnormal testis morphology
description: An anomaly of the testicle (the male gonad).

name: Renal insufficiency
description: A reduction in the level of performance of the kidneys in areas of function comprising the concentration of urine, removal of wastes, the maintenance of electrolyte balance, homeostasis of blood pressure, and calcium metabolism.

name: Lacunar stroke
description: A stroke related to a small infarct (2-20 mm in diameter) in the deep cerebral white matter, basal ganglia, or pons, that is presumed to result from the occlusion of a single small perforating artery supplying the subcortical areas of the brain.

name: Pregnancy exposure
description: Exposure of pregnant women to toxins from any source, such as environmental toxins or chemicals, that may potentially cause problems such as miscarriage, preterm delivery, low birth weight, and, in some cases, developmental delays in infants.

name: Abnormal pyramidal tract morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the pyramidal tract, whose chief element, the corticospinal tract, is the only direct connection between the brain and the spinal cord. In addition to the corticospinal tract, the pyramidal system includes the corticobulbar, corticomesencephalic, and corticopontine tracts.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the pyramidal tract

name: Abnormal localization of kidney
description: An abnormal site of the kidney.

name: Abnormal psychotic pattern
description: Any abnormal pattern of psychotic experiences, where an individual has significant disturbances in their thoughts, perceptions, emotions, and behavior, resulting in a loss of touch with reality.

name: Cyclopia
description: Cyclopia is a congenital abnormality in which there is only one eye. That eye is centrally placed in the area normally occupied by the root of the nose.

name: Adrenocortical adenoma
description: Adrenocortical adenomas are benign tumors of the adrenal cortex.

name: Zollinger-Ellison syndrome
description: A condition in which there is increased production of gastrin by a gastrin-secreting tumor (usually located in the pancreas, duodenum, or abdominal lymph nodes) that stimulates the gastric mucosa to maximal activity, with consequent gastrointestinal mucosal ulceration.

name: Duplication of renal pelvis
description: A duplication of the renal pelvis.

name: Malrotation of small bowel
description: A deviation from the normal rotation of the midgut during embryologic development with mislocalization of the small bowel.

name: Abnormal mast cell morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of mast cells, which are found in almost all tissues and contain numerous basophilic granules and are capable of releasing large amounts of histamine and heparin upon activation.

name: Deeply set eye
description: An eye that is more deeply recessed into the plane of the face than is typical.

name: Limb pain
description: Chronic pain in the limbs with no clear focal etiology.

name: Abnormal mesentery morphology
description: Folds of membranous tissue (peritoneum, mesothelium) attached to the wall of the abdomen and enclosing viscera. Examples include the mesentery for the small intestine; the transverse mesocolon, which attaches the transverse portion of the colon to the back wall of the abdomen; and the mesosigmoid, which enfolds the sigmoid portion of the colon. Cells of the same embryologic origin also surround the other organs of the body such as the lungs (pleura) or the heart (pericardium).

name: Protruding tongue
description: Tongue extending beyond the alveolar ridges or teeth at rest.

name: Peg-shaped maxillary lateral incisors
description: A tooth crown with its mesial and distal sides converging or tapering toward the incisal edge causing severe reduction of mesiodistal diameter

name: Penile freckling
description: Multiple pigmented macules located on the skin of the penis.

name: Aplastic clavicle
description: Absence of the clavicles as a developmental defect.

name: Abnormal heart sound
description: Any abnormal noise generated by the beating heart.

name: Porencephalic cyst
description: A cavity within the cerebral hemisphere, filled with cerebrospinal fluid, that communicates directly with the ventricular system.

name: Bleeding with minor or no trauma
description: Significant bleeding or hemorrhage without significant precipitating factor.
synonyms: Bleeding with minor or no trauma

name: Abnormal morphology of the proximal phalanx of the hallux
description: An abnormal shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the big toe.
synonyms: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the hallux

name: Sprengel anomaly
description: A congenital skeletal deformity characterized by the elevation of one scapula (thus, one scapula is located superior to the other).
synonyms: Congenital, upward displacement of the scapula

name: Abnormal circulating branched chain amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a branched chain family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Ultra-low vision
description: Best corrected visual acuity worse than 1.90 logMAR (roughly 20/1590).

name: Abnormal ossification involving the femoral head and neck
synonyms: Abnormal maturation of thigh bone head and neck

name: Nephritis
description: The presence of inflammation affecting the kidney.

name: Hyperautofluorescent macular lesion
description: Increased amount of autofluorescence in the macula as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

name: Abnormal urine pH
description: A deviation of urine pH from the normal range of 4.5 to 7.8.

name: Abnormal brain N-acetyl aspartate level by MRS
description: A deviation from normal in the level of N-acetyl aspartate in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).
synonyms: Abnormal brain N-acetyl aspartate level by magnetic resonance spectroscopy

name: Mild fetal ventriculomegaly
description: A kind of ventriculomegaly occurring in the fetal period and usually diagnosed by prenatal ultrasound. Cerebral ventriculomegaly is defined by atrial measurements 10 mm or more. Mild ventriculomegaly (MVM) is defined as measurements between 10 and 15 mm. Measurements are obtained from an axial plane at the level of the thalamic nuclei just below the standard image to measure the BPD (PMID:16100637).

name: Hemiparesis
description: Loss of strength in the arm, leg, and sometimes face on one side of the body. Hemiplegia refers to a complete loss of strength, whereas hemiparesis refers to an incomplete loss of strength.
synonyms: Weakness of one side of body

name: Impaired tactile sensation
description: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation). This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

name: Broad philtrum
description: Distance between the philtral ridges, measured just above the vermilion border, more than 2 standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the ridges of the philtrum.

name: Coma
description: The complete absence of wakefulness and consciousness, which is evident through a lack of response to any form of external stimuli.

name: Entropion
description: An abnormal inversion (turning inward) of the eyelid (usually the lower) towards the globe. Entropion is usually acquired as a result of involutional or cicatricial processes but may occasionally be congenital.

name: Intestinal hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the intestine.

name: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid
description: Abnormality of the amniotic fluid, which is the fluid contained in the amniotic sac surrounding the developing fetus.

name: Recurrent bronchitis
description: An increased susceptibility to bronchitis as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchitis.

name: Premature coronary artery atherosclerosis
description: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries before age of 45.

name: Upper eyelid coloboma
description: A short discontinuity of the margin of the upper eyelid.
synonyms: Full thickness defect of the upper eyelid

name: Amenorrhea
description: Absence of menses for an interval of time equivalent to a total of more than (or equal to) 3 previous cycles or 6 months.

name: Peripheral visual field loss
description: Loss of peripheral vision with retention of central vision, resulting in a constricted circular tunnel-like field of vision.

name: Premature atrial contractions
description: A type of cardiac arrhythmia with premature atrial contractions or beats caused by signals originating from ectopic atrial sites.

name: Abnormality of cytokine secretion
description: An abnormality in the production or cellular release of a cytokine (i.e., any of the non-antibody proteins made by inflammatory leukocytes and some non-leukocytic cells that affect the behavior of other cells).

name: Narrow nasal bridge
description: Decreased width of the bony bridge of the nose.

name: Cutaneous abscess
description: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the skin.

name: Constriction of peripheral visual field
description: An absolute or relative decrease in retinal sensitivity extending from edge (periphery) of the visual field in a concentric pattern. The visual field is the area that is perceived simultaneously by a fixating eye.

name: Posterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
description: Adhesions between the iris and the lens.

name: Nonimmune hydrops fetalis
description: A type of hydrops fetalis in which there is no identifiable circulating antibody to red blood cell antigens .

name: Mild postnatal growth retardation
description: A mild degree of slow or limited growth after birth, being between two and three standard deviations below age- and sex-related norms.
synonyms: Postnatal onset of mild growth retardation

name: Delayed menarche
description: First period after the age of 15 years.

name: Abnormality of cranial sutures
description: Any anomaly of a cranial suture, that is one of the six membrane-covered openings in the incompletely ossified skull of the fetus or newborn infant.

name: AV nodal tachycardia
description: A type of supraventricular tachycardia that originates in the atrioventricular node.

name: Fiber type grouping
description: An abnormal distribution of muscle fiber types in muscle tissue. Human skeletal muscle contains at least two fiber types recognizable by histochemical techniques. In transverse sections of normal skeletal muscle, type 1 and type 2 fibers are distributed in a random fashion. Grouping of fibers of the same type can be seen in certain peripheral neuropathies, thought to be due to reinnervation of denervated muscle fibers by sprouting axons. With grouping, motor units enlarge. The fibers of a motor unit, which are normally scattered, come to lie adjacent to one another. Histochemical examination shows groups of muscle fibers of the same histochemical type.

name: Progressive proximal muscle weakness
description: Lack of strength of the proximal muscles that becomes progressively more severe.

name: Abnormal fetal cardiovascular morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the fetal circulation system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.
synonyms: Abnormality of the fetal cardiovascular system
Abnormality of the fetal circulation system
Abnormality of the foetal cardiovascular system
Abnormality of the foetal circulation system

name: Perianal abscess
description: The presence of an abscess located around the anus.

name: Anodontia
description: The absence of all teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
synonyms: Failure of development of all teeth

name: Abnormal antitragus morphology
description: An abnormality of the antitragus, which is a small tubercle opposite to the tragus of the ear. The antitragus and the tragus are separated by the intertragic notch.

name: Toxemia of pregnancy
description: Pregnancy-induced toxic reactions of the mother that can be as harmless as slight Maternal hypertension or as life threatening as Eclampsia.

name: Inguinal hernia
description: Protrusion of the contents of the abdominal cavity through the inguinal canal.

name: Thickened ears
description: Increased thickness of the external ear.

name: Abnormal morphology of the great vessels
description: A structural anomaly affecting a blood vessel involved in the circulation of the heart, i.e., the superior or inferior vena cava, the pulmonary arteries, the pulmonary veins, and the aorta.

name: Delayed umbilical cord separation
description: Separation of the umbilical cord occurs at an abnormally late timepoint.

name: Pectus excavatum of inferior sternum
description: Pectus excavatum (defect of the chest wall characterized by depression of the sternum) affecting primarily the inferior region of the sternum.

name: Posterior helix pit
description: Permanent indentation on the posteromedial aspect of the helix that may be sharply or indistinctly delineated.
synonyms: Indentation in back of outer ear
Pits in posterior aspect of ear helices

name: CSF pleocytosis
description: An increased white blood cell count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Microlissencephaly
description: Severe microcephaly and lissencephaly with granular surfaces with immature cortical plate, reduced in thickness, with focal polymicrogyria and immature small neurons with rare processes, intermingled with a considerable number of glial elements.

name: Absent phalangeal crease
description: Absence of one or more interphalangeal creases (i.e., of the transverse lines in the skin between the phalanges of the fingers).

name: Rectal prolapse
description: Protrusion of the rectal mucous membrane through the anus.

name: Abnormal epididymis morphology
description: An abnormality of the epididymis.

name: Abnormality of the glabella
description: An abnormality of the glabella.
synonyms: Abnormality of the area between the eyebrows
Deformity of the area between the eyebrows
Malformation of the area between the eyebrows

name: Dyspareunia
description: Recurrent or persistent genital pain associated with sexual intercourse.

name: Pili canaliculi
description: A characteristic triangular, kidney- or heat-shaped diameter of hair shafts with typical longitudinal canalicular deformation as observable by scanning electron microscopy.

name: Congenital thrombocytopenia
description: Thrombocytopenia with congenital onset.

name: Decreased Achilles reflex
description: Decreased intensity of the Achilles reflex (also known as the ankle jerk reflex), which can be elicited by tapping the tendon is tapped while the foot is dorsiflexed.

name: Abnormal hypothalamus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the hypothalamus.

name: Defective DNA repair after ultraviolet radiation damage
Abnormal urinary color
description: An abnormal color of the urine, that is, the color of the urine appears different from the usual straw-yellow color.

name: Flat occiput
description: Reduced convexity of the occiput (posterior part of skull).

name: Alopecia totalis
description: Loss of all scalp hair.

name: Ketotic hypoglycemia
description: Low blood glucose is accompanied by elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

name: Horizontal eyebrow
description: An eyebrow that extends straight across the brow, without curve.

name: Osteochondroma
description: A cartilage capped bony outgrowth of a long bone. Osteochondroma arises on the external surface of bone containing a marrow cavity that is continuous with that of the underlying bone.

name: Abnormal morphology of the abdominal musculature
description: An abnormality of the abdominal musculature.

name: Exanthem
description: A widespread rash.

name: Motor seizure
description: A motor seizure is a type of seizure that is characterized at onset by involvement of the skeletal musculature. The motor event could consist of an increase (positive) or decrease (negative) in muscle contraction to produce a movement.

name: Acidemia
description: An abnormally low blood pH (usually defined as less than 7.35).

name: Cerebral hypomyelination
description: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the white matter of the central nervous system.

name: Limb dysmetria
description: A type of dysmetria involving the limbs.

name: Spider hemangioma
description: A form of telangiectasis characterized by a central elevated red dot the size of a pinhead, representing an arteriole, with numerous small blood vessels that radiate out thereby resembling the legs of a spider. Characteristically, compression of the central arteriole causes the entire lesion to blanch, and the lesion quickly refills once the compression is released.

name: Ketosis
description: Presence of elevated levels of ketone bodies in the body.

name: Prolinuria
description: Level of proline in the urine anove the upper limit of normal.

name: Skin-picking
description: Repetitive and compulsive picking of skin which results in tissue damage.

name: Abnormality of the incisor
description: An abnormality of the Incisor tooth.

name: Elevated circulating glutaric acid concentration
description: An increased concentration of glutaric acid in the blood.

name: Radial deviation of the hand
description: An abnormal position of the hand in which the wrist is bent toward the radius (i.e., toward the thumb).

name: Penoscrotal hypospadias
description: A severe form of hypospadias in which the urethral opening is located at the junction of the penis and scrotum.

name: Angioid streaks of the fundus
description: Irregular lines in the deep retina that are typically configured in a radiating fashion and emanate from the optic disc. Angioid streaks are crack-like dehiscences in abnormally thickened and calcified Bruch's membrane, resulting in atrophy of the overlying retinal pigment epithelium. They may be associated with a number of endocrine, metabolic, and connective tissue abnormalities but are frequently idiopathic.

name: Maternal diabetes
description: Maternal diabetes can either be a gestational, mostly type 2 diabetes, or a type 1 diabetes. Essential is the resulting maternal hyperglycemia as a non-specific teratogen, imposing the same risk of congenital malformations to pregnant women with both type 1 and type2 diabetes.

name: Pathologic fracture
description: A pathologic fracture occurs when a bone breaks in an area that is weakened secondarily to another disease process such as tumor, infection, and certain inherited bone disorders. A pathologic fracture can occur without a degree of trauma required to cause fracture in healthy bone.

name: Hypomimic face
description: A reduced degree of motion of the muscles beneath the skin of the face, often associated with reduced facial crease formation.

name: Panhypopituitarism
description: A pituitary functional deficit affecting all the anterior pituitary hormones (growth hormone, thyroid-stimulating hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone, luteinizing hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, and prolactin).

name: Compensated hypothyroidism
description: Condition associated with a raised serum concentration of thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) but a normal serum free thyroxine (FT4).

name: Asthenia
description: A state characterized by a feeling of weakness and loss of strength leading to a generalized weakness of the body.

name: Optic nerve dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the optic nerve.

name: Irritability
description: An emotional state characterized by negative feelings of heightened frustration, annoyance, or feeling upset, often triggered by internal factors (e.g., fatigue, hunger, unfulfilled desires) or external factors (e.g., social or environmental challenges). Irritability may be unpredictable, and is accompanied by a lowered threshold for emotional reactivity and observable features (speech, facial expressions, or psychomotor activity).

name: Abnormal circulating gastrin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of gastrin in the blood.

name: Loss of consciousness
description: Loss of alertness and orientation to place and time.

name: Arterial dissection
description: A separation (dissection) of the layers of an artery.

name: Abnormal curvature of the vertebral column
description: The presence of an abnormal curvature of the vertebral column.
synonyms: Abnormality of the curvature of the vertebral column

name: Absent lacrimal punctum
description: No identifiable superior and/or inferior lacrimal punctum.

name: Permanent atrial fibrillation
description: Atrial fibrillation (AF) that cannot be successfully terminated by cardioversion, and longstanding (more than 1 year) AF, where cardioversion is not indicated or has not been attempted, is termed permanent.

name: Abnormal blood monovalent inorganic cation concentration
description: An abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis.
synonyms: Abnormality of monovalent inorganic cation homeostasis

name: Hypertyrosinemia
description: An increased concentration of tyrosine in the blood.

name: Broad ribs
description: Increased width of ribs

name: Abnormal vitreous humor morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the vitreous body.

name: Abnormality of amino acid metabolism
description: Abnormality of an amino acid metabolic process.

name: Hammertoe
description: Hyperextension of the metatarsal-phalangeal joint with hyperflexion of the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joint.

name: Absent eyebrow
description: Absence of the eyebrow.

name: Increased body mass index
description: Abnormally increased weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of overweight compared to averages.

name: Coronal craniosynostosis
description: Premature closure of the coronal suture of skull.

name: Abnormal spaced incisors
synonyms: Abnormality of spacing of front teeth

name: Corneal stromal edema
description: Abnormal accumulation of fluid and swelling of the stroma of cornea.

name: Celiac disease
description: Celiac disease (CD) is an autoimmune condition affecting the small intestine, triggered by the ingestion of gluten, the protein fraction of wheat, barley, and rye. Clinical manifestations of CD are highly variable and include both gastrointestinal and non-gastrointestinal features. The hallmark of CD is an immune-mediated enteropathy. This term is included because the occurrence of CD is seen as a feature of a number of other diseases.

name: Reduced social responsiveness
description: A reduced ability to participate in the back-and-forth flow of social interaction appropriate to culture and developmental level, which is normally characterized by an influence of the behavior of one person on the behavior of another person. This results in difficulty interacting with others through emotional, physical, or verbal communication.

name: Inferior cerebellar vermis hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the inferior portion of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Microcolon
description: A colon of abnormally small caliber.

name: Red eye
description: A reddish appearance over the white part (sclera) of the eye ranging from a few enlarged blood vessels appearing as wiggly lines over the sclera to a bright red color completely covering to sclera.

name: Narrow foramen obturatorium
description: Decreased width of the foramen obturatorium. The foramen obturatorium (also known as the obturator foramen) is a hole located between the ischium and pubis bones of the pelvis.

name: Increased circulating very long-chain fatty acid concentration
description: Increased concentration of very long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation. Very long-chain fatty acids are fatty acids (FAs) with a chain-length of 22 or more carbons.
synonyms: Increased plasma levels of very long-chain fatty acid

name: Progressive flexion contractures
description: Progressively worsening joint contractures.

name: Increased serum serotonin
description: A increased concentration of serotonin in the blood.

name: Abnormal urine potassium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

name: Aplasia of the olfactory bulb
description: Lack of formation (congenital absence) of the olfactory bulb.

name: Hemeralopia
description: A visual defect characterized by the inability to see as clearly in bright light as in dim light. The word hemeralopia literally means day blindness.

name: Type 2 muscle fiber predominance
description: An abnormal predominance of type II muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

name: Abnormal periventricular white matter morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the myelinated axons (white matter) located near the cerebral ventricles.
synonyms: Abnormality of the periventricular white matter

name: Increased megakaryocyte count
description: Increased megakaryocyte number, i.e., of platelet precursor cells, present in the bone marrow.

name: Necrotizing enterocolitis
description: Inflammation of the intestine leading to bacterial invasion causing cellular damage and death which causes necrosis of the colon and intestine.

name: Apathy
description: Apathy is a quantitative reduction of interest, motivation and the initiation and persistence of goal-directed behavior, where often the accompanying emotions, thoughts, and social interactions are also diminished. The individual is typically non-reactive to provocations, positive or negative, and appears to not care. Distinguished from lethargy which involves lack of physical or mental energy.
synonyms: Lack of feeling, emotion, interest, motivation, initiation

name: Partial agenesis of the corpus callosum
description: A partial failure of the development of the corpus callosum.
synonyms: Partial or complete agenesis of corpus callosum
Partial to complete agenesis of corpus callosum
Partial or complete agenesis of the corpus callosum

name: Progressive leukoencephalopathy
description: Leukoencephalopathy that gets more severe with time.

name: Abnormal circulating glutamine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glutamine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal pubic bone morphology
description: An anomaly of the the pubic bone, i.e., of the ventral and anterior of the three principal components (pubis, ilium, ischium) of the hip bone.

name: Open bite
description: Visible space between the dental arches in occlusion.
synonyms: Absence of overlap of upper and lower teeth
Open bite between upper and lower teeth

name: Food intolerance
description: A detrimental reaction to a food, beverage, food additive, or compound found in foods that produces symptoms in one or more body organs and systems that is not mediated by an immune reaction.

name: Hypoplastic labia majora
description: Undergrowth of the outer labia.

name: Low plasma citrulline
description: A decreased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

name: Abnormality of reproductive system physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the genital system.

name: Shoulder girdle muscle atrophy
description: Amyotrophy affecting the muscles of the shoulder girdle.

name: Shield chest
description: A broad chest.

name: Shivering
description: Involuntary contraction or twitching of the muscles.

name: Hypomelanotic macule
description: Hypomelanotic macules ("ash leaf spots") are white or lighter patches of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by a lack of melanin. White ash leaf-shaped macules are considered to be characteristic of tuberous sclerosis.

name: Visual fixation instability
description: A deficit in the ability to fixate eye movements in order to stabilize images on the retina

name: Decreased circulating total IgG concentration
description: A reduction beneath the normal level of total immunoglobulin G (IgG) in the blood.

name: Increased hematocrit
description: An elevation above the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.

name: Decreased serum creatinine
description: An abnormally reduced amount of creatinine in the blood.

name: Increased urine proteinogenic amino acid derivative level
description: An elevated urine level of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

name: Juvenile aseptic necrosis
description: Juvenile aseptic necrosis comprises a group of orthopedic diseases characterized by interruption of the blood supply of a bone, followed by localized bony necrosis most often of the epiphyses of bones of children or teenagers.

name: Abnormal circulating creatine concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of creatine in the blood circulation. Creatine is a derivative of glycine having methyl and amidino groups attached to the nitrogen. Creatine is naturally produced from amino acids, primarily in liver and kidney, and acts as an energy source for cells, primarily for muscle cells.

name: Acanthocytosis
description: Acanthocytosis is a type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence of spikes on the cell surface. The cells have an irregular shape resembling many-pointed stars.

name: Axial hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) affecting the musculature of the trunk.

name: Sparse eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number of eyebrow hairs.

name: Abnormality of the ovary
description: An abnormality of the ovary.

name: Mesomelic leg shortening
description: Shortening of the middle parts of the leg in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

name: Decerebrate rigidity
description: A type of rigidity that is manifested by an exaggerated extensor posture of all extremities.

name: Deviation of the thumb
description: Displacement of the thumb from its normal position.

name: Concave nasal ridge
description: Nasal ridge curving posteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip.

name: Abnormal enchondral ossification
description: An abnormality of the process of endochondral ossification, which is a type of replacement ossification in which bone tissue replaces cartilage.

name: Autoimmune antibody positivity
description: The presence of an antibody in the blood circulation that is directed against the organism's own cells or tissues.

name: Neurogenic bladder
description: A type of bladder dysfunction caused by neurologic damage. Neurogenic bladder can be flaccid or spastic. Common manifestatios of neurogenic bladder are overflow incontinence, frequency, urgency, urge incontinence, and retention.
synonyms: Lack of bladder control due to nervous system injury

name: Abnormal coagulation factor V activity
description: Any deviation from the activity of coagulation factor V.

name: Impaired renal concentrating ability
description: A defect in the ability to concentrate the urine.

name: Abnormal metaphysis morphology
description: An abnormality of one or more metaphysis, i.e., of the somewhat wider portion of a long bone that is adjacent to the epiphyseal growth plate and grows during childhood.
synonyms: Abnormality of the wide portion of a long bone

name: Abnormal lacrimal punctum morphology
description: An abnormality of the lacrimal punctum, an opening on the eyelid close to the medial canthus that drains tears from the conjunctival sac into the lacrimal duct in the same eyelid.

name: Deviation of the hallux
description: Displacement of the big toe from its normal position.

name: Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
description: A loss of myelinated nerve fibers in the peripheral nervous system (in general, this finding can be observed on nerve biopsy).
synonyms: Decreased number of large and small myelinated fibers
Decreased number of large and small myelinated fibres
Decreased number of peripheral myelinated nerve fibres

name: Abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure
description: The presence of an abnormal shape of the palpebral fissure.
synonyms: Abnormal morphology of the palpebral fissure
Abnormal shape of the opening between the eyelids

name: Abnormal choroid plexus morphology
description: An abnormality of the choroid plexus, which is the area in the cerebral ventricles in which cerebrospinal fluid is produced by modified ependymal cells.

name: Malnutrition
description: A deficiency in the intake of energy and nutrients.

name: Oligomenorrhea
description: Infrequent menses (less than 6 per year or more than 35 days between cycles).

name: Abnormal blood sodium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of sodium.

name: Absent or minimally ossified vertebral bodies
Gastrointestinal ulcer
description: A deep defect in the esophageal, gastric, duodenal or intestinal wall involving the entire mucosal thickness and penetrating through the muscularis mucosae.

name: Abnormal thrombosis
description: Venous or arterial thrombosis (formation of blood clots) of spontaneous nature and which cannot be fully explained by acquired risk (e.g. atherosclerosis).

name: Rheumatoid arthritis
description: Inflammatory changes in the synovial membranes and articular structures with widespread fibrinoid degeneration of the collagen fibers in mesenchymal tissues, as well as atrophy and rarefaction of bony structures.

name: Pectus excavatum
description: A defect of the chest wall characterized by a depression of the sternum, giving the chest ("pectus") a caved-in ("excavatum") appearance.

name: Alveolar cell carcinoma
description: Adenocarcinoma of the Bronchus.

name: Impaired distal tactile sensation
description: A reduced sense of touch (tactile sensation) on the skin of the distal limbs. This is usually tested with a wisp of cotton or a fine camel's hair brush, by asking patients to say 'now' each time they feel the stimulus.

name: Peters anomaly
description: A form of anterior segment dysgenesis in which abnormal cleavage of the anterior chamber occurs. Peters anomaly is characterized by central, paracentral, or complete corneal opacity.

name: Lower limb pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the leg.

name: Floppy infant
description: Floppiness/hypotonia is defined as reduced resistance to passive movement of joints. Physical examination of floppy/hypotonic infants shows head lag, lack of shoulder and elbow muscle contraction on traction response, inability to tighten the shoulder girdle muscles (or slipping through) when held under the axillae, scarf sign (when the arm is pulled to the opposite side, the arm wraps around the neck with the elbow crossing midline), hyperdorsiflexion of the feet, easy apposition of the thumb against the forearm, feet touching the cheek with ease and without discomfort, frog leg position, and inverted U sign on ventral suspension (head, arms, and legs hanging down without elbow or knee flexion and the trunk rounded in a dome shape).

name: Multiple glomerular cysts
description: The presence of many cysts in the glomerulus of the kidney related to dilatation of the Bowman's capsule.

name: Anti-acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against acetylcholine receptor.

name: Rhizomelia
description: Disproportionate shortening of the proximal segment of limbs (i.e. the femur and humerus).
synonyms: Disproportionately short upper portion of limb

name: Congenital fibrosis of extraocular muscles
description: Congenital non-progressive ophthalmoplegia with multiple extraocular muscle restrictions. Typically, there is ptosis and variable degrees of restriction of horizontal and vertical eye movements.
synonyms: Congenital fibrosis of the extraocular muscles

name: Triangular mouth
description: The presence of a triangular form of the mouth.

name: Prominent eyelashes
description: Eyelashes that draw the attention of the viewer due to increased density and/or length and/or curl without meeting the criteria of trichomegaly.

name: Abnormal 2nd metacarpal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the second metacarpal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 2nd long bone of hand

name: Focal automatism seizure
description: A focal seizure characterized at onset by coordinated motor activity. This often resembles a voluntary movement and may consist of an inappropriate continuation of preictal motor activity.

name: Retinal arterial tortuosity
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal artery.

name: Increased C-peptide level
description: An elevated concentration of C-peptide in the circulation. Since C-peptide is secreted in equimolar amounts to insulin, this feature correlates with increased insulin secretion.

name: Early onset of sexual maturation
description: An early onset of puberty, in this case early does not refer to precocious.

name: Truncal ataxia
description: Truncal ataxia is a sign of ataxia characterized by instability of the trunk. It usually occurs during sitting.
synonyms: Instability or lack of coordination of central trunk muscles

name: Increased circulating IgM level
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin M in blood.

name: Fetal anomaly
description: Structural or functional abnormalities of the fetus. Note that this section comprises terms that describe abnormalities that are specific to the fetus or differ from the corresponding general terms. A term from anywhere in the Human Phenotype Ontology can be applied to a fetus if appropriate.

name: Mitral valve prolapse
description: One or both of the leaflets (cusps) of the mitral valve bulges back into the left atrium upon contraction of the left ventricle.

name: Decreased total T cell count
description: The absolute number of T cells per volume is below the lower limit of normal.
synonyms: Decreased numbers of circulating T cells

name: Congenital hepatic fibrosis
description: The presence of fibrosis of that part of the liver with congenital onset.
synonyms: Excessive buildup of connective tissue and scarring of liver at birth

name: Adrenocorticotropic hormone deficiency
description: A reduced ability to secrete adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), a hormone that stimulates the adrenal cortex to secrete of glucocorticoids such as cortisol.

name: Fragmented elastic fibers in the dermis
description: Elastic fibers in the dermis exhibit an increased number of breaks associated with disorganization of the structure of the elastic fibers.
synonyms: Fragmented elastic fibres in the dermis

name: Decreased adiponectin level
description: A reduced circulating concentration of adiponectin, a 30-kDa complement C1-related protein that is the most abundant secreted protein expressed in adipose tissue.

name: Alternating esotropia
description: Esotropia in which either eye may be used for fixation.

name: Retinal atrophy
description: Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the fundus, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.

name: Proximal upper limb muscle weakness
description: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the arms.
synonyms: Proximal muscle weakness in upper limbs

name: Microretrognathia
description: A form of developmental hypoplasia of the mandible in which the mandible is mislocalised posteriorly.

name: Abnormal morphology of myocardial trabeculae
description: Any structural anomaly of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the right and left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae).

name: Abnormality on pulmonary function testing
description: Any anomaly measure by pulmonary function testing, which includes spirometry, measures of diffusing capacity, and plethysmography.

name: Abnormal lower motor neuron morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the lower motor neuron.

name: EEG with parietal epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the parietal region.

name: Thrombophlebitis
description: Inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: Severe cytomegalovirus infection
description: An unusually severe infection by cytomegalovirus.

name: Anisocytosis
description: Abnormally increased variability in the size of erythrocytes.
synonyms: Unequal size of red blood cells

name: Cholangiocarcinoma
description: Cholangiocarcinoma is a primary cancer originating in the biliary epithelium i.e., the cholangiocytes, of the extrahepatic and intrahepatic biliary ducts. It is extremely invasive, develops rapidly, often metastasizes, and has a very poor prognosis. They are slow growing tumors which spread longitudinally along the bile ducts with neural, perineural and subepithelial extension.

name: Hepatic bridging fibrosis
description: Hepatic fibrosis that reaches from a portal area to another portal area.

name: Epistaxis
description: Epistaxis, or nosebleed, refers to a hemorrhage localized in the nose.

name: Allergic rhinitis
description: It is characterized by one or more symptoms including sneezing, itching, nasal congestion, and rhinorrhea.

name: Malar flattening
description: Underdevelopment of the malar prominence of the jugal bone (zygomatic bone in mammals), appreciated in profile, frontal view, and/or by palpation.

name: Pulmonary carcinoid tumor
description: A malignant neuroendocrine tumor of the lung. According to histopathologic criteria (WHO 2004), carcinoids are divided into four groups i.e. typical and atypical carcinoids, large cell neuroendocrine carcinoma and small cell lung carcinoma.

name: Spontaneous pneumothorax
description: Pneumothorax occurring without traumatic injury to the chest or lung.

name: Prominent calcaneus
description: Protruding heel bone, or calcaneus.

name: Abnormal blistering of the skin
description: The presence of one or more bullae on the skin, defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls.

name: Anterior polar cataract
description: A polar cataract that affects the anterior pole of the lens.

name: Palpebral thickening
description: An increased thickness of the eyelid not related to acute inflammation.

name: Abnormal substantia nigra morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the substantia nigra, which is a midbrain dopaminergic nucleus which has a critical role in modulating motor movement and reward functions as part of the basal ganglia circuitry.

name: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid concentration
description: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the blood circulation. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Hyperchloriduria
description: An increased concentration of chloride in the urine.

name: Noncommunicating hydrocephalus
description: A form of hydrocephalus in which the flow of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) within the cerebral ventricular system or in the outlets of the CSF to the arachnoid space is obstructed.

name: Distal lower limb muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the distal musculature of the legs.
synonyms: Distal muscle weakness in lower limbs

name: Increased connective tissue
description: The presence of an abnormally increased amount of connective tissue.

name: Recurrent Haemophilus influenzae infections
description: Increased susceptibility to Haemophilus influenzae infections as manifested by recurrent episodes of infection by Haemophilus influenzae.

name: Potter facies
description: A facial appearance characteristic of a fetus or neonate due to oligohydramnios experienced in the womb, comprising ocular hypertelorism, low-set ears, receding chin, and flattening of the nose.

name: Splenomegaly
description: Abnormal increased size of the spleen.

name: Plagiocephaly
description: Asymmetric head shape, which is usually a combination of unilateral occipital flattening with ipsilateral frontal prominence, leading to rhomboid cranial shape.

name: Elevated circulating acylcarnitine concentration
description: Concentration of acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

name: Vestibular schwannoma
description: A vestibular schwannoma (also known as acoustic neuroma, acoustic neurinoma, or acoustic neurilemoma) is a benign, usually slow-growing tumor that develops from the VIIIth cranial nerve supplying the inner ear.

name: Hypoproteinemia
description: A decreased concentration of protein in the blood.

name: Narrow palate
description: Width of the palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased palatal width (subjective).

name: Hemifacial spasm
description: Intermittent clonic or tonic contraction of muscles supplied by facial nerve. Muscles are relaxed in between contractions.
synonyms: Spasms on one side of the face

name: Abnormal distal femoral metaphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of the metaphysis of the distal femur (close to the knee).
synonyms: Abnormality of wide portion of outermost thighbone

name: Abnormal nasal cavity morphology
description: Abnormality of the nasal cavity (the cavity includes and starts at the nares and reaches all the way through to the and includes the choanae, the posterior nasal apertures).

name: Difficulty climbing stairs
description: Reduced ability to climb stairs.

name: Positive Romberg sign
description: The patient stands with the feet placed together and balance and is asked to close his or her eyes. A loss of balance upon eye closure is a positive Romberg sign and is interpreted as indicating a deficit in proprioception.

name: Abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism
description: An abnormality of the tricarboxylic acid cycle.

name: Abnormal corneal stroma morphology
description: An abnormality of the stroma of cornea, also known as the substantia propria of cornea.

name: Delayed closure of the anterior fontanelle
description: A delay in closure (ossification) of the anterior fontanelle, which generally undergoes closure around the 18th month of life.
synonyms: Delayed closure of the soft spot on the skull
Late closure of soft spot on the skull
Delayed closure of the bregma sutures
Late closure of large anterior fontanel
Late closure of the bregma sutures
Later than typical closing of soft spot of skull

name: Abnormal platelet granules
description: An anomaly of alpha or dense granules or platelet lysosomes.

name: Retinal dystrophy
description: Retinal dystrophy is an abnormality of the retina associated with a hereditary process. Retinal dystrophies are defined by their predominantly monogenic inheritance and they are frequently associated with loss or dysfunction of photoreceptor cells as a primary or secondary event.
synonyms: Breakdown of light-sensitive cells in back of eye

name: Abnormal sacrum morphology
description: An abnormality of the sacral bone.

name: Acral ulceration
description: A type of digital ulcer that manifests as an open sore on the surface of the skin at the tip of a finger or toe.

name: Amelogenesis imperfecta
description: A developmental dysplasia of the dental enamel.

name: Spondylolisthesis
description: Complete bilateral fractures of the pars interarticularis resulting in the anterior slippage of the vertebra.
synonyms: Displacement of one backbone compared to another

name: Full cheeks
description: Increased prominence or roundness of soft tissues between zygomata and mandible.

name: Punding
description: Punding is a stereotypical motor behavior characterized by an intense fascination with repetitive, excessive and non-goal oriented handling, and examining of objects.

name: Abnormal memory T cell proportion
description: An abnormal proportion of memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood. Memory T cells have previously encountered and responded to their cognate antigen and upon a repeated encounter with the antigen can mount a faster and stronger response.
synonyms: Abnormal proportion of memory T cells

name: Hypergalactosemia
description: Elevated concentration of galactose in the blood.

name: Enlarged tonsils
description: Increase in size of the tonsils, small collections of lymphoid tissue facing into the aerodigestive tract on either side of the back part of the throat.

name: Focal T2 hyperintense brainstem lesion
description: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the brainstem.

name: Skewfoot
description: A type of flat-foot characterized by hindfoot abductovalgus, metatarsus adductus, and Achilles tendon shortening. The predominant radiographic findings include forefoot adduction with lateral subluxation of the navicular on the talus and heel valgus. Very abnormal shoe wear is noted on the medial side. Calluses occur under the metatarsal heads and the head of the plantar-flexed talus.

name: Abnormality of visual evoked potentials
description: An anomaly of visually evoked potentials (VEP), which are electrical potentials, initiated by brief visual stimuli, which are recorded from the scalp overlying the visual cortex.

name: Prominent umbilicus
description: Abnormally prominent umbilicus (belly button).

name: Downbeat nystagmus
description: Downbeat nystagmus is a type of fixation nystagmus with the fast phase beating in a downward direction. It generally increases when looking to the side and down and when lying prone.

name: Acral blistering
description: Bullae (defined as fluid-filled blisters more than 5 mm in diameter with thin walls) of the skin with an acral distribution (affecting peripheral regions such as hands and feet).

name: Abnormal bladder morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the bladder.

name: Breast carcinoma
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the breast.

name: Lipodystrophy
description: Degenerative changes of the fat tissue.
synonyms: Inability to make and keep healthy fat tissue

name: Narrow nasal ridge
description: Decreased width of the nasal ridge.
synonyms: Decreased width of dorsum of nose

name: Nuclear cataract
description: A nuclear cataract is an opacity or clouding that develops in the lens nucleus. That is, a nuclear cataract is one that is located in the center of the lens. The nucleus tends to darken changing from clear to yellow and sometimes brown.

name: Toe deformity
description: Abnormal positioning of toe phalanges. Deformities of the lesser toes often occur gradually, though they can be brought on by trauma. The main adult sagittal plane deformities consist of claw toes, hammer toes and mallet toes. Axial plane deformities include crossover toes.

name: Long nasal bridge
description: Increased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.

name: Extra-axial cerebrospinal fluid accumulation
description: An increased amount of cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) in the subarachnoid space.

name: Spastic gait
description: Spasticity is manifested by increased stretch reflex which is intensified with movement velocity. This results in excessive and inappropriate muscle activation which can contribute to muscle hypertonia. Spastic gait is characterized by manifestations such as muscle hypertonia, stiff knee, and circumduction of the leg.

name: Hoffmann sign
description: A Hoffmann test is performed by flicking the fingernail of the long finger, from dorsal to volar, on each hand while the hand was supported by the examiner's hand. The test was done with the neck in the neutral position and then with the neck maximally forward flexed. Any flexion of the ipsilateral thumb and/or index finger was interpreted as a positive test.

name: Anti-thyroid antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against one or more components on the thyroid.

name: Severe muscular hypotonia
description: A severe degree of muscular hypotonia characterized by markedly reduced muscle tone.

name: Acute leukemia
description: A clonal (malignant) hematopoietic disorder with an acute onset, affecting the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. The malignant cells show minimal differentiation and are called blasts, either myeloid blasts (myeloblasts) or lymphoid blasts (lymphoblasts).

name: Prelingual sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural deafness with either congenital onset or infantile onset, i.e., before the acquisition of speech.

name: EEG with generalized epileptiform discharges
description: EEG discharges recorded on the entire scalp typically seen in persons with epilepsy.

name: Abnormality of the genital system
description: An abnormality of the genital system.

name: Loss of Purkinje cells in the cerebellar vermis
Visually-induced seizure
description: Seizures evoked by visual stimuli. This includes clinical seizures induced by strobe lighting, television and other screens, flickering environmental lighting and self-induction by causing a strobe effect.

name: Neoplasm
description: An organ or organ-system abnormality that consists of uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation which can occur in any part of the body as a benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor).

name: Abnormal facial shape
description: An abnormal morphology (form) of the face or its components.

name: Bulbar palsy
description: Bulbar weakness (or bulbar palsy) refers to bilateral impairment of function of the lower cranial nerves IX, X, XI and XII, which occurs due to lower motor neuron lesion either at nuclear or fascicular level in the medulla or from bilateral lesions of the lower cranial nerves outside the brain-stem. Bulbar weakness is often associated with difficulty in chewing, weakness of the facial muscles, dysarthria, palatal weakness and regurgitation of fluids, dysphagia, and dysphonia.

name: Cerebellar vermis atrophy
description: Wasting (atrophy) of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Intra-oral hyperpigmentation
description: Increased pigmentation, either focal or generalized, of the mucosa of the mouth.

name: Blistering by histological location
description: Blistering (presence of multiple fluid filled blisters) categorized according to the layer of the skin in which the blister originates. The skin is divided into three layers. The epidermis (outermost layer, which mainly consists of keratinocytes), the dermis, and a subcutaneous layer. The epidermis is divided into five layers: the basal lamina (innermost layer), the basal cell layer, the stratum spinosum, the stratum granulosum, and the stratum corneum (outermost layer). Cleavage in epidermolysis bullosa (EB) simplex occurs within the basal keratinocytes; in junctional EB, within the lamina lucida; and in dystrophic EB occurs in the sublamina densa, in the upper portion of the dermis (papillary dermis). In Kindler's EB, cleavage can occur in the basal keratinocytes, in the lamina lucida, or below the lamina densa.

name: Progressive external ophthalmoplegia
description: Initial bilateral ptosis followed by limitation of eye movements in all directions and slowing of saccades.

name: Calcific stippling
description: An abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) pattern of calcifications in soft tissues within or surrounding bones (as observed on radiographs).

name: Abnormal circulating hormone concentration
description: Concentration of a hormone in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

name: Hypoplasia of the iris
description: Congenital underdevelopment of the iris.

name: Abnormal morphology of the nasal alae
description: An abnormality of the Ala of nose.
synonyms: Abnormality of the nasal alar cartilage
Deformity of the nasal alar cartilage
Malformation of the nasal alar cartilage

name: Renal necrosis
description: Cell death (necrosis) affecting one or more parts of the kidney.

name: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin
description: An abnormally increased level of bone isoforms of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.
synonyms: Elevated alkaline phosphatase of bone origin

name: Decreased circulating aldosterone concentration
description: Abnormally reduced levels of aldosterone.

name: Abnormal nasopharynx morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the nasopharynx.

name: Hyporeflexia of lower limbs
description: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the lower limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

name: Diaphyseal sclerosis
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more diaphyses. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: Increased bone density in shaft of long bone

name: Ketoacidosis
description: Acidosis resulting from accumulation of ketone bodies.

name: Abnormal inner ear morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the internal part of the ear.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the inner ear

name: EEG with polyspike wave complexes
description: The presence of complexes of repetitive spikes and waves in EEG.
synonyms: EEG: spike and multispike waves, 3-4 hz

name: Abnormally slow thought process
description: An inner sense from the self that thoughts are abnormally slow and the individual feels that they are unable to increase their rate of thinking. The primary pathology is the decreased rate and other qualities of thinking (e.g. naming of objects) are intact, just slowed. This may be associated with slowed speech, but may be internal and masked by speech that is limited to brief (yes or no) answers.

name: Reticulocytopenia
description: A reduced number of reticulocytes in the peripheral blood.

name: Hypophosphatemia
description: An abnormally decreased phosphate concentration in the blood.

name: Diagnostic behavioral phenotype
description: The Human Phenotype Ontology provides terms to describe specific phenotypic abnormalities rather than disease diagnoses. Nevertheless, it is common for descriptions such as 'Autism' to be used to describe individuals affected with Mendelian forms of neurodevelopmental disease and many other conditions. If possible, we recommend annotation using specific terms in other branchs of the Atypical behavior subontology, but if this is not possible, then terms from this branch may be used.

name: Exocrine pancreatic insufficiency
description: Impaired function of the exocrine pancreas associated with a reduced ability to digest foods because of lack of digestive enzymes.
synonyms: Inability to properly digest food due to lack of pancreatic digestive enzymes

name: Hypoinsulinemia
description: A decreased concentration of insulin in the blood.

name: Opportunistic fungal infection
description: An infection that is caused by a fungus that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such fungi take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

name: Abnormal reproductive system morphology
description: A structural or developmental anomaly of any of the tissues involved in the genital system.

name: Neuroendocrine neoplasm
description: A tumor that originates from a neuroendocrine cell.

name: Long palpebral fissure
description: Distance between medial and lateral canthi is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, apparently increased length of the palpebral fissures.

name: Spondylolysis
description: Spondylolysis is an osseous defect of the pars interarticularis, thought to be a developmental or acquired stress fracture secondary to chronic low-grade trauma.

name: Copper accumulation in liver
description: An anomalous build up of copper (Cu) in the liver.

name: Long clavicles
description: Increased length of the clavicles.

name: Esophagitis
description: Inflammation of the esophagus.

name: Tibial bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the tibia.

name: Decreased patellar reflex
description: Decreased intensity of the patellar reflex (also known as the knee jerk reflex).
