name: Abnormal fingernail morphology
description: An abnormality of the fingernails.

name: Dysgyria
description: An abnormal gyral pattern characterized by abnormalities of sulcal depth or orientation.

name: Recurrent acute respiratory tract infection
description: A history of repeated acute infections of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

name: Polycystic kidney dysplasia
description: The presence of multiple cysts in both kidneys.

name: Hypoalbuminemia
description: Concentration of albumin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Myelopathy
description: Myelopathy is an descriptive term, referring to pathology leading to a neurologic deficit related to the spinal cord. The clinical diagnosis of myelopathy requires a detailed history and physical examination to define the clinical syndrome. Neuroimaging is indicated in most instances of new-onset myelopathy. It is indicated also when the worsening of a myelopathy is unexplained.

name: Esophageal stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the lumen of the esophagus.

name: Ovarian papillary adenocarcinoma
description: The presence of a papillary adenocarcinoma of the ovary.

name: Papilloma
description: A tumor of the skin or mucous membrane with finger-like projections.

name: Macular coloboma
description: A congenital defect of the macula distinct from coloboma associated with optic fissure closure defects. Macular coloboma is characterized by a sharply defined, rather large defect in the central area of the fundus that is oval or round, and coarsely pigmented.

name: Flared iliac wing
description: Widening of the ilium ala, that is of the wing of the ilium, combined with external rotation, leading to a flared appearance of the iliac wing.

name: Thoracic kyphosis
description: Over curvature of the thoracic region, leading to a round back or if sever to a hump.

name: Deep venous thrombosis
description: Formation of a blot clot in a deep vein. The clot often blocks blood flow, causing swelling and pain. The deep veins of the leg are most often affected.
synonyms: Blood clot in a deep vein

name: Atelectasis
description: Collapse of part of a lung associated with absence of inflation (air) of that part.
synonyms: Partial or complete collapse of part or entire lung

name: Schizophrenia
description: A mental disorder characterized by a disintegration of thought processes and emotional responsiveness. It most commonly manifests as auditory hallucinations, paranoid or bizarre delusions, or disorganized speech and thinking. It is accompanied by significant social or occupational dysfunction. The onset of symptoms typically occurs in young adulthood, with a global lifetime prevalence of about 1%. This term is not a helpful parent term to describe abnormal experiences.

name: Excessive bleeding from superficial cuts
description: An abnormally increased degree of bleeding following a superficial injury to the surface of the skin.

name: Stereotypical body rocking
description: Habitual repetitive movement of the entire body, front to back or side to side.

name: Tall stature
description: A height above that which is expected according to age and gender norms.

name: Candida esophagitis
description: Candida infections of the esophagus are considered opportunistic infections and are seen most commonly in immunosuppressed patients, the most common symptoms being dysphagia, odynophagia, and retrosternal pain.

name: Hypoplasia of the thymus
description: Underdevelopment of the thymus.

name: Decreased total eosinophil count
description: Abnormal decrease of absolute number of eosinophils in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Abnormal placental membrane morphology
description: Structural anomaly of the fetal membranes (also known as the amniochorionic or placental membranes), which comprise a vital intrauterine compartment, where they perform mechanical, immune, and endocrine functions to promote growth of the fetus and protection from environmental adversity. Amniochorionic membranes anatomically consist of a single layer of cuboidal amnion epithelial cells, chorionic trophoblasts, and scattered fibroblasts connected by a layer of type IV collagen-rich extracellular matrix.

name: Shoulder pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the shoulder.

name: Very long chain fatty acid accumulation
Bell-shaped thorax
description: The rib cage has the shape of a wide mouthed bell. That is, the superior portion of the rib cage is constricted, followed by a convex region, and the inferior portion of the rib cage expands again to have a large diameter.

name: Normocytic anemia
description: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is normal.

name: Scleritis
description: Inflammation of the sclera.
synonyms: Inflammation of the outer white part of the eye

name: Diaphragmatic weakness
description: A decrease in the strength of the diaphragm.

name: Hiatus hernia
description: The presence of a hernia in which the upper part of the stomach, i.e., mainly the gastric cardia protrudes through the diaphragmatic esophageal hiatus.

name: Postexertional symptom exacerbation
description: Post-exertional symptom exacerbation (PESE), also referred to as post-exertional malaise (PEM), is defined as the worsening of symptoms that can follow minimal cognitive, physical, emotional, or social activity, or activity that could previously be tolerated. Symptoms typically worsen 12 to 72 hours after activity and can last for days or even weeks, sometimes leading to a relapse.

name: Pulmonary artery dilatation
description: An abnormal widening of the diameter of the pulmonary artery.

name: Coxa valga
description: Coxa valga is a deformity of the hip in which the angle between the femoral shaft and the femoral neck is increased compared to age-adjusted values (about 150 degrees in newborns gradually reducing to 120-130 degrees in adults).

name: Lymphangiectasis
description: Dilation of the lymphatic vessels, the basic process that may result in the formation of a lymphangioma.

name: Dysarthria
description: Dysarthric speech is a general description referring to a neurological speech disorder characterized by poor articulation. Depending on the involved neurological structures, dysarthria may be further classified as spastic, flaccid, ataxic, hyperkinetic and hypokinetic, or mixed.

name: Vertebral clefting
description: Schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

name: Vascular neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) originating in the vascular system.

name: Cleft earlobe
description: Discontinuity in the convexity of the inferior margin of the lobe.

name: Abnormal QT interval
description: Any anomaly of the time interval between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

name: Immunologic hypersensitivity
description: Immunological states where the immune system produces harmful responses upon reexposure to sensitizing antigens.

name: Eruption failure
description: A tooth which does not erupt within the teeth eruption timeline and after the loss of eruption potential.

name: Abnormal odontoid process morphology
description: Abnormal structure of the odontoid process, which is a part of the C2 or axis vertebra and forms pivot of the structures forming the craniovertebral junction. The odontoid process is also known as the dens of the axis.

name: Abnormal corneal epithelium morphology
description: Abnormality of the corneal epithelium, that is of the epithelial tissue that covers the front of the cornea.

name: Absent fingernail
description: Absence of a fingernail.

name: Vacuolated lymphocytes
description: The presence of clear, sharply defined vacuoles in the lymphocyte cytoplasm.

name: Coiled sperm flagella
description: Sperm cells whose flagella are twisted (coiled).

name: Neonatal seizure
description: A seizure occurring within the neonatal period (28 days beyond the full term date).

name: Myeloproliferative disorder
description: Proliferation (excess production) of hemopoietically active tissue or of tissue which has embryonic hemopoietic potential.

name: Increased adipose tissue
description: An increase in adipose tissue mass by hyperplastic growth (increase in the number of adipocytes) or by hypertrophic growth (increase in the size of adipocytes occurring primarily by lipid accumulation within the cell).

name: Intrinsic hand muscle atrophy
description: Atrophy of the intrinsic muscle groups of the hand, comprising the thenar and hypothenar muscles; the interossei muscles; and the lumbrical muscles.

name: Congenital hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism with congenital onset.

name: Slender long bone
description: Reduced diameter of a long bone.

name: Broad foot
description: A foot for which the measured width is above the 95th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately wide for its length.

name: Short chin
description: Decreased vertical distance from the vermilion border of the lower lip to the inferior-most point of the chin.

name: Corneal opacity
description: A reduction of corneal clarity.
synonyms: Scarring or clouding of the cornea of the eye

name: Deficit in phonologic short-term memory
description: Impaired ability to repeat non-word sounds. The test for nonword repetition involves the repetition of nonsensical words of increasing length and complexity and is regarded as a measure of phonological (speech sound) processing and short-term memory

name: Erythroid hypoplasia
description: Decreased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
synonyms: Erythroid hypoplasia in the bone marrow

name: Tibialis anterior muscle atrophy
description: Wasting of the tibialis anterior muscle.

name: Abnormal gastrointestinal motility
description: An anomaly of the muscular contractions that propel food though the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Recurrent fever
description: Periodic (episodic or recurrent) bouts of fever.

name: Hypoplasia of the corpus callosum
description: Underdevelopment of the corpus callosum.
synonyms: Underdevelopment of part of brain called corpus callosum

name: Abnormal sacroiliac joint morphology
description: An anomaly of the sacroiliac joint, which connects the base of the spine (sacrum) to the ilium (a hip bone).

name: Butterfly vertebrae
description: A butterfly vertebra (sagittal cleft vertebra or anterior rachischisis) is a sagittal defect in the vertebral body caused by failure of fusion of the two lateral chondrification centers during embryogenesis. The name is based on the appearance of the two hemivertebrae emerging as butterfly wings from the central cleft on x-ray.

name: Abnormal circulating IgE concentration
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgE immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Abnormal vena cava morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure of the veins that return deoxygenated blood from the body into the heart, i.e., the superior vena cava and the inferior vena cava.

name: Focal cortical dysplasia
description: A type of malformation of cortical development that primarily affects areas of neocortex. It can be identified on conventional magnetic resonance imaging as focal cortical thickening, abnormal gyration, and blurring between gray and white matter, often associated with clusters of heterotopic neurons.

name: Paroxysmal dyskinesia
description: Episodic bouts of involuntary movements with dystonic, choreic, ballistic movements, or a combination thereof. There is no loss of consciousness during the attacks.

name: Diffuse alveolar hemorrhage
description: A type of of pulmonary hemorrhage that originates from the pulmonary microcirculation, including the alveolar capillaries, arterioles, and venules. It presents with hemoptysis, anemia, diffuse lung infiltration, and acute respiratory failure. The diagnosis is confirmed by the observation of the accumulation of red blood cells, fibrin, or hemosiderin-laden macrophage in the alveolar space on pathologic biopsy. Hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, appears at least 48-72 hours after bleeding and is helpful in distinguishing diffuse alveolar hemorrhage from surgical trauma. Mild interstitial thickening, organizing pneumonia, or diffuse alveolar damage can also be seen.

name: Nasolacrimal duct obstruction
description: Blockage of the lacrimal duct.

name: Abnormal CSF lactate concentration
description: Abnormal concentration of lactate in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Breast aplasia
description: Failure to develop and congenital absence of the breast.

name: Snoring
description: Deep, noisy breathing during sleep, accompanied by hoarse or harsh sounds, is caused by the vibration of respiratory structures, especially the soft palate. This vibration results in sound due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping.

name: Branchial sinus
description: A congenital branchial sinus is a remnant of the embryonic branchial arches and their intervening clefts and pouches that has failed to regress completely. Sinuses typically have their external orifice inferior to the ramus of the mandible. They may traverse the parotid gland, and run in close vicinity to the facial nerve in the external auditory canal.

name: Abnormal glycosphingolipid metabolism
description: An abnormality of glycosphingolipid metabolism.

name: Steppage gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern that arises from weakness of the pretibial and peroneal muscles due to a lower motor neuron lesion. Affected patients have footdrop and are unable to dorsiflex and evert the foot. The leg is lifted high on walking so that the toes clear the ground, and there may be a slapping noise when the foot strikes the ground again.

name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
description: A type of adrenal hyperplasia with congenital onset.

name: Abnormal affect
description: An anomaly in intensity, frequency, or duration of the verbal or behavioral expression of emotions, feelings, or thoughts.

name: Thromboembolism
description: The formation of a blood clot inside a blood vessel that subsequently travels through the blood stream from the site where it formed to another location in the body, generally leading to vascular occlusion at the distant site.

name: Synovial lining hyperplasia
description: Synovial hyperplasia involves proliferation of mesenchymal stromal/stem cells and leads to synovial thickening, which can be observed radiographically.

name: Dermatochalasis
description: Loss of elasticity of the upper and lower eyelids causing the skin to sag and bulge.

name: Impaired cortisol response to insulin stimulation test
description: Failure of cortisol levels to respond adequately (by increasing) to the insulin tolerance test (ITT).

name: Developmental stagnation
description: A cessation of the development of a child in the areas of motor skills, speech and language, cognitive skills, and social and/or emotional skills.

name: Impaired visuospatial constructive cognition
description: Reduced ability affecting mainly visuospatial cognition which may be tested using pattern construction (for example by Differential Ability Scales, which test a person's strengths and weaknesses across a range of intellectual abilities).

name: Abnormal conjunctiva morphology
description: An abnormality of the conjunctiva.

name: Exercise-induced myoglobinuria
description: Presence of myoglobin in the urine following exercise.

name: Sutural cataract
description: A type of congenital cataract in which the opacity follows the anterior or posterior Y suture.

name: Abnormal cardiac septum morphology
description: An anomaly of the intra-atrial or intraventricular septum.

name: Recurrent intrapulmonary hemorrhage
description: A recurrent hemorrhage occurring within the lung.

name: Increased intramyocellular lipid droplets
description: An abnormal increase in intracellular lipid droplets In a muscle. The number and size of these drops can increase with somd disorders of lipid metabolism affecting muscle. See PMID 20691590 for histological images.

name: Subretinal fluid
description: Edema/fluid accumulating between the retinal pigment epithelium and Bruch's membrane.

name: Abnormal granulocyte count
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of absolute number of granulocytes in the blood, per microliter, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Bowel diverticulosis
description: The presence of multiple diverticula of the intestine.

name: Eye movement-induced pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye that is worse in certain directions of gaze and during prolonged gaze holding.

name: Hypoplasia of the musculature
description: Underdevelopment of the musculature.

name: Abnormal circulating copper concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of copper.

name: Stomach cancer
description: A cancer arising in any part of the stomach.

name: Hypochromia
description: A qualitative impression that red blood cells have less color than normal when examined under a microscope, usually related to a reduced amount of hemoglobin in the red blood cells.

name: Abnormal hepatobiliary system physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the hepatobiliary system

name: Elongated superior cerebellar peduncle
description: Increased length of the superior cerebellar peduncle.

name: Abnormal digestive system morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the digestive system.

name: Abnormal skin adnexa morphology
description: An abnormality of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.

name: Optic nerve glioma
description: A glioma originating in the optic nerve or optic chiasm.

name: Biventricular hypertrophy
description: Thickening of the heart walls in both ventricles.

name: Ulnar deviation of the 2nd finger
description: Displacement of the 2nd (index) finger towards the ulnar side.
synonyms: Ulnar angulation of the index finger

name: Acral overgrowth
description: Excessive growth of hands and feet (predominantly due to soft tissue swelling). Typical manifestations include shoe size increase, foot enlargement, glove tightness, and hand enlargement.

name: Abnormal anterior chamber morphology
description: Abnormality of the anterior chamber, which is the space in the eye that is behind the cornea and in front of the iris.

name: Abnormal circulating beta globulin level
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of beta globulin. The beta globulins are a group of globular (globe-shaped) proteins in blood.

name: Short nasal bridge
description: Decreased superior-inferior length of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose.
synonyms: Decreased length of bridge of nose

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet
description: Any abnormality of the epiphyses of the feet.
synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the foot bone

name: Abnormal lymph node morphology
description: A structural lymph node abnormality.

name: Abnormal lower lip morphology
description: An abnormality of the lower lip.

name: Abnormal mitochondrial morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the mitochondria.

name: Bronchomalacia
description: Weakness or softness of the cartilage in the walls of the bronchial tubes.

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the upper limbs
Delayed brainstem auditory evoked response conduction time
description: An abnormal increase (delay) in the conduction time of the brainstem auditory-evoked response.

name: Presyncope
description: Presyncope is a state of lightheadedness, muscular weakness, blurred vision, and feeling faint. Presyncope is most often cardiovascular in cause.

name: Nasogastric tube feeding
description: The condition of inability to eat normally treated by placement of a thin tube through the nose into the stomach that is then used to carry food.

name: Posterior fossa cyst
description: A discrete posterior fossa cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) collection that does not communicate directly with the fourth ventricle.

name: Capillary hemangioma
description: The presence of a capillary hemangioma, which are hemangiomas with small endothelial spaces.

name: Skin tags
description: Cutaneous skin tags also known as acrochorda or fibroepithelial polyps are small benign tumors that may either form secondarily over time primarily in areas where the skin forms creases, such as the neck, armpit or groin or may also be present at birth, in which case they usually occur in the periauricular region.

name: Osteochondrosis
description: Abnormal growth ossification centers in children. Initially a degeneration/ necrosis followed by regeneration or recalcification.

name: Abnormal distal phalanx morphology of finger
description: Any anomaly of distal phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Abnormal terminal phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the distal phalanx of finger
Abnormality of the outermost finger bone

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the thorax
description: A disease or lesion affecting the muscles of the thorax.

name: Orthostatic hypotension
description: A form of hypotension characterized by a sudden fall in blood pressure that occurs when a person assumes a standing position.
synonyms: Decrease in blood pressure upon standing up

name: Myoclonus
description: Very brief, involuntary random muscular contractions occurring at rest, in response to sensory stimuli, or accompanying voluntary movements.

name: Laryngeal cleft
description: Presence of a gap in the posterior laryngotracheal wall with a continuity between the larynx and the esophagus.

name: Stage 3 chronic kidney disease
description: A type of chronic kidney disease with moderately reduced glomerular filtration rate (GFR 30-59 mL/min/1.73 m2).

name: Optic atrophy
description: Atrophy of the optic nerve. Optic atrophy results from the death of the retinal ganglion cell axons that comprise the optic nerve and manifesting as a pale optic nerve on fundoscopy.

name: Slanting of the palpebral fissure
synonyms: Slanting of the opening between the eyelids

name: Abnormal maternal serum screening
description: An abnormally elevated or decreased level of a maternal serum marker analytes used in screening for aneuploidy.

name: Low serum calcitriol
description: A reduced concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the lower limbs
Predominantly lower limb lymphedema
description: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system, affecting mainly the legs.

name: Spastic diplegia
description: Spasticity (neuromuscular hypertonia) primarily in the muscles of the legs, hips, and pelvis.

name: Bilateral sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects both ears.

name: Recurrent staphylococcal infections
description: Increased susceptibility to staphylococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of staphylococcal infections.

name: Abnormal corpus callosum morphology
description: Abnormality of the corpus callosum.

name: Asymmetry of the thorax
description: Lack of symmetry between the left and right halves of the thorax.

name: Severely reduced left ventricular ejection fraction
description: A large reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at over 50 percent, and a severe reduction is defined as less than 30 percent.

name: 2-3 toe syndactyly
description: Syndactyly with fusion of toes two and three.
synonyms: Syndactyly of second and third toes

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the proximal phalanges of the hand
synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the innermost hand bones

name: Tapered distal phalanges of finger
description: A reduction in diameter of the distal phalanx of finger towards the distal end.
synonyms: Tapered distal phalanges of the hand

name: Childhood-onset truncal obesity
description: Truncal obesity with onset during childhood, defined as between 2 and 10 years of age.

name: Long thumb
description: Length of the thumb is greater than normal.

name: Anterior open-bite malocclusion
description: Anterior open bite is a malocclusion characterized by a gap between the anterior teeth (incisors), that is, by a deficiency in the normal vertical overlap between antagonist incisal edges when the posterior teeth are in occlusion.
synonyms: Absence of overlap of anterior upper and lower teeth
Anterior open bite between upper and lower teeth
Gap between upper and lower front teeth when biting

name: Caudal appendage
description: The presence of a tail-like skin appendage located adjacent to the sacrum.

name: Hepatocellular adenoma
description: A benign tumor of the liver of presumably epithelial origin.

name: Recurrent candida infections
description: An increased susceptibility to candida infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of candida infections.

name: Abnormal urinary electrolyte concentration
description: An abnormality in the concentration of electrolytes in the urine.

name: Minimal change glomerulonephritis
description: The presence of minimal changes visible by light microscopy but flattened and fused podocyte foot processes on electron microscopy in a person with nephrotic range proteinuria.

name: Abnormal optic chiasm morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the optic chiasm.The optic chiasm, located below the hypothalamus, is a partial crossing of the optic nerves.

name: Hypoplastic anemia
description: Anemia with varying degrees of erythrocytic hypoplasia without leukopenia or thrombocytopenia.

name: Sparse lateral eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of lateral eyebrow hairs.
synonyms: Limited hair on end of eyebrow

name: Abnormality of corneal size
description: Any abnormality of the size or morphology of the cornea.

name: Aortic tortuosity
description: Abnormal tortuous (i.e., twisted) form of the aorta.

name: Abnormal conus terminalis morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the conus terminalis, which is the distal bulbous part of the spinal cord at the location where the spinal cord tapers and ends (usually between the L1 and L2 lumbar vertebrae).

name: Abnormal nipple morphology
description: An abnormality of the nipple.

name: Abnormality of the hypothenar eminence
description: An abnormality of the hypothenar eminence, i.e., of the muscles on the ulnar side of the palm of the hand (i.e., on the side of the little finger).

name: Abnormal nail surface
description: An anomaly of the surface of the nail.

name: Periventricular heterotopia
description: A form of gray matter heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is typically located periventricularly, also sometimes called subependymal heterotopia. Periventricular means beside the ventricles. This is by far the most common location for heterotopia. Subependymal heterotopia present in a wide array of variations. There can be a small single node or a large number of nodes, can exist on either or both sides of the brain at any point along the higher ventricle margins, can be small or large, single or multiple, and can form a small node or a large wavy or curved mass.

name: Truncal titubation
description: Tremor of the trunk in an anterior-posterior plane at 3-4 Hz.

name: Decreased circulating free T3
description: A reduced concentration of free 3,3',5-triiodo-L-thyronine in the blood circulation.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the intestines
description: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the intestines.

name: Infantile encephalopathy
description: Encephalopathy with onset in the infantile period.

name: Ventricular septal hypertrophy
description: The dividing wall between left and right sides of the heart, thickens and bulges into the left ventricle.

name: Urethral stricture
description: Narrowing of the urethra associated with inflammation or scar tissue.

name: Arrhinencephaly
description: A defect of development of the brain characterized by congenital absence of the part of the brain that includes the olfactory bulbs, tracts, and other structures associated with the sense of smell.

name: Abnormal endocardium morphology
description: An abnormality of the endocardium.

name: Generalized hypotonia
description: Generalized muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone).

name: Abnormal response to glucagon stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to the glucagon stimulation test, which like the insulin tolerance test (ITT) stimulates the release of both adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH).

name: Proximal renal tubular acidosis
description: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of the proximal tubular cells to reabsorb bicarbonate, leading to urinary bicarbonate wasting and subsequent acidemia.

name: Retinal arteriolar tortuosity
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal arterioles.

name: Internally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers
description: An abnormally increased proportion of nuclei of sarcomeres with an internal localization. Individual muscle fibers are syncytia, formed by embryonic fusion of many myoblasts or later, myosatellite cells. Each muscle fiber contains many nuclei, peripherally positioned immediately adjacent to the sarcolemmal membrane. In healthy muscle only 3-5% of fibers contain nuclei that are located internally, within the cell, but many disease processes lead to internal nuclei.

name: Neoplasm by histology
description: Neoplasm categorized according to type of histological abnormality.

name: Occipital cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy of the occipital cortex.

name: Intermittent claudication
description: Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial occlusive disease. After having walked over a distance which is individually characteristic, the patients experience pain or cramps in the calves, feet or thighs which typically subsides on standing still.

name: Transient hyperphenylalaninemia
description: A condition of not having consistently high levels of phenylalanine in the blood but of experiencing temporary hyperphenylalaninemia following ingestion of large quantities of phenylalanine (for instance, following an oral loading test with phenylalanine).

name: Lipoatrophy
description: Localized loss of fat tissue.
synonyms: Loss of fat tissue in localised area
Loss of fat tissue in localized area

name: Neoplasm of the large intestine
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the large intestine.

name: Severe varicella zoster infection
description: An unusually severe form of varicella zoster virus (VZV) infection. In the majority of the cases, especially in children, varicella is a very mild infection characterized by skin lesions, low grade fever and malaise. Severe infection is characterized by manifestations including VZV pneumonia, hepatitis, meningitis, and disseminated varicella.

name: Neoplasm of the ear
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ear.

name: Decreased total B cell count
description: The absolute number of B cells in the blood, per microlitre is below the lower limit of normal of the reference range for the appropriate sex and age-group.

name: Abnormal germ cell morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a reproductive cell.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of a reproductive cell

name: Short upper lip
description: Decreased width of the upper lip.
synonyms: Decreased vertical length of upper lip

name: Chronic pulmonary obstruction
description: An anomaly that is characterized progressive airflow obstruction that is only partly reversible, inflammation in the airways, and systemic effects or comorbities.

name: Dysdiadochokinesis
description: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to perform rapidly alternating movements, such as pronating and supinating his or her hand on the dorsum of the other hand as rapidly as possible.
synonyms: Difficulty performing quick and alternating movements

name: Osteopenia
description: Osteopenia is a term to define bone density that is not normal but also not as low as osteoporosis. By definition from the World Health Organization osteopenia is defined by bone densitometry as a T score -1 to -2.5.

name: Muscular dystrophy
description: The term dystrophy means abnormal growth. However, muscular dystrophy is used to describe primary myopathies with a genetic basis and a progressive course characterized by progressive skeletal muscle weakness and wasting, defects in muscle proteins, and histological features of muscle fiber degeneration (necrosis) and regeneration. If possible, it is preferred to use other HPO terms to describe the precise phenotypic abnormalities.

name: Omphalocele
description: A midline anterior incomplete closure of the abdominal wall in which there is herniation of the abdominal viscera into the base of the abdominal cord.

name: Visual agnosia
description: The condition is known as visual agnosia, which refers to the inability to recognize objects that are visually presented, even though the individual may have normal visual field, acuity, color vision, brightness discrimination, language, and memory.

name: Partial absence of thumb
description: The absence of a phalangeal segment of a thumb.
synonyms: Aplasia of the phalanges of the thumb

name: Depressed nasal bridge
description: Posterior positioning of the nasal root in relation to the overall facial profile for age.

name: Neonatal hyperbilirubinemia
description: A type of hyperbilirubinemia with neonatal onset.
synonyms: High blood bilirubin levels in neonate

name: Abnormal humeral metaphysis morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of the wide portion of the long bone in upper arm

name: Abnormal periauricular region morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of the region around the ear

name: Abnormality of the inner ear
description: An abnormality of the inner ear.

name: Abnormal basal ganglia morphology
description: Abnormality of the basal ganglia.

name: Spinal cord compression
description: External mechanical compression of the spinal cord.

name: Abnormal peritoneum morphology
description: An abnormality of the peritoneum.

name: Abnormality of the cervical spine
description: Any abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Abnormal circulating sex hormone concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a sex hormone in the blood circulation

name: Abnormality of the liver
description: An abnormality of the liver.

name: Convex nasal ridge
description: Nasal ridge curving anteriorly to an imaginary line that connects the nasal root and tip. The nose appears often also prominent, and the columella low.

name: Abnormality of the chin
description: An abnormality of the chin, i.e., of the inferior portion of the face lying inferior to the lower lip and including the central prominence of the lower jaw.

name: Abnormal left ventricular ejection fraction
description: Any abnormality of the left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF), which is the fraction of chamber volume ejected in systole (stroke volume) in relation to the volume of the blood in the ventricle at the end of diastole (end-diastolic volume). Stroke volume (SV) is calculated as the difference between end-diastolic volume (EDV) and end-systolic volume (ESV). LVEF is calculated as [SV/EDV] in percent.

name: Aplasia of the phalanges of the hand
description: Absence of one or more of the phalanges of the hand.
synonyms: Absent finger bone of the hand

name: Increased total B cell count
description: The absolute number of B cells in the blood, per microlitre is above the upper limit of normal of the reference range for the appropriate sex and age-group.

name: Microcytic anemia
description: A kind of anemia in which the volume of the red blood cells is reduced.

name: Anhydramnios
description: A complete or near-complete lack of amniotic fluid surrounding a fetus. This finding can be observed sonographically in the third trimesters if the deepest pocket of amniotic fluid is less than or equal to 2 cm.

name: Abnormality of secondary sexual hair
description: Abnormality of the growth of secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty. In males, secondary sexual hair usually comprises body hair, including underarm, abdominal, chest, and pubic hair. In females, secondary sexual hair usually comprises a lesser degree of body hair, most prominently underarm and pubic hair.

name: Abnormality of upper limb joint
synonyms: Abnormality of the joints of the upper limbs

name: Hepatitis
description: Inflammation of the liver.

name: Impaired proprioception
description: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position.

name: Abnormal capillary physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the tiny blood vessels that connect arterioles with venules and whose walls act as semipermeable membranes that mediate the diffusion of fluids and gases between the blood circulation and body tissues.

name: Central adrenal insufficiency
description: A form of adrenal insufficiency related to a lack of ACTH, which leads to a decrease in the production of cortisol by the adrenal glands. Aldosterone production is not usually affected.

name: Orthokeratosis
description: Formation of an anuclear keratin layer

name: Upper limb muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles of the arms.

name: Aniridia
description: Abnormality of the iris characterized by, typically bilateral, complete or partial iris hypoplasia. The phenotype ranges from mild defects of anterior iris stroma only to almost complete absence of the iris.

name: Recurrent gastroenteritis
description: Increased susceptibility to gastroenteritis, an infectious inflammationof the stomach and small intestines manifested by signs and symptoms such as diarheas and abdominal pain, as manifested by recurrent episodes of gastroenteritis.

name: Decreased circulating complement factor I concentration
description: Concentration of the complement component factor I in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Chronic gastritis
description: A chronic form of gastritis.

name: Abnormal blood chloride concentration
description: An abnormality of chloride homeostasis or concentration in the body.

name: Synostosis involving bones of the hand
description: An abnormal union between bones or parts of bones of the hand.

name: Increased muscle lipid content
description: An abnormal accumulation of lipids in skeletal muscle.

name: Early satiety
description: The condition of being unable to eat a full meal because of a feeling of fullness (satiety), or or feeling very full after eating only a small amount of food.
synonyms: Not able to finish a normal-sized meal

name: Anti-glutamic acid decarboxylase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the serum that react against glutamic acid decarboxylase.

name: Palmar hyperlinearity
description: Exaggerated skin markings (dermatoglyphics) on the palms of the hand.

name: Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the tricuspid valve.

name: Abnormal renal corpuscle morphology
description: Any anomalous structure of the renal corpuscle, which is the initial component of the nephron that filters blood. The renal corpuscle consists of a knot of capillaries (glomerulus) that is surrounded by a double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule.

name: Hypoplastic fifth fingernail
description: A nail of the fifth finger that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail of little finger.

name: Anterior pituitary agenesis
description: Absence of the anterior pituitary gland resulting from a developmental defect.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber alpha dystroglycan
description: A deviation from normal of muscle alpha-dystroglcan expression. Alpha-dystroglycan is a heavily glycosylated peripheral-membrane component of the dystrophin-associated glycoprotein complex (DAPC), which, in addition to laminin alpha2, binds perlecan and agrin in the extracellular matrix, whereas beta-dystroglycan, derived from the same gene, is a transmembrane protein that links to dystrophin intracellularly.

name: Post-partum hemorrhage
description: Significant maternal hemorrhage/blood loss following deilvery of a child.

name: Porphyrinuria
description: Abnormally increased excretion of porphyrins in the urine.

name: Abnormal intervertebral disk morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the intervertebral disk.

name: Reduced subcutaneous adipose tissue
description: A reduced amount of fat tissue in the lowest layer of the integument. This feature can be appreciated by a reduced skinfold thickness.
synonyms: Reduced fat tissue below the skin

name: Abnormal urine metabolite level
description: Any deviation from the normal amount of a metabolite in urine.

name: Abnormal toenail morphology
description: An anomaly of the toenail.

name: Bilateral cryptorchidism
description: Absence of both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

name: Abnormal brain-evoked potentials
description: Any anomaly of brain-evoked potentials, defined as potentials generated by exteroceptive stimuli reflect synchronized activity by neuronal and axonal groups in the central nervous system (CNS) resulting from the arrival of nerve impulses after stimulation of a peripheral nerve or its receptors. Depending on the type of stimulus, evoked potentials are categorized as visual (VEP), auditory (AEP), or somatosensory (SSEP). Motor evoked potentials (MEP) occur when the brain's motor area is stimulated. They result from the activation of a sufficient number of motor units.

name: Abnormality of lower limb joint
synonyms: Abnormality of the joints of the lower limbs

name: Facial paralysis
description: Complete loss of ability to move facial muscles innervated by the facial nerve (i.e., the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Decreased testicular size
description: Reduced volume of the testicle (the male gonad).

name: Pes cavus
description: An increase in height of the medial longitudinal arch of the foot that does not flatten on weight bearing (i.e., a distinctly hollow form of the sole of the foot when it is bearing weight).

name: Neoplasm of the pancreas
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the pancreas.

name: Focal cognitive seizure
description: A focal cognitive seizure involves an alteration in a cognitive function (which can be a deficit or a positive phenomenon such as forced thought), which occurs at seizure onset. To be classified as a focal cognitive seizure, the change in cognitive function should be specific and out of proportion to other relatively unimpaired aspects of cognition, because all cognition is impaired in a focal impaired awareness seizure.

name: Pontocerebellar atrophy
description: Atrophy affecting the pons and the cerebellum.

name: Dysgenesis of the hippocampus
description: Structural abnormality of the hippocampus related to defective development.

name: Abnormality of frontal sinus
description: An abnormality of the frontal sinus, one of the mucosa-lined, normally air-filled paranasal sinuses of the bones of the skull. The frontal sinus is located within the frontal bone.

name: Extrahepatic cholestasis
description: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in large bile ducts outside the liver.

name: Abnormal knee morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

name: Brain imaging abnormality
description: An anomaly of metabolism or structure of the brain identified by imaging.

name: Abnormal coccyx morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the coccyx.

name: Descending aortic dissection
description: A separation of the layers within the wall of the descending aorta. Tears in the intimal layer result in the propagation of dissection (proximally or distally) secondary to blood entering the intima-media space.

name: Unusual infection by anatomical site
description: An unusual infection classified by the affected body part.

name: Abnormal bleeding
description: An abnormal susceptibility to bleeding, often referred to as a bleeding diathesis. A bleeding diathesis may be related to vascular, platelet and coagulation defects.

name: Fatigable weakness of skeletal muscles
description: A type of weakness of skeletal muscle that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Supraventricular tachycardia
description: Supraventricular tachycardia (SVT) is an abnormally increased heart rate (over 100 beats per minute at rest) with origin above the level of the ventricles.

name: Leiomyosarcoma
description: A smooth muscle connective tissue tumor, which is rare type of cancer that is a malignant neoplasm of smooth muscle. When such a neoplasm is benign, it is called a leiomyoma.

name: Dilated cardiomyopathy
description: Dilated cardiomyopathy (DCM) is defined by the presence of left ventricular dilatation and left ventricular systolic dysfunction in the absence of abnormal loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) or coronary artery disease sufficient to cause global systolic impairment. Right ventricular dilation and dysfunction may be present but are not necessary for the diagnosis.

name: Vasculitis in the skin
description: A type of vasculitis (inflammation of blood vessel walls) that affects skeletal muscle tissue.

name: Pituitary growth hormone cell adenoma
description: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces growth hormone.

name: Subcortical cerebral atrophy
description: Atrophy of the cerebral subcortical white and gray matter, termed subcortical atrophy, reflects loss of nerve cells in the basal ganglia or fibers in the deep white matter.

name: Blepharitis
description: Inflammation of the eyelids.

name: Polycythemia
description: Polycythemia is diagnosed if the red blood cell count, the hemoglobin level, and the red blood cell volume all exceed the upper limits of normal.

name: Deviation of the 3rd finger
description: Displacement of the 3rd finger from its normal position.

name: Myeloid leukemia
description: A leukemia that originates from a myeloid cell, that is the blood forming cells of the bone marrow.

name: Abnormality of the tonsils
description: An abnormality of the tonsils.

name: Hydranencephaly
description: A defect of development of the brain characterized by replacement of greater portions of the cerebral hemispheres and the corpus striatum by cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and glial tissue.

name: Intercostal muscle weakness
description: Lack of strength of the intercostal muscles, i.e., of the muscle groups running along the ribs that create and move the chest wall.

name: Multiple lipomas
description: The presence of multiple lipomas (a type of benign tissue made of fatty tissue).

name: Hypoplastic helices
description: Underdevelopment of the helix, i.e., of the outer rim of the pinna.

name: Euthyroid goiter
description: A goiter that is not associated with functional thyroid abnormalities.

name: Moderate myopia
description: A moderate form of myopia with refractive error of between -3.00 and -6.00 diopters.

name: Partial absence of cerebellar vermis
description: Congenital absence of a part of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Milia
description: Presence of multiple small cysts containing keratin (skin protein) and presenting as tiny pearly-white bumps just under the surface of the skin.

name: Abnormal septum pellucidum morphology
description: An abnormality of the septum pellucidum, which is a thin, triangular, vertical membrane separating the lateral ventricles of the brain.

name: Skin dimple
description: Skin dimples are cutaneous indentations that are the result of tethering of the skin to underlying structures (bone) causing an indentation.

name: Central hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism due to an insufficient stimulation of an otherwise normal thyroid gland. Central hypothyroidism is caused by either pituitary (secondary hypothyroidism) or hypothalamic (tertiary hypothyroidism) defects.

name: Sleep drunkeness
description: Sleep drunkenness refers to the prolonged and pronounced difficulty with awakening from nocturnal sleep and daytime naps. This symptom should be distinguished from the milder and physiologic state of sleep inertia seen even in healthy controls.
synonyms: Slow speech or confused thinking upon waking

name: Hypoplasia of the vagina
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the vagina.

name: Sick sinus syndrome
description: An abnormality involving the generation of the action potential by the sinus node and is characterized by an atrial rate inappropriate for physiological requirements. Manifestations include severe sinus bradycardia, sinus pauses or arrest, sinus node exit block, chronic atrial tachyarrhythmias, alternating periods of atrial bradyarrhythmias and tachyarrhythmias, and inappropriate responses of heart rate during exercise or stress.

name: Suicidal ideation
description: Frequent thoughts about or preoccupation with killing oneself.

name: Delayed eruption of permanent teeth
description: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the secondary dentition.

name: Duplication involving bones of the feet
synonyms: Duplication involving bones of the feet

name: Age of death
description: The age group when the cessation of life happens.

name: Hypoplastic hippocampus
description: Underdevelopment of the hippocampus.

name: Conjunctival hamartoma
description: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) of the conjunctiva.

name: Cortical thickening of long bone diaphyses
description: Abnormal thickening of the cortex of the diaphyseal region of long bones.

name: Decreased circulating complement C4 concentration
description: Concentration of the complement component C4 in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Mild microcephaly
description: Decreased occipito-frontal (head) circumference (OFC). For the microcephaly OFC must be between -3 SD and -2 SD compared to appropriate, age matched, normal standards (i.e. -3 SD <= OFC < -2 SD).

name: Weakness of facial musculature
description: Reduced strength of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Eclampsia
description: An acute and life-threatening complication of pregnancy, which is characterized by the appearance of tonic-clonic seizures, usually in a patient who had developed pre-eclampsia. Eclampsia includes seizures and coma that happen during pregnancy but are not due to preexisting or organic brain disorders.

name: Adrenocorticotropin deficient adrenal insufficiency
description: Adrenal insufficiency secondary to a defect in ACTH production.

name: Flattened femoral epiphysis
description: An abnormal flattening of an epiphysis of femur.
synonyms: Flattended end part of thigh bone

name: Increased susceptibility to fractures
description: An abnormally increased tendency to fractures of bones caused by an abnormal reduction in bone strength that is generally associated with an increased risk of fracture.

name: Increased circulating osteocalcin level
description: An elevated level of osteocalcin in the blood.

name: Abnormality of binocular vision
description: An abnormality of binocular vision, that is of the ability to synthesize the visual inputs from both eyes to a single image with perception of depth.

name: Chronic lung disease
description: According to the definitions of the American and British Thoracic Societies, including pulmonary functional tests, X-rays, and CT scans for items such as fibrosis, bronchiectasis, bullae, emphysema, nodular or lymphomatous abnormalities.

name: Duplication of phalanx of toe
description: Partial/complete duplication of one or more phalanx of toe.
synonyms: Partial/complete duplication of the phalanges of the toes

name: Acetabular dysplasia
description: A smaller than normal acetabulum that has insufficient femoral head coverage leading to abnormal hip joint contact pressures, instability and pain.
synonyms: Decreased femoral head coverage by acetabulum

name: Retinal flecks
description: Presence of multiple yellowish-white lesions of various size and configuration on the retina not related to vascular lesions.

name: Photoreceptor layer loss on macular OCT
description: Loss of the outer nuclear layer (photoreceptor layer) as assessed by ocular coherence tomography.

name: Granular macular appearance
description: Mottled (spotted or blotched with different shades) pigmentary abnormality of the macula lutea.

name: Posterior rib cupping
description: Wide, concave posterior rib end.

name: Infantile onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between 28 days to one year of life.
synonyms: Onset in first year of life

name: Infection following live vaccination
description: An infection resulting from live attenuated vaccines (LAV), that is, a vaccine prepared from living viruses or bacteria that have been weakened under laboratory conditions. LAV vaccines will replicate in a vaccinated individual and produce an immune response but usually cause mild or no disease. are derived from disease-causing pathogens.

name: Intervertebral space narrowing
description: Decreased height of the intervertebral disk.

name: Block vertebrae
description: Congenital synostosis between two or more adjacent vertebrae (partial or complete fusion of adjacent vertabral bodies).

name: Upper limb asymmetry
description: Difference in length or size between the right and left arm.

name: Pharyngitis
description: Inflammation (due to infection or irritation) of the pharynx.

name: Abnormal transferrin saturation
description: Any abnormality in the serum transferrin saturation, which is calculated by dividing the serum iron level by total iron-binding capacity.

name: Abnormal sperm head morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the sperm head.

name: Microglossia
description: Decreased length and width of the tongue.

name: Elevated systolic blood pressure
description: Abnormal increase in systolic blood pressure.

name: Expressive aphasia
description: Impairment of expressive language and relative preservation of receptive language abilities. That is, the patient understands language (speech, writing) but cannot express it.

name: Severe hearing impairment
description: A severe form of hearing impairment.

name: Abnormal circulating calcitonin concentration
description: Concentration of calcitonin, a 32-amino acid polypeptide hormone that is produced primarily by the parafollicular cells of the thyroid, in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

name: Facial telangiectasia
description: Telangiectases (small dilated blood vessels) located near the surface of the skin of the face.

name: Abnormal circulating IgG concentration
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgG immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Focal hemiclonic seizure
description: A type of focal clonic seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking rapidly involves one side of the body at seizure onset.

name: Hyperphosphatemia
description: An abnormally increased phosphate concentration in the blood.

name: Impaired vibration sensation in the lower limbs
description: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration in the legs.
synonyms: Decreased vibratory sense in lower limbs
Decreased vibratory sense in the lower extremities
Decreased vibratory sense in the lower limbs
Diminished vibratory sensation in the legs
Distal sensory loss, especially vibratory sense
Distal vibratory impairment of the lower limbs
Impaired vibration sensation in the lower limbs

name: Abnormality of urine bicarbonate level
description: An abnormal amount of hydrogencarbonate in the urine.

name: Abnormal renal cortex morphology
description: An abnormality of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Chronic lymphatic leukemia
description: A chronic lymphocytic/lymphatic/lymphoblastic leukemia (CLL) is a neoplastic disease characterized by proliferation and accumulation (blood, marrow and lymphoid organs) of morphologically mature but immunologically dysfunctional lymphocytes. A CLL is always a B-cell lymphocytic leukemia as there are no reports of cases of T-cell lymphocytic leukemias.

name: Aplasia of the phalanges of the toes
description: Absence of a digit or of one or more phalanges of a toe.

name: Toe syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

name: Increased circulating IgA concentration
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin A in blood.

name: Keratan sulfate excretion in urine
description: An increased concentration of keratan sulfate in the urine.

name: Facial hypertrichosis
description: Excessive, increased hair growth located in the facial region.

name: Subcortical heterotopia
description: A form of heterotopia were the mislocalized gray matter is located deep within the white matter.

name: Decreased circulating vitamin B12 concentration
description: The concentration of vitamin B12 in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Adrenocorticotropic hormone excess
description: Overproduction of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), which generally leads secondarily to overproduction of cortisol by the adrenal cortex.

name: Decreased circulating androgen concentration
description: A reduction in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

name: Abnormal autonomic nervous system physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the autonomic nervous system.

name: Aplasia of the uterus
description: A congenital defect characterized by absence of the uterus. Aplasia refers to the failure of an organ to develop during embryonic growth and development due to the absence of primordial tissue.

name: Abnormal response to endocrine stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to a test that is designed to probe the function of the endocrine system.

name: Astrocytoma
description: Astrocytoma is a neoplasm of the central nervous system derived from astrocytes. Astrocytes are a type of glial cell, and thus astrocytoma is a subtype of glioma.

name: Petechiae
description: Petechiae are pinpoint-sized reddish/purple spots, resembling a rash, that appear just under the skin or a mucous membrane when capillaries have ruptured and some superficial bleeding into the skin has happened. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing petechiae.

name: Short foot
description: A measured foot length that is more than 2 SD below the mean for a newborn of 27 - 41 weeks gestation, or foot that is less than the 3rd centile for individuals from birth to 16 years of age (objective). Alternatively, a foot that appears disproportionately short (subjective).

name: Follicular thyroid carcinoma
description: The presence of an follicular adenocarcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Pseudoarthrosis
description: A pathologic entity characterized by a developmental defect in a long bone leading to bending and pathologic fracture, with inability to form a normal bony callus with subsequent fibrous nonunion, leading to the pseudarthrosis (or "false joint").

name: Neoplasm of the male external genitalia
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the male external genitalia.
synonyms: Neoplasia of the male external genitalia

name: Abnormal inferior vena cava morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the principal vein draining blood from the lower portion of the body.

name: Neoplasm of the oral cavity
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the oral cavity.

name: Scleral staphyloma
description: A staphyloma is a localized defect in the eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

name: Pruritus
description: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased disposition to experience pruritus.

name: Cystic hygroma
description: A cystic lymphatic lesion of the neck.

name: Semilobar holoprosencephaly
description: A type of holoprosencephaly in which the left and right frontal and parietal lobes are fused and the interhemispheric fissure is only present posteriorly.

name: Sparse hair
description: Reduced density of hairs.

name: Tritanomaly
description: Difficulty distinguishing between yellow and blue, possible related to dysfunction of the S photopigment.

name: Tremor
description: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement about a joint axis.

name: Tractional retinal detachment
description: A type of retinal detachment arising due to a combination of contracting retinal membranes, abnormal vitreoretinal adhesions, and vitreous changes. It is usually seen in the context of diseases that induce a fibrovascular response, e.g. diabetes.

name: Clubbing
description: Broadening of the soft tissues (non-edematous swelling of soft tissues) of the digital tips in all dimensions associated with an increased longitudinal and lateral curvature of the nails.

name: Abdominal colic
description: A type of abdominal pain that comes and goes in waves, most often starting and ending suddenly and being of severe intensity.

name: Bifid nose
description: Visually assessable vertical indentation, cleft, or depression of the nasal bridge, ridge and tip.
synonyms: Indentation or clefting of the nose

name: Generalized hypertrichosis
description: Generalized excessive, abnormal hairiness.

name: Downturned corners of mouth
description: A morphological abnormality of the mouth in which the angle of the mouth is downturned. The oral commissures are positioned inferior to the midline labial fissure.

name: Skin rash
description: A red eruption of the skin.

name: Keratitis
description: Inflammation of the cornea.

name: Cleft soft palate
description: Cleft of the soft palate (also known as the velum, or muscular palate) as a result of a developmental defect occurring between the 7th and 12th week of pregnancy. Cleft soft palate can cause functional abnormalities of the Eustachian tube with resulting middle ear anomalies and hearing difficulties, as well as speech problems associated with hypernasal speech due to velopharyngeal insufficiency.

name: Abnormal atrioventricular valve morphology
description: An abnormality of an atrioventricular valve.

name: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fiber size
description: Any abnormality of the size of the skeletal muscle cell.
synonyms: Abnormality of skeletal muscle fibre size

name: Thickened ribs
description: Increased thickness (diameter) of ribs.

name: Colitis
description: Colitis refers to an inflammation of the colon and is often used to describe an inflammation of the large intestine (colon, cecum and rectum). Colitides may be acute and self-limited or chronic, and broadly fit into the category of digestive diseases.

name: Flat nasal alae
description: An abnormal degree of flatness of the Ala of nose, which can be defined as a reduced nasal elevation index (lateral depth of the nose from the tip of the nose to the insertion of the nasal ala in the cheek x 100 divided by the side-to-side breadth of the nasal alae).

name: First degree atrioventricular block
description: Delay of conduction through the atrioventricular node, which is manifested as prolongation of the PR interval in the electrocardiogram (EKG). All atrial impulses reach the ventricles.

name: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
description: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM) is defined by the presence of increased ventricular wall thickness or mass in the absence of loading conditions (hypertension, valve disease) sufficient to cause the observed abnormality.

name: Abnormal synaptic transmission at the neuromuscular junction
description: Any abnormality of the neuromuscular junction, which is the synapse between the motor end plate of a motor neuron and the skeletal muscle fibers.

name: Chronic pain
description: Persistent pain, usually defined as pain that has lasted longer than 3 to 6 months.

name: External genital hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of part or all of the external reproductive organs.

name: Myoglobinuria
description: Presence of myoglobin in the urine.

name: Neoplasm of the thyroid gland
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the thyroid gland.

name: Varicose veins
description: Enlarged and tortuous veins.

name: Short umbilical cord
description: Decreased length of the umbilical cord.

name: Hypermobility of interphalangeal joints
description: The ability of the interphalangeal joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Areflexia
description: Absence of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.

name: Pulmonary venous hypertension
description: An abnormal increase in pressure in the pulmonary veins, usually as a result of left atrial hypertension.

name: Epidermal acanthosis
description: Diffuse hypertrophy or thickening of the stratum spinosum of the epidermis (prickle cell layer of the skin).
synonyms: Thickening of upper layer of skin

name: Short philtrum
description: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD below the mean. Alternatively, an apparently decreased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.

name: Villous atrophy
description: The enteric villi are atrophic or absent.
synonyms: Small intestine biopsy shows villous atrophy

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the 5th finger
description: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the little (5th) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the innermost bone little finger
Abnormality of the innermost bone pinkie finger
Abnormality of the innermost bone pinky finger

name: Cellulitis
description: A bacterial infection and inflammation of the skin und subcutaneous tissues.

name: Turricephaly
description: Tall head relative to width and length.

name: Metacarpal pseudoepiphysis
description: A pseudoepiphysis is a secondary ossification center distinct from the normal epiphysis. The normal metacarpal epiphyses are located at the distal ends of the metacarpal bones. Accessory epiphyses (which are also known as pseudoepiphyses) can also occasionally be observed at the proximal ends of the metacarpals, usually involving the 2nd metacarpal bone.

name: Crumpled ear
description: Distortion of the course of the normal folds of the ear and the appearance of supernumerary crura and folds.

name: Abnormal response to corticotropin releasing hormone stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to the corticotropin releasing hormone (CRH) stimulation test. Normally,CRH is released by the hypothalamus to induce adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) release by the anterior pituitary. In the stimulation test, CRH is administered intravenously and ACTH and cortisol are measured at intervals.
synonyms: Abnormal response to CRH stimulation test

name: Abnormal 2nd finger morphology
description: An anomaly of the second finger, also known as the index finger.

name: Hydroxyprolinemia
description: An increased concentration of hydroxyproline in the blood.

name: Leukonychia
description: White discoloration of the nails.

name: Periodontitis
description: Inflammation of the periodontium.

name: Abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit
description: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impaired smooth-pursuit eye movements.

name: Symphalangism affecting the phalanges of the hand
description: Fusion of two or more phalangeal bones of the hand.
synonyms: Fused finger bones of the hand
Synostosis involving phalanges of the hand

name: Scotoma
description: A regional and pathological increase of the light detection threshold in any region of the visual field surrounded by a field of normal or relatively well-preserved vision.

name: Tonic seizure
description: A tonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by unilateral or bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening.

name: Erythroid dysplasia
description: Dysplasia in the erythroid lineage, which presents with a variety of morphological changes in the bone marrow, including nuclear budding or irregular nuclear contour in erythroblasts.

name: Abnormality of the adrenal glands
description: Abnormality of the adrenal glands, i.e., of the endocrine glands located at the top of the kindneys.

name: Radial deviation of finger
description: Bending or curvature of a finger toward the radial side (i.e., towards the thumb). The deviation is at the metacarpal-phalangeal joint, and this finding is distinct from clinodactyly.

name: Oral cavity bleeding
description: Recurrent or excessive bleeding from the mouth.

name: Small joint hypermobilty
description:
The capability that a small joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes. Small joints include metacarpophalangeal joints, proximal interphalangeal joints, 
second to fifth metatarsophalangeal joints, and wrists.

name: Malignant genitourinary tract tumor
description: The presence of a malignant neoplasm of the genital system.

name: Hypergranulosis
description: Hypergranulosis is an increased thickness of the stratum granulosum.

name: Abnormal umbilical stump bleeding
description: Abnormal bleeding of the umbilical stump following separation of the cord at approximately 7-10 days after birth.

name: Limited hip extension
description: Limitation of the extension of the hip, i.e., decreased ability to straighten the hip joint and thereby increase the angle between torso and thigh; moving the thigh or top of the pelvis backward.

name: Non-obstructive azoospermia
description: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from a defect in the production of spermatozoa in the testes. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

name: Sloping forehead
description: Inclination of the anterior surface of the forehead from the vertical more than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or apparently excessive posterior sloping of the forehead in a lateral view.

name: Distal sensory impairment
description: An abnormal reduction in sensation in the distal portions of the extremities.
synonyms: Distal sensory impairment in lower limbs
Distal sensory impairment of the lower extremities
Distal sensory loss, upper and lower limbs

name: Gray matter heterotopia
description: Heterotopia or neuronal heterotopia are macroscopic clusters of misplaced neurons (gray matter), most often situated along the ventricular walls or within the subcortical white matter.

name: Cardiac conduction abnormality
description: Any anomaly of the progression of electrical impulses through the heart.

name: Weakness of muscles of respiration
description: Reduced function of the muscles required to generate subatmospheric pressure in the thoracic cavity during breathing: the diaphragm, the external intercostal and the interchondral part of the internal intercostal muscles.

name: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
description: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.

name: Right atrial enlargement
description: Increase in size of the right atrium.

name: Self-biting
description: Habitual biting of one's own body.

name: Prominent antihelix
description: The presence of an abnormally prominent antihelix.

name: Absent cellular immunity
description: Complete inability of T cells to perform their functions in cell-mediated immunity.

name: Cryptorchidism
description: Testis in inguinal canal. That is, absence of one or both testes from the scrotum owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

name: Pseudobulbar signs
description: Pseudobulbar signs result from injury to an upper motor neuron lesion to the corticobulbar pathways in the pyramidal tract. Patients have difficulty chewing, swallowing and demonstrate slurred speech (often initial presentation) as well as abnormal behavioral symptoms such as inappropriate emotional outbursts of uncontrolled laughter or weeping etc.

name: Global brain atrophy
description: Unlocalized atrophy of the brain with decreased total brain matter volume and increased ventricular size.

name: Prominence of the premaxilla
description: Prominent positioning of the premaxilla in relation to the rest of the maxilla, the facial skeleton, or mandible. Not necessarily caused by an increase in size (hypertrophy of) the premaxilla.
synonyms: Anterior position of the primary palate bone
Prominence of the primary palate bone

name: Pain in head and neck region
Abnormality of tibial epiphyses
synonyms: Abnormality of end part of shinbone

name: Abnormal long bone morphology
description: An abnormality of size or shape of the long bones.

name: Renal cyst
description: A fluid filled sac in the kidney.

name: Short nose
description: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations below the mean, or alternatively, an apparently decreased length from the nasal root to the nasal tip.

name: Skin ulcer
description: A discontinuity of the skin exhibiting complete loss of the epidermis and often portions of the dermis and even subcutaneous fat.

name: Shock
description: The state in which profound and widespread reduction of effective tissue perfusion leads first to reversible, and then if prolonged, to irreversible cellular injury.

name: Elevated circulating short-chain acylcarnitine concentration
description: Concentration of short-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Short chain acylcarnitines have between two and five carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C2-C5),

name: Duodenal atresia
description: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the duodenal lumen, that is, an abnormal closure of the duodenum.
synonyms: Absence or narrowing of first part of small bowel

name: ST segment depression
description: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located inferior to the isoelectric line.

name: Scapular winging
description: Abnormal protrusion of the scapula away from the surface of the back.

name: Spastic tetraparesis
description: Spastic weakness affecting all four limbs.

name: Hyperkeratotic papule
description: A circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point that is composed of localized hyperkeratosis (the latter may be demonstrated histopathologically).

name: Impaired collagen-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to collagen or collagen-mimetics as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition collagen or collagen-mimetics.

name: Poor wound healing
description: A reduced ability to heal cutaneous wounds.

name: Disorder of thought content
description: Thought content disorders are characterized by abnormal beliefs and convictions (that are to be assessed given the culture and personal background of the affected individual).

name: Sparse axillary hair
description: Reduced number or density of axillary hair.
synonyms: Sparse scalp, axillary, and pubic hair

name: Enlargement of the costochondral junction
description: Abnormally increased size of the costochondral junctions, which are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

name: Ectopic calcification
description: Deposition of calcium salts in a tissue or location in which calcification does not normally occur.

name: Cytoplasmic antineutrophil antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against proteins predominantly expressed in cytoplasmic granules of neutrophils.

name: Elevated hemoglobin A1c
description: An increased concentration of hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c), which is the product of nonenzymatic attachment of a hexose molecule to the N-terminal amino acid of the hemoglobin molecule. This reaction is dependent on blood glucose concentration, and therefore reflects the mean glucose concentration over the previous 8 to 12 weeks. The HbA1c level provides a better indication of long-term glycemic control than one-time blood or urinary glucose measurements.

name: Abnormal semicircular canal morphology
description: An abnormality of the morphology of the semicircular canal.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the semicircular canal

name: Abnormal cranial nerve physiology
description: A functional abnormality affecting one or more of the cranial nerves, which emerge directly from the brain stem.

name: Abnormal prostate morphology
description: An abnormality of the prostate.

name: Horner syndrome
description: An abnormality resulting from a lesion of the sympathetic nervous system characterized by a combination of unilateral ptosis, miosis, and often ipsilateral hypohidrosis and conjunctival injection.

name: Uveal melanoma
description: A malignant melanoma originating within the eye. The tumor originates from the melanocytes in the uvea (which comprises the iris, ciliary body, and choroid).

name: Imperforate hymen
description: A congenital disorder where the hymen (a membrane that surrounds or partially covers the external vaginal opening) does not have an opening and completely obstructs the vagina.

name: Urinary urgency
description: Urge incontinence is the strong, sudden need to urinate.

name: Cryptozoospermia
description: A type of oligozoospermia in which spermatozoa can be detected in an ejaculate only after centrifugation and inspection of the pellet.

name: Spinal muscular atrophy
description: Muscular weakness and atrophy related to loss of the motor neurons of the spinal cord and brainstem.

name: Lower limb undergrowth
description: Leg shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the lower extremity.
synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the lower limbs

name: Myofiber disarray
description: A nonparallel arrangement of cardiac myocytes.

name: Retinal degeneration
description: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells.
