name: Hyperlipidemia
description: An elevated lipid concentration in the blood.

name: Abnormal enzyme activity in cultured fibroblasts
description: Concentration or activity of an enzyme is above or below the limits of normal in cultured fibroblasts. Fibroblasts are easy to grow in culture and are the main cell type involved in producing extracellular matrix. They are used as a convenient model system for measuring enzyme activity for enzymes that are not expressed in blood cells. Usually, the test is done in fibroblasts for convenience rather than for the investigation of a pathophysiology specific to fibroblasts.

name: Vitreoretinopathy
description: Ocular abnormality characterized by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment.

name: Abnormal bone marrow cell morphology
description: An anomaly of the form or number of cells in the bone marrow.
synonyms: Abnormality of bone marrow cell morphology
Anomaly of the bone marrow cells

name: Cobblestone-like hyperkeratosis
description: The presence of verrucous, cobblestone-like papules and nodules in a region of skin that is said to have an appearance like that of cobblestones.

name: Exercise-induced muscle stiffness
description: A type of muscle stiffness that occurs following physical exertion.

name: Anemia of inadequate production
description: A kind of anemia characterized by inadequate production of erythrocytes.

name: Prominent supraorbital ridges
description: Greater than average forward and/or lateral protrusion of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

name: Multiple mitochondrial DNA deletions
description: The presence of multiple deletions of mitochondrial DNA (mtDNA).

name: Gastroesophageal reflux
description: A condition in which the stomach contents leak backwards from the stomach into the esophagus through the lower esophageal sphincter.

name: Abnormal nasolacrimal system morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasolacrimal drainage system, which serves as a conduit for tear flow from the external eye to the nasal cavity.

name: Melanocytic nevus
description: A oval and round, colored (usually medium-to dark brown, reddish brown, or flesh colored) lesion. Typically, a melanocytic nevus is less than 6 mm in diameter, but may be much smaller or larger.

name: Abnormal foramen magnum morphology
description: Any abnormality of the foramen magnum.

name: Overhanging nasal tip
description: Positioning of the nasal tip inferior to the nasal base.

name: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
description: Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) manifests at age 2-3 years or by first grade at the latest. The main symptoms are distractibility, impulsivity, hyperactivity, and often trouble organizing tasks and projects, difficulty going to sleep, and social problems from being aggressive, loud, or impatient.

name: Palmar pruritus
description: Pruritus is an itch or a sensation that makes a person want to scratch. This term refers to an abnormally increased sensation of itching over the palm(s) of the hand.

name: Nodular changes affecting the eyelids
description: Nodular changes affecting the eyelids may have many different causes such as cystic lesions (chalaziae, hordeolae), lipogranulomas, melanomas, infectious diseases (Molluscum contagiosum) and many more.

name: Vascular dilatation
description: Abnormal outpouching or sac-like dilatation in the wall of an artery, vein or the heart.
synonyms: Wider than typical opening or gap

name: Physical urticaria
description: Urticaria caused by physical agents, such as heat, cold, light, friction.

name: Abnormality of the larynx
description: An abnormality of the larynx.

name: Calvarial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth of the calvaria.

name: Triphalangeal thumb
description: A thumb with three phalanges in a single, proximo-distal axis. Thus, this term applies if the thumb has an accessory phalanx, leading to a digit like appearance of the thumb.

name: Chronic furunculosis
description: A furuncle (boil) is a skin infection involving an entire hair follicle and nearby skin tissue. Chronic furunculosis refers to recurrent episodes of furuncles, often caused by recurrent staphylococcus infection.

name: Second trimester onset
description: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the second trimester, which comprises the range of gestational ages from 14 0/7 weeks to 27 6/7 (inclusive).

name: Tetralogy of Fallot
description: A congenital cardiac malformation comprising pulmonary stenosis, overriding aorta, ventricular septum defect, and right ventricular hypertrophy. The diagnosis of TOF is made if at least three of the four above mentioned features are present.

name: Pelvic kidney
description: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position within the pelvis.

name: Heterochromia iridis
description: Heterochromia iridis is a difference in the color of the iris in the two eyes.

name: Intestinal polyp
description: A discrete abnormal tissue mass that protrudes into the lumen of the intestine and is attached to the intestinal wall either by a stalk, pedunculus, or a broad base.

name: Low insertion of columella
description: Insertion of the posterior columella below the nasal base.

name: Elevated brain choline level by MRS
description: An increase in the level of choline-containing compounds in the brain identified by magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS).

name: Abnormal cerebral ventricle morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the cerebral ventricles.

name: Acromicria
description: Small hands and feet in proportion to the rest of the body.

name: Palate fistula
description: A fistula which connects the oral cavity and the pharyngeal area via the aspects of the soft palate.

name: Abnormal consumption behavior
description: Recurrent abnormal consumption of food, liquids, or objects that could have negative consequences for the individual.

name: Supravalvular aortic stenosis
description: A pathological narrowing in the region above the aortic valve associated with restricted left ventricular outflow.

name: Abnormal intraocular pressure
description: An anomaly in the amount of force per unit area exerted by the intraocular fluid within the eye.

name: Auditory hypersensitivity
description: Hyperresponsive to sound that is abnormal in intensity and/or frequency.

name: Poikilocytosis
description: The presence of abnormally shaped erythrocytes.

name: Craniofacial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth of the craniofacial bones.
synonyms: Excessive bone growth of the skull and face

name: Renovascular hypertension
description: The presence of hypertension related to stenosis of the renal artery.
synonyms: Hypertension due to renal artery hyperplasia

name: Osteosarcoma
description: A malignant bone tumor that usually develops during adolescence and usually affects the long bones including the tibia, femur, and humerus. The typical symptoms of osteosarcoma comprise bone pain, fracture, limitation of motion, and tenderness or swelling at the site of the tumor.

name: Abnormal eating behavior
description: Abnormal eating habits involve excessive or insufficient consumption of food, or any other abnormal pattern of food consumption.

name: Sarcoma
description: A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells. Bone and soft tissue sarcomas are the main types of sarcoma. Sarcoma is usually highly malignant.

name: Lower limb amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy affecting the lower limb.

name: Infantile spasms
description: Infantile spasms represent a subset of "epileptic spasms". Infantile Spasms are epileptic spasms starting in the first year of life (infancy).

name: Absent sternal ossification
description: Lack of formation of mineralized bony tissue of the sternum.

name: Band keratopathy
description: An abnormality of the cornea characterized by the deposition of calcium in a band across the central cornea, leading to decreased vision, foreign body sensation, and ocular irritation.

name: Mitochondrial inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the mitochondrial genome. Because the mitochondrial genome is essentially always maternally inherited, a mitochondrial condition can only be transmitted by females, although the condition can affect both sexes. The proportion of mutant mitochondria can vary (heteroplasmy).

name: Jaw claudication
description: Pain in the jaw or ear induced by chewing or otherwise moving the jaw.

name: Hyperextensibility at elbow
description: The ability of the elbow joint to move beyond its normal range of motion.

name: Decreased circulating vitamin D concentration
description: The concentration of vitamin D in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Basal ganglia calcification
description: The presence of calcium deposition affecting one or more structures of the basal ganglia.

name: Lumbar kyphosis
description: Over curvature of the lumbar region.

name: Natal tooth
description: A tooth present at birth or erupting within the first month of life.

name: Disproportionate short-limb short stature
description: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short limbs but an average-sized trunk.

name: Uveitis
description: Inflammation of one or all portions of the uveal tract.

name: Abnormal nostril morphology
description: Abnormality of the nostril.

name: Nail dystrophy
description: Onychodystrophy (nail dystrophy) refers to nail changes apart from changes of the color (nail dyschromia) and involves partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

name: Hepatic amyloidosis
description: A form of amyloidosis that affects the liver.

name: Ureterocele
description: A ureterocele is a congenital saccular dilatation of the distal segment of the ureter.

name: Abnormal circulating free T3 concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of free triiodothyronine (T3) in the blood circulation. A proportion of T3 is bound to plasma proteins in the blood, including mainly thyroxine binding globulin, transthyretin, and albumin. T3 that is not bound to a protein is referred to as free T3.

name: Lower limb muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles of the legs.

name: Decreased skull ossification
description: A reduction in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

name: Total ophthalmoplegia
description: Paralysis of both the extrinsic and intrinsic ocular muscles.

name: Chronic cough
description: A persistent cough, defined as a cough lasting longer than eight weeks in adults or longer than four weeks in children.

name: Dyskinesia
description: A movement disorder which consists of effects including diminished voluntary movements and the presence of involuntary movements.

name: Ocular pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the eye.

name: Abnormality of thrombocytes
description: An abnormality of platelets.

name: Pyoderma
description: Any manifestation of a skin disease associated with the production of pus.

name: Pineal cyst
description: A glial uniloculated or multiloculated fluid-filled sac that either reside within or completely replace the pineal gland.

name: Abnormality of the temporomandibular joint
description: An anomaly of the temporomandibular joint.

name: Abnormal subungual morphology
description: A lesion located beneath a fingernail or toenail.

name: Limb undergrowth
description: Limb shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the extremities.
synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the extremities

name: Opportunistic infection
description: An infection that is caused by a pathogen that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such pathogens take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

name: Focal tonic seizure
description: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained increase in muscle contraction, lasting a few seconds to minutes.

name: Abnormal stapes morphology
description: An abnormality of the stapes, a stirrup-shaped ossicle in the middle ear.

name: Congenital posterior urethral valve
description: A developmental defect resulting in an obstructing membrane in the posterior male urethra.

name: Gastrointestinal inflammation
description: Inflammation of the alimentary part of the gastrointestinal system.

name: Abnormal cranial nerve morphology
description: Structural abnormality affecting one or more of the cranial nerves, which emerge directly from the brain stem.

name: Abnormal delayed hypersensitivity skin test
description: Delay in cutaneous immune reaction to specific antigens mediated not by antibodies but by cells. The delayed hypersensitivity test is an immune function test measuring the presence of activated T cells that recognize a specific antigen and is performed by injecting a small amount of the antigen into the skin. The area of the injection is examined 48-72 hours thereafter.

name: Abnormal bronchoalveolar lavage fluid morphology
description: Abnormal type or counts of nucleated immune cells and acellular components in bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid. BAL us performed with a fiberoptic bronchoscope in the wedged position within a selected bronchopulmonary segment. BAL is commonly used to inform the differential diagnosis of interstitial lung disease or to monitor therapeutic interventions.

name: Renal corticomedullary cysts
description: The presence of multiple cysts at the border between the renal cortex and medulla.

name: Acromesomelia
description: Small hands and feet.

name: Facial capillary hemangioma
description: Hemangioma, a benign tumor of the vascular endothelial cells with small endothelial spaces, occurring in the face.

name: Delayed CNS myelination
description: Delayed myelination in the central nervous system.
synonyms: Delay in central nervous system myelination

name: Osteomalacia
description: Osteomalacia is a general term for bone weakness owing to a defect in mineralization of the protein framework known as osteoid. This defective mineralization is mainly caused by lack in vitamin D. Osteomalacia in children is known as rickets.

name: Involuntary vocalization
description: Production of sound done without will or conscious control. Involuntary vocalizations include tics, stereotypies vocalizations as part of dystonia or chorea, continuous vocalizing behaviors such as groaning or grunting, pathological laughter and crying, and others. These vocalizations are not recognized as socially or culturally appropriate.

name: Facial diplegia
description: Facial diplegia refers to bilateral facial palsy (bilateral facial palsy is much rarer than unilateral facial palsy).

name: Polyclonal elevation of IgM
description: A heterogeneous increase in IgM immunoglobulins characterized by a diffuse band on serum electrophoresis.

name: Sparse eyelashes
description: Decreased density/number of eyelashes.

name: Cutaneous photosensitivity
description: An increased sensitivity of the skin to light. Photosensitivity may result in a rash upon exposure to the sun (which is known as photodermatosis). Photosensitivity can be diagnosed by phototests in which light is shone on small areas of skin.

name: Cystathioninemia
description: An increased concentration of cystathionine in the blood.

name: Impulsivity
description: Acting on the spur of the moment or on a momentary basis without consideration of outcomes; having difficulty establishing or following plans; experiencing a sense of urgency and engaging in behavior that is uninhibited, cannot be inhibited, and is uncontrolled. The possibility of repression is inconceivable.

name: Hypoventilation
description: A reduction in the amount of air transported into the pulmonary alveoli by breathing, leading to hypercapnia (increase in the partial pressure of carbon dioxide).

name: Anhidrosis
description: Inability to sweat.

name: Abnormal hair whorl
description: An abnormal hair whorl (that is, a patch of hair growing in the opposite direction of the rest of the hair).

name: Abnormal circulating carbohydrate concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of a carbohydrate in the blood circulation.

name: Recurrent joint dislocation
description: Dislocation of a given joint repeated times.

name: Flexion contracture of the 2nd finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 2nd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 2nd finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Aplasia of metacarpal bones
description: Developmental defect associated with absence of one or more metacarpal bones.

name: Carpal bone hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of one or more carpal bones.

name: Corpus callosum atrophy
description: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the corpus callosum.

name: Autism
description: Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impaired social interaction and communication, and by restricted and repetitive behavior. Autism begins in childhood. It is marked by the presence of markedly abnormal or impaired development in social interaction and communication and a markedly restricted repertoire of activity and interest. Manifestations of the disorder vary greatly depending on the developmental level and chronological age of the individual (DSM-IV).

name: Delayed proximal femoral epiphyseal ossification
description: Developmental delay of ossification of the proximal epiphysis of the femur.
synonyms: Delayed ossification of the proximal femoral epiphysis

name: Cerebral infarct
description: A necrotic lesion in the cerebrum resulting from a sudden insufficiency of arterial or venous blood supply due to emboli, thrombi or mechanical factors.

name: Agenesis of corpus callosum
description: Absence of the corpus callosum as a result of the failure of the corpus callosum to develop, which can be the result of a failure in any one of the multiple steps of callosal development including cellular proliferation and migration, axonal growth or glial patterning at the midline.

name: Bladder neoplasm
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary bladder.

name: Urinary tract neoplasm
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the urinary system.

name: Rod-cone dystrophy
description: An inherited retinal disease subtype in which the rod photoreceptors appear to be more severely affected than the cone photoreceptors. Typical presentation is with nyctalopia (due to rod dysfunction) followed by loss of mid-peripheral field of vision, which gradually extends and leaves many patients with a small central island of vision due to the preservation of macular cones.

name: Decreased adipose tissue
description: The amount of adipose tissue (fat) in the body or a part of the body is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Abnormal 3rd finger phalanx morphology
description: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd (middle) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the middle finger bones
Abnormality of the phalanges of the 3rd finger

name: Decreased nasal nitric oxide
description: Reduced level of nasal nitric oxide (nNO). Current American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society (ATS/ERS) guidelines for nNO measurements recommend air aspiration via a nasal probe while the subject exhales through the mouth against resistance in order to maintain velum closure.

name: Interictal EEG abnormality
description: Interictal refers to a period of time between epileptic seizures. Electroencephalographic (EEG) patterns are important in the differential diagnosis of epilepsy, and the EEG is almost always abnormal during a seizure. Some persons with seizures may show EEG abnormalities between seizures, while others do not. In some cases, multiple interictal EEGs must be recorded before an abnormality is observed. In most cases the electrographic pattern of seizure onset is completely different from the activity recorded during interictal discharge.

name: Prenatal movement abnormality
description: An abnormality of fetal movement.

name: Proximal amyotrophy
description: Amyotrophy (muscular atrophy) affecting the proximal musculature.
synonyms: Wasting of muscles near the body

name: Posterior plagiocephaly
description: Asymmetry of the posterior part of the skull.

name: Abnormal size of the dental root
Dermoid cyst
description: A congenital subcutaneous cyst that arises from entrapment of skin along the lines of embryonic fusion. In contrast to epidermal cysts, dermoid cysts tend to contain various adnexal structures such as hair, sebaceous, eccrine or apocrine glands. Dermoid cysts are present at birth, and are indolent, firm, deep, subcutaneous nodules. They are often located on the head and neck, and rarely in the anogenital area. Dermoid cysts are slowly progressive and can grow to a size of 1 to 4 cm.

name: Diaphragmatic eventration
description: A congenital failure of muscular development of part or all of one or both hemidiaphragms, resulting in superior displacement of abdominal viscera and altered lung development.

name: Single ventricle
description: The presence of only one working lower chamber in the heart, usually with a virtual absence of the ventricular septum and usually present in conjunction with double inlet left or right ventricle.

name: Gastritis
description: The presence of inflammation of the gastric mucous membrane.

name: Calvarial osteosclerosis
description: An increase in bone density affecting the calvaria (roof of the skull).

name: Preauricular skin tag
description: A rudimentary tag of skin often containing ear tissue including a core of cartilage and located just anterior to the auricle (outer part of the ear).
synonyms: Skin tag in front of the ear
Skin tag on the posterior cheek

name: Motor deterioration
description: Loss of previously present motor (i.e., movement) abilities.

name: Abnormality of blood volume homeostasis
description: An abnormality in the amount of volume occupied by intravascular blood.

name: Papilledema
description: Papilledema refers to edema (swelling) of the optic disc secondary to any factor which increases cerebral spinal fluid pressure.

name: Abnormal diminished volition
description: A reduction in willful and motivated goal-directed behavior that is considered the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action.

name: Hypoplasia of the olfactory bulb
description: Underdevelopment of the olfactory bulb.

name: Gingival bleeding
description: Hemorrhage affecting the gingiva.

name: Craniofacial osteosclerosis
description: Abnormally increased density of craniofacial bone tissue.

name: Diastasis recti
description: A separation of the rectus abdominis muscle into right and left halves (which are normally joined at the midline at the linea alba).
synonyms: Gap between large left and right abdominal muscles

name: Abnormal flash visual evoked potentials
description: Anomaly of the visual evoked potentials elicited by a flash stimulus, generally a flash of light subtending an angle of at least 20 degrees of the visual field and presented in a dimly lit room.

name: Abnormal putamen morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the putamen, a brain nucleus which together with the caudate nucleus and fundus striati makes up the striatum.

name: Anterior pituitary hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the anterior pituitary gland.

name: Abnormal hepatic glycogen storage
description: Change in normal glycogen storage content.

name: EEG with frontal epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the frontal region.

name: Increased circulating interleukin 6 concentration
description: The concentration of interleukin-6 in the blood circulation is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Absent septum pellucidum
description: Absence of the septum pellucidum (meaning translucent wall in Latin - SP), also known as the ventricle of Sylvius. The septum pellucidum is a thin, triangular double membrane separating the frontal horns of the right and left lateral ventricles of the brain. It extends between the anterior portion of the corpus callosum, and the body of the fornix and its width varies from 1.5 to 3.0 mm.

name: Astrocytosis
description: Proliferation of astrocytes in the area of a lesion of the central nervous system.

name: Stomatocytosis
description: The presence of erythrocytes with a mouth-shaped (stoma) area of central pallor on peripheral blood smear.

name: Myoclonic status epilepticus
description: A type of motor status epilepticus with repeating bilateral sudden brief (less than 100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography.

name: Macrocephaly
description: Occipitofrontal (head) circumference greater than 97th centile compared to appropriate, age matched, sex-matched normal standards. Alternatively, a apparently increased size of the cranium.

name: Leukodystrophy
description: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes. Symmetric white matter involvement at MRI is a typical finding in patients with leukodystrophies.
synonyms: Degeneration of white matter of brain

name: Abnormal circulating follicle-stimulating hormone concentration
description: An anomaly of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

name: Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone concentration
description: A reduction of the circulating level of follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).
synonyms: Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone level

name: Impaired ristocetin-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to ristocetin as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ristocetin.

name: Fragmented epiphyses
description: Fragmented appearance of the epiphyses.

name: Joint hypermobility
description: The capability that a joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes.
synonyms: Joints move beyond expected range of motion

name: Abnormal CSF protein concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal range of a protein concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Lower extremity joint dislocation
description: Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the lower extremity (leg).

name: Aplasia cutis congenita over the scalp vertex
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp vertex, often just lateral to the midline.

name: Abnormality of acid-base homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the balance or maintenance of the balance of acids and bases in bodily fluids, resulting in an abnormal pH.

name: Abnormality of the pulmonary vasculature
synonyms: Abnormality of the lung blood vessels

name: Frontotemporal cerebral atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting, decrease in size of cells or tissue) affecting the frontotemporal cerebrum.

name: Abnormal circulating androgen level
description: An anomaly in the blood concentration of an androgen, that is, of a steroid hormone that controls development and maintenance of masculine characteristics. The androgens include testosterone and Dehydroepiandrosterone.

name: Central scotoma
description: An area of depressed vision located at the point of fixation and that interferes with central vision.
synonyms: Blind spot located at fixation point

name: Hypnopompic hallucination
description: Hallucinations occurring during the transition from sleep to wakefulness.

name: Focal myoclonic seizure
description: A type of focal motor seizure characterized by sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction(s) of muscles(s) or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

name: Hyperglycinuria
description: An increased concentration of glycine in the urine.

name: Non-infectious meningitis
description: Inflammation of the layers of tissue that cover the brain and spinal cord (meninges) and of the fluid-filled space between the meninges (subarachnoid space) when it is caused by disorders that are not infections or by drugs or vaccines.

name: Functional abnormality of the inner ear
description: An abnormality of the function of the inner ear.
synonyms: Functional abnormality of the inner ear

name: Abnormal eyelid physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of the eyelid.

name: Abnormal Z disk morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the Z disk, which is the platelike region of a muscle sarcomere to which the plus ends of actin filaments are attached.

name: Moon facies
description: A rounded, puffy face with fat deposits in the temporal fossa and cheeks, a double chin.

name: Chronic sinusitis
description: A chronic form of sinusitis.

name: Broad distal phalanx of the toes
description: Increased width of the distal phalanx of toe of one or more toes.
synonyms: Broad outermost bone of the toe
Wide outermost bone of the toe

name: Decreased circulating immunoglobulin concentration
description: An abnormally decreased level of immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Death in adulthood
description: Cessation of life at the age of 16 years or later.

name: Abnormal oral glucose tolerance
description: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral administration of glucose.

name: Bundle branch block
description: Block of conduction of electrical impulses along the Bundle of His or along one of its bundle branches.

name: Dermal atrophy
description: Partial or complete wasting (atrophy) of the skin.

name: Hypothermia
description: Reduced body temperature due to failed thermoregulation.

name: Abnormal endometrium morphology
description: An anomaly of the inner mucous membrane of the uterus.

name: Abnormal urine protein level
description: Any deviation of the concentration of one or more proteins in the urine.

name: Abnormal epiphysis morphology of the phalanges of the hand
description: Abnormality of one or all of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand. Note that this includes the epiphysis of the 1st metacarpal. In contrast to the metacarpals 2-5, the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5 (whereas the proximal phalanx of the thumb is equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits).

name: Pain insensitivity
description: Inability to perceive painful stimuli.

name: Large posterior fontanelle
description: An enlargement of the posterior fontanelle relative to age-dependent norms.

name: Sparse or absent eyelashes
synonyms: Partial to total absence of eyelashes

name: Abnormal earlobe morphology
description: An abnormality of the lobule of pinna.

name: Microvesicular hepatic steatosis
description: A form of hepatic steatosis characterized by the presence of small, lipid-laden vesicles in the affected hepatocytes.

name: Limited knee flexion
description: Reduced ability to flex (bend) the knee joint.

name: Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return
description: A form of anomalous pulmonary venous return in which not all pulmonary veins drain abnormally. Partial anomalous pulmonary venous return frequently involves one or both of the veins from one lung.

name: Abnormal liver parenchyma morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the liver located predominantly in the hepatocytes as opposed to stromal cells.

name: Ventral hernia
description: Ventral hernia refers to a condition in which abdominal contents protrude through a weakened portion of the abdominal wall.

name: Prominent nose
description: Distance between subnasale and pronasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased anterior protrusion of the nasal tip.

name: Gingival overgrowth
description: Hyperplasia of the gingiva (that is, a thickening of the soft tissue overlying the alveolar ridge. The degree of thickening ranges from involvement of the interdental papillae alone to gingival overgrowth covering the entire tooth crown.

name: Arteriosclerosis
description: Sclerosis (hardening) of the arteries with increased thickness of the wall of arteries as well as increased stiffness and a loss of elasticity.

name: Asterixis
description: A clinical sign indicating a lapse of posture and is usually manifest by a bilateral flapping tremor at the wrist, metacarpophalangeal, and hip joints.

name: Abnormal neutrophil morphology
description: An abnormal form or size of neutrophils.

name: Pancreatic calcification
description: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition lesions in the pancreas.

name: Abnormal circulating calcium-phosphate regulating hormone concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a hormone that is involved in the regulation of phosphate and calcium.
synonyms: Abnormal Ca2+ PO4 regulating hormone level

name: Degeneration of the lateral corticospinal tracts
description: Deterioration of the tissues of the lateral corticospinal tracts.

name: Subretinal deposits
description: Deposits accumulating between the outer retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Abnormal lymphatic vessel morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the vessel that contains or conveys lymph fluid.

name: Generalized-onset motor seizure
description: A generalized motor seizure is a type of generalized-onset seizure with predominantly motor (involving musculature) signs. The motor event could consist of an increase (positive) or decrease (negative) in muscle contraction to produce a movement.

name: Bladder diverticulum
description: Diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

name: Reduced renal corticomedullary differentiation
description: Reduced differentiation between renal cortex and medulla on diagnostic imaging.
synonyms: Loss of definition of corticomedullary differentiation

name: Abnormal leukocyte count
description: Number of leukocytes per volume of blood beyond normal limits.

name: Generalized hypopigmentation of hair
description: Reduced pigmentation of hair diffusely.

name: Enuresis
description: Lack of the ability to control the urinary bladder leading to involuntary urination at an age where control of the bladder should already be possible.

name: Sclerosis of hand bone
description: Osteosclerosis affecting one or more bones of the hand.
synonyms: Increased bone density in hand bone
Increased bone density in hand bones

name: Thyroid carcinoma
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Vocal cord paralysis
description: A loss of the ability to move the vocal folds.

name: Double aortic arch
description: A conenital abnormality of the aortic arch in which the two embryonic aortc arches form a vascular ring that surrounds the trachea or esophagus and then join to form the descending aorta. Double aortic arch can cause symptoms because of compression of the esophagus (dysphagia, cyanosis while eating) or trachea (stridor).

name: Partial duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.
synonyms: Bifid terminal phalanges of the hand
Partial duplication of the outermost bone of the hand

name: Clinodactyly
description: An angulation of a digit at an interphalangeal joint in the plane of the palm (finger) or sole (toe).

name: Deficit in grammar
description: Deficit in grammar, including syntax and morphology.

name: Abnormal liver morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the bile-secreting organ that is important for detoxification, for fat, carbohydrate, and protein metabolism, and for glycogen storage.

name: Eyelid coloboma
description: A short discontinuity of the margin of the lower or upper eyelid.
synonyms: Full thickness defect of the eyelid

name: Handgrip myotonia
description: Difficulty releasing one's grip associated with prolonged first handgrip relaxation times.

name: Recurrent upper and lower respiratory tract infections
description: Increased susceptibility to upper and lower respiratory tract infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of upper and lower respiratory tract infections.

name: Impaired vibration sensation at ankles
description: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration at the ankles. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to the malleoli of the ankles.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex IV
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex IV, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Limitation of joint mobility
description: A reduction in the freedom of movement of one or more joints.

name: Abnormality of neuronal migration
description: An abnormality resulting from an anomaly of neuronal migration, i.e., of the process by which neurons travel from their origin to their final position in the brain.

name: Gonadal neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a gonad.

name: Abnormality of the pylorus
description: An abnormality of the pylorus.

name: Decreased naive T cell proportion
description: An abnormally decreased proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: Decreased proportion of naive T cells
Decreased proportion of naive thymus-derived, alpha-beta T cells
Reduced proportion of naive T cells

name: Severe combined immunodeficiency
description: A type of primary immune deficiency that is characterized by a more severe defect in both the T- and B-lymphocyte systems.

name: Primitive reflex
description: The primitive reflexes are a group of behavioral motor responses which are found in normal early development, are subsequently inhibited, but may be released from inhibition by cerebral, usually frontal, damage. They are thus part of a broader group of reflexes which reflect release phenomena, such as exaggerated stretch reflexes and extensor plantars. They do however involve more complex motor responses than such simple stretch reflexes, and are often a normal feature in the neonate or infant.

name: Large for gestational age
description: The term large for gestational age applies to babies whose birth weight lies above the 90th percentile for that gestational age.

name: Absent thumb
description: Absent thumb, i.e., the absence of both phalanges of a thumb and the associated soft tissues.

name: Limb ataxia
description: A kind of ataxia that affects movements of the extremities.

name: Abnormal nervous system electrophysiology
description: An abnormality of the function of the electrical signals with which nerve cells communicate with each other or with muscles as measured by electrophysiological investigations.

name: Focal T2 hyperintense basal ganglia lesion
description: A lighter than expected T2 signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia. This term refers to a localized hyperintensity affecting a particular region of the basal ganglia.
synonyms: Hyperintense lesions in the basal ganglia on MRI

name: Mydriasis
description: Abnormal dilatation of the iris.

name: Restrictive ventilatory defect
description: A functional defect characterized by reduced total lung capacity (TLC) not associated with abnormalities of expiratory airflow or airway resistance. Spirometrically, a restrictive defect is defined as FEV1 (forced expiratory volume in 1 second) and FVC (forced vital capacity) less than 80 per cent. Restrictive lung disease may be caused by alterations in lung parenchyma or because of a disease of the pleura, chest wall, or neuromuscular apparatus.
synonyms: Restrictive deficit on pulmonary function testing
Restrictive deficit on pulmonary function tests
Stiff lung or chest wall causing decreased lung volume

name: Delayed ability to sit
description: A failure to achieve the ability to sit at an appropriate developmental stage. Most children sit with support at 6 months of age and sit steadily without support at 9 months of age.

name: Pulmonary artery aneurysm
description: An aneurysm (severe localized balloon-like outward bulging) in the pulmonary artery.

name: Abnormal cheek morphology
description: An abnormality of the cheek- one of two bilateral soft tissue facial structures in the region of the face inferior to the eyes and between the nose and the ear. "Buccal" means relating to the cheek. The cheek is part of the midface

name: Percussion myotonia
description: A localized myotonic contraction in a muscle in reaction to percussion (tapping with the examiner's finger, a rubber percussion hammer, or a similar object).
synonyms: Transient swelling of muscle induced by percussion

name: Heart block
description: Impaired conduction of cardiac impulse occurring anywhere along the conduction pathway.

name: Abnormal judgment
description: Beliefs that deviate from what is considered rational or within the range of normal human judgment and belief formation.

name: Hypoplasia of teeth
description: Developmental hypoplasia of teeth.

name: Chordee
description: Ventral (i.e., downward), lateral, or ventrolateral curvature of the shaft and glans penis of more than 30 degrees.

name: Abnormality of the axillary hair
description: Abnormality of the growth of the axillary hair. Axillary hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

name: Myocardial infarction
description: Necrosis of the myocardium caused by an obstruction of the blood supply to the heart and often associated with chest pain, shortness of breath, palpitations, and anxiety as well as characteristic EKG findings and elevation of serum markers including creatine kinase-MB fraction and troponin.

name: Spinal cord tumor
description: A neoplasm affecting the spinal cord.

name: Abnormality of retinal pigmentation
synonyms: Abnormality of the retinal pigment epithelium

name: Type 2 muscle fiber atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting) affecting primary type 2 muscle fibers. This feature in general can only be observed on muscle biopsy.

name: Abnormal number of permanent teeth
description: The presence of an altered number of of permanent teeth.

name: Neoplasm of the tongue
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the tongue.

name: Abnormal skin morphology of the palm
description: An abnormality of the skin of the palm, that is, the skin of the front of the hand.

name: Cardiac amyloidosis
description: Extracellular deposition in cardiac tissue of a proteinaceous material that, when stained with Congo red, demonstrates apple-green birefringence under polarized light and that has a distinct color when stained with sulfated Alcian blue. Viewed with electron microscopy, the amyloid deposits are seen to be composed of a beta-sheet fibrillar material. These nonbranching fibrils have a diameter of 7.5 to 10 nm and are the result of protein misfolding.

name: Abnormality of skull ossification
description: An abnormality of the process of ossification of the skull.
synonyms: Abnormality of bone calcification of calvarium
Abnormality of bone calcification of cranium
Abnormality of bone calcification of skull
Abnormality of bone formation of calvarium
Abnormality of bone formation of cranium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of calvarium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of cranium
Abnormality of bone mineralization of skull

name: Increased vertebral height
description: Increased top to bottom height of vertebral bodies.

name: X-linked recessive inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for recessive traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked recessive disorders manifest in males (who have one copy of the X chromosome and are thus hemizygotes), but generally not in female heterozygotes who have one mutant and one normal allele.

name: Calvarial skull defect
description: A localized defect in the bone of the skull resulting from abnormal embryological development. The defect is covered by normal skin. In some cases, skull x-rays have shown underlying lytic bone lesions which have closed before the age of one year.

name: Abnormal glomerular mesangial cellularity
description: Abnormal number of its constituent cells of the mesangium of the glomerulus of the kidney.

name: Crossed fused renal ectopia
description: A developmental anomaly in which the kidneys are fused and localized on the same side of the midline. This anomaly is thought to result from disruption of the normal embryologic migration of the kidneys.

name: Bilateral renal agenesis
description: A bilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

name: Orthostatic hypotension due to autonomic dysfunction
Abnormal circulating lipid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a lipid in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced factor XII activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XII. Factor XII (fXII) is part of the intrinsic coagulation pathway and binds to exposed collagen at site of vessel wall injury, activated by high-MW kininogen and kallikrein, thereby initiating the coagulation cascade.

name: Abnormality of foveal pigmentation
description: An anomaly of the pigmentation in the fovea centralis.

name: Abnormal urine alpha-ketoglutarate concentration
description: A deviation from normal of the concentration of 2-oxoglutaric acid in the urine.
synonyms: Abnormality of urine alpha ketoglutarate concentration

name: Hypertriglyceridemia
description: An abnormal increase in the level of triglycerides in the blood.

name: Clinodactyly of the 5th toe
description: Bending or curvature of a fifth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Microcornea
description: A congenital abnormality of the cornea in which the cornea and the anterior segment of the eye are smaller than normal. The horizontal diameter of the cornea does not reach 10 mm even in adulthood.
synonyms: Cornea of eye less than 10mm in diameter

name: Erythema nodosum
description: An erythematous eruption commonly associated with drug reactions or infection and characterized by inflammatory nodules that are usually tender, multiple, and bilateral.

name: Hypokalemia
description: An abnormally decreased potassium concentration in the blood.

name: BCGosis
description: Distant, or disseminated infection with Bacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination associated with failure to contain thebacillus Calmette-Guerin (BCG) following vaccination leading to spread of BCG to many sites in the body. The tuberculosis vaccine BCG contains live attenuated Mycobacterium bovis.

name: Galactosuria
description: Elevated concentration of galactose in the urine.

name: Endocardial fibroelastosis
description: Diffuse thickening of the ventricular endocardium and by associated myocardial dysfunction

name: Impaired temperature sensation
description: A reduced ability to discriminate between different temperatures.

name: Polyhydramnios
description: The presence of excess amniotic fluid in the uterus during pregnancy.

name: Decreased circulating iron concentration
description: The concentration of iron in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal.

name: Bone marrow hypocellularity
description: A reduced number of hematopoietic cells present in the bone marrow relative to marrow fat.

name: Painful subcutaneous lipomas
description: The presence of multiple subcutaneous lipoma that cause pain.
synonyms: Painful noncancerous fat tissue tumor under the skin
Painful noncancerous fat tissue tumour under the skin

name: Respiratory failure
description: A severe form of respiratory insufficiency characterized by inadequate gas exchange such that the levels of oxygen or carbon dioxide cannot be maintained within normal limits.

name: Abnormal limb epiphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of one or more epiphyses of a limb.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of end part of limb bones
Abnormality involving the epiphyses of the limbs

name: Talipes valgus
description: Outward turning of the heel, resulting in clubfoot with the person walking on the inner part of the foot.

name: Attenuation of retinal blood vessels
synonyms: Narrowing of blood vessels in back of eye

name: Hypertrichosis
description: Hypertrichosis is increased hair growth that is abnormal in quantity or location.

name: Psoriasiform dermatitis
description: A skin abnormality characterized by redness and irritation, with thick, red skin that displays flaky, silver-white patches (scales).

name: Abnormal isohemagglutinin level
description: An abnormal level of isohemagglutinin in the blood. An isohemagglutinin refers to the naturally occurring antibodies in the ABO blood group system (i.e., anti-A in a group B person, anti-B in a group A person, and anti-A, anti-B, and anti-A,B in a group O person).
synonyms: Abnormal level of natural antibody to blood group agents
Abnormal natural antibody level to blood group antigens in blood (isohemagglutinin)

name: Tracheobronchomalacia
description: Weakness of the cartilage in the trachea and the bronchi, resulting in a floppy (non-rigid) airway. Affected persons may have difficulties to maintain patency of the airways.

name: Central diabetes insipidus
description: A form of diabetes insipidus related to a failure of vasopressin (AVP) release from the hypothalamus.

name: Cortical sclerosis
description: Sclerosis (abnormal hardening) of cortical bone, characterized by increased radiodensity.

name: Glanular hypospadias
description: A type of hypospadias in which the urethral meatus is located at the head of the penis, but not all the way at the tip.

name: Recurrent aphthous stomatitis
description: Recurrent episodes of ulceration of the oral mucosa, typically presenting as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

name: Diabetes insipidus
description: A state of excessive water intake and hypotonic (dilute) polyuria. Diabetes insipidus may be due to failure of vasopressin (AVP) release (central or neurogenic diabetes insipidus) or to a failure of the kidney to respond to AVP (nephrogenic diabetes insipidus).

name: Respiratory tract infection
description: An infection of the upper or lower respiratory tract.

name: Increased urinary potassium
description: An increased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

name: Agitation
description: A state of excessive motor activity that is associated with mental distress or a feeling of substantial unease or inner tension. Distinguished from restlessness by the increased level of emotional distress and negative intensity of the experience. Agitation has a significant level of physical activity that is typically threatening to the self or others.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the hallux
synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost bone of the big toe

name: Z-band streaming
description: Streaming or smearing of the Z band, which is then no longer confined to a narrow zone which bisects the I band. The Z disk may extend across the I band or the entire sarcomere in a zigzag manner. Focal thickening, smudging, and blurring of the Z band takes place concurrently. Myofibrillar disorganization is a frequent but not invariable accompanying change.

name: Hypoplasia of the ventral pons
description: Underdevelopment of the ventral portion of the pons.

name: Horizontal ribs
description: A horizontal (flat) conformation of the ribs, the long curved bones that form the rib cage and normally progressively oblique (slanted) from ribs 1 through 9, then less slanted through rib 12.

name: Abnormal large intestine morphology
description: Any abnormality of the large intestine.

name: Depressed nasal tip
description: Decreased distance from the nasal tip to the nasal base.

name: Equinus calcaneus
description: Abnormal plantar flexion of the calcaneus relative to the longitudinal axis of the tibia. This results in the angle between the long axis of the tibia and the long axis of the heel bone (calcaneus) being greater than 90 degrees.

name: Hypoplasia of the radius
description: Underdevelopment of the radius.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber merosin expression
description: An anomalous amount of merosin in muscle fibers. Merosin is a basement membrane-associated protein found in placenta, striated muscle, and peripheral nerve.

name: Abnormal venous morphology
description: An anomaly of vein.

name: Hyperopic astigmatism
description: A form of astigmatism in which one meridian is hyperopic while the one at a right angle to it has no refractive error.

name: Hepatosplenomegaly
description: Simultaneous enlargement of the liver and spleen.

name: Abnormal fetal pulmonary morphology
description: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal lungs. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Fair hair
description: A lesser degree of hair pigmentation than would otherwise be expected.

name: Macroglossia
description: Increased length and width of the tongue.

name: Nephronophthisis
description: Presence of cysts at the corticomedullary junction of the kidney in combination with tubulointerstitial fibrosis.

name: Impaired ADP-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal platelet response to ADP as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of ADP.

name: Shagreen patch
description: A plaque representing a connective-tissue nevus. Connective tissue naevi are uncommon skin lesions that occur when the deeper layers of the skin do not develop correctly or the components of these layers occur in the wrong proportion. Shagreen patches are oval-shaped and nevoid, skin-colored or occasionally pigmented, smooth or crinkled. The word shagreen refers to a type of roughened untanned leather.

name: Abnormal upper limb metaphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of one or more metaphyses of the arms.
synonyms: Abnormality of the wide portion of upper limb bone
Metaphyseal abnormality of the upper limbs

name: Neuronal loss in the cerebral cortex
Poor head control
description: Difficulty to maintain correct position of the head while standing or sitting. Infant head lag is observed when the head seems to flop around or lags posteriorly behind the trunk. Several articles have maintained that head lag should be absent by age 3 to 4 months.

name: Abnormal vagina morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the vagina.

name: Pure red cell aplasia
description: A type of anemia resulting from suppression of erythropoiesis with little or no abnormality of leukocyte or platelet production. Erythroblasts are virtually absent in bone marrow; however, leukocyte and platelet production show little or no reduction.

name: Retinoschisis
description: Splitting of the neuroretinal layers of the retina.

name: Increased LDL cholesterol concentration
description: An elevated concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Congestive heart failure
description: The presence of an abnormality of cardiac function that is responsible for the failure of the heart to pump blood at a rate that is commensurate with the needs of the tissues or a state in which abnormally elevated filling pressures are required for the heart to do so. Heart failure is frequently related to a defect in myocardial contraction.

name: Bicornuate uterus
description: The presence of a bicornuate uterus.

name: Elevated hepatic iron concentration
description: An increased level of iron in liver tissues.

name: Arthrogryposis multiplex congenita
description: Multiple congenital contractures in different body areas.

name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalized onset
description: A bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalized onset is a type of bilateral tonic-clonic seizure characterized by generalized onset; these seizures rapidly engage networks in both hemispheres at the start of the seizure.
synonyms: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure with generalised onset
Generalised tonic-clonic seizure without focal onset
Generalised tonic-clonic seizure without partial onset
Generalised tonic-clonic seizures without focal onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizure without focal onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizure without partial onset
Generalized tonic-clonic seizures without focal onset

name: Peripheral neuropathy
description: Peripheral neuropathy is a general term for any disorder of the peripheral nervous system. The main clinical features used to classify peripheral neuropathy are distribution, type (mainly demyelinating versus mainly axonal), duration, and course.

name: Eccentric visual fixation
description: A uniocular condition in which there is fixation of an object by a point other than the fovea. This point adopts the principal visual direction. The degree of the eccentric fixation is defined by its distance from the fovea in degrees.

name: Lingual dystonia
description: Involuntary protrusions, movements, spams and contortions of the tongue.

name: Azoospermia
description: Absence of any measurable level of sperm,whereby spermatozoa cannot be observed even after centrifugation of the semen pellet.

name: Neurodegeneration
description: Progressive loss of neural cells and tissue.

name: Cardiomyocyte hypertrophy
description: An increase in cell size, enhanced protein synthesis, and heightened organization of the sarcomere within cardiac myocytes.

name: Anterior plagiocephaly
description: Asymmetry of the anterior part of the skull.

name: Retinal exudate
description: Fluid which has escaped from retinal blood vessels with a high concentration of lipid, protein, and cellular debris with a typically bright, reflective, white or cream colored appearance on the surface of the retina.

name: Neoplasm of the endocrine system
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the endocrine system.

name: Osteoarthritis of the small joints of the hand
Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei
description: Hyposegmented (hypolobulated) or bilobed neutrophil nuclei.
synonyms: Hyposegmentation of neutrophil nuclei in peripheral blood

name: Abnormal urine hormone level
description: An abnormal concentration of a hormone in the urine.

name: Deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
description: Displacement of the hand or of fingers of the hand from their normal position.
synonyms: Displaced hand or fingers of the hand

name: Erythroderma
description: An inflammatory exfoliative dermatosis involving nearly all of the surface of the skin. Erythroderma develops suddenly. A patchy erythema may generalize and spread to affect most of the skin. Scaling may appear in 2-6 days and be accompanied by hot, red, dry skin, malaise, and fever.
synonyms: Red scaly skin caused by inflammatory skin disease

name: Patent foramen ovale
description: Failure of the foramen ovale to seal postnatally, leaving a potential conduit between the left and right cardiac atria.

name: Renal dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the kidney.

name: Abnormal circulating metabolite concentration
description: An abnormal level of an analyte measured in the blood.

name: Pulmonary nodule
description: Focal rounded or ovoid opacity, not more than 3 cm in diameter. Pulmonary nodules are typically observed by chest radiography or computer tomography imaging.

name: Abnormal circulating renin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of renin in the blood, a central hormone in the control of blood pressure and various other physiological functions.

name: Abnormal blood vessel morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a blood vessel (artery, arteriole, capillary, venule, or vein).

name: Hypermelanotic macule
description: A hyperpigmented circumscribed area of change in normal skin color without elevation or depression of any size.

name: Focal motor status epilepticus
description: Status epilepticus with focal motor signs originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. Involves musculature in any form. The motor event could consist of an increase (positive) or decrease (negative) in muscle contraction to produce a movement.

name: Arthritis
description: Inflammation of a joint.

name: Brachyturricephaly
description: Abnormal vertical height of the skull and a shortening of its anterior-posterior length, frequently combined with malformations of the occipital region.

name: Impaired pain sensation
description: Reduced ability to perceive painful stimuli.

name: Type I transferrin isoform profile
description: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type I congenital disorder of glycosylation. In the traditional nomenclature for congenital disorders of glycosylation, absence of entire glycans was designated type I, and loss of one or more monosaccharides as type II.
synonyms: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type I pattern
Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type I

name: Cerebral white matter atrophy
description: The presence of atrophy (wasting) of the cerebral white matter.

name: Abnormal eyelash morphology
description: An abnormality of the eyelashes.

name: Glaucoma
description: Glaucoma refers loss of retinal ganglion cells in a characteristic pattern of optic neuropathy usually associated with increased intraocular pressure.

name: Easy fatigability
description: Increased susceptibility to fatigue.

name: Choriocapillaris atrophy
description: Atrophy of the capillary lamina of choroid.

name: Bronchitis
description: Inflammation of the large airways in the lung including any part of the bronchi from the primary bronchi to the tertiary bronchi.

name: Abnormal circulating androstenedione concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of androstenedione in the blood circulation.

name: Reduced protein C activity
description: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein C. Protein C is activated to protein Ca by thrombin bound to thrombomodulin. Activated protein C degrades factors VIIIa and Va.

name: Duodenal adenocarcinoma
description: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the duodenum.

name: Short middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the middle phalanx of the second finger, also known as the index finger.
synonyms: Hypoplastic/small middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Short middle bone of index finger

name: Reduced forced vital capacity
description: An abnormal reduction in the amount of air a person can expel following maximal inspiration.

name: Paroxysmal vertigo
description: Paroxysmal episodes of vertigo.

name: Abnormality of vitamin B12 metabolism
synonyms: Abnormality of the vitamin B12 metabolism

name: Decreased urinary potassium
description: A decreased concentration of potassium(1+) in the urine.

name: Failure to thrive secondary to recurrent infections
description: Insufficient weight gain or inappropriate weight loss for a child, that is attributed to an endogenous recurrent infections.
synonyms: Faltering weight secondary to recurrent infections
Weight faltering secondary to recurrent infections

name: Renal amyloidosis
description: A form of amyloidosis that affects the kidney. On hematoxylin and eosin stain, amyloid is identified as extracellular amorphous material that is lightly eosinophilic. These deposits often stain weakly for periodic acid Schiff (PAS), demonstrate a blue-to-gray hue on the trichrome stain and are typically negative on the Jones methenamine silver (JMS) stain. These tinctorial properties contrast with the histologic appearance of collagen, a major component of basement membranes, mesangial matrix and areas of sclerosis, which demonstrates strong positivity for PAS and JMS (See Figure 1 of PMID:25852856).

name: Ovarian neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the ovary.

name: Optic disc hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the optic disc, that is of the optic nerve head, where ganglion cell axons exit the eye to form the optic nerve.

name: Severe postnatal growth retardation
description: Severely slow or limited growth after birth, being four standard deviations or more below age- and sex-related norms.

name: Premature loss of teeth
description: Exfoliation of a tooth more than 2 SD earlier than the normal age for the deciduous teeth and not related to traume or neglect. Exfoliation of a permanent tooth is per se abnormal.

name: Increased total neutrophil count
description: Abnormal increase of absolute number of neutrophils in the blood, per microliter, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Hypoplastic female external genitalia
description: Underdevelopment of part or all of the female external reproductive organs (which include the mons pubis, labia majora, labia minora, Bartholin glands, and clitoris).

name: Posterior uveitis
description: Inflammation of the uveal tract in which the primary site of inflammation is the retina or choroid.

name: Hip subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of the hip joint, whereby the head of the femur is partially displaced from the socket.

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial ATP synthase complex
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial proton-transporting ATP synthase complex, which makes ATP via oxidative phosphorylation, and is sometimes described as Complex V of the electron transport chain.
synonyms: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex V

name: Synostosis involving bones of the feet
synonyms: Fusion involving the bones of the feet

name: Dysplastic corpus callosum
description: Dysplasia and dysgenesis of the corpus callosum are nonspecific descriptions that imply defective development of the corpus callosum. The term dysplasia is applied when the morphology of the corpus callosum is altered as a congenital trait. For instance, the corpus callosum may be hump-shaped, kinked, or a striped corpus callosum that lacks an anatomically distinct genu and splenium.

name: Retinal neovascularization
description: In wound repair, neovascularization (NV) involves the sprouting of new vessels from pre-existent vessels to repair or replace damaged vessels. In the retina, NV is a response to ischemia. The NV adheres to the inner surface of the retina and outer surface of the vitreous. NV are deficient in tight junctions and hence leak plasma into surrounding tissue including the vitreous. Plasma causes the vitreous gel to degenerate, contract, and eventually collapse which pulls on the retina. Since retinal NV is adherent to both retina and vitreous, as the vitreous contracts the NV may be sheared resulting in vitreous hemorrhage or the NV may remain intact and pull the retina with the vitreous resulting in retinal elevation referred to as traction retinal detachment.

name: Esophageal atresia
description: A developmental defect resulting in complete obliteration of the lumen of the esophagus such that the esophagus ends in a blind pouch rather than connecting to the stomach.
synonyms: Birth defect in which part of esophagus did not develop
Birth defect in which part of oesophagus did not develop

name: Nasal regurgitation
description: Regurgitation of milk through the nose.

name: Finger syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism".

name: Decreased activity of mitochondrial complex I
description: A reduction in the activity of the mitochondrial respiratory chain complex I, which is part of the electron transport chain in mitochondria.

name: Calf muscle pseudohypertrophy
description: Enlargement of the muscles of the calf due to their replacement by connective tissue or fat.

name: Abnormality of nail color
description: An anomaly of the color of the nail.

name: Congenital sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A type of hearing impairment caused by an abnormal functionality of the cochlear nerve with congenital onset.

name: Generalized lymphadenopathy
description: A generalized form of lymphadenopathy.
synonyms: Swollen lymph nodes affecting all regions of the body

name: Limb joint contracture
description: A contracture (chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin) that prevent normal movement of one or more joints of the limbs.

name: Increased urinary cortisol level
description: Abnormally increased concentration of cortisol in the urine.

name: Cirrhosis
description: A chronic disorder of the liver in which liver tissue becomes scarred and is partially replaced by regenerative nodules and fibrotic tissue resulting in loss of liver function.
synonyms: Scar tissue replaces healthy tissue in the liver

name: Severely reduced visual acuity
description: Severe reduction of the ability to see. On the 6m visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 6/60 but at least 3/60. On the 20ft visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 20/200 but at least 20/400. On the decimal visual acuity scale, severe reduction is defined as less than 0.1 but at least 0.05.

name: Atrioventricular canal defect
description: A defect of the atrioventricular septum of the heart.

name: Femoral hernia
description: A hernia which occurs just below the inguinal ligament, where abdominal contents pass through a naturally occurring weakness called the femoral canal.

name: Renal phosphate wasting
description: High urine phosphate in the presence of hypophosphatemia.
synonyms: Decreased tubular maximum for phosphate reabsorption per glomerular filtration rate

name: Sclerosis of skull base
description: Increased bone density of the skull base without significant changes in bony contour.

name: Hypohidrosis
description: Abnormally diminished capacity to sweat.

name: Renal agenesis
description: Agenesis, that is, failure of the kidney to develop during embryogenesis and development.

name: Premature rupture of membranes
description: Premature rupture of membranes (PROM) is a condition which occurs in pregnancy when the amniotic sac ruptures more than an hour before the onset of labor.

name: Premature skin wrinkling
description: The presence of an increased degree of wrinkling (irregular folds and indentations) of the skin as compared with age-related norms.

name: Giant somatosensory evoked potentials
description: An abnormal enlargement (i.e. increase in measured voltage) of somatosensory evoked potentials.

name: Abnormal renal echogenicity
description: Anomalous echogenicity of the kidney on ultrasound examination.

name: Hemorrhage of the eye
description: Bleeding from vessels of the various tissues of the eye.

name: Hip contracture
description: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the hip joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

name: Ascending tubular aorta aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the tubular part of the ascending aorta.
synonyms: Aneurysm of the ascending tubular aorta
Bulging of wall of large artery located above heart

name: Cellular immunodeficiency
description: An immunodeficiency characterized by defective cell-mediated immunity or humoral immunity.

name: Abnormality of coagulation
description: An abnormality of the process of blood coagulation. That is, altered ability or inability of the blood to clot.

name: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia
description: A form of acute leukemia characterized by excess lympoblasts.

name: Abnormal cardiac test
description: Abnormal test result of cardiovascular physiology.

name: Unusual skin infection
description: A type of infection of the skin that can be regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection.

name: Abnormality of the pharynx
description: An anomaly of the pharynx, i.e., of the tubular structure extending from the base of the skull superiorly to the esophageal inlet inferiorly.

name: Drowsiness
description: Abnormal feeling of sleepiness or difficulty staying awake.

name: Torsion dystonia
description: Sustained involuntary muscle contractions that produce twisting and repetitive movements of the body.

name: Oligohydramnios
description: Diminished amniotic fluid volume in pregnancy.

name: Visual loss
description: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain time point in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that).

name: Abnormal thumb morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the first digit of the hand.

name: Nephropathy
description: A nonspecific term referring to disease or damage of the kidneys.

name: Prominent antitragus
description: Increased anterosuperior prominence of the area between the bottom of the incisura and the inner margin of the antihelix.

name: Syringomyelia
description: Dilated, glial-lined cavity in spinal cord. This cavity does not communicate with the central canal, and usually is between the dorsal columns unilaterally or bilaterally along the side of the cord.

name: Abnormal cerebral vascular morphology
description: An anomaly of the cerebral blood vessels.
synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral blood vessels

name: Hypoparathyroidism
description: A condition caused by a deficiency of parathyroid hormone characterized by hypocalcemia and hyperphosphatemia.

name: Abnormality of the dorsal column of the spinal cord
description: An abnormality of the dorsal columns, i.e., of the dorsal portion of the gray substance of the spinal cord. The dorsal column consists of the fasciculus gracilis and fasciculus cuneatus and itself is part of the dorsal funiculus.

name: Glomerulopathy
description: Inflammatory or noninflammatory diseases affecting the glomeruli of the nephron.

name: Osteopetrosis
description: Abnormally increased formation of dense trabecular bone tissue. Despite the increased density of bone tissue, osteopetrotic bones tend to be more fracture-prone than normal.

name: Hemothorax
description: The presence of blood in the pleural space.

name: Cardiac valve calcification
description: Abnormal calcification of a cardiac valve.

name: Soft skin
description: Subjective impression of increased softness upon palpation of the skin.

name: Thrombocytosis
description: Increased numbers of platelets in the peripheral blood.
synonyms: Increased number of platelets in blood

name: Delayed eruption of primary teeth
description: Delayed tooth eruption affecting the primary dentition.

name: Megakaryocytopenia
description: A reduced count of megakaryocytes.

name: Ragged-red muscle fibers
description: An abnormal appearance of muscle fibers observed on muscle biopsy. Ragged red fibers can be visualized with Gomori trichrome staining as irregular and intensely red subsarcolemmal zones, whereas the normal myofibrils are green. The margins of affect fibers appear red and ragged. The ragged-red is due to the accumulation of abnormal mitochondria below the plasma membrane of the muscle fiber, leading to the appearance of a red rim and speckled sarcoplasm.

name: Focal sensory seizure with visual features
description: A seizure characterized by elementary visual hallucinations such as flashing or flickering lights/colors, or other shapes, simple patterns, scotomata, or amaurosis as its first clinical manifestation.

name: Mild myopia
description: A mild form of myopia with up to -3.00 diopters.

name: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract
description: Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract.
synonyms: Recurrent infection of the GI tract
Recurrent infection of the gastrointestinal tract

name: Undulate ribs
description: An abnormally wavy surface or edge of the ribs.

name: Underdeveloped supraorbital ridges
description: Flatness of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.

name: Contracture of the proximal interphalangeal joint of the 5th finger
description: Proximal interphalangeal (PIP) flexion deformity of the little finger. That is, the PIP joint of a little finger is bent (flexed) and cannot be straightened actively or passively. It is thus a chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Retinal perforation
description: A small hole through the whole thickness of the retina.

name: Abnormality of the female genitalia
description: Abnormality of the female genital system.

name: Proximal radio-ulnar synostosis
description: An abnormal osseous union (fusion) between the proximal portions of the radius and the ulna.

name: Clubbing of toes
description: Terminal broadening of the toes (distal phalanges of the toes).

name: Inappropriate behavior
description: An explicit or perceived action, demonstration, conduct, or language (verbal and written) that is contrary to generally accepted norms, rules, procedures, or unacceptable within the context in which it is carried out. Inappropriate behaviors could take place in a sexual or social context and could be aggressive, violent, impulsive, intimidating, or threatening in nature.

name: Abnormality of the epiphyses of the distal phalanx of finger
description: Any anomaly of distal epiphysis of phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the end part of the outermost bone of finger

name: Abnormal nasal base norphology
description: An anomaly of the nasal base, which can be conceived of as an imaginary line between the most lateral points of the external inferior attachments of the alae nasi to the face.

name: Hypoplasia of the odontoid process
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the dens of the axis.

name: Glioma
description: The presence of a glioma, which is a neoplasm of the central nervous system originating from a glial cell (astrocytes or oligodendrocytes).

name: Bowed humerus
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the humerus.
synonyms: Bowed long bone in upper arm

name: Myelodysplasia
description: Clonal hematopoietic stem cell disorders characterized by dysplasia (ineffective production) in one or more hematopoietic cell lineages, leading to anemia and cytopenia.

name: Pili torti
description: Pili (from Latin pilus, hair) torti (from Latin tortus, twisted) refers to short and brittle hairs that appear flattened and twisted when viewed through a microscope.

name: Generalized limb muscle atrophy
