description: Generalized (unlocalized) atrophy affecting muscles of the limbs in both proximal and distal locations.
synonyms: Generalised muscle atrophy, proximal and distal
Generalized muscle atrophy, proximal and distal

name: Conical incisor
description: An abnormal conical morphology of the incisor tooth.

name: Spinal canal stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the spinal canal.

name: Abnormal spinal meningeal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the spinal meninges, the system of membranes (dura mater, the arachnoid mater, and the pia mater) which envelops the spinal cord.

name: Elevated circulating long chain fatty acid concentration
description: Increased concentration of long-chain fatty acids in the blood circulation.

name: Pustule
description: A small elevation of the skin containing cloudy or purulent material usually consisting of necrotic inflammatory cells.

name: Abnormal erythroid lineage cell morphology
description: An anomaly of erythroid lineage cells, that is, of the erythropoietic cells in the lineage leading to and including erythrocytes.
synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the erythroid lineage

name: Keratoacanthoma
description: Keratoacanthoma (KA) is a common benign epithelial tumor that originates from the pilosebaceous glands. In most cases, it is characterized by rapid evolution, followed by spontaneous resolution over 4 to 6 months. KA usually presents as a solitary flesh-coloured nodule with a central keratin plug on the sun-exposed skin of elderly individuals.

name: Abnormal macroscopic urine appearance
description: Anomalous physical appearance (color, cloudiness, clarity) or odor of urine.

name: Recurrent sinopulmonary infections
description: An increased susceptibility to infections involving both the paranasal sinuses and the lungs, as manifested by a history of recurrent sinopulmonary infections.

name: Exstrophy
description: Eversion of a hollow organ and exposure, inside out, and protruded through the abdominal wall.

name: Hitchhiker thumb
description: With the hand relaxed and the thumb in the plane of the palm, the axis of the thumb forms an angle of at least 90 degrees with the long axis of the hand.

name: Abnormal fingertip morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the tip (end) of a finger.

name: Cortical cataract
description: A cataract which affects the layer of the lens surrounding the nucleus, i.e., the lens cortex. It is identified by its unique wedge or spoke appearance.

name: Talipes equinovarus
description: Talipes equinovarus (also called clubfoot) typically has four main components: inversion and adduction of the forefoot; inversion of the heel and hindfoot; equinus (limitation of extension) of the ankle and subtalar joint; and internal rotation of the leg.

name: Decreased circulating methylcobalamin concentration
description: The concentration of methylcobalamin in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal. Methylcobalamin is a form of vitamin B12.

name: Arachnodactyly
description: Abnormally long and slender fingers (spider fingers).

name: Gonadal dysgenesis
description: Gonadal dysgenesis is the name given to any of a multitude of conditions that can cause impaired development of the gonads, i.e., the testes or ovaries, or to the related phenotypic features. The term is to be avoided if possible for new annotations, and more specific terms should be chosen.

name: Increased circulating troponin T concentration
description: An increased concentration of tropnin T in the blood, which is a cardiac regulatory protein that controls the calcium mediated interaction between actin and myosin. Raised cardiac troponin concentrations are now accepted as the standard biochemical marker for the diagnosis of myocardial infarction.
synonyms: Increased troponin T level in blood

name: Renal angiomyolipoma
description: A benign renal neoplasm composed of fat, vascular, and smooth muscle elements.

name: Proptosis
description: An eye that is protruding anterior to the plane of the face to a greater extent than is typical.
synonyms: Anterior bulging of the globe of eye

name: Abnormal circulating C-peptide concentration
description: An anomalous circulating concentration of the connecting (C) peptide, which links the insulin A and B chains in proinsulin, providing thereby a means to promote their efficient folding and assembly in the endoplasmic reticulum during insulin biosynthesis. After cleavage of proinsulin, C-peptide is stored with insulin in the soluble phase of the secretory granules and is subsequently released in equimolar amounts with insulin, providing a useful independent indicator of insulin secretion.

name: EEG with generalized sharp slow waves
description: EEG with generalized sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec followed by a slow wave.
synonyms: EEG with generalised sharp slow waves

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the toes
Atonic seizure
description: Atonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by a sudden loss or diminution of muscle tone without apparent preceding myoclonic or tonic event lasting about 1 to 2 seconds, involving head, trunk, jaw, or limb musculature.

name: Neoplasm of the heart
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the heart.

name: Abnormal size of pituitary gland
description: A deviation from the normal size of the pituitary gland.

name: Abnormality of the wrist
description: Abnormality of the wrist, the structure connecting the hand and the forearm.

name: Pulmonary artery hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the pulmonary artery.

name: Nocturnal lagophthalmos
description: The inability to close the eyelids during sleep.
synonyms: Inability to close the eyelids at night

name: Asymmetry of the ears
description: An asymmetriy, i.e., difference in size, shape or position between the left and right ear.

name: Abnormal ischium morphology
description: An anomaly of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Absence of lymph node germinal center
description: Absence of germinal centers in lymph nodes. Germinal centers are the parts of lymph nodes in which B lymphocytes proliferate, differentiate, mutate through somatic hypermutation and class switch during antibody responses.
synonyms: Absence of lymph node germinal centre

name: Central nervous system cyst
description: A fluid-filled sac (cyst) located within the central nervous system.
synonyms: Cyst of the central nervous system

name: Asthma
description: Asthma is characterized by increased responsiveness of the tracheobronchial tree to multiple stimuli, leading to narrowing of the air passages with resultant dyspnea, cough, and wheezing.

name: Pneumonia
description: Inflammation of any part of the lung parenchyma.

name: Impaired horizontal smooth pursuit
description: An abnormality of ocular smooth pursuit characterized by an impairment of the ability to track horizontally moving objects.

name: Serositis
description: Inflammation in any serous cavity.

name: Congenital nonbullous ichthyosiform erythroderma
description: The term collodion baby applies to newborns who appear to have an extra layer of skin (known as a collodion membrane) that has a collodion-like quality. It is a descriptive term, not a specific diagnosis or disorder (as such, it is a syndrome). Affected babies are born in a collodion membrane, a shiny waxy outer layer to the skin. This is shed 10-14 days after birth, revealing the main symptom of the disease, extensive scaling of the skin caused by hyperkeratosis. With increasing age, the scaling tends to be concentrated around joints in areas such as the groin, the armpits, the inside of the elbow and the neck. The scales often tile the skin and may resemble fish scales.

name: Metaphyseal cupping
description: Metaphyseal cupping refers to an inward bulging of the metaphyseal profile giving the metaphysis a cup-like appearance.

name: Epileptic aura
description: An epileptic aura is a purely subjective clinical manifestation of an epileptic seizure. If an epileptic aura is not followed by loss of awareness or propagation to a bilateral tonic-clonic seizure then it is a type of focal aware non-motor seizure.

name: Short mandibular rami
synonyms: Short body and ramus of mandible

name: Abnormal T cell morphology
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of total or subset T cell count. T cells are commonly characterized as CD3+ lymphocytes, or their subpopulations, in the blood, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group, measured ex vivo. These may include both TCR alpha/beta and gamma/delta T cells.

name: Endocarditis
description: An inflammation of the endocardium, the inner layer of the heart, which usually involves the heart valves.

name: Decreased mean corpuscular volume
description: A reduction from normal of the mean corpuscular volume, or mean cell volume (MCV) of red blood cells (usually defined as an MCV below 80 femtoliters).

name: Increased circulating thyroglobulin concentration
description: An abnormal elevation of the concentration of thyroglobulin, a protein produced in the thyroid gland that acts as a precursor to thyrroid hormones.

name: Blue sclerae
description: An abnormal bluish coloration of the sclera.
synonyms: Blue outer white part of eyeball
Whites of eyes are a bluish-gray color
Whites of eyes are a bluish-gray colour

name: Kyphosis
description: Exaggerated anterior convexity of the thoracic vertebral column.

name: Anophthalmia
description: Absence of the globe or eyeball.

name: Exertional dyspnea
description: Perceived difficulty to breathe that occurs with exercise or exertion and improves with rest.
synonyms: Shortness of breathing upon physical activity

name: Abnormal cardiac exercise stress test
description: Abnormal results of exercise on heart function.

name: Focal autonomic seizure
description: An autonomic seizure is a type of focal non-motor seizure characterized by alteration of autonomic nervous system function as the initial semiological feature.

name: Focal cortical dysplasia type II
description: A type of focal cortical dysplasia that is characterized by disrupted cortical lamination and specific cytological abnormalities.

name: Palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: Abnormal thickening of the skin localized to the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot.
synonyms: Hyperkeratosis of the palms and soles
Thickening of the outer layer of the skin of the palms and soles

name: Short ribs
description: Reduced rib length.

name: Abnormality of the frontal hairline
description: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the forehead, that is, the border between skin on the forehead that has head hair and that does not.
synonyms: Abnormality of hairline at front of head

name: Renal hypoplasia
description: Hypoplasia of the kidney.

name: Abnormal serum bicarbonate concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of bicarbonate, HCO3[-], in the circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
description: Any deviation of the concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood from the normal range.

name: Self-injurious behavior
description: Self-aggression.

name: Overtubulated long bones
description: Overconstriction, or narrowness of the diaphysis and metaphysis of long bones.

name: Hypermetric saccades
description: A saccade that overshoots the target with the dynamic saccade.

name: Abnormal bronchus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the bronchi, i.e., of the airways leading from the trachea to the lungs.

name: Median cleft palate
description: Cleft palate of the midline of the palate.

name: Abnormal circulating inhibin level
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of inhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone.

name: T-cell lymphoma
description: A type of lymphoma that originates in T-cells.

name: Aplasia of the left hemidiaphragm
description: Congenital absence of the left half of the diaphragm.

name: Patchy hypopigmentation of hair
description: Reduced pigmentation of hair in patches.

name: Facial erythema
description: Redness of the skin of the face, caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Chronic myelogenous leukemia
description: A myeloproliferative disorder characterized by increased proliferation of the granulocytic cell line without the loss of their capacity to differentiate.

name: Mandibular prognathia
description: Abnormal prominence of the chin related to increased length of the mandible.

name: Cheilitis
description: Inflammation of the lip.

name: Hyperventilation
description: Hyperventilation refers to an increased pulmonary ventilation rate that is faster than necessary for the exchange of gases. Hyperventilation can result from increased frequency of breathing, an increased tidal volume, or both, and leads to an excess intake of oxygen and the blowing off of carbon dioxide.

name: Varicocele
description: A varicocele is a widening of the veins along the spermatic cord, leading to enlarged, twisted veins in the scrotum, and manifested clinically by a painless testicle lump, scrotal swelling, or bulge in the scrotum.

name: Progressive macrocephaly
description: The progressive development of an abnormally large skull.

name: Generalized hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth over much of the entire body.

name: Recurrent sinusitis
description: A recurrent form of sinusitis.

name: Increased circulating renin concentration
description: An increased level of renin in the blood.

name: Childhood onset
description: Onset of disease at the age of between 1 and 5 years.

name: Abnormal circulating fatty-acid anion concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a fatty acid anion in the blood circulation.

name: Failure to thrive
description: Failure to thrive (FTT) refers to a child whose physical growth is substantially below the norm.

name: Hypodontia
description: The absence of five or less teeth from the normal series by a failure to develop.
synonyms: Failure of development of between one and six teeth
Missing between one and six teeth

name: Prolonged bleeding time
description: Prolongation of the time taken for a standardized skin cut of fixed depth and length to stop bleeding.

name: Cognitive distortion
description: A cognitive distortion is a maladaptive, exaggerated, or irrational thought pattern.

name: Molluscoid pseudotumors
description: Bluish-grey, spongy nodules associated with scars over pressure points and easily traumatized areas like the elbows and knees.

name: Otosclerosis
description: In otosclerosis, a callus of bone accumulates on the stapes creating a partial fixation. This limits the movement of the stapes bone, which results in hearing loss.

name: Spina bifida occulta
description: The closed form of spina bifida with incomplete closure of a vertebral body with intact overlying skin.

name: Abnormal nasal mucus secretion
description: Any deviation from the normal quantity of secretion of nasal mucus, a thick viscous liquid produced by the mucous membranes of the nose.

name: Abnormal gamma-glutamyltransferase level
description: Any deviation from the normal level of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues.

name: Abnormal chorioretinal morphology
description: An abnormality of the choroid and retina.

name: Blue nevus
description: A solitary, bluish, smooth surfaced macule, papule or plaque that is generally round or oval in shape. The histopathology of blue nevi varies by subtype, but general characteristics include a vertical wedge or bulbous shaped proliferation of spindle cells, dendritic melanocytes, and melanophages into a sclerotic dermis or subcutis.

name: Abnormal columella morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the columella.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell physiology
description: Abnormal response of natural killer (NK) cells to stimuli.

name: Morning glory anomaly
description: An abnormality of the optic nerve in which the optic nerve is large and funneled and displays a conical excavation of the optic disc. The optic disc appears dysplastic.

name: Splenic rupture
description: A breach of the capsule of the spleen.

name: Rectal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula affecting the rectum.

name: Abnormality of the diaphragm
description: Any abnormality of the diaphragm, the sheet of skeletal muscle that separates the thoracic cavity from the abdominal cavity.

name: Aplasia of the semicircular canal
description: Absence of the semicircular canal.

name: Spermatogenesis maturation arrest
description: Maturation arrest (MA) is defined as germ cells that fail to complete maturation. Uniform MA is characterized by spermatogenic arrest at the same stage of spermatogenesis throughout the seminiferous tubules. MA is subcategorized into early MA, in which only spermatogonia or spermatocytes are found, and late MA, in which spermatids are detected without spermatozoa.

name: Atrial arrhythmia
description: A type of supraventricular tachycardia in which the atria are the principal site of electrophysiologic disturbance.

name: Generalized lipodystrophy
description: Generalized degenerative changes of the fat tissue.

name: Generalized osteosclerosis
description: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density with generalized involvement of the skeleton.
synonyms: Increased bone density in skeletal bones

name: Trigonocephaly
description: Wedge-shaped, or triangular head, with the apex of the triangle at the midline of the forehead and the base of the triangle at the occiput.

name: Brittle hair
description: Fragile, easily breakable hair, i.e., with reduced tensile strength.

name: Y-linked inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for traits related to a gene encoded on the Y chromosome.

name: Abnormality of macular pigmentation
description: Abnormality of macular or foveal pigmentation.

name: Abnormal U wave
description: An anomaly of the U wave of the electrocardiogram (EKG). The U wave is a small (0.5 mm) deflection immediately following the T wave, usually in the same direction as the T wave. It is best seen in leads V2 and V3.

name: Megalocornea
description: An enlargement of the cornea with normal clarity and function. Megalocornea is diagnosed with a horizontal corneal diameter of 12 mm or more at birth or 13 mm or more after two years of age.

name: Epiblepharon
description: Redundant eyelid skin pressing the eyelashes against the cornea and/or conjunctiva.

name: Reticulocytosis
description: An elevation in the number of reticulocytes (immature erythrocytes) in the peripheral blood circulation.
synonyms: Increased number of immature red blood cells

name: Abnormality of chromosome stability
description: A type of chromosomal aberration characterized by reduced resistance of chromosomes to change or deterioration.

name: Increased theta frequency activity in EEG
description: Increased frequency of theta wave activity in the electroencephalogram. Theta waves have a frequency of 3.5-7.5 Hertz, and are present in very small amounts in healthy waking adult EEGs. Theta activity is normal in small very amounts in the healthy waking adult EEG in a symmetrical distribution.

name: Abnormal pelvis bone ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the bony pelvis.
synonyms: Abnormal ossification involving the bones of the pelvis
Abnormal maturation of the pelvis bone

name: Abnormality of skin physiology
description: Any abnormality of the physiological function of the skin.

name: Histiocytosis
description: An excessive number of histiocytes (tissue macrophages).

name: Migraine
description: Migraine is a chronic neurological disorder characterized by episodic attacks of headache and associated symptoms.

name: Anemia due to reduced life span of red cells
description: A type of anemia related to a reduction in the average life span of red blood cells in the peripheral circulation, which is normally around 120 days.
synonyms: Anaemia due to reduced life span of red cells

name: Conspicuously happy disposition
description: An unusually happy demeanor over time, which can also be observed during inappropriate situations that should, for example, cause distress, fear, or anger.

name: Decreased memory T cell proportion
description: An abnormally reduced proportion of memory T cells compared to the total number of T cells in the blood.
synonyms: Decreased proportion of memory T cells

name: Hyperphenylalaninemia
description: An increased concentration of L-phenylalanine in the blood.

name: Open mouth
description: A facial appearance characterized by a permanently or nearly permanently opened mouth.

name: Chronic hepatitis due to cryptosporidium infection
description: Chronic hepatitis associated with infection by cryptosporidia, as demonstrated (for example) by immunohistochemistry of liver tissue.
synonyms: Hepatitis, chronic, due to cryptosporidium infection

name: Knee clonus
description: Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Knee clonus can be tested by rapidly pushing the patella towards the toes.

name: Cerebral hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the cerebrum.

name: Supraventricular arrhythmia
description: A type of arrhythmia that originates above the ventricles, whereby the electrical impulse propagates down the normal His Purkinje system similar to normal sinus rhythm.

name: Abnormal cochlea morphology
description: An abnormality of the cochlea.

name: Abnormal hypothalamus physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the hypothalamus.

name: Anotia
description: Complete absence of any auricular structures.

name: Elevated circulating phytanic acid concentration
description: An abnormal elevation of phytanic acid.

name: Abnormal metacarpophalangeal joint morphology
description: An anomaly of a metacarpophalangeal joint.

name: Paresthesia
description: Abnormal sensations such as tingling, pricking, or numbness of the skin with no apparent physical cause.

name: Knee joint hypermobility
description: The ability of the knee to move past its normal range of motion, (knee hyperextension is greater than 10 degrees).

name: Odontogenic neoplasm
description: Neoplasm involving odontogenic cells, an odontogenic tumor.

name: Duplication of thumb phalanx
description: Complete or partial duplication of the phalanges of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones (bifid), two separate bones appearing side to side, or completely duplicated phalanges (proximal and distal phalanx of the thumb and/or 1st metacarpal). In contrast to the phalanges of the digits 2-5 (proximal, middle and distal), the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits.
synonyms: Complete/partial duplication of phalanges of the thumb

name: Tricuspid valve prolapse
description: One or more of the leaflets (cusps) of the tricuspid valve bulges back into the right atrium upon contraction of the right ventricle.

name: Hyperkinetic movements
description: Motor hyperactivity with excessive movement of muscles of the body as a whole.

name: Retinal nonattachment
description: Failure of attachment of the retina during development.

name: Hypokinesia
description: Abnormally diminished motor activity. In contrast to paralysis, hypokinesia is not characterized by a lack of motor strength, but rather by a poverty of movement. The typical habitual movements (e.g., folding the arms, crossing the legs) are reduced in frequency.

name: Paranoia
description: The feeling and belief that one is being targeted or is a focus of negative or untoward actions, overt or covert, from others. The affected individual expresses a concern that people are in general against the individual and are engaging in subtle behaviors to make things difficult for them. The origins of such thinking may arise from real events and become amplified over time. Paranoia may also arise in the absence of any action or interaction between the person and their environment.

name: Motor delay
description: A type of Developmental delay characterized by a delay in acquiring motor skills.
synonyms: Delay in development of motor milestones

name: Reduced amplitude of dark-adapted bright flash electroretinogram a-wave
description: An abnormal reduction in the amplitude of the a-wave.

name: Interrupted inferior vena cava with azygous continuation
description: Interrupted inferior vena cava with azygous continuation is the result of connection failure between the right subcardinal vein and the right vitelline vein. Consequently, venous blood from the caudal part of the body reaches the heart via the azygous vein and superior vena cava.

name: Abnormal circulating porphyrin concentration
description: An abnormality in the synthesis or catabolism of heme. Heme is composed of ferrous iron and protoporphyrin IX and is an essential molecule as the prosthetic group of hemeproteins such as hemoglobin, myoglobin, mitochondrial and microsomal cytochromes.

name: Biparietal narrowing
description: A narrowing of the biparietal diameter (i.e., of the transverse distance between the protuberances of the two parietal bones of the skull).

name: Generalized muscle weakness
description: Generalized weakness or decreased strength of the muscles, affecting both distal and proximal musculature.

name: Abnormal hairshaft morphology
description: An abnormal structure of the hairshaft, i.e., of the nongrowing portion of a hair that protrudes from the skin.

name: Insulin-resistant diabetes mellitus
description: A type of diabetes mellitus related not to lack of insulin but rather to lack of response to insulin on the part of the target tissues of insulin such as muscle, fat, and liver cells. This type of diabetes is typically associated with increases both in blood glucose concentrations as well as in fasting and postprandial serum insulin levels.

name: Abnormality of dental color
description: A developmental defect of tooth color.

name: Chronic infection
description: Presence of a protracted or persistent infection by a pathogen potentially related to an underlying abnormality of the immune system that is not able to clear the infection.

name: Anal stenosis
description: Abnormal narrowing of the anal opening.

name: Eczematoid dermatitis
description: Eczema is a form of dermatitis that is characterized by scaly, pruritic, erythematous lesions located on flexural surfaces.

name: Abnormal frontal bone morphology
description: An abnormality of the frontal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the bone of the forehead

name: Acne
description: A skin condition in which there is an increase in sebum secretion by the pilosebaceous apparatus associated with open comedones (blackheads), closed comedones (whiteheads), and pustular nodules (papules, pustules, and cysts).

name: Abnormal circulating free fatty acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a free fatty acid in the blood circulation.
synonyms: Abnormal circulating free fatty acid level

name: Decreased circulating IgG2 concentration
description: A reduction in immunoglobulin levels of the IgG2 subclass in the blood circulation.

name: Flank pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the flank.

name: Abnormal calvaria morphology
description: Abnormality of the morphology (structure) of the calvaria (skullcap), that is, of that part of the skull that is made up of the superior portions of the frontal bone, occipital bone, and parietal bones and covers the cranial cavity that contains the brain.
synonyms: Abnormality of the shape of calvarium

name: Abnormal nasal septum morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasal septum.

name: EMG abnormality
description: Abnormal results of investigations using electromyography (EMG).

name: Fifth finger distal phalanx clinodactyly
description: Bending or curvature of the distal phalanx of little finger in the radial direction (i.e., towards the 4th finger).
synonyms: Curvature of outermost bone of little finger
Curvature of outermost bone of pinkie finger
Curvature of outermost bone of pinky finger

name: Abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials
description: An abnormality of somatosensory evoked potentials (SSEP), i.e., of the electrical signals of sensation going from the body to the brain in response to a defined stimulus. Recording electrodes are placed over the scalp, spine, and peripheral nerves proximal to the stimulation site. Clinical studies generally use electrical stimulation of peripheral nerves to elicit potentials. SSEP testing determines whether peripheral sensory nerves are able to transmit sensory information like pain, temperature, and touch to the brain. Abnormal SSEPs can result from dysfunction at the level of the peripheral nerve, plexus, spinal root, spinal cord, brain stem, thalamocortical projections, or primary somatosensory cortex.

name: Hyperlysinuria
description: An increased concentration of lysine in the urine.

name: Abnormal anterior fontanelle morphology
description: An abnormality of the anterior fontanelle, i.e., the cranial fontanelle that is located at the intersection of the coronal and sagittal sutures.
synonyms: Abnormality of the forehead soft spot

name: Aphthous ulcer
description: Oral aphthous ulcers typically present as painful, sharply circumscribed fibrin-covered mucosal defects with a hyperemic border.

name: Widely patent fontanelles and sutures
description: An abnormally increased width of the cranial fontanelles and sutures.

name: Abnormal circulating lactate dehydrogenase concentration
description: A deviation from the normal serum concentration/activity of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), which catalyzes the reduction of pyruvate to form lactate.

name: Reactive hypoglycemia
description: Hypoglycermia following a meal (or more generally, after intake of glucose).
synonyms: Low blood sugar after a meal

name: Abnormality of the parathyroid gland
description: An abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

name: Abnormal penis morphology
description: Abnormality of the male external sex organ.

name: Open angle glaucoma
description: A type of glaucoma defined by an open, normal appearing anterior chamber angle and raised intraocular pressure,

name: Delayed ability to stand
description: A failure to achieve the ability to stand up at an appropriate developmental stage. Most children begin to walk alone at 11 to 15 months of age. On average, children can stand while holding on at the age of 9 to 10 months, can pull up to stand and walk with one hand being held at 12 months, and can stand alone and walk well at 18 months.

name: Vertebral segmentation defect
description: An abnormality related to a defect of vertebral separation during development.

name: Placental abruption
description: Separation of the placenta from the uterus wall before delivery.

name: Ovarian gonadoblastoma
description: The presence of a gonadoblastoma of the ovary.

name: Recurrent lower respiratory tract infections
description: An increased susceptibility to lower respiratory tract infections as manifested by a history of recurrent lower respiratory tract infections.

name: Enlarged cisterna magna
description: Increase in size of the cisterna magna, one of three principal openings in the subarachnoid space between the arachnoid and pia mater, located between the cerebellum and the dorsal surface of the medulla oblongata.

name: Renal cortical cysts
description: Cysts of the cortex of the kidney.

name: Reduced C-peptide level
description: A decreased concentration of C-peptide in the circulation. Since C-peptide is secreted in equimolar amounts to insulin, this feature correlates with reduced insulin secretion.

name: Abnormality of urinary uric acid level
description: Abnormal amount of urate in the urine.

name: Usual interstitial pneumonia
description: Temporal and spatial heterogeneity in lungs based on presence of fibrosis and honeycombing.

name: Anal atresia
description: Congenital absence of the anus, i.e., the opening at the bottom end of the intestinal tract.

name: Nyctalopia
description: Inability to see well at night or in poor light.

name: Ulnar claw
description: An abnormal hand position characterized by hyperextension of the fourth and fifth fingers at the metacarpophalangeal joints and flexion of the interphalangeal joints of the same fingers such that they are curled towards the palm.

name: Isomerism
description: Isomerism in the context of the congenitally malformed heart is defined as a situation where some paired structures on opposite sides of the left-right axis of the body are, in morphologic terms, symmetrical mirror images of each other.

name: Overfolding of the superior helices
description: A condition in which the superior portion of the helix is folded over to a greater degree than normal.

name: Elevated tissue non-specific alkaline phosphatase
description: An abnormally increased level of alkaline phosphatase, tissue-nonspecific isozyme in the blood.

name: Increased muscle fatiguability
description: An abnormal, increased fatiguability of the musculature.

name: Purpura
description: Purpura (from Latin: purpura, meaning purple) is the appearance of red or purple discolorations on the skin that do not blanch on applying pressure. They are caused by bleeding underneath the skin. This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to developing purpura. Purpura are larger than petechiae.
synonyms: Red or purple spots on the skin

name: Bifid distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx) to a partially fused appearance of the two bones.
synonyms: Notched outermost bone of the thumb

name: Abnormal nasal bridge morphology
description: Abnormality of the nasal bridge, which is the saddle-shaped area that includes the nasal root and the lateral aspects of the nose. It lies between the glabella and the inferior boundary of the nasal bone, and extends laterally to the inner canthi.
synonyms: Abnormality of the bridge of the nose
Deformity of the bridge of the nose
Malformation of the bridge of the nose

name: Abnormal pleura morphology
description: An abnormality of the pulmonary pleura, the thin, transparent membrane which covers the lungs and lines the inside of the chest walls.

name: Visual field defect
synonyms: Partial loss of field of vision

name: Gastrointestinal eosinophilia
description: Eosinophilic infiltration of one or more gastrointestinal organs. Gastrointestinal eosinophilia is a broad term for abnormal eosinophil accumulation in the GI tract, involving many different disease identities. These diseases include primary eosinophil associated gastrointestinal diseases, gastrointestinal eosinophilia in HES and all gastrointestinal eosinophilic states associated with known causes. Each of these diseases has its unique features but there is no absolute boundary between them.

name: Camptocormia
description: An abnormal forward-flexed posture e.g. forward flexion of the spine, which is noticeable when standing or walking but disappears when lying down. It is becoming an increasingly recognized feature of Parkinson's disease and dystonic disorders.

name: Decreased circulating total IgA
description: Undetectable serum immunoglobulin A level at a value < 5 mg/dL (0.05 g/L).

name: Abnormal cell morphology
description: Any anomaly of cell structure.

name: Posterior staphyloma
description: A localized defect in the posterior eye wall with protrusion of uveal tissue due to alterations in scleral thickness and structure.

name: Rhegmatogenous retinal detachment
description: A type of retinal detachment associated with a retinal tear, that is, with a break in the retina that allows fluid to pass from the vitreous space into the subretinal space between the sensory retina and the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to polysaccharide vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Broad face
description: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width greater than 2 standard deviations above the mean (objective); or an apparent increase in the width of the face (subjective).

name: Hepatic calcification
description: The presence of abnormal calcium deposition in the liver.

name: Akinesia
description: Inability to initiate changes in activity or movement and to perform ordinary volitional movements rapidly and easily.

name: Intestinal bleeding
description: Bleeding from the intestines.

name: Abnormality of central nervous system electrophysiology
Temporomandibular joint ankylosis
description: Bony fusion of the mandibular condyle to the base of the skull, resulting in limitation of jaw opening.

name: Trichorrhexis nodosa
description: Trichorrhexis nodosa is the formation of nodes along the hair shaft through which breakage readily occurs. It is thus a focal defect in the hair fiber that is characterized by thickening or weak points (nodes) that cause the hair to break off easily. The result is defective, abnormally fragile hair.

name: Long foot
description: Increased back to front length of the foot.

name: Limited elbow extension
description: Limited ability to straighten the arm at the elbow joint.

name: Midface retrusion
description: Posterior positions and/or vertical shortening of the infraorbital and perialar regions, or increased concavity of the face and/or reduced nasolabial angle.

name: Stillbirth
description: Death of the fetus in utero after at least 22 weeks of gestation.

name: Lacticaciduria
description: An increased concentration of lactic acid in the urine.

name: EEG with abnormally slow frequencies
description: EEG with abnormally slow frequencies.

name: Lambdoidal craniosynostosis
description: A kind of craniosynostosis affecting the lambdoidal suture.

name: Upper limb undergrowth
description: Arm shortening because of underdevelopment of one or more bones of the upper extremity.
synonyms: Hypoplasia involving bones of the upper limbs

name: Nonproductive cough
description: A cough that does not produce phlegm or mucus.

name: Abnormal sperm physiology
description: Abnormality of a sperm function including protection of paternal DNA, traversing the female reproductive tract, oocyte localisation, penetration of the zona pellucida, oocyte activation and centriole deposition.

name: Apraxia
description: A defect in the understanding of complex motor commands and in the execution of certain learned movements, i.e., deficits in the cognitive components of learned movements.

name: Abnormal arm span
description: A deviation from normal of the length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle)

name: Prolonged PR interval
description: Increased time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex).

name: Hair-pulling
description: A phenomenon in which persons repetitively pull out their own hair, resulting in noticeable hair loss.

name: Solitary median maxillary central incisor
description: A single maxillary central incisor positioned in the midline with morphological symmetry of the crown and bordered by lateral incisors.
synonyms: Solitary median maxillary central incisor syndrome

name: Abnormal demeanor
description: An anomaly in demeanor, which refers to the outward behavior, manner, or conduct of a person. It encompasses how an individual presents themselves to others in terms of attitude, posture, and general comportment.

name: Happy demeanor
description: A conspicuously happy disposition, characterized by frequent smiling and laughing, which may be contextually inappropriate or unrelated to the situation.

name: Migraine with aura
description: A type of migraine in which there is an aura characterized by focal neurological phenomena that usually proceed, but may accompany or occur in the absence of, the headache. The symptoms of an aura may include fully reversible visual, sensory, and speech symptoms but not motor weakness. Visual symptoms may include flickering lights, spots and lines and/or loss of vision and/or unilateral sensory symptoms such as paresthesias or numbness. At least one of the symptoms of an aura develops gradually over 5 or more minutes and/or different symptoms occur in succession.

name: Epiphora
description: Abnormally increased lacrimation, that is, excessive tearing (watering eye).

name: Widely spaced toes
description: An overall widening of the spaces between the digits.

name: Pierre-Robin sequence
description: Pierre Robin malformation is a sequence of developmental malformations characterized by micrognathia (mandibular hypoplasia), glossoptosis and cleft palate.

name: Enuresis nocturna
description: Enuresis occurring during sleeping hours.

name: Abnormal finger phalanx morphology
description: Abnormalities affecting the phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Abnormal form of phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the phalanges of the hand

name: Oculogyric crisis
description: An acute dystonic reaction with blepharospasm, periorbital twitches, and protracted fixed staring episodes. There may be a maximal upward deviation of the eyes in the sustained fashion. Oculogyric crisis can be triggered by a number of factors including neuroleptic medications.

name: Impairment of activities of daily living
description: Difficulty in performing one or more activities normally performed every day, such as eating, bathing, dressing, grooming, work, homemaking, and leisure.

name: Late young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at an age of greater than or equal to 25 to under 40 years.

name: Adrenal calcification
description: Calcification within the adrenal glands.

name: Muscle fiber necrosis
description: Abnormal cell death involving muscle fibers usually associated with break in, or absence of, muscle surface fiber membrane and resulting in irreversible damage to muscle fibers.

name: Facial myokymia
description: Facial myokymia is a fine fibrillary activity of one or more muscles innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Rachitic rosary
description: A row of beadlike prominences at the junction of a rib and its cartilage (i.e., enlarged costochondral joints), resembling a rosary. Note that rachitic rosary would have one bead per rib (a swelling at the costochondral junction), while beaded ribs in the context of multiple rib fractures have multiple beads (fractures) along the same rib.

name: Sclerosis of finger phalanx
description: An elevation in bone density in one or more phalanges of the fingers. Sclerosis is normally detected on a radiograph as an area of increased opacity.
synonyms: Increased bone density in the finger bone
Sclerosis of the phalanges of the hand

name: Mesomelic arm shortening
description: Shortening of the middle parts of the arm in relation to the upper and terminal segments.

name: Decreased methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity
description: An abnormality of Krebs cycle metabolism that is characterized by a decreased rate of methylmalonyl-CoA mutase activity.

name: Hyperuricemia
description: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the blood.

name: Hypocalcemic tetany
description: Hyperexcitability of the neuromuscular system related to abnormally low level of calcium in the blood, resulting in carpopedal or generalized spasms.

name: Upslanted palpebral fissure
description: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations above the mean for age (objective); or, the inclination of the palpebral fissure is greater than typical for age.
synonyms: Upward slanting of the opening between the eyelids

name: Abnormal circulating proline concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of proline or a proline metabolite in the blood circulation.

name: Hypoplastic anterior commissure
description: Underdevelopment of the anterior commissure.

name: Urticaria
description: Raised, well-circumscribed areas of erythema and edema involving the dermis and epidermis. Urticaria is intensely pruritic, and blanches completely with pressure.

name: Lupus anticoagulant
description: Presence of lupus anticoagulant (LA) autoantibodies. LA represent a heterogeneous group of autoantibodies, IgG, IgM, or a mixture of both classes, that interfere with standard phospholipid-based coagulant tests (this is only an in vitro phenomenon, LA do not cause reduction of coagulation in vivo). The antibodies are directed against plasma proteins which also bind to phospholipid surfaces.

name: Impaired vibratory sensation
description: A decrease in the ability to perceive vibration. Clinically, this is usually tested with a tuning fork which vibrates at 128 Hz and is applied to bony prominences such as the malleoli at the ankles or the metacarpal-phalangeal joints. There is a slow decay of vibration from the tuning fork. The degree of vibratory sense loss can be crudely estimated by counting the number of seconds that the examiner can perceive the vibration longer than the patient.

name: Hyperglycemia
description: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Decreased libido
description: Decreased sexual desire.

name: Adrenal hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the adrenal glands.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 2nd finger
synonyms: Abnormality of terminal index finger phalanx
Abnormality of the outermost bone of the 2nd finger

name: Retinal nerve fiber edema
description: Swelling (edema) of the retinal nerve fibers.

name: Stomatitis
description: Stomatitis is an inflammation of the mucous membranes of any of the structures in the mouth.

name: Headache
description: Cephalgia, or pain sensed in various parts of the head, not confined to the area of distribution of any nerve.

name: Dermatan sulfate excretion in urine
description: An increased concentration of dermatan sulfate in the urine.

name: Superficial thrombophlebitis
description: Inflammation of a superficial vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: Abnormal middle phalanx morphology of the hand
description: An anomaly of middle phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the middle finger bones of the hand
Abnormality of the middle phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormal circulating non-proteinogenic amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.

name: Abnormal hematocrit
description: Any deviation from the normal ratio of the volume of red blood cells to the total volume of blood.

name: Abnormal respiratory system morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the respiratory system.

name: Abnormality of glycolipid metabolism
description: An abnormality of glycolipid metabolism.

name: Abnormal erythrocyte sedimentation rate
description: A deviation from normal range of the erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR), a test that measures the distance that erythrocytes have fallen after one hour in a vertical column of anticoagulated blood under the influence of gravity. The ESR is a nonspecific finding. An elevation may indicate inflammation or may be caused by any condition that elevates fibrinogen. A decreased ESR may be seen in polycythemia or in certain blood diseases in which red blood cells have an irregular or smaller shape that causes slower settling.

name: Psoriasiform lesion
description: A skin lesions that resembles the lesions observed in psoriasis, viz., an erythematous plaque covered by fine silvery scales. Psoriasiform lesions can be observed in psoriasis as well as in other conditions including allergic contact dermatitis, seborrhoeic dermatitis, Atopic dermatitis, pityriasis rubra, and lichen simplex chronicus.

name: Chronic pancreatitis
description: A chronic form of pancreatitis.

name: 3-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 3 and 4.

name: Memory impairment
description: An impairment of memory as manifested by a reduced ability to remember things such as dates and names, and increased forgetfulness.

name: Joint contracture of the hand
description: Contractures of one ore more joints of the hands meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.

name: Abnormal thyroid morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the thyroid gland.

name: Cardiac arrest
description: An abrupt loss of heart function.

name: Increased circulating immunoglobulin concentration
description: An increased level of gamma globulin (immunoglobulin) in the blood.

name: Abnormal metacarpal morphology
description: Any abnormal shape or structure of the metacarpal bones.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of long bones of hand

name: Food allergy
description: Primary food allergies primarily occur as a result (most likely) of gastrointestinal sensitization to predominantly stable food allergens (glycoproteins). A secondary food allergy develops after primary sensitization to airborne allergens (e. g., pollen allergens) with subsequent reactions (due to cross-reactivity) to structurally related often labile allergens in (plant) foods.

name: Abnormal patella morphology
description: Abnormality of the patella (knee cap).

name: Radial deviation of the hand or of fingers of the hand
Cerebral cortical hemiatrophy
description: Atrophy of one side of the brain, characterized by findings including thinning of the cerebral cortex, reduced volume of the cerebral white matter with abnormal myelination, and enlargement of the ispilateral fourth ventricle.

name: Abnormal Intonation
description: Abnormal rise and fall of the voice in speech and vocalization for the context and cultural situation.

name: Fingernail dysplasia
description: An abnormality of the development of the fingernails.

name: Unilateral cryptorchidism
description: Absence of a testis from the scrotum on one side owing to failure of the testis or testes to descend through the inguinal canal to the scrotum.

name: Abnormal sputum
description: Abnormal appearance of material expectorated (coughed up) from the respiratory system and that is composed of mucus but may contain other substances such as pus, blood, microorganisms, and fibrin.

name: Facial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth (overgrowth) of the facial bones, that is of the facial skeleton.
synonyms: Increase in size of the facial bones

name: Abnormality of the middle ear
description: An abnormality of the middle ear.

name: Abnormality of the abdominal wall
description: The presence of any abnormality affecting the abdominal wall.
synonyms: Abnormality of external features of the abdomen

name: Poikiloderma
description: Poikiloderma refers to a patch of skin with (1) reticulated hypopigmentation and hyperpigmentation, (2) wrinkling secondary to epidermal atrophy, and (3) telangiectasias.

name: Iris atrophy
description: Loss of iris tissue (atrophy)

name: Bone spicule pigmentation of the retina
description: Pigment migration into the retina in a bone-spicule configuration (resembling the nucleated cells within the lacuna of bone).

name: Hypoplasia of the femoral head
description: Underdevelopment of the femoral head.

name: Benign neoplasm of the central nervous system
Bilateral microphthalmos
description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of both eyes.
synonyms: Decreased size of globes of eyes
Abnormally small eyeball on both sides

name: Spastic dysarthria
description: A type of dysarthria related to bilateral damage of the upper motor neuron tracts of the pyramidal and extra- pyramidal tracts. Speech of affected individuals is slow, effortful, and has a harsh vocal quality.

name: Cleft ala nasi
description: The presence of a notch in the margin of the ala nasi.

name: Somatic sensory dysfunction
description: An abnormality of the primary sensation that is mediated by peripheral nerves (pain, temperature, touch, vibration, joint position). The word hypoesthesia (or hypesthesia) refers to a reduction in cutaneous sensation to a specific type of testing.

name: Broad toe
description: Visible increase in width of the non-hallux digit without an increase in the dorso-ventral dimension.

name: Postural tremor
description: A type of tremors that is triggered by holding a limb in a fixed position.

name: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

name: Abnormal serum insulin-like growth factor 1 level
description: An anomalous level of insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF1) in the blood circulation.

name: Xerostomia
description: Dryness of the mouth due to salivary gland dysfunction.

name: Abnormality of abdominal situs
description: An abnormality of the abdominal situs, i.e., of the sidedness of the abdomen and its organs.

name: Abnormal peripheral myelination
description: An abnormality of the myelination of motor and sensory peripheral nerves. These are axons for motor nerves and dendrites for sensory nerves in the strict anatomic sense.

name: Globozoospermia
description: Any structural anomaly of the acrosome resulting in a round sperm head.

name: Hypoplasia of the pons
description: Underdevelopment of the pons.

name: Abnormal larynx morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the larynx.

name: Preaxial hand polydactyly
description: Supernumerary digits located at the radial side of the hand. Polydactyly (supernumerary digits) involving the thumb occurs in many distinct forms of high variability and severity. Ranging from fleshy nubbins over varying degrees of partial duplication/splitting to completely duplicated or even triplicated thumbs or preaxial (on the radial side of the hand) supernumerary digits.

name: Abnormal brainstem MRI signal intensity
description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brainstem.

name: Broad metatarsal
description: Increased side-to-side width of a metatarsal bone.

name: Inappropriate laughter
description: Laughing that may be excessive and/or inappropriate in context (e.g., laughing at a funeral while others are crying).

name: Abnormal epiglottis morphology
description: An abnormality of the epiglottis.

name: Abnormal urine phosphate concentration
description: An abnormal phosphate concentration in the urine.

name: Retinal coloboma
description: A notch or cleft of the retina.
synonyms: Hole in the back of the eye

name: Episodic ataxia
description: Periodic spells of incoordination and imbalance, that is, episodes of ataxia typically lasting from 10 minutes to several hours or days.

name: Abnormal finger morphology
description: An anomaly of a finger.

name: Decreased compound muscle action potential amplitude
description: Reduced level of the compound muscle action potential (CMAP), which is recorded following electrical stimulation of a nerve from surface electrodes overlying a muscle supplied by that nerve.

name: Abdominal wall muscle weakness
description: Decreased strength of the abdominal musculature.

name: Neoplasm of the middle ear
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the middle ear.

name: Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa
description: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the mucosa of the mouth.
synonyms: Abnormal color of the oral mucosa
Abnormal colour of the oral mucosa
Abnormal pigmentation of oral mucous membrane
Abnormal pigmentation of the oral mucosa/gingivae

name: Abdominal cramps
description: A type of abdominal pain characterized by a feeling of contractions and typically fluctuating in intensity.

name: Proximal femoral epiphysiolysis
description: Slipped capital femoral epiphysis is defined as a posterior and inferior slippage of the proximal epiphysis of the femur onto the metaphysis (femoral neck), occurring through the physeal plate during the early adolescent growth spurt.
synonyms: Slipped end part of innermost thighbone

name: Agenesis of permanent teeth
description: A congenital defect characterized by the absence of one or more permanent teeth, including oligodontia, hypodontia, and adontia of the of permanent teeth.
synonyms: Failure of development of permanent teeth
Failure of development of secondary teeth

name: Lymphoma
description: A cancer originating in lymphocytes and presenting as a solid tumor of lymhpoid cells.

name: Pendular nystagmus
description: Rhythmic, involuntary sinusoidal oscillations of one or both eyes. The waveform of pendular nystagmus may occur in any direction.

name: Wormian bones
description: The presence of extra bones within a cranial suture. Wormian bones are irregular isolated bones which appear in addition to the usual centers of ossification of the cranium.
synonyms: Islands of bone within cranial sutures

name: Generalized neonatal hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period and affecting the entire musculature.
synonyms: Generalised low muscle tone in neonate
Generalized low muscle tone in neonate

name: Hypothalamic hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyrotropin-releasing hormone activity.

name: Limbal stem cell deficiency
description: A condition characterized by a loss or deficiency of the stem cells in the limbus that are vital for re-population of the corneal epithelium and to the barrier function of the limbus.

name: Scapuloperoneal amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy in the distribution of shoulder girdle and peroneal muscles.

name: Small cerebral cortex
description: Reduced size of the cerebral cortex.

name: Chest pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the chest.

name: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionizing radiation
description: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with ionizing radiation.
synonyms: Chromosomal breakage induced by ionising radiation

name: Hyperketonemia
description: An increase in the level of ketone bodies (acetoacetic acid, beta-hydroxybutyric acid, and acetone) in the blood.
synonyms: Increased level of ketone bodies in blood

name: Abnormal second toe morphology
description: An anomaly of the second toe.

name: Increased body weight
description: Abnormally increased body weight.

name: Immunodeficiency
description: Failure of the immune system to protect the body adequately from infection, due to the absence or insufficiency of some component process or substance.

name: Motor regression
description: Loss of previously achieved motor skills, as manifested by loss of developmental motor milestones.

name: Protuberant abdomen
description: A thrusting or bulging out of the abdomen.

name: Recurrent cutaneous abscess formation
description: An increased susceptibility to cutaneous abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent cutaneous abscesses.

name: Abnormal ventricular axis
description: Any deviation from the normal direction of the ventricular axis. The left ventricle makes up most of the heart muscle under normal circumstances and therefore generates the most electrical force visible on the EKG. The normal ventricular axis is directed downward and slightly towards the left. The ventricular axis can be determined by analyzing the QRS complex, which represents ventricular depolarization.

name: Abnormal coronary artery morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the coronary arteries.

name: Choking episodes
description: Incidents in which a piece of food or other objects get stuck in the upper airway and provoke coughing, gagging, inability to talk, and difficulty breathing.

name: Increased serum testosterone level
description: An elevated circulating testosterone level in the blood.

name: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctival vasculature
description: Any abnormality of the blood vessels of the conjunctiva.
synonyms: Abnormal morphology of the conjunctiva vasculature
Abnormal vasculature of the conjunctiva morphology
Abnormality of the vasculature of the conjunctiva

name: Abnormal B cell subset distribution
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of any B cell subpopulation, measured as percentage of total CD19+ or CD20+ B cells in the blood, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Polymicrogyria
description: Polymicrogyria is a congenital malformation of the cerebral cortex characterized by abnormal cortical layering (lamination) and an excessive number of small gyri (folds).

name: Radial deviation of the 2nd finger
description: Displacement of the 2nd finger towards the radial side.

name: Hepatocellular carcinoma
description: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates in hepatocytes and presents macroscopically as a soft and hemorrhagic tan mass in the liver.

name: Autophagic vacuoles
description: The lysosomal-vacuolar pathway has a role in the controlled intracellular digestion of macromolecules such as protein complexes and organelles. This feature refers to the presence of an abnormally increased number of autophagic vacuoles in muscle tissue.

name: Common atrium
description: Complete absence of the interatrial septum with common atrioventricular valve and two atrioventricular connections.

name: Rhombencephalosynapsis
description: Rhombencephalosynapsis is a rare brain malformation defined by midline fusion of the cerebellar hemispheres with partial or complete loss of the intervening vermis.

name: Abnormal circulating homocysteine concentration
description: An abnormality of a homocysteine metabolic process.

name: Areflexia of upper limbs
description: Inability to elicit tendon reflexes in the upper limbs.

name: Impaired epinephrine-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to epinephrine as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of epinephrine.

name: Polar cataract
description: A type of Congenital cataract in which the opacities occupy the subcapsular cortex at the anterior or posterior pole of the lens.

name: Abnormal dura mater morphology
description: An abnormality of the Dura mater.

name: Hypopigmentation of the fundus
description: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalized. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid).

name: Absent palmar crease
description: The absence of the major creases of the palm (distal transverse crease, proximal transverse crease, or thenar crease).

name: Posterior embryotoxon
description: A posterior embryotoxon is the presence of a prominent and anteriorly displaced line of Schwalbe.

name: Type II lissencephaly
description: A form of lissencephaly characterized by an uneven cortical surface with a so called 'cobblestone' appearace. There are no distinguishable cortical layers.

name: Abnormal P wave
description: Any anomaly of the P wave of the EKG, which results from atrial depolarization. The P wave occurs when the sinoatrial node creates an action potential that depolarizes the atria.

name: Elevated circulating porphyrin concentration
description: Concentration of porphyrins or of a specific porphryin above the upper limit of normal. The most commonly tested circulating porphyrins are coproporphyrin, protoporphyrin, and uroporphyrin. Normally protoporphyrin is present in the highest concentration.

name: Myopia
description: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects nearby clearly, while objects in the distance appear blurry.

name: Abnormal female external genitalia morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the female external genitalia.

name: Neoplasm of the respiratory system
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the respiratory system.

name: Thoracic aortic aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the thoracic aorta.

name: Prolonged QTc interval
description: A longer than normal interval (corrected for heart rate) between the Q and T waves in the heart's cycle. Prolonged QTc can cause premature action potentials during late phase depolarizations thereby leading to ventricular arrhythmias and ventricular fibrillations.

name: Retinal arterial occlusion
description: Blockage of the retinal artery, generally associated with interruption of blood flow and oxygen delivery to the retina.

name: Abnormal change in social behavior
description: An alternation in the habits and emotional tendencies of an individual with a change in behavior that is typically noticed by family members or peers.

name: Unexplained fevers
description: Episodes of fever for which no infectious cause can be identified.

name: Abnormal circulating ferritin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of ferritin. Ferritin concentration can be measured in serum or plasma.

name: Abnormally large globe
description: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) without glaucoma.

name: Impaired ocular adduction
description: Reduced ability to move the eye in the direction of the nose.

name: Abnormal morphology of musculature of pharynx
description: An abnormality of any of the muscles of the pharynx.
synonyms: Abnormality of muscles of the pharynx

name: Pulmonary artery atresia
description: A congenital anomaly with a narrowing or complete absence of the opening between the right ventricle and the pulmonary artery.

name: Exercise intolerance
description: A functional motor deficit where individuals whose responses to the challenges of exercise fail to achieve levels considered normal for their age and gender.

name: Decreased total leukocyte count
description: An abnormal decreased number of leukocytes in the blood.

name: Respiratory distress
description: Respiratory distress is objectively observable as the physical or emotional consequences from the experience of dyspnea. The physical presentation of respiratory distress is generally referred to as labored breathing, while the sensation of respiratory distress is called shortness of breath or dyspnea.

name: Abnormality of the anus
description: Abnormality of the anal canal.

name: Abnormality of the foot musculature
description: An anomaly of the musculature of foot.

name: Tubular luminal dilatation
description: Dilatation (expansion beyond the normal dimension) of the cavity (lumen) of tubules of the kidney. The tubular cross section displays an attenuated brush border (apical PAS positivity greater than 10 percent of the normal expected height, but unequivocally less than normal expected height), resulting in an apparent increase in the size of lumen.

name: Gynecomastia
description: Abnormal development of large mammary glands in males resulting in breast enlargement.

name: Neurofibroma
description: A benign peripheral nerve sheath tumor that generally appears as a soft, skin-colored papule or small subcutaneous nodule. Individuals with neurofibromatosis can have numerous neurofibromas.

name: Abnormality of the pubic hair
description: Abnormality of the growth of the pubic hair. Pubic hair is part of the secondary sexual hair, which normally ensues during puberty.

name: Antiphospholipid antibody positivity
description: The presence of circulating autoantibodies to phospholipids.

name: Prominent crus of helix
description: The presence of an abnormally prominent of the crus of the helix. That is, development of the crus helix to the same degree as an average antihelix stem or helix.
synonyms: Abnormal prominence of the crus of the ear

name: Epidural hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring between the dura mater and the skull.

name: Arteritis
description: Arterial inflammation.

name: Chills
description: A sudden sensation of feeling cold.

name: Abnormal fifth toe morphology
description: An anomaly of the little toe.

name: Hyperparathyroidism
description: Excessive production of parathyroid hormone (PTH) by the parathyroid glands.

name: Shoulder flexion contracture
description: Chronic reduction in active and passive mobility of the shoulder joint due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Abnormality of skeletal maturation
description: The bones of the skeleton undergo a series of characteristic changes in size, shape, and calcification from fetal life until puberty. An abnormality of this process can include delayed or accelerated skeletal maturation, or deviation of some, but not all bones from the expected patterns of maturation.

name: Insidious onset
description: Gradual, very slow onset of disease manifestations.

name: Problematic alcohol consumption
description: Impaired ability to stop or control alcohol use despite adverse social, occupational, or health consequences.

name: Unconjugated hyperbilirubinemia
description: An increased amount of unconjugated (indirect) bilurubin in the blood.

name: Abnormal oral mucosa morphology
description: Abnormality of the oral mucosa.

name: Abnormal dental pulp morphology
description: An abnormality of the dental pulp.

name: Palmar telangiectasia
description: The presence of telangiectases on the skin of palm of hand.

name: Attached earlobe
description: Attachment of the lobe to the side of the face at the lowest point of the lobe without curving upward.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to unconjugated pneumococcus vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a pneumococcus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Tapered sperm head
description: Sperm with cigar-shaped heads that gradually dimish in diameter (taper).

name: Hemoptysis
description: Coughing up (expectoration) of blood or blood-streaked sputum from the larynx, trachea, bronchi, or lungs.
synonyms: Coughing up blood or blood-stained mucus

name: Autoamputation of digits
description: The spontaneous detachment of a digit (finger or toe) from the body due to long standing pathology.

name: Penile hypospadias
description: Location of the urethral opening on the inferior aspect of the penis.

name: Abnormality of the pulmonary artery
description: An abnormality of the pulmonary artery.

name: Reduced progressive sperm motility
description: A reduced proportion of sperm that move in a straight line or large circles; alternatively, an increased proportion of sperm that move in tight circles or in some other non-linear fashion.

name: Abnormality of the common coagulation pathway
description: An abnormality of blood coagulation, common pathway.

name: Mild proteinuria
description: Mildly increased levels of protein in the urine (150-500 mg per day in adults).

name: Broad palm
description: For children from birth to 4 years of age the palm width is more than 2 SD above the mean; for children from 4 to 16 years of age the palm width is above the 95th centile; or, the width of the palm appears disproportionately wide for the length.

name: Polyphagia
description: A neurological anomaly with gross overeating associated with an abnormally strong desire or need to eat.

name: Rigidity
description: Continuous involuntary sustained muscle contraction. When an affected muscle is passively stretched, the degree of resistance remains constant regardless of the rate at which the muscle is stretched. This feature helps to distinguish rigidity from muscle spasticity.

name: Long ear
description: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two SD above the mean determined by the maximal distance from the superior aspect to the inferior aspect of the external ear.

name: Phonophobia
description: An abnormally heightened sensitivity to loud sounds.

name: Refractory anemia with ringed sideroblasts
description: A type of myelodysplastic syndrome characterized by less than 5% myeloblasts in the bone marrow, but with 15% or greater red cell precursors in the marrow being abnormal iron-stuffed cells called ringed sideroblasts.

name: Micrographia
description: Abnormally small-sized handwriting is formally defined as an impairment of fine motor skills, which mainly manifests as a progressive or stable reduction in amplitude during a writing task.

name: Onion bulb formation
description: Repeated episodes of segmental demyelination and remyelination lead to the accumulation of supernumerary Schwann cells around axons, which is referred to as onion bulb formation. This finding affects peripheral nerves.

name: Dysgerminoma
description: The presence of a dysgerminoma, i.e., an undifferentiated germ cell tumor of the ovary.

name: Everted upper lip vermilion
description: Inner aspect of the upper lip vermilion (normally apposing the teeth) visible in a frontal view, i.e., the presence of an everted upper lip.

name: Hyperautofluorescent retinal lesion
description: Increased amount of autofluorescence in the retina as ascertained by fundus autofluorescence imaging.

name: Generalized abnormality of skin
description: An abnormality of the skin that is not localized to any one particular region.

name: Thick eyebrow
description: Increased density/number and/or increased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

name: Patchy palmoplantar hyperkeratosis
description: A focal type of palmoplantar keratoderma in which only certain areas of the palms and soles are affected.

name: Galactorrhea
description: Spontaneous flow of milk from the breast, unassociated with childbirth or nursing.

name: Aplasia of the thymus
description: Absence of the thymus. This feature may be appreciated by the lack of a thymic shadow upon radiographic examination.

name: Abnormal circulating leucine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal circulation of leucine in the blood circulation.

name: Edema of the dorsum of feet
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the feet.
synonyms: Oedema of the dorsum of feet

name: Choroidal neovascularization
description: Choroidal neovascularization (CNV) is the creation of new blood vessels in the choroid layer of the eye.

name: Premature sagging cheeks
description: Drooping or sinking of tissues of the cheeks more than would be expected at a given age. Sagging can occur due to a relative excess of skin and/or lack of elastic recoil as well as fat accumulation.

name: Abnormal sweat gland morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the sweat gland.

name: Pulmonic regurgitation
description: The retrograde (backwards) flow of blood through the pulmonary valve into the right ventricle during diastole.

name: Extrapyramidal muscular rigidity
description: Muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement).

name: Syndactyly
description: Webbing or fusion of the fingers or toes, involving soft parts only or including bone structure. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers or toes in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "symphalangism".

name: Chronic kidney disease
description: Functional anomaly of the kidney persisting for at least three months.

name: Thickened skin
description: Laminar thickening of skin.

name: Abnormal palmar dermatoglyphics
description: An abnormality of the dermatoglyphs, i.e., an abnormality of the patterns of ridges of the skin of palm of hand.

name: Abnormal sclera morphology
description: An abnormality of the sclera.
synonyms: Abnormality of the outer white part of eyeball

name: Madelung deformity
description: An anomaly related to partial closure, or failure of development of the ulnar side of the distal radial growth plate, which results in an arrest of epiphyseal growth of the medial and volar portions of the distal radius. This leads to shortening of the radius and relative overgrowth of the ulna.

name: Open neural tube defect
description: A type of neural tube defect that is not covered by skin.

name: Distal sensory impairment of all modalities
description: Reduced ability to sense pain, temperature, touch, vibration stimuli in the distal regions of the extremities.
synonyms: Distal sensory loss to all modalities

name: Lupus nephritis
description: Lupus nephritis is a type of glomerulonephritis that constitutes one of the most severe organ manifestations of systemic lupus erythematosus. Lupus nephritis is subclassified in six distinct classes, that represent different manifestations and severities of renal involvement and guide the therapeutic management.

name: Anterior creases of earlobe
description: Sharply demarcated, typically linear and approximately horizontal, indentations in the outer surface of the ear lobe.

name: Anti-myeloperoxidase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the blood circulation that react against myeloperoxidase.

name: Abnormally low T cell receptor excision circle level
description: Reduced level of T cell receptor excision circle (TRECs) as measured by the TREC assay. Late in maturation, 70% of thymocytes that will ultimately express alpha/beta-T cell receptors form a circular DNA TREC from the excised TCRdelta gene that lies within the TCRalpha genetic locus. The circles are stable but do not increase following cell division and, therefore, become diluted as T cells proliferate. A quantitative polymerase chain reaction (PCR) reaction across the joint of the circular DNA provides the TREC copy number, a marker of newly-formed, antigenically-nave thymic emigrant T cells.

name: Discoid lupus rash
description: Cutaneous lesion that develops as a dry, scaly, red patch that evolves to an indurated and hyperpigmented plaque with adherent scale. Scarring may result in central white patches (loss of pigmentation) and skin atrophy.

name: Branchial cyst
description: A branchial cyst is a remnant of embryonic development resulting from a failure of obliteration of a branchial cleft and consists of a subcutaneous cystic mass. Cysts are located anterior or posterior to the ear or in the submandibular region.

name: Sclerodactyly
description: Localized thickening and tightness of the skin of the fingers or toes.

name: Gustatory lacrimation
