description: Gustatory lacrimation results from an aberrant innervation of fibers from the seventh cranial nerve to the pterygopalatine ganglion which are destined originally for the submandibular ganglion. This aberrant innervation leads to uncontrollable tearing while eating or in anticipation of a meal.

name: Wrist drop
description: A condition in which the affected individual cannot extend the wrist, which hangs flaccidly.

name: Duodenal polyposis
description: Presence of multiple polyps in the duodenum.

name: Abnormal brainstem morphology
description: An anomaly of the brainstem.

name: Broad nasal tip
description: Increase in width of the nasal tip.
synonyms: Increased breadth of tip of nose
Increased width of tip of nose

name: Triangular face
description: Facial contour, as viewed from the front, triangular in shape, with breadth at the temples and tapering to a narrow chin.
synonyms: Face with broad temples and narrow chin

name: Abnormal right ventricular function
description: Anomalous physiology (function) of the right ventricle.

name: Monotonic speech
description: A speech pattern characterized by a persistently abnormal lack of tone in the voice. Monotonic speech is typically ongoing, lasting throughout the day, but may have a diurnal variation in the pattern, i.e. slower at specific times of the day.

name: White forelock
description: A triangular depigmented region of white hairs located in the anterior midline of the scalp.
synonyms: White part of hair above forehead

name: Paroxysmal ventricular tachycardia
description: Episodes of ventricular tachycardia that have a sudden onset and ending.

name: Stereotypic upper-extremity movements
description: Abnormal movements of the upper extremities.

name: Hyperorality
description: Hyperorality is a condition characterized by an excessive preoccupation with oral sensations and behaviors, such as chewing, sucking, biting, swallowing, and excessive mouthing of objects.

name: Abnormal rapid eye movement sleep
description: Abnormality of REM Sleep are phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tone except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are also phases of rapid eye movements.

name: Malabsorption
description: Impaired ability to absorb one or more nutrients from the intestine.

name: Fluctuations in consciousness
description: Changes in one's level of awareness and responsiveness to their environment.

name: Decreased mitogen-induced T-cell proliferation
description: Abnormal decrease of T cell proliferation in response to mitogenic stimuli. This is commonly measured through intracellular expression of Ki67, decreasing surface expression of carboxyfluorescein diacetate (CFSE), or 3H-thymidine incorporation. Length of incubation, specific stimulus and strength of stimulation may vary between laboratories.
synonyms: Decreased lymphocyte proliferation in response to mitogen

name: Abnormal synovial membrane morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the synovium, which is a membrane that lines the cavity of synovial joints and consists of a lining layer of macrophage-like synoviocytes and fibroblast-like synoviocytes, as well as a sublining of connective tissue. Synovial cells are thought to contribute to joint homeostasis by secreting various factors such as hyaluronic acid and lubricin important for joint lubrication and function, as well as disposing of the waste products.

name: Square face
description: Facial contours, as viewed from the front, show a broad upper face/cranium and lower face/mandible, creating a square appearance.

name: Abnormal femoral neck morphology
description: An abnormality of the femoral neck (which is the process of bone, connecting the femoral head with the femoral shaft).

name: Normal interictal EEG
description: Lack of observable abnormal electroencephalographic (EEG) patterns in an individual with a history of seizures. About half of individuals with epilepsy show interictal epileptiform discharges upon the first investigation. The yield can be increased by repeated studies, sleep studies, or by ambulatory EEG recordings over 24 hours. Normal interictal EEG is a sign that can be useful in the differential diagnosis.

name: Abnormal middle ear morphology
description: An abnormality of the morphology or structure of the middle ear.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the middle ear

name: Patellar hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the patella.

name: Decreased calvarial ossification
description: Abnormal reduction in ossification of the calvaria (roof of the skull consisting of the frontal bone, parietal bones, temporal bones, and occipital bone).

name: Abnormal erythrocyte morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of erythrocytes (red-blood cells).

name: Everted lower lip vermilion
description: An abnormal configuration of the lower lip such that it is turned outward i.e., everted, with the Inner aspect of the lower lip vermilion (normally opposing the teeth) being visible in a frontal view.

name: Hypometric saccades
description: Saccadic undershoot, i.e., a saccadic eye movement that has less than the magnitude that would be required to gain fixation of the object.

name: Diabetes mellitus
description: A group of abnormalities characterized by hyperglycemia and glucose intolerance.

name: Coarse facial features
description: Absence of fine and sharp appearance of brows, nose, lips, mouth, and chin, usually because of rounded and heavy features or thickened skin with or without thickening of subcutaneous and bony tissues.
synonyms: Thickened facial skin with coarse facial features

name: Delayed ability to crawl
description: A failure to achieve the ability to crawl at an appropriate developmental stage. Normal infant motor development is marked by a series of postural milestones including learning to crawl on hands and knees between the ages of 6 and 10 months.

name: Acute pancreatitis
description: A acute form of pancreatitis.

name: Rectal polyposis
description: The presence of multiple rectal hyperplastic/adenomatous polyps.

name: Choroidal hemangioma
description: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the choroid. These are generally reddish or orange or can have increased pigmentation maiking them difficult to distinguish from choroidal melanomas.

name: Epiphyseal dysplasia
synonyms: Abnormal development of end part of bone
Abnormal development of the ends of long bones in arms and legs

name: Abnormal upper limb bone morphology
synonyms: Abnormal morphology of bones of the upper limbs
Abnormal shape of bones of the upper limbs

name: Preeclampsia
description: Pregnancy-induced hypertension in association with significant amounts of protein in the urine.

name: Claw hand deformity
description: An abnormality of the hand characterized by metacarpophalangeal (MCP) hyperextension and proximal interphalangeal (PIP) and distal interphalangeal (DIP) flexion. The position of the affected hand is said to resemble a claw.

name: Exercise-induced myalgia
description: The occurrence of an unusually high amount of muscle pain following exercise.

name: Abnormal placenta morphology
description: An abnormality of the placenta, the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall to enable nutrient uptake, waste elimination, and gas exchange.

name: Photopsia
description: Perceived flashes of light.

name: Occipital meningocele
description: A herniation of meninges through a congenital bone defect in the skull in the occipital region.

name: Urethral obstruction
description: Obstruction of the flow of urine through the urethra.

name: Preaxial polydactyly
description: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the thumb or great toe.

name: Reduced circulating prolactin concentration
description: A reduced level of prolactin in the blood circulation. Prolactin is a protein hormone that is secreted by lactotrophs in the anterior pituitary and that stimulates mammary gland development and milk production.

name: Heat intolerance
description: The inability to maintain a comfortable body temperature in warm or hot weather.

name: Elevated circulating alanine aminotransferase concentration
description: An abnormally high concentration in the circulation of alanine aminotransferase (ALT).

name: Parietal cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy of the parietal cortex.

name: Bowing of the legs
description: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the leg.

name: Absent earlobe
description: Absence of fleshy non-cartilaginous tissue inferior to the tragus and incisura.

name: Parkinsonism
description: Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting from degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait.

name: Atrial standstill
description: Atrial standstill or silent atrium is a rare condition presenting with the absence of electrical and mechanical activity in the atria. It presents with the absence of P waves, bradycardia, and wide QRS complex in the electrocardiogram.

name: Abnormal astrocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of astrocytes.

name: Eunuchoid habitus
description: A body habitus that is tall, slim and underweight, with long legs and long arms (i.e., arm span exceeds height by 5 cm or more).

name: Thromboembolic stroke
description: A cerebrovascular accident (stroke) that occurs because of thromboembolism.

name: Nocturnal seizures
description: Seizures that occur while the affected individual is sleeping.

name: Abnormality of the posterior hairline
description: An anomaly in the placement or shape of the hairline (trichion) on the back of the head (neck), that is, the border between skin on the back of the head that has head hair.
synonyms: Abnormality of hairline at back of head

name: Wrist hypermobility
description: The ability of the wrist joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Leukemia
description: A cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an abnormal proliferation of leukocytes.

name: Uplifted earlobe
description: An abnormal orientation of the earlobes such that they point out- and upward. That is, the lateral surface of ear lobe faces superiorly.

name: Moderately short stature
description: A moderate degree of short stature, more than -3 SD but not more than -4 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Abnormality of circulating fibrinogen
description: An abnormality of the level of activity of circulating fibrinogen.

name: Arterial thrombosis
description: The formation of a blood clot inside an artery.

name: Fetal neck anomaly
description: A structural anomaly in the fetal neck region. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Maternal autoimmune disease
description: A medical history of a fetus or child born to a mother with an autoimmune disease.

name: Limited knee extension
description: Reduced ability to extend (straighten) the knee joint.

name: Focal-onset seizure
description: A focal-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating within networks limited to one hemisphere. They may be discretely localized or more widely distributed, and may originate in subcortical structures.
synonyms: Seizure affecting one half of brain

name: Sensorimotor neuropathy
synonyms: Nerve damage causing decreased feeling and movement

name: Mesoaxial polydactyly
description: The presence of a supernumerary finger or toe (not a thumb or hallux) involving the third or fourth metacarpal/tarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Short 4th toe
description: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fourth toe.

name: Lip pit
description: A depression located on a lip.

name: Calcification of cartilage
description: The presence of calcium deposition in cartilage.

name: Sideroblastic anemia
description: Sideroblastic anemia results from a defect in the incorporation of iron into the heme molecule. A sideroblast is an erythroblast that has stainable deposits of iron in cytoplasm (this can be demonstrated by Prussian blue staining).

name: Abnormality of muscle size
description: Abnormalities of the overall muscle bulk based on clinical observation.

name: Pseudobulbar paralysis
description: Bilateral impairment of the function of the cranial nerves 9-12, which control musculature involved in eating, swallowing, and speech. Pseudobulbar paralysis is characterized clinically by dysarthria, dysphonia, and dysphagia with bifacial paralysis, and may be accompanied by Pseudobulbar behavioral symptoms such as enforced crying and laughing.

name: Absent tibia
description: Absence of the tibia.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
description: Squamous cell carcinoma of the skin is a malignant tumor of squamous epithelium.

name: Falciform retinal fold
description: An area of the retina that is buckled so that a sector-shaped sheet of retina lies in front of the normal retina. This feature is of congenital onset.

name: Decreased circulating ACTH concentration
description: The concentration of corticotropin, also known as adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH), is below the lower limit of normal in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal peripheral action potential amplitude
description: An anomaly in the magnitude of the action potential along a peripheral nerve, that is, of the rapid rise and fall of the electrical membrane potential of the nerve.

name: Periportal fibrosis
description: The presence of fibrosis affecting the interlobular stroma of liver.

name: Decreased total lymphocyte count
description: A reduced number of lymphocytes in the blood.

name: Short first metatarsal
description: Short first metatarsal bone.

name: Shortened PR interval
description: Reduced time for the PR interval (beginning of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex). In adults, normal values are 120 to 200 ms long.

name: Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system
description: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disc to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract.
synonyms: Persistent posterior fetal fibrovascular sheath of the lens
Persistent posterior foetal fibrovascular sheath of the lens

name: Distal renal tubular acidosis
description: A type of renal tubular acidosis characterized by a failure of acid secretion by the alpha intercalated cells of the cortical collecting duct of the distal nephron. The urine cannot be acidified below a pH of 5.3, associated with acidemia and hypokalemia.

name: Abnormal sella turcica morphology
description: Abnormality of the sella turcica, a saddle-shaped depression in the sphenoid bone at the base of the human skull.

name: Abnormal circulating interferon concentration
description: The concentration of an interferon is outside the limits of normal.

name: Congenital malformation of the great arteries
description: Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the aorta and pulmonary arteries.

name: Esophageal stricture
description: A pathological narrowing of the esophagus that is caused by the development of a ring of scar tissue that constricts the esophageal lumen.
synonyms: Narrowing of esophagus due to inflammation and scar tissue
Narrowing of oesophagus due to inflammation and scar tissue

name: Enamel hypoplasia
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the dental enamel.

name: Reduced number of corneal endothelial cells
description: A reduction in the number of corneal endothelial cells.

name: Prominent occiput
description: Increased convexity of the occiput (posterior part of the skull).

name: Oromandibular dystonia
description: A kind of focal dystonia characterized by forceful contractions of the face, jaw, and/or tongue causing difficulty in opening and closing the mouth and often affecting chewing and speech.

name: Abnormal urine magnesium concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of magnesium the urine.

name: Lactose intolerance
description: An inability to digest lactose.

name: Abnormal lung development
description: A structural defect associated with abnormal development of the lung.

name: Upper-limb joint contracture
description: A limitation in the passive range of motion of a joint of the upper limb resulting from loss of elasticity in the periarticular tissues owing to structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules or skin.
synonyms: Contractures of the joints of the upper limbs

name: Cutaneous syndactyly of toes
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between adjacent foot digits that involves at least half of the proximodistal length of one of the two involved digits; or, a soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between two digits of the foot that does not meet the prior objective criteria.

name: Low-grade fever
description: Mild fever that does not exceed 38.5 degrees centigrade.

name: Abnormal location of ears
description: Abnormal location of the ear.

name: Hypothalamic hamartoma
description: The presence of a hamartoma of the hypothalamus.

name: Unicoronal synostosis
description: Synostosis affecting only one of the coronal sutures.

name: Decreased circulating prealbumin concentration
description: Concentration of prealbumin in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status.

name: Abnormal facial skeleton morphology
description: An abnormality of one or more of the set of bones that make up the facial skeleton.

name: Striae distensae
description: Thinned, erythematous, depressed bands of atrophic skin. Initially, striae appear as flattened and thinned, pinkish linear regions of the skin. Striae tend to enlarge in length and become reddish or purplish. Later, striae tend to appear as white, depressed bands that are parallel to the lines of skin tension. Striae distensae occur most often in areas that have been subject to distension such as the lower back, buttocks, thighs, breast, abdomen, and shoulders.

name: Livedo
description: A reddish-blue mottled condition of skin caused by inflammation of the cutaneous blood vessels.

name: Myofibrillar myopathy
description: Myofibrillar structural changes characterized by abnormal intracellular accumulation of the intermediate filament desmin and other proteins.

name: Crumpled long bones
description: An crumpled radiographic appearance of the long bones, as if the long bone had been crushed together producing irregularities. This feature is the result of multiple fractures and repeated rounds of ineffective healing, as can be seen for instance in severe forms of osteogenesis imperfecta.

name: Abnormal cervical spine morphology
description: Any morphological abnormality of the cervical vertebral column.

name: Absence of the sacrum
description: Absence (aplasia) of the sacrum.

name: Abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts
description: An abnormality of the spinocerebellar tracts, a set of axonal fibers originating in the spinal cord and terminating in the ipsilateral cerebellum. The spinocerebellar tract convey information to the cerebellum about limb and joint position (proprioception). They comprise the ventral spinocerebellar tract, the anterior spinocerebellar tract, and the posterior spinocerebellar tract.

name: Recurrent ear infections
description: Increased susceptibility to ear infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of ear infections.

name: Abnormally high-pitched voice
description: A persistent (minutes to hours) abnormal increase in the pitch (frequency) of the voice for the context or social situation or significantly different from baseline of the individual.

name: Disseminated intravascular coagulation
description: Disseminated intravascular coagulation is characterized by the widespread activation of coagulation, which results in the intravascular formation of fibrin and ultimately thrombotic occlusion of small and midsize vessels.

name: Abnormality of fundus pigmentation
description: Any anomaly of the pigmentation of the fundus, the posterior part of the eye including the retina and optic nerve.

name: Abnormality of the supraorbital ridges
description: An anomaly of the supraorbital portion of the frontal bones.
synonyms: Abnormality of the brow of the face

name: Abnormal oral physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the mouth (which is also known as the oral cavity).

name: Abnormality of primary teeth
description: Any abnormality of the primary tooth.

name: Generalized aminoaciduria
description: An increased concentration of all types of amino acid in the urine.

name: Cognitive impairment
description: Abnormal cognition is characterized by deficits in thinking, reasoning, or remembering.

name: Abnormal ulnar metaphysis morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the portion of the ulna between the epiphysis and the diaphysis.

name: Macular dystrophy
description: Macular dystrophy is a nonspecific term for premature retinal cell aging and cell death, generally confied to the macula in which no clear extrinsic cause is evident.

name: Severe lactic acidosis
description: A severe form of lactic acidemia.

name: Flattened femoral head
description: An abnormally flattened femoral head.

name: Fibrous tissue neoplasm
description: Any neoplasm composed of fibrous tissue.

name: Fetal ascites
description: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity during the fetal period.

name: Short columella
description: Reduced distance from the anterior border of the naris to the subnasale.

name: Persistence of primary teeth
description: Persistence of the primary teeth beyond the age by which they normally are shed and replaced by the permanent teeth.

name: Broad first metatarsal
description: Increased side-to-side width of the first metatarsal bone.

name: Curvilinear intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material
description: An intracellular accumulation of autofluorescent lipopigment storage material in a curved pattern.
synonyms: Intracellular curvilinear profiles on ultrastructural analysis

name: Ureteropelvic junction obstruction
description: Blockage of urine flow from the renal pelvis to the proximal ureter.

name: Abnormal mitochondrial number
description: A deviation from the normal number of mitochondria per cell.

name: Gowers sign
description: A phenomenon whereby patients are not able to stand up without the use of the hands owing to weakness of the proximal muscles of the lower limbs.

name: Annular pancreas
description: A congenital anomaly in which the pancreas completely (or sometimes incompletely) encircles the second portion of duodenum and occasionally obstructs the more proximal duodenum.

name: Macule
description: A flat, distinct, discolored area of skin less than 1 cm wide that does not involve any change in the thickness or texture of the skin.

name: Temporal cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy of the temporal cortex.

name: Antineutrophil antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against neutrophils.

name: Hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth or abnormal thickening of bone tissue.

name: Cerebral cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy of the cortex of the cerebrum.
synonyms: Decrease in size of the outer layer of the brain due to loss of brain cells

name: External ophthalmoplegia
description: Paralysis of the external ocular muscles.
synonyms: Paralysis or weakness of muscles within or surrounding outer part of eye
Progressive paralysis or weakness of muscles of eye motility
Progressive paralysis or weakness of muscles of eye movement

name: Joint contracture of the 5th finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 5th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 5th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Abnormality of the vasculature of the eye
Abnormal granulocytopoietic cell morphology
description: An anomaly of cells involved in the formation of a granulocytes, that is, of the granulocytopoietic cell.
synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the granulocytic lineage

name: Tactile hypersensitivity
description: A decreased tolerance to physical touch.

name: Upper limb hypertonia
description: Increased muscle tone observed in the arms of the affected person.

name: Eclabion
description: A turning outward of the lip or lips, that is, eversion of the lips.

name: Limb dystonia
description: A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the limbs.

name: Bone cyst
description: A fluid filled cavity that develops with a bone.

name: Pleural effusion
description: The presence of an excessive amount of fluid in the pleural cavity.

name: Palmoplantar blistering
description: A type of blistering that affects the skin of the palms of the hands and the soles of the feet.

name: Irregular vertebral endplates
description: An irregular surface of the vertebral end plates, which are normally relatively smooth.

name: Nocturnal hypoventilation
description: An abnormal reduction in alveolar ventilation occurring during sleep. This is characterized by a rise in arterial carbon dioxide.

name: Focal emotional seizure
description: Seizures presenting with an emotion or the appearance of having an emotion as an early prominent feature, such as fear, spontaneous joy or euphoria, laughing (gelastic), or crying, (dacrystic). These emotional seizures may occur with or without objective clinical signs of a seizure evident to the observer.

name: Choanal atresia
description: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture). Most embryologists believe that posterior choanal atresia results from a failure of rupture between the 35th and 38th day of fetal life of the partition which separates the bucconasal or buccopharyngeal membranes. The resultant choanal atresia may be unilateral or bilateral, bony or membranous, complete or incomplete. In over 90 per cent of cases the obstruction is bony, while in the remainder it is membranous. The bony type of atresia is commonly located 1-2 mm. anterior to the posterior edge of the hard palate, and the osseous septum varies in thickness from 1 to 10 mm. In the membranous form of choanal atresia the obstruction usually occurs further posteriorly. In approximately one third of cases the atresia is bilateral.
synonyms: Blockage of the rear opening of the nasal cavity

name: Blind vagina
description: The vagina ends in a blind pouch or sac rather than being connected to the internal genitalia.

name: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system
description: Any abnormality of the part of the nervous system that consists of the nerves and ganglia outside of the brain and spinal cord.
synonyms: Abnormality of the peripheral nervous system

name: Weakness of the intrinsic hand muscles
Mucopolysacchariduria
description: Excessive amounts of mucopolysaccharide in the urine.

name: Abnormal circulating GABA concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the blood circulation.

name: Spermatocyte maturation arrest
description: A type of spermatogenesis maturation arrest in which the block of developmental occurs in the spermatocyte stage. Testicular histology shows seminiferous tubules with Sertoli cells, spermatogonial cells and spermatocytes but no further differentiated cells like round spermatids.

name: Exophoria
description: A form of strabismus with one or both eyes deviated outward to a milder degree than with exotropia.

name: Prolonged QRS complex
description: Increased time for the complex comprised of the Q wave, R wave, and S wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).. In adults, normal values are 0.06 - 0.10 sec.

name: Accelerated atherosclerosis
description: Atherosclerosis which occurs in a person with certain risk factors (e.g., SLE, diabetes, smoking, hypertension, hypercholesterolaemia, family history of early heart disease) at an earlier age than would occur in another person without those risk factors.

name: Increased total bilirubin
description: Increased concentration of total (conjugated and unconjugated) bilirubin in the blood.

name: Patellar subluxation
description: The kneecap normally is located within the groove termed trochlea on the distal femur and can slide up and down in it. Patellar subluxation refers to an unstable kneecap that does not slide centrally within its groove, i.e., a partial dislocation of the patella.

name: Left ventricular diastolic dysfunction
description: Abnormal function of the left ventricule during left ventricular relaxation and filling.

name: Abnormal common carotid artery morphology
description: An abnormality of the common carotid arteries, which provide the arterial supply to the head and neck and give rise to the internal carotid artery and the external carotid artery.
synonyms: Abnormality of the common carotid artery

name: Ascites
description: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity (between the layers of the peritoneum that lines the abdomen).
synonyms: Accumulation of fluid in the abdomen

name: Partial duplication of the phalanx of hand
description: A partial duplication, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance, affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a complete duplication there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones.

name: Photosensitive myoclonic seizure
description: Generalised myoclonic seizure provoked by flashing or flickering light.

name: Abnormality of iron homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of iron cation.

name: Decreased circulating free T4 concentration
description: A reduced concentration of free thyroxine (fT4) in the blood circulation.

name: Enlarged sylvian cistern
description: An increase in size of the subarachnoid space associated with the lateral cerebral sulcus (Sylvian fissure).

name: Bicoronal synostosis
description: Synostosis affecting the right and the left coronal suture.

name: Hypolipoproteinemia
description: An abnormal decrease in the level of lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood.

name: Apnea
description: Lack of breathing with no movement of the respiratory muscles and no exchange of air in the lungs. This term refers to a disposition to have recurrent episodes of apnea rather than to a single event.

name: Nemaline bodies
description: Nemaline rods are abnormal bodies that can occur in skeletal muscle fibers. The rods can be observed on histological analysis of muscle biopsy tissue or upon electron microscopy, where they appear either as extensions of sarcomeric Z-lines, in random array without obvious attachment to Z-lines (often in areas devoid of sarcomeres) or in large clusters localized at the sarcolemma or intermyofibrillar spaces.

name: Duplicated collecting system
description: A duplication of the collecting system of the kidney, defined as a kidney with two (instead of, normally, one) pyelocaliceal systems. The pyelocaliceal system is comprised of the renal pelvis and calices. The duplicated renal collecting system can be associated with a single ureter or with double ureters. In the latter case, the two ureters empty separately into the bladder or fuse to form a single ureteral orifice.
synonyms: Double urinary collecting systems on intravenous pyelography

name: Abnormality of the curvature of the cornea
Abnormal neural tube morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the hollow epithelial tube found on the dorsal side of the vertebrate embryo that develops into the central nervous system (i.e. brain and spinal cord).

name: Abnormal sternum morphology
description: An anomaly of the sternum, also known as the breastbone.

name: Micronodular cirrhosis
description: A type of cirrhosis characterized by the presence of small regenerative nodules.

name: Loss of ambulation
description: Inability to walk in a person who previous had the ability to walk.

name: Decreased serum leptin
description: A decreased concentration of leptin in the blood.

name: Ovotestis
description: A gonad that contains both ovarian follicles and testicular tubular elements.

name: Absent circulating B cells
description: Absence of detectable circulating B cells, commonly characterized as CD19+ or CD20+ lymphocytes, in the blood. Usually, less than 20 cells per microlitre is considered to be an absence.

name: Abnormality of subcutaneous fat tissue
synonyms: Abnormality of fatty tissue below the skin

name: Hemimegalencephaly
description: Enlargement of all or parts of one cerebral hemisphere.

name: Anterior beaking of lumbar vertebrae
description: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies of the lumbar spine.
synonyms: Anterior tongue-like protrusion of lumbar vertebral bodies

name: Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformation
description: Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformation is a choroidal type of arteriovenous malformation that develops between 6 and 11 weeks of gestation. It results from 1 or more arteriovenous fistulas shunting blood toward the prosencephalic vein of Markowski, the embryonic precursor of the vein of Galen. This abnormal shunt leads to progressive dilation of the vein and prevents its involution and subsequent development into the vein of Galen.

name: Contracture of the distal interphalangeal joint of the fingers
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in one or more distal interphalangeal joints of the fingers.

name: Abnormal palate morphology
description: Any abnormality of the palate, i.e., of roof of the mouth.
synonyms: Abnormality of the roof of the mouth

name: Lop ear
description: Anterior and inferior folding of the upper portion of the ear that obliterates triangular fossa and scapha.

name: Aplastic anemia
description: Aplastic anemia is defined as pancytopenia with a hypocellular marrow.

name: Oliguria
description: Low output of urine, clinically classified as an output below 300-500ml/day.

name: Abnormal helix morphology
description: An abnormality of the helix. The helix is the outer rim of the ear that extends from the insertion of the ear on the scalp (root) to the termination of the cartilage at the earlobe.

name: Abnormal saccadic eye movements
description: An abnormality of eye movement characterized by impairment of fast (saccadic) eye movements.

name: Delayed puberty
description: Passing the age when puberty normally occurs with no physical or hormonal signs of the onset of puberty.

name: Progressive ptosis
description: A progressive form of ptosis.

name: Melena
description: The passage of blackish, tarry feces associated with gastrointestinal hemorrhage. Melena occurs if the blood remains in the colon long enough for it to be broken down by colonic bacteria. One degradation product, hematin, imbues the stool with a blackish color. Thus, melena generally occurs with bleeding from the upper gastrointestinal tract (e.g., stomach ulcers or duodenal ulcers), since the blood usually remains in the gut for a longer period of time than with lower gastrointestinal bleeding.

name: Episcleritis
description: Inflammation of the episclera, a thin layer of tissue covering the white part (sclera) of the eye.
synonyms: Inflammation of the thin layer on top of the white part of eye

name: Mesoaxial foot polydactyly
description: The presence of a supernumerary toe (not a hallux) involving the third or fourth metatarsal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Abnormal transition from sleep to wakefulness
description: Abnormal transition of consciousness from wakefulness to sleep.

name: Central apnea
description: Apnea resulting from depression of the respiratory centers in the medulla oblongata. There is a lack of respiratory effort rather than obstruction of airflow.

name: Intermittent thrombocytopenia
description: Reduced platelet count that occurs sporadically, i.e., it comes and goes.

name: Acholic stools
description: Clay colored stools lacking bile pigment.

name: Hepatic vein thrombosis
description: An obstruction in the veins of the liver caused by a blood clot (thrombosis).

name: Peripheral arterial stenosis
description: Narrowing of peripheral arteries with reduction of blood flow to the limbs. This feature may be quantified as an ankle-brachial index of less than 0.9, and may be manifested clinically as claudication.

name: Deviated nasal septum
description: Positioning of the nasal septum to the right or left in contrast to the normal midline position of the nasal septum.

name: Limited extraocular movements
description: Limited mobility of the eye within its socket.

name: Dysplasia of the femoral head
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the femoral head.

name: Obstructive azoospermia
description: Absence of any measurable level of sperm in his semen, resulting from post-testicular obstruction or retrograde ejaculation. This can be differentiated from obstructive azoospermia on the basis of testicular biopsy.

name: Progressive spasticity
description: Spasticity that increases in degree with time.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the 3rd finger
synonyms: Abnormality of terminal phalanx of middle-finger
Abnormality of the outermost bone of the 3rd finger

name: Epithelial neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from and is composed of epithelial cells. This category include adenomas, papillomas, and carcinomas [NCIT:C3709].

name: Abnormal rib morphology
description: An anomaly of the rib.

name: Broad thumb
description: Increased thumb width without increased dorso-ventral dimension.

name: Abnormal finger flexion crease
description: Anomalous flexion crease (i.e., a transverse line that crosses the skin of a finger).

name: Brachycephaly
description: An abnormality of skull shape characterized by a decreased anterior-posterior diameter. That is, a cephalic index greater than 81%. Alternatively, an apparently shortened anteroposterior dimension (length) of the head compared to width.

name: Abnormal sexual behavior
description: A deviation of sexual behaviors from the personal norms of the individual in the context of socially and culturally recognized patterns of human sexual behaviors.

name: Severe infection
description: A type of infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection because of unusual severity or intensity of the infection.

name: Dexamethasone-suppressible primary hyperaldosteronism
description: A form of primary hyperaldosteronism in which the overproduction of aldosterone can be suppressed by the administration of dexamethasone.

name: Narrow face
description: Bizygomatic (upper face) and bigonial (lower face) width are both more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or, an apparent reduction in the width of the upper and lower face (subjective).

name: Abnormal clavicle morphology
description: Any abnormality of the clavicles (collar bones).

name: Laterally extended eyebrow
description: An eyebrow that extends laterally beyond the orbital rim rather than turning gently downward at that location.

name: Follicular hyperkeratosis
description: A skin condition characterized by excessive development of keratin in hair follicles, resulting in rough, cone-shaped, elevated papules resulting from closure of hair follicles with a white plug of sebum.

name: Onychogryphosis
description: Onychogryphosis is a disorder of nail plate growth that is clinically characterized by an opaque, yellow-brown thickening of the nail plate with associated gross hyperkeratosis, elongation, and increased curvature.

name: Angle closure glaucoma
description: A type of glaucomatous optic neuropathy in an eye that has evidence of angle closure (i.e. significant iridotrabecular contact).

name: Abnormal left ventricle morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the left ventricle of the heart.

name: Pulmonary interstitial high-resolution computed tomography abnormality
description: High-resolution computed tomography (HRCT) can distinguish findings that characterize characterize interstitial lung diseases in a way not possible with other modalities.

name: Cutis laxa
description: Wrinkled, redundant, inelastic and sagging skin.

name: 3-4 finger cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the A/P axis between fingers 3 and 4.

name: CNS demyelination
description: A loss of myelin from nerve fibers in the central nervous system.

name: Depressed nasal ridge
description: Lack of prominence of the nose resulting from a posteriorly-placed nasal ridge.

name: Hand polydactyly
description: A kind of polydactyly characterized by the presence of a supernumerary finger or fingers.

name: Hyperpituitarism
description: Hypersecretion of one or more pituitary hormones. This can occur in conditions in which deficiency in the target organ leads to decreased hormonal feedback, or as a primary condition most usually in connection with a pituitary adenoma.

name: Jaundice
description: Yellow pigmentation of the skin due to bilirubin, which in turn is the result of increased bilirubin concentration in the bloodstream.

name: Granuloma
description: A compact, organized collection of mature mononuclear phagocytes, which may be but is not necessarily accompanied by accessory features such as necrosis.

name: Vertebral fusion
description: A developmental defect leading to the union of two adjacent vertebrae.

name: Abnormal CSF carboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a carboxylic acid in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Pituitary hypothyroidism
description: A type of hypothyroidism that results from a defect in thyroid-stimulating hormone secretion.
synonyms: Low thyroid gland function due to abnormal pituitary gland

name: Low back pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the lower back.

name: Abnormal pulmonary thoracic imaging finding
description: This term groups terms representing abnormal findings derived from chest X-ray investigation of the lung. In general, lung abnormalities can manifest as opacities (areas of increased density) or as regions with decreased density.

name: Abnormality of skin pigmentation
description: An abnormality of the pigmentation of the skin.

name: Abnormal circulating creatinine concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of creatinine in the blood.

name: Palmoplantar erythema
description: Redness of the skin of the palm of the hand and the sole of the foot caused by hyperemia of the capillaries in the lower layers of the skin.

name: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure on awakening
description: Bilateral tonic-clonic seizure of either generalized or focal onset occurring on or soon after wakening (typically within 90 minutes of waking, regardless of the time of day).

name: Abnormal scrotum morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the scrotum, i.e., the sac that contains the testes, epididymis, and the lower part of the spermatic cord.

name: Anisocoria
description: Anisocoria, or unequal pupil size, may represent a benign physiologic variant or a manifestation of disease.

name: Methylmalonic acidemia
description: Increased concentration of methylmalonic acid in the blood.

name: Weak voice
description: Reduced intensity (volume) of speech.

name: Rotary nystagmus
description: A form of nystagmus in which the eyeball makes rotary motions around the axis.

name: Premature graying of hair
description: Development of gray hair at a younger than normal age.

name: Increased bone mineral density
description: An abnormal increase of bone mineral density, that is, of the amount of matter per cubic centimeter of bones which is often referred to as osteosclerosis. Osteosclerosis can be detected on radiological examination as an increased whiteness (density) of affected bones.

name: Thoracic aorta calcification
description: An accumulation of calcium and phosphate in arteries with mineral deposits in the intimal or medial layer of the vessel wall in the thoracic aorta.

name: Sertoli cell neoplasm
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the testis with origin in a Sertoli cell.

name: Meconium ileus
description: Obstruction of the intestine due to abnormally thick meconium.

name: Horizontal pendular nystagmus
description: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements of equal velocity.

name: Decreased circulating IgG subclass concentration
description: A reduction below the normal concentration of a subclass of immunoglobulin G (IgG) in the blood.
synonyms: Decreased IgG subclass level in blood

name: Calcification of the aorta
description: Calcification, that is, pathological deposition of calcium salts in the aorta.

name: Decreased circulating cortisol level
description: Abnormally reduced concentration of cortisol in the blood.

name: Increased glutamine family amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of an glutamine family amino acid in the urine.

name: Abnormal circulating serine family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a serine family amino acid in the blood circulation.
synonyms: Abnormality of serine family amino acid metabolism

name: Webbed neck
description: Pterygium colli is a congenital skin fold that runs along the sides of the neck down to the shoulders. It involves an ectopic fibrotic facial band superficial to the trapezius muscle. Excess hair-bearing skin is also present and extends down the cervical region well beyond the normal hairline.

name: Sterile abscess
description: An abscess not caused by infection with pyogenic bacteria. Operationally, a sterile abscess is inferred if investigations of an abscess fail to reveal evidence of pathogenic organisms.

name: Thyroiditis
description: Inflammation of the thyroid gland.

name: Hypoplastic dermoepidermal hemidesmosomes
description: Underdeveloped hemidesmosomes at the dermoepidermal junction. Hemidesmosomes are the specialized junctional complexes, that contribute to the attachment of epithelial cells to the underlying basement membrane in stratified and other complex epithelia, such as the skin.

name: Alzheimer disease
description: A degenerative disease of the brain characterized by the insidious onset of dementia. Impairment of memory, judgment, attention span, and problem solving skills are followed by severe apraxia and a global loss of cognitive abilities. The condition primarily occurs after age 60, and is marked pathologically by severe cortical atrophy and the triad of senile plaques, neurofibrillary tangles, and neuropil threads.
synonyms: Late-onset form of familial Alzheimer disease

name: Abnormal hair quantity
description: An abnormal amount of hair.

name: Abnormal anterior eye segment morphology
description: An abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball (which comprises the structures in front of the vitreous humor: the cornea, iris, ciliary body, and lens).
synonyms: Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eye
Abnormality of the anterior segment of the eyeball
Abnormality of the anterior segment of the globe

name: Anal fissure
description: A small tear in the thin, moist tissue (mucosa) that lines the anus. It appears as a crack or slit in the mucous membrane of the anus.

name: Epileptic encephalopathy
description: A condition in which epileptiform abnormalities are believed to contribute to the progressive disturbance in cerebral function. Epileptic encephalaopathy is characterized by (1) electrographic EEG paroxysmal activity that is often aggressive, (2) seizures that are usually multiform and intractable, (3) cognitive, behavioral and neurological deficits that may be relentless, and (4) sometimes early death.

name: Metatarsus valgus
description: A condition in which the anterior part of the foot rotates outward away from the midline of the body and the heel remains straight.

name: Congenital malformation of the right heart
description: Defect or defects of the morphogenesis of the right heart identifiable at birth.

name: Hyporeflexia of upper limbs
description: Reduced intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in the upper limbs. Reflexes are elicited by stretching the tendon of a muscle, e.g., by tapping.

name: Abnormal circulating organic compound concentration
description: Any deviation of the concentration of an orrganic compound from the normal range. An organic compound is defined as any compound that contains a carbon atom.

name: Impaired ocular abduction
description: An impaired ability of the eye to move in the outward direction (towards the side of the head).

name: Eyelid myoclonia seizure
description: An eyelid myoclonia seizure is a type of generalized myoclonic seizure which may or may not be associated with loss of awareness.

name: Broad chin
description: Increased width of the midpoint of the mandible (mental protuberance) and overlying soft tissue.

name: Absent hand
description: The total absence of the hand, with no bony elements distal to the radius or ulna.

name: Hyperreflexia
description: Hyperreflexia is the presence of hyperactive stretch reflexes of the muscles.

name: Hypsarrhythmia
description: Hypsarrhythmia is abnormal interictal high amplitude waves and a background of irregular spikes. There is continuous (during wakefulness), high-amplitude (>200 Hz), generalized polymorphic slowing with no organized background and multifocal spikes demonstrated by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Abnormality of the testis size
description: An anomaly of the size of the testicle (the male gonad).

name: Compulsive behaviors
description: Behavior that consists of repetitive acts, characterized by the feeling that one "has to" perform them, while being aware that these acts are not in line with one's overall goal.

name: Glomerular deposits
description: An abnormal accumulation of protein in the glomerulus.

name: Hamartoma of the eye
description: A hamartoma (disordered proliferation of mature tissues) which can originate from any tissue of the eye.

name: Decreased circulating complement factor B concentration
description: Concentration of the complement component factor B in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Thoracic platyspondyly
description: A flattened vertebral body shape with reduced distance between the vertebral endplates affecting the thoracic spine.

name: Depression
description: Frequently experiencing feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; struggling to recover from these moods; having a pessimistic outlook on the future; feeling a pervasive sense of shame; having a low self-worth; experiencing thoughts of suicide and engaging in suicidal behavior.

name: Liver abscess
description: A circumscribed area of pus or necrotic debris in the liver.

name: Metatarsal synostosis
synonyms: Fusion of the long bones of the feet

name: Neoplasm of the stomach
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the stomach.

name: Abnormal left atrium morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the left atrium.

name: Abnormal antihelix morphology
description: An abnormality of the antihelix.

name: Absent distal interphalangeal creases
description: Absence of the distal interphalangeal flexion creases of the fingers.
synonyms: Absence of skin creases over distal interphalangeal joints
Aplasia of the distal interphalangeal creases

name: Small earlobe
description: Reduced volume of the earlobe.

name: Primary hypercortisolism
description: Hypercortisolemia associated with a primary defect of the adrenal gland leading to overproduction of cortisol.

name: Ineffective esophageal peristalsis
description: Reduced or inadequate esophageal peristalsis, with resultant slow passage of contents through the esophagus.

name: Increased neuronal autofluorescent lipopigment
description: Lipofuscin, a generic term applied to autofluorescent lipopigment, is a mixture of protein and lipid that accumulates in most aging cells, particularly those involved in high lipid turnover (e.g., the adrenal medulla) or phagocytosis of other cell types (e g., the retinal pigment epithelium or RPE; macrophage). This term pertains if there is an increase in the neuronal accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

name: Postaxial hand polydactyly
description: Supernumerary digits located at the ulnar side of the hand (that is, on the side with the fifth finger).

name: Abnormal dense granules
description: Defective structure, size or content of dense granules, platelet organelles that contain granules proaggregatory factors such as adenosine diphosphate (ADP), adenosine triphosphate (ATP), ionized calcium, histamine and serotonin.

name: Neck flexor weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles involved in neck flexion (sternocleidomastoid, longus capitus, longus colli, and scalenus anterior).

name: Increased inflammatory response
description: A abnormal increase in the inflammatory response to injury or infection.

name: Overfriendliness
description: A form of hypersociability that presents as mostly inappropriate friendliness towards others.
synonyms: Excessive eagerness to interact with others

name: Heterotropia
description: Manifest deviation of the visual axes not controlled by fusion.

name: Abnormal circulating serine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine in the blood circulation.

name: Tented upper lip vermilion
description: Triangular appearance of the oral aperture with the apex in the midpoint of the upper vermilion and the lower vermilion forming the base.

name: Arthralgia
description: Joint pain.

name: Increased total lymphocyte count
description: Increase in the number or proportion of lymphocytes in the blood.

name: Cessation of head growth
description: Stagnation of head growth seen as flattening of the head circumference curve.

name: Aspiration pneumonia
description: Pneumonia due to the aspiration (breathing in) of food, liquid, or gastric contents into the upper respiratory tract.

name: Abnormal circulating monocarboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a monocarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Right ventricular dilatation
description: Enlargement of the chamber of the right ventricle, which can be defined echocardiographically as a right ventricular to left ventricular ratio greater than 1:1.

name: Aortic dissection
description: Aortic dissection refers to a tear in the intimal layer of the aorta causing a separation between the intima and the medial layers of the aorta.
synonyms: Tear in inner wall of large artery that carries blood away from heart

name: Shortening of all middle phalanges of the fingers
description: Short, hypoplastic middle phalanx of finger, affecting all fingers.

name: Severe photosensitivity
description: A severe degree of photosensitivity of the skin.

name: Narrow pelvis bone
description: Reduced side to side width of the pelvis.

name: Abnormal libido
description: Any deviation from the normal sexual drive or desire for sexual activity.

name: Focal motor seizure
description: A type of focal-onset seizure characterized by a motor sign as its initial semiological manifestation.

name: Heparan sulfate excretion in urine
description: An increased concentration of heparan sulfates in the urine.

name: Megacystis
description: Dilatation of the bladder postnatally.

name: Holoprosencephaly
description: Holoprosencephaly is a structural anomaly of the brain in which the developing forebrain fails to divide into two separate hemispheres and ventricles.

name: Abnormal foot bone ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of foot.
synonyms: Abnormality of the mineralisation and ossification of bones of the feet
Abnormal ossification involving bones of the feet

name: Abnormal systemic blood pressure
description: A chronic deviation from normal pressure in the systemic arterial system.

name: Knuckle pad
description: Knuckle pads are benign fibrofatty subcutaneous pads located over the proximal interphalangeal (PIP) joints that can be mistaken for arthritis. Rarely they affect the dorsal aspect of the metacarpophalangeal (MCP) joints. Clinically they are painless and often affect both hands in an asymmetrical pattern.
synonyms: Knuckle pads on dorsal aspect of finger joints

name: Postprandial hyperglycemia
description: An increased concentration of glucose in the blood following a meal.

name: Mild global developmental delay
description: A mild delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

name: Episodic flaccid weakness
description: Recurrent episodes of muscle flaccidity, a type of paralysis in which a muscle becomes soft and yields to passive stretching.

name: Increased fecal porphyrin
description: Abnormally high concentration of fecal porphyrins in feces.

name: Titubation
description: Nodding movement of the head or body.

name: Peritoneal abscess
description: The presence of an abscess of the peritoneum.

name: Cataplexy
description: A sudden and transient episode of bilateral loss of muscle tone, often triggered by emotions.

name: Abnormality of the sense of smell
description: An anomaly in the ability to perceive and distinguish scents (odors).
synonyms: Abnormality of the sense of smell

name: Deep palmar crease
description: Excessively deep creases of the palm.

name: Posterior scalloping of vertebral bodies
description: An excessive concavity of the posterior surface of one or more vertebral bodies.

name: Abnormal circulating thyroid hormone concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal range of the hormones produced by the thyroid gland.

name: Abnormal vas deferens morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the secretory duct of the testicle that carries spermatozoa from the epididymis to the prostatic urethra where it terminates to form ejaculatory duct.

name: Abnormal size of the palpebral fissures
description: An abnormal size of the palpebral fissures for example unusually long or short palpebral fissures.
synonyms: Abnormal size of the opening between the eyelids

name: Dysesthesia
description: Painful sensations elicited by a nonpainful cutaneous stimulus such as a light touch or gentle stroking over affected areas of the body. Sometimes referred to as hyperpathia or hyperalgesia. Often perceived as an intense burning, dyesthesias may outlast the stimulus by several seconds.

name: Abnormal basophil morphology
description: Any structural abnormality or abnormal count of basophils.

name: Decreased cervical spine flexion due to contractures of posterior cervical muscles
synonyms: Inability to touch chin to chest

name: Renal steatosis
description: Abnormal fat accumulation in the kidneys.

name: Hypercalcemia
description: An abnormally increased calcium concentration in the blood.

name: Recurrent Aspergillus infections
description: An increased susceptibility to Aspergillus infections, as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of Aspergillus infections.

name: Uterus didelphys
description: A malformation of the uterus in which the uterus is present as a paired organ as a result of the failure of fusion of the mullerian ducts during embryogenesis.

name: Enlarged naris
description: Increased aperture of the nostril.

name: Parotitis
description: Inflammation of the parotid gland.

name: Highly elevated creatine kinase
description: An increased CPK level between 4X and 50X above the upper normal level.

name: Abnormal circulating cholesterol concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of cholesterol in the blood circulation.

name: Slowly progressive
description: Applies to a disease manifestation that only slowly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.
synonyms: Signs and symptoms worsen slowly with time

name: Tetany
description: A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magnesium deficiency.

name: Small thenar eminence
description: Underdevelopment of the thenar eminence with reduced palmar soft tissue mass surrounding the base of the thumb.

name: Tapered finger
description: The gradual reduction in girth of the finger from proximal to distal.

name: Abnormal midface morphology
description: An anomaly of the midface, which is a region and not an anatomical term. It extends, superiorly, from the inferior orbital margin to, inferiorly, the level of nasal base. It is formed by the maxilla (upper jaw) and zygoma and cheeks and malar region. Traditionally, the nose and premaxilla are not included in the midface.

name: Hyposmia
description: A decreased sensitivity to odorants (that is, a decreased ability to perceive odors).

name: Abnormal scapula morphology
description: Any abnormality of the scapula, also known as the shoulder blade.

name: Thoracolumbar kyphosis
description: Hyperconvexity of the thoracolumbar spine producing a rounded or humped appearance.

name: Hydroureter
description: The distention of the ureter with urine.

name: Limb fasciculations
description: Fasciculations affecting the musculature of the arms and legs.

name: Gliosis
description: Gliosis is the focal proliferation of glial cells in the central nervous system.

name: Adenocarcinoma of the small intestine
description: A malignant epithelial tumor with a glandular organization that originates in the small intestine.

name: Abnormal jejunum morphology
description: An abnormality of the jejunum, i.e., of the middle section of the small intestine.

name: Scalp tenderness
description: Pain or discomfort of the scalp elicited by palpation.

name: Salivary gland neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of a salivary gland.

name: Atrophic gastritis
description: Atrophic gastritis (AG) is a histopathological entity that is characterized by chronic inflammation of the gastric mucosa with loss of gastric glandular cells and replacement by intestinal-type epithelium, pyloric-type glands, and fibrous tissue.

name: Premature loss of permanent teeth
description: Premature loss of the permanent teeth.

name: Motor axonal neuropathy
description: Progressive impairment of function of motor axons with muscle weakness, atrophy, and cramps. The deficits are length-dependent, meaning that muscles innervated by the longest nerves are affected first, so that for instance the arms are affected at a later age than the onset of deficits involving the lower leg.

name: Abnormal platelet function
description: Any anomaly in the function of thrombocytes.

name: Abnormality of vision
description: Abnormality of eyesight (visual perception).

name: Deviation of the 4th finger
description: Displacement of the 4th finger from its normal position.

name: Abnormal male internal genitalia morphology
description: An abnormality of the male internal genitalia.

name: Renal duplication
description: A congenital anomaly of the urinary tract, in which the kidney is duplicated and is drained via two separate renal pelves and ureters.

name: Abnormal cell proliferation
description: Any abnormality in the multiplication or reproduction of cells, which may result in the expansion of a cell population.

name: Dicarboxylic aciduria
description: An increased concentration of dicarboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Ptosis
description: The upper eyelid margin is positioned 3 mm or more lower than usual and covers the superior portion of the iris (objective); or, the upper lid margin obscures at least part of the pupil (subjective).

name: Short palm
description: Short palm.

name: Abnormal circulating amino acid concentration
description: The presence of an abnormal decrease or increase of one or more amino acids in the blood circulation.
synonyms: Abnormality of serum amino acid level
Abnormality of serum amino acid levels

name: Neoplasm of the liver
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the liver.

name: Intermittent hyperventilation
description: Episodic hyperventilation.

name: Absence of subcutaneous fat
description: Lack of subcutaneous adipose tissue.
synonyms: Lack of fatty tissue below the skin

name: Long penis
description: Penile length more than 2 SD above the mean for age.

name: Primitive neuroectodermal tumor
description: A tumor that originates in cells from the primitive neural crest. This group of tumors is characteirzed by the presence of primitive cells with elements of neuronal and/or glial differentiation.

name: Abnormal mitochondria in muscle tissue
description: An abnormality of the mitochondria in muscle tissue.

name: Abnormal tracheal morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the trachea.

name: Fetal distress
description: An intrauterine state characterized by suboptimal values in the fetal heart rate, oxygenation of fetal blood, or other parameters indicative of compromise of the fetus. Signs of fetal distress include repetitive variable decelerations, fetal tachycardia or bradycardia, late decelerations, or low biophysical profile.

name: Endocardial fibrosis
description: The presence of excessive connective tissue in the endocardium.

name: Retinal dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the retina.

name: Abnormal pupillary function
description: A functional abnormality of the pupil.

name: Response to drugs acting on neuromuscular transmission
description: Specific drugs interfere selectively with the different cellular mechanisms involved in neuromuscular transmission (synthesis, storage, release, action and inactivation of transmitter). The response of a patient to a specific drug can therefore be useful information for the differential diagnosis.

name: Hyperuricosuria
description: An abnormally high level of uric acid in the urine.

name: Fat malabsorption
description: Abnormality of the absorption of fat from the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Colorectal polyposis
description: Multiple abnormal growths that arise from the lining of the large intestine (colon or rectum) and protrude into the intestinal lumen.

name: Hypoplastic pubic ramus
description: Underdevelopment of a ramus (branch) of the pubic bone.

name: Periodic hypokalemic paresis
description: Episodes of muscle weakness associated with reduced levels of potassium in the blood.

name: Typified by incomplete penetrance
description: Description of conditions in which not all individuals with a given genotype exhibit the disease. Penetrance is the proportion that develop disease given a lifespan of 80 years.

name: Biliary atresia
description: Atresia of the biliary tree.

name: Schizencephaly
description: The presence of a cleft in the cerebral cortex unilaterally or bilaterally, usually located in the frontal area.

name: Long eyelashes
description: Mid upper eyelash length >10 mm or increased length of the eyelashes (subjective).

name: Craniofacial dysostosis
description: A characteristic appearance resulting from defective ossification of craniofacial bones.

name: Xanthomatosis
description: The presence of multiple xanthomas (xanthomata) in the skin. Xanthomas are yellowish, firm, lipid-laden nodules in the skin.
synonyms: Yellow bumps of fatty deposits on skin

name: Anonychia
description: Aplasia of the nail.

name: Abnormal choroid morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the choroid.

name: Frontotemporal dementia
description: A dementia associated with degeneration of the frontotemporal lobe and clinically associated with personality and behavioral changes such as disinhibition, apathy, and lack of insight. The hallmark feature of frontotemporal dementia is the presentation with focal syndromes such as progressive language dysfunction, or aphasia, or behavioral changes characteristic of frontal lobe disorders.

name: Abnormal hair pattern
description: An abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.

name: Elevated mean arterial pressure
description: An abnormal increase in the average blood pressure in an individual during a single cardiac cycle.

name: Bifid tongue
description: Tongue with a median apical indentation or fork.

name: Abnormal reticulocyte morphology
description: A reticulocyte abnormality.

name: Thyroid defect in oxidation and organification of iodide
Abnormal cartilage morphology
description: Any morphological abnormality of cartilage.

name: Cavum septum pellucidum
description: If the two laminae of the septum pellucidum are not fused then a fluid-filled space or cavum is present. The cavum septum pellucidum is present at birth but usually obliterates by the age of 3 to 6 months. It is up to 1cm in width and the walls are parallel. It is an enclosed space and is not part of the ventricular system or connected with the subarachnoid space.

name: Abnormality of the spleen
description: An abnormality of the spleen.

name: Hypoplastic ischia
description: Underdevelopment of the ischium, which forms the lower and back part of the hip bone.

name: Abnormality of thyroid physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the thyroid gland.

name: Skin vesicle
description: A circumscribed, fluid-containing, epidermal elevation generally considered less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point.

name: Bone pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to bone.

name: Myoclonic absence seizure
description: Myoclonic absence seizure is a type of generalized non-motor (absence) seizure characterized by an interruption of ongoing activities, a blank stare and rhythmic three-per-second myoclonic movements, causing ratcheting abduction of the upper limbs leading to progressive arm elevation, and associated with 3 Hz generalized spike-wave discharges on the electroencephalogram. Duration is typically 10-60 s. Whilst impairment of consciousness may not be obvious the ILAE classified this seizure as a generalized non-motor seizure in 2017.

name: Slow pupillary light response
description: Reduced velocity and acceleration in the pupillary light response.

name: Calcinosis
description: Formation of calcium deposits in any soft tissue.
synonyms: Calcium buildup in soft tissues of body

name: Shawl scrotum
description: Superior margin of the scrotum superior to the base of the penis.

name: Spinal rigidity
description: Reduced ability to move the vertebral column with a resulting limitation of neck and trunk flexion.

name: Limitation of movement at ankles
description: An abnormal limitation of the mobility of the ankle joint.

name: Moderate global developmental delay
description: A moderate delay in the achievement of motor or mental milestones in the domains of development of a child.

name: Pleuritis
description: Inflammation of the pleura.
synonyms: Inflammation of tissues lining lungs and chest

name: Cafe-au-lait spot
description: Cafe-au-lait spots are hyperpigmented lesions that can vary in color from light brown to dark brown with smooth borders and having a size of 1.5 cm or more in adults and 0.5 cm or more in children.

name: Wide cranial sutures
description: An abnormally increased width of the cranial sutures for age-related norms (generally resulting from delayed closure).

name: Hypertonia
description: A condition in which there is increased muscle tone so that arms or legs, for example, are stiff and difficult to move.

name: Impaired tandem gait
description: Reduced ability to walk in a straight line while placing the feet heel to toe.

name: Abnormal sperm axoneme morphology
description: Abnormal structure of the sperm axonemal structure which consists of a ring of nine microtubular doublets and a central pair of microtubules, giving the classical 9+2 microtubular arrangement. The axoneme contains a central pair of microtubules (C1 and C2) that are connected by a bridge-like structure forming the central pair complex (CPC). Each of the nine outer doublets is composed of type A and B microtubules and connected by radial spokes to the CPC.

name: Meconium stained amniotic fluid
description: Amniotic fluid containing the earliest stools of a mammalian infant.

name: Abnormality of the orbital region
synonyms: Abnormality of the region around the eyes
Anomaly of the orbital region of the face
Deformity of the orbital region of the face
Malformation of the orbital region of the face

name: Abnormality of spinal facet joint
description: An anomaly of the small joints located between and behind adjacent vertebrae.

name: Miosis
description: Abnormal (non-physiological) constriction of the pupil.

name: Type II transferrin isoform profile
description: Abnormal transferrin isoform profile consistent with a type II congenital disorder of glycosylation.
synonyms: Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type II pattern
Isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin consistent with CDG type II
Abnormal isoelectric focusing of serum transferrin, type 2 pattern

name: Abnormal ureter physiology
description: A functional abnormality of the ureter. The ureter is the duct by which urine passes from the kidney to the bladder.

name: Subependymal cysts
description: Cerebral cysts, usually located in the wall of the caudate nucleus or in the caudothalamic groove. They are found in up to 5.2% of all neonates, using transfontanellar ultrasound in the first days of life.

name: Abnormal platelet volume
description: Anomalous size of platelets. Most normal sized platelets are 1.5 to 3 micrometers in diameter. Large platelets are 4 to 7 micrometers. Giant platelets are larger than 7 micrometers and usually 10 to 20 micrometers.

name: Paraplegia
description: Severe or complete weakness of both lower extremities with sparing of the upper extremities.

name: Abnormality of the distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Any anomaly of the distal phalanx of thumb.
synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost bone of the thumb

name: Negativism
description: Opposing or not responding to instructions or external stimuli.

name: Arthralgia of the hip
description: Joint pain affecting the hip.

name: Abnormal ciliary body morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the ciliary body.

name: Overgrowth
description: Excessive postnatal growth which may comprise increased weight, increased length, and/or increased head circumference.

name: Hypocalciuria
description: An abnormally decreased calcium concentration in the urine.

name: Broad finger
description: Increased width of a non-thumb digit of the hand.

name: Abnormal cardiac biomarker test
description: Abnormal blood test results measuring creatine kinase (CK), CK-MB, troponin (TROPI), myoglobin, and/or cardiac enzymes.

name: Recurrent abscess formation
description: An increased susceptibility to abscess formation, as manifested by a medical history of recurrent abscesses.

name: Decreased level of coenzyme Q10 in skeletal muscle
description: Reduced amount of coenzyme Q10,a naturally occurring quinone, in skeletal muscle tissue.

name: Interrupted aortic arch
description: Non-continuity of the arch of aorta with an atretic point or absent segment.

name: Dorsocervical fat pad
description: An area of fat accumulation at the back of the neck in the form of a hump.

name: Alobar holoprosencephaly
description: A type of holoprosencephaly characterized by the presence of a single ventricle and no separation of the cerebral hemisphere. The single midline ventricle is often greatly enlarged.

name: Keratoconjunctivitis
description: Inflammation of the cornea and conjunctiva.

name: Chronic diarrhea
description: The presence of chronic diarrhea, which is usually taken to mean diarrhea that has persisted for over 4 weeks.

name: Gout
description: Recurrent attacks of acute inflammatory arthritis of a joint or set of joints caused by elevated levels of uric acid in the blood which crystallize and are deposited in joints, tendons, and surrounding tissues.

name: Enlarged joints
description: Increase in size of one or more joints.

name: Abnormal lower-limb motor evoked potentials
description: An anomaly identified by motor evoked potentials (MEPs) in the leg.
synonyms: Abnormal motor evoked potentials in the lower limb

name: Abnormal glial cell morphology
description: An abnormality of the glia cell.

name: Neonatal asphyxia
description: Respiratory failure in the newborn.

name: Abnormal myocardium morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the muscle layer of the heart wall.

name: Abnormal thorax morphology
description: Any abnormality of the thorax (the region of the body formed by the sternum, the thoracic vertebrae and the ribs).
synonyms: Structural abnormality of the chest wall

name: Abnormal stool composition
description: Abnormal level of metabolite or other abnormal analyte result in a stool test.

name: Urethral diverticulum
description: The presence of a diverticulum (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urethra.

name: Abdominal situs ambiguus
description: An abnormality in which the abdominal organs are positioned in such a way with respect to each other and the left-right axis as to be not clearly lateralised and thus have neither the usual, or normal (situs solitus), nor the mirror-imaged (situs inversus) arrangements.

name: Diaphragmatic paralysis
description: The presence of a paralyzed diaphragm.

name: Abnormal megakaryocyte morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of megakaryocytes. Mature blood platelets are released from the cytoplasm of megakaryocytes, which are bone-marrow resident cells.
synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the megakaryocyte lineage

name: Chronic hepatitis
description: Hepatitis that lasts for more than six months.

name: Macroorchidism
description: The presence of abnormally large testes.

name: Pneumocystis jirovecii pneumonia
description: An opportunistic disease caused by invasion of unicellular fungus Pneumocystis jirovecii. Transmission of P. jirovecii cysts takes place through the airborne route, and usually, its presence in lungs is asymptomatic. However, people with impaired immunity, especially those with CD4+ T cell count below 200/microliter, are still at risk of the development of Pneumocystis pneumonia due to P. jirovecii invasion. Symptoms induced by this disease are not specific: progressive dyspnea, non-productive cough, low-grade fever, arterial partial pressure of oxygen below 65 mmHg, and chest radiographs demonstrating bilateral, interstitial shadowing.

name: Ocular flutter
