description: Ocular flutter is an abnormal eye movement consisting of repetitive, irregular, involuntary bursts of horizontal saccades without an intersaccadic interval. It is generally superimposed on normal oculomotor behavior and its occurrence may be favored by various events, such as blinks, the triggering of normal saccades or optokinetic stimulation.

name: Cholecystitis
description: The presence of inflammatory changes in the gallbladder.

name: Neoplasm of the gastrointestinal tract
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Acroparesthesia
description: A type of paresthesia (tingling, pins-and-needles, burning or numbness or stiffness) that occurs in the hands and feet and particularly in the fingers and toes.

name: Cerebral white matter hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the cerebral white matter.

name: Hemangioblastoma
description: A hemangioblastoma is a benign vascular neoplasm that arises almost exclusively in the central nervous system. Hemangioblastomas consist of a tightly packed cluster of small blood vessels forming a mass of up to 1 or 2 cm in diameter.

name: Temperature instability
description: Disordered thermoregulation characterized by an impaired ability to maintain a balance between heat production and heat loss, with resulting instability of body temperature.

name: Allodynia
description: Pain due to a stimulus that does not normally provoke pain.

name: Biconcave vertebral bodies
description: Exaggerated concavity of the anterior or posterior surface of the vertebral body, i.e., the upper and lower vertebral endplates are hollowed inward.

name: Recurrent fractures
description: The repeated occurrence of bone fractures (implying an abnormally increased tendency for fracture).

name: Anomic aphasia
description: An inability to name people and objects that are correctly perceived. The individual is able to describe the object in question, but cannot provide the name.

name: Abnormal tibia morphology
description: Abnormality of the tibia (shinbone).

name: Diabetic ketoacidosis
description: A type of diabetic metabolic abnormality with an accumulation of ketone bodies.

name: Neuronal loss in central nervous system
Long philtrum
description: Distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between nasal base and midline upper lip vermilion border.

name: Decreased size of nerve terminals
description: A reduction in the size of nerve terminals.

name: Short lingual frenulum
description: The presence of an abnormally short lingual frenulum.

name: Hyperextensibility of the finger joints
description: The ability of the finger joints to move beyond their normal range of motion.

name: Reduced factor XI activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XI. Factor XI, also known as plasma thromboplastin antecedent, is a serine proteinase that activates factor IX.

name: Intestinal malrotation
description: An abnormality of the intestinal rotation and fixation that normally occurs during the development of the gut. This can lead to volvulus, or twisting of the intestine that causes obstruction and necrosis.

name: Tricuspid stenosis
description: A narrowing of the orifice of the tricuspid valve of the heart.

name: Male hypogonadism
description: Decreased functionality of the male gonad, i.e., of the testis, with reduced spermatogenesis or testosterone synthesis.

name: Hypersomnia
description: Excessive sleepiness or feeling of sleepiness, or difficulty staying awake despite having had adequate sleep, which persists over several days.

name: Abnormality of temperature regulation
description: An abnormality of temperature homeostasis.

name: Cardiac diverticulum
description: A cardiac diverticulum is a rare congenital malformation which is either fibrous or muscular.

name: Atrophy of alveolar ridges
synonyms: Atrophy of alveolar processes of jaw
Resorption of alveolar processes of jaw
Flattening of alveolar processes of jaw

name: Abnormal dentate nucleus morphology
description: An abnormality of the dentate nucleus.

name: Abnormality of refraction
description: An abnormality in the process of focusing of light by the eye in order to produce a sharp image on the retina.

name: Right ventricular cardiomyopathy
description: Right ventricular dysfunction (global or regional) with functional and morphological right ventricular abnormalities, with or without left ventricular disease.

name: Congenital diaphragmatic hernia
description: The presence of a hernia of the diaphragm present at birth.

name: Recurrent streptococcal infections
description: Increased susceptibility to streptococcal infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of streptococcal infections.

name: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract
description: An abnormality of the upper respiratory tract.
synonyms: Abnormality of the upper respiratory tract

name: Dilatation of the cerebral artery
description: The presence of a localized dilatation or ballooning of a cerebral artery.

name: Vertebral wedging
description: An abnormal shape of the vertebral bodies whereby the vertebral bodies are thick on one side and taper to a thin edge at the other.

name: Ichthyosis
description: An abnormality of the skin characterized the presence of excessive amounts of dry surface scales on the skin resulting from an abnormality of keratinization.

name: Bilateral talipes equinovarus
description: Bilateral clubfoot deformity.

name: Lipemia retinalis
description: A creamy appearance of the retinal blood vessels that occurs when the concentration of lipids in the blood are extremely increased, with pale pink to milky white retinal vessels and altered pale reflexes from choroidal vasculature.

name: Hyperfibrinogenemia
description: Increased concentration of fibrinogen in the blood.

name: Radial bowing
description: A bending or abnormal curvature of the radius.
synonyms: Bowing of outer large bone of the forearm
Bowing of radius bone of the forearm

name: Adenoma sebaceum
description: The presence of a sebaceous adenoma with origin in the sebum secreting cells of the skin.

name: Joint contracture of the 4th finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 4th finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 4th finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.
synonyms: Joint contractures of the fourth finger

name: Increased skull ossification
description: An increase in the magnitude or amount of ossification of the skull.

name: Hyposthenuria
description: An abnormally low urinary specific gravity, i.e., reduced concentration of solutes in the urine.

name: Abnormal erythrocyte adenosine deaminase activity
description: Activity of adenosine deaminase in red blood cells outside the limits of normal.

name: Macrotia
description: Median longitudinal ear length greater than two standard deviations above the mean and median ear width greater than two standard deviations above the mean (objective); or, apparent increase in length and width of the pinna (subjective).

name: Small basal ganglia
description: Decreased size of the basal ganglia.

name: Osteolysis
description: Osteolysis refers to the destruction of bone through bone resorption with removal or loss of calcium.

name: Alopecia
description: A noncongenital process of hair loss, which may progress to partial or complete baldness.

name: Fundus hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the fundus of the eye.

name: Delayed fine motor development
description: A type of motor delay characterized by a delay in acquiring the ability to control the fingers and hands.

name: Abnormality of the extrinsic pathway
description: An abnormality of the extrinsic pathway (also known as the tissue factor pathway) of the coagulation cascade.

name: Abnormality of circulating glucocorticoid level
description: An abnormality of the concentration of a glucocorticoid in the blood.

name: Simplified gyral pattern
description: An abnormality of the cerebral cortex with fewer gyri but with normal cortical thickness. This pattern is usually often associated with congenital microcephaly.

name: Abnormal reflex
description: Any anomaly of a reflex, i.e., of an automatic response mediated by the nervous system (a reflex does not need the intervention of conscious thought to occur).

name: Elevated circulating luteinizing hormone level
description: An elevated concentration of luteinizing hormone in the blood.

name: Acantholysis
description: The loss of intercellular connections, such as desmosomes, resulting in loss of cohesion between keratinocytes.

name: Mitral atresia
description: A congenital defect with failure to open of the mitral valve orifice.

name: Opportunistic bacterial infection
description: An infection that is caused by a bacterium that would generally not be able to cause an infection in a host with a normal immune system. Such bacteria take advantage of the opportunity, so to speak, that is provided by a weakened immune system.

name: Small nail
description: A nail that is diminished in length and width, i.e., underdeveloped nail.

name: Abnormal nasal tip morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasal tip.

name: Increased circulating lactate concentration
description: Abnormally increased level of blood lactate (2-hydroxypropanoic acid). Lactate is produced from pyruvate by lactate dehydrogenase during normal metabolism. The terms lactate and lactic acid are often used interchangeably but lactate (the component measured in blood) is strictly a weak base whereas lactic acid is the corresponding acid. Lactic acidosis is often used clinically to describe elevated lactate but should be reserved for cases where there is a corresponding acidosis (pH below 7.35).
synonyms: Higher than normal levels of lactate in blood

name: Malignant hyperthermia
description: Malignant hyperthermia is characterized by a rapid increase in temperature to 39-42 degrees C. Malignant hyperthermia may occur in response to either inhalational anesthetics such as halothane, to muscle relaxants such as succinylcholine, or to exercise.

name: Hypernasal speech
description: A type of speech characterized by the presence of an abnormally increased nasal airflow during speech associated with structural abnormality of the nasal passages.

name: Abnormal renal tubular resorption
description: An abnormality of renal absorption.

name: Tube feeding
description: Feeding problem necessitating food and nutrient delivery via a tube.

name: Abnormal Bowman capsule morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the double-walled capsule (Bowman capsule) that opens into a renal tubule.

name: Bilateral single transverse palmar creases
description: The distal and proximal transverse palmar creases are merged into a single transverse palmar crease on both hands.

name: Parakeratosis
description: Abnormal formation of the keratinocytes of the epidermis characterized by persistence of nuclei, incomplete formation of keratin, and moistness and swelling of the keratinocytes.

name: Incisor macrodontia
description: Increased size of the incisor tooth.

name: Chronic hemolytic anemia
description: An chronic form of hemolytic anemia.

name: Mask-like facies
description: A lack of facial expression often with staring eyes and a slightly open mouth.

name: Lagophthalmos
description: A condition in which the eyelids do not close to cover the eye completely.

name: Broad phalanx of the toes
description: Increased width of phalanx of one or more toes.

name: Abnormal renal medulla morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the medulla of the kidney.

name: Retrocollis
description: A form of torticollis in which the head is drawn back, either due to a permanent contractures of neck extensor muscles, or to a spasmodic contracture.

name: Rhabdomyolysis
description: Breakdown of muscle fibers that leads to the release of muscle fiber contents (myoglobin) into the bloodstream.

name: Macular degeneration
description: A nonspecific term denoting degeneration of the retinal pigment epithelium and/or retinal photoreceptor cells of the macula lutea.

name: Synkinesis
description: Unintentional movement in one area of the body produced during intentional movement of another area of the body.

name: Ablepharon
description: Absent eyelids.

name: Nystagmus
description: Rhythmic, involuntary oscillations of one or both eyes related to abnormality in fixation, conjugate gaze, or vestibular mechanisms.

name: Abnormality of the glenoid fossa
description: An anomaly of the glenoid fossa, also known as the glenoid cavity, which is the articular surface of the scapula that articulates with the head of the humerus.

name: EEG with centrotemporal epileptiform discharges
description: Focal epileptiform EEG discharges recorded in the centrotemporal region.

name: Accessory oral frenulum
description: Extra fold of tissue extending from the alveolar ridge to the inner surface of the upper or lower lip.

name: Encephalomalacia
description: Encephalomalacia is the softening or loss of brain tissue after cerebral infarction, cerebral ischemia, infection, craniocerebral trauma, or other injury.

name: Ileal atresia
description: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the ileum.

name: Hodgkin lymphoma
description: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

name: Increased level of L-fucose in urine
description: An increase in the level of L-fucose in the urine.

name: Recurrent mycobacterial infections
description: Increased susceptibility to mycobacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of mycobacterial infection.

name: Portal inflammation
description: Infiltration of portal fields by inflammatory cells.

name: Macrocephaly at birth
description: The presence of an abnormally large skull with onset at birth.
synonyms: Head circumference large for gestational age

name: Chromosomal breakage induced by crosslinking agents
description: Increased amount of chromosomal breaks in cultured blood lymphocytes or other cells induced by treatment with DNA cross-linking agents such as diepoxybutane and mitomycin C.
synonyms: Chromosomal breakage induced by mitomycin C

name: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis
description: Hypoplasia of the epiglottis.

name: Coarctation of aorta
description: Coarctation of the aorta is a narrowing or constriction of a segment of the aorta.

name: Low-molecular-weight proteinuria
description: Excretion in urine of proteins of a size smaller than albumin (molecular weight 69 kD).

name: Agenesis of cerebellar vermis
description: Congenital absence of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Abnormal central sensory function
description: An abnormality of sensation related to CNS function. Assuming the primary sensory modalities are intact and the patient is alert and cooperative, the presence of an abnormality of sensory function may indicate a lesion of a parietal cortex, the thalamocortical projections to the parietal cortex, or the spinal cord.

name: Patent ductus arteriosus
description: In utero, the ductus arteriosus (DA) serves to divert ventricular output away from the lungs and toward the placenta by connecting the main pulmonary artery to the descending aorta. A patent ductus arteriosus (PDA) in the first 3 days of life is a physiologic shunt in healthy term and preterm newborn infants, and normally is substantially closed within about 24 hours after bith and completely closed after about three weeks. Failure of physiologcal closure is referred to a persistent or patent ductus arteriosus (PDA). Depending on the degree of left-to-right shunting, PDA can have clinical consequences.

name: Hoarse voice
description: Hoarseness refers to a change in the pitch or quality of the voice, with the voice sounding weak, very breathy, scratchy, or husky.

name: Hypotelorism
description: Interpupillary distance less than 2 SD below the mean (alternatively, the appearance of an decreased interpupillary distance or closely spaced eyes).

name: Melanoma
description: The presence of a melanoma, a malignant cancer originating from pigment producing melanocytes. Melanoma can originate from the skin or the pigmented layers of the eye (the uvea).

name: Lymphedema
description: Localized fluid retention and tissue swelling caused by a compromised lymphatic system.
synonyms: Swelling caused by excess lymph fluid under skin

name: Anomalous trichromacy
description: Individuals with anomalous trichromacy possess three types of cones, but one of the three types of cones has an abnormal spectral sensitivity compared to normal cones.

name: Urethrovaginal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the urethra.

name: Anencephaly
description: Anencephaly is a developmental anomaly characterized by a fetus that has no calvarium, with a lack of most or all of the fetus' brain tissue. Anencephaly belongs to a collective group known as neural tube defects (NTD) and is a result of the neural tube failing to close in its rostral end during fetal development.

name: Absent distal phalanges
description: Aplasia (absence) of the distal phalanges.

name: Perineal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula between the bowel and the perineum.

name: Burkitt lymphoma
description: A form of undifferentiated malignant lymphoma commonly manifested as a large osteolytic lesion in the jaw or as an abdominal mass.

name: Abnormal tissue metabolite concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a metabolite in a tissue.

name: Death in childhood
description: Death in during childhood, defined here as between the ages of 2 and 10 years.

name: Sleep disturbance
description: An abnormal pattern in the quality, quantity, or characteristics of sleep.

name: Abnormal circulating free T4 concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of free thyroxine (T4) in the blood circulation. Circulating T4 is almost entirely bound to specific transport proteins such as thyroxine-binding globulin (TBG) but it is the unbound (free) fraction that is able to enter tissues and exert effects.

name: Heinz bodies
description: A type of erythrocyte inclusion composed of denatured hemoglobin.

name: Abnormal aortic arch morphology
description: An anomaly of the arch of aorta.

name: Abnormal liver sonography
description: An abnormal appearance of the liver or any of its components on sonography (ultrasound).

name: Disproportionate short stature
description: A kind of short stature in which different regions of the body are shortened to differing extents.

name: Paralysis
description: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Motor paralysis results from deficits of the upper motor neurons (corticospinal, corticobulbar, or subcorticospinal). Motor paralysis is often accompanied by an impairment in the facility of movement.

name: Abnormal femoral head morphology
description: An abnormality of the femoral head.

name: Recurrent myoglobinuria
description: Recurring episodes of myoglobinuria, i.e., of the presence of myoglobin in the urine. This is usually a consequence of rhabdomyolysis, i.e., of the destruction of muscle tissue.

name: Abnormal umbilicus morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure or appearance of the umbilicus.

name: EEG with burst suppression
description: The burst suppression pattern in electroencephalography refers to a characteristic periodic pattern of low voltage (<10 microvolts) suppressed background and a relatively shorter pattern of higher amplitude slow, sharp, and spiking complexes.

name: Multicystic kidney dysplasia
description: Multicystic dysplasia of the kidney is characterized by multiple cysts of varying size in the kidney and the absence of a normal pelvicaliceal system. The condition is associated with ureteral or ureteropelvic atresia, and the affected kidney is nonfunctional.

name: Pelvic girdle muscle weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as the hip girdle), that is, lack of strength of the muscles around the pelvis.

name: 4-5 finger cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the fourth (ring) to the fifth (little) finger that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.

name: Limb hypertonia
synonyms: Increased muscle tone of arm or leg

name: High serum calcitriol
description: An increased concentration of calcitriol in the blood. Calcitriol is also known as 1,25-dihydroxycholecalciferol or 1,25-dihydroxyvitamin D3.

name: Abnormal eyebrow morphology
description: An abnormality of the eyebrow.

name: Hypercholesterolemia
description: An increased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

name: Abnormal spinal cord morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the spinal cord (myelon).

name: Streak ovary
description: A developmental disorder characterized by the progressive loss of primordial germ cells in the developing ovaries of an embryo, leading to hypoplastic ovaries composed of wavy connective tissue with occasional clumps of granulosa cells, and frequently mesonephric or hilar cells.

name: Cerebral inclusion bodies
description: Nuclear or cytoplasmic aggregates of stainable substances within cells of the brain.

name: Abnormal metaphyseal trabeculation
description: An abnormality of the pattern of trabecula (small interconnecting rods of bone) in a metaphyseal region of bone.

name: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of the femurs
description: Flaring of distal femur.
synonyms: Erlenmeyer flask deformity of distal femur

name: Aortopulmonary collateral arteries
description: Small ectopic arteries or arterial branches that connect the aorta, aortic branches and/or subclavian artery regions directly to the lung parenchyma, usually seen in conjunction with pulmonary atresia, ventricular septal defect (VSD) and/or closed ductus arteriosus.

name: Fatigue
description: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation.

name: Paraparesis
description: Weakness or partial paralysis in the lower limbs.

name: Wrist flexion contracture
description: A chronic loss of wrist joint motion due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevent normal movement of the joints of the wrist.

name: Abnormal social behavior
description: An abnormality of actions or reactions of a person taking place during interactions with others.

name: Abnormal alveolar ridge morphology
description: Any abnormality of the alveolar ridges (on the upper or lower jaws). The alveolar ridges contain the sockets (alveoli) of the teeth.
synonyms: Abnormality of alveolar processes of jaw

name: Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord
description: An abnormality of the placenta (the organ that connects the developing fetus to the uterine wall) or of the umbilical cord (the cord that connects the fetus to the placenta).
synonyms: Abnormalities of placenta or umbilical cord

name: Neonatal death
description: Death within the first 28 days of life.

name: Widely spaced primary teeth
description: Increased space between the primary teeth. Note this phenotype should be distinguished from increased space due purely to microdontia.

name: Abnormality of pattern visual evoked potentials
Abnormal interpretation of external stimuli
description: Abnormal perception of reality is characterized by an abnormal or inaccurate experience of external stimuli.

name: Malaise
description: A feeling of general discomfort, weakness, or lack of health.

name: Bipolar affective disorder
description: Bipolar disorder is an illness of mood characterized by alternating episodes of elevated and depressed moods, which are interspersed with euthymic periods.

name: Ridged nail
description: Longitudinal, linear prominences in the nail plate.

name: Abnormal nasal skeleton morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasal skeleton.
synonyms: Deformity of the bones of the nose
Distortion of the bones of the nose
Malformation of the bones of the nose

name: Left ventricular systolic dysfunction
description: Abnormality of left ventricular contraction, often defined operationally as an ejection fraction of less than 40 percent.

name: Postural instability
description: A tendency to fall or the inability to keep oneself from falling; imbalance. The retropulsion test is widely regarded as the gold standard to evaluate postural instability, Use of the retropulsion test includes a rapid balance perturbation in the backward direction, and the number of balance correcting steps (or total absence thereof) is used to rate the degree of postural instability. Healthy subjects correct such perturbations with either one or two large steps, or without taking any steps, hinging rapidly at the hips while swinging the arms forward as a counterweight. In patients with balance impairment, balance correcting steps are often too small, forcing patients to take more than two steps. Taking three or more steps is generally considered to be abnormal, and taking more than five steps is regarded as being clearly abnormal. Markedly affected patients continue to step backward without ever regaining their balance and must be caught by the examiner (this would be called true retropulsion). Even more severely affected patients fail to correct entirely, and fall backward like a pushed toy soldier, without taking any corrective steps.

name: Hematuria
description: The presence of blood in the urine. Hematuria may be gross hematuria (visible to the naked eye) or microscopic hematuria (detected by dipstick or microscopic examination of the urine).

name: Abducens palsy
description: Malfunction of the abducens nerve as manifested by impairment of the ability of the affected eye to be moved outward. Patients who develop abducens nerve palsy often present with binocular horizontal diplopia, which is a double vision when looking at objects side by side. There will be a notable weakness of the ipsilateral lateral rectus muscle leading to a deficit in of eye abduction on the affected side. Some patients may present with a constant head turning movement to maintain binocular fusion and to lessen the degree of diplopia.

name: Abnormal carotid artery morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the carotid arteries, including the common carotid artery and its' arterial branches.

name: Head tremor
description: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting head movement.

name: Abnormal LDL cholesterol concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of low-density lipoprotein cholesterol in the blood circulation.

name: Red-green dyschromatopsia
description: Difficulty with discriminating red and green hues.

name: Reduced cerebral white matter volume
description: An abnormally low volume of the white matter of the brain.

name: Megalencephaly
description: Diffuse enlargement of the entire cerebral hemispheres leading to macrocephaly (with or without overlying cortical dysplasia).

name: Scaling skin
description: Refers to the loss of the outer layer of the epidermis in large, scale-like flakes.

name: Euryblepharon
description: Euryblepharon is a congenital eyelid anomaly characterized by horizontal enlargement of the palpebral fissure. The eyelid is shortened vertically compared with the horizontal dimension, with associated lateral canthal malpositioning and lateral ectropion abnormally wide lid opening.

name: Lens coloboma
description: A sectoral indentation of the crystalline lens, usually due to zonular weakness or absence.

name: Cerebellar dysplasia
description: Cerebellar dysplasia (abnormal growth or development) is defined by abnormal cerebellar foliation, white matter arborization, and gray-white matter junction. Cerebellar dysplasia is a neuroimaging finding that describes abnormalities of both the cerebellar cortex and white matter and is associated with variable neurodevelopmental outcome. Dysplasia may globally involve the cerebellum or affect only one cerebellar hemisphere. In addition, cerebellar dysplasia may be associated with cortical/subcortical cysts.

name: Mild short stature
description: A mild degree of short stature, more than -2 SD but not more than -3 SD from mean corrected for age and sex.

name: Antecubital pterygium
description: Pterygium affecting the elbow. This is a cutaneous web that can lead to severe flexion contracture of the elbow joint. Antecubital pterygium can be unilateral, bilateral, symmetric, or asysmmetric.

name: Abnormal circulating osteocalcin level
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of osteocalcin in the blood circulation.

name: Bronchial wall thickening
description: Radiological appearance of increased density around the walls of a bronchus or large bronchiole. This feature is thought to be related to edema involving the bronchial wall as well as the peribronchial interstitial space. If the cross section of a bronchus is captured in a radiograph or computed tomography image, it is said to have the appearance of a donut because of the central lucency representing the airway of the bronchus surrounded by a circular region of increased density.

name: Iridocyclitis
description: A type of anterior uveitis, in which there is Inflammation of the iris and the ciliary body.

name: Genetic anticipation
description: A type of autosomal dominant inheritance involving a gene that exhibits anticipation, the increase in severity and/or an earlier age of onset in subsequent generations.

name: Non-Hodgkin lymphoma
description: A type of lymphoma characterized microscopically by the absence of multinucleated Reed-Sternberg cells.

name: Delayed myelination
description: Delayed myelination.

name: Decreased circulating terminal complement component concentration
description: Concentration below the lower limit of normal of one or more components of the the terminal membrane attack complex (MAC) portion of complement, which represents the lytic, pore-forming part of the system. The MAC comprises seven components: C5b, C6, C7, C8 (a heterotrimer composed of C8alpha, C8beta and C8gamma) and multiple copies of C9.

name: Central primitive neuroectodermal tumor
description: A primitive neuroectodermal neoplasm that occurs in the central nervous system.

name: Thick vermilion border
description: Increased width of the skin of vermilion border region of upper lip.

name: Secondary hyperparathyroidism
description: Secondary hyperparathyroidism refers to the production of higher than normal levels of parathyroid hormone in the presence of hypocalcemia.

name: Epididymal cyst
description: A smooth, extratesticular, spherical cyst in the head of the epididymis.

name: Restlessness
description: A state of unease is characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion, which is subject to limited control, nonproductive, or disorganized behavior.

name: Aortic atherosclerotic lesion
description: The presence of atheromas or atherosclerotic plaques in the aorta.

name: Respiratory alkalosis
description: Alkalosis due to excess loss of carbon dioxide from the body.

name: Unusual infection
description: A type of infection that is regarded as a sign of a pathological susceptibility to infection. There are five general subtypes. (i) Opportunistic infection, meaning infection by a pathogen that is not normally able to cause infection in a healthy host (e.g., pneumonia by Pneumocystis jirovecii or CMV); (ii) Unusual location (focus) of an infection (e.g., an aspergillus brain abscess); (iii) a protracted course or lack of adequate response to treatment (e.g., chronic rhinosinusitis); (iv) Unusual severity or intensity of an infection; and (v) unusual recurrence of infections.

name: Abnormality of urine homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the composition of urine or the levels of its components.

name: Reduced circulating growth hormone concentration
description: Concentration of growth hormone in the blood circulation below normal limits.

name: Small forehead
description: The presence of a forehead that is abnormally small.
synonyms: Decreased size of frontal region of face

name: Lens luxation
description: Complete dislocation of the lens of the eye.

name: Narrow iliac wing
description: Decreased width of the wing (or ala) of the ilium (which is the large expanded portion which bounds the greater pelvis laterally).

name: Premature thelarche
description: Premature development of the breasts.

name: Aplasia involving bones of the extremities
Central sleep apnea
description: Sleep apnea results from a temporary loss of the central drive to the muscles responsible for breathing.

name: Abnormal fundus autofluorescence imaging
description: Fundus autofluorescence (FAF) is a non-invasive retinal imaging modality used in clinical practice to provide a density map of lipofuscin, the predominant ocular fluorophore, in the retinal pigment epithelium. Autofluorescent patterns result from the complex interaction of fluorophores such a lipofuscin, which release an autofluorescent signal, and elements such as melanin and rhodopsin, which absorb the excitation beam and attenuate autofluorescence. Other structures such as retinal vessels and the crystalline lens may also influence autofluorescence through blocking and interference.

name: Elevated urinary vanillylmandelic acid
description: An increased concentration of vanillylmandelic acid in the urine.

name: Dilatation of renal calices
description: An abnormal enlargement of the renal calices, the system of ducts of the kidney that collect urine.

name: Tachypnea
description: Very rapid breathing.
synonyms: Increased respiratory rate or depth of breathing

name: Abnormal atrioventricular valve physiology
description: Any functional defect of the mitral or tricuspid valve.

name: Abnormal total basophil count
description: Abnormal increase or decrease of absolute number of basophils in the blood, per microliter, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Dilated fourth ventricle
description: An abnormal dilatation of the fourth cerebral ventricle.

name: Juvenile onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease between the age of 5 and 15 years.
synonyms: Signs and symptoms begin before 15 years of age

name: Edema of the dorsum of hands
description: An abnormal accumulation of fluid beneath the skin on the back of the hands.
synonyms: Oedema of the dorsum of hands

name: Second degree atrioventricular block
description: An intermittent atrioventricular block with failure of some atrial impulses to conduct to the ventricles, i.e., some but not all atrial impulses are conducted through the atrioventricular node and trigger ventricular contraction.

name: Thin skin
description: Reduction in thickness of the skin, generally associated with a loss of suppleness and elasticity of the skin.

name: Amyloidosis
description: The presence of amyloid deposition in one or more tissues. Amyloidosis may be defined as the extracellular deposition of amyloid in one or more sites of the body.

name: Mild hearing impairment
description: The presence of a mild form of hearing impairment.

name: Dextrotransposition of the great arteries
description: A type of transposition of the great arteries (TGA) in which aorta is in front of and primarily to the right of the pulmonary artery. This is the most common kind of TGA.
synonyms: D-loop transposition of the great arteries

name: Sex reversal
description: Development of the reproductive system is inconsistent with the chromosomal sex.

name: Upper airway obstruction
description: Increased resistance to the passage of air in the upper airway.

name: Joint stiffness
description: Joint stiffness is a perceived sensation of tightness in a joint or joints when attempting to move them after a period of inactivity. Joint stiffness typically subsides over time.

name: Personality disorder
description: A personality disorder is a deeply ingrained pattern of behavior of a specified kind that deviates markedly from the norms of generally accepted behavior. It is typically apparent by the time of adolescence and causes long-term difficulties in personal relationships or functioning in society.

name: Choroid plexus carcinoma
description: Intraventricular papillary neoplasm derived from choroid plexus epithelium. Plexus tumors are most common in the lateral and fourth ventricles; while 80% of lateral ventricle tumors present in children, fourth ventricle tumors are evenly distributed in all age groups. Clinically, choroid plexus tumors tend to cause hydrocephalus and increased intracranial pressure. Histologically, choroid plexus papillomas correspond to WHO grade I, choroid plexus carcinomas to WHO grade III.

name: Cervical neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the uterine cervix.

name: Increased circulating IgG concentration
description: An abnormally increased level of immunoglobulin G in blood.

name: Pyelonephritis
description: An inflammation of the kidney involving the parenchyma of kidney, the renal pelvis and the kidney calices.

name: Abnormal conjugate eye movement
description: Any deviation from the normal motor coordination of the eyes that allows for bilateral fixation on a single object.

name: Abnormal blood carbon dioxide level
description: An abnormality of carbon dioxide (CO2) in the arterial blood.

name: Hand muscle atrophy
description: Muscular atrophy involving the muscles of the hand.
synonyms: Amyotrophy involving the musculature of the hand

name: Decreased activity of the pyruvate dehydrogenase complex
synonyms: Decreased activity of the PDH complex

name: Oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
description: A squamous cell carcinoma that originates in the oropharnyx.

name: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th toe
synonyms: Abnormality of the little toe bones
Abnormality of the pinkie toe bones
Abnormality of the pinky toe bones

name: Cervical subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of one or more intervertebral joints in the cervical vertebral column.

name: Rib fusion
description: Complete or partial merging of adjacent ribs.

name: Cranial hyperostosis
description: Excessive growth of the bones of cranium, i.e., of the skull.

name: Disproportionate short-trunk short stature
description: A type of disproportionate short stature characterized by a short trunk but a average-sized limbs.

name: Preaxial foot polydactyly
description: Duplication of all or part of the first ray.
synonyms: Partial/complete duplication of the phalanges of the big toe

name: Increased hepatic echogenicity
description: Increased echogenicity of liver tissue on sonography, manifested as an increased amount of white on the screen of the sonography device.

name: Neutrophilic infiltration of the skin
description: A predominantly neutrophilic infiltrate of the dermis and or epidermis (i.e., a large number of neutrophils inferred to have migrated into the skin).

name: Peritonitis
description: Inflammation of the peritoneum.

name: Hypoplasia of the fovea
description: Underdevelopment of the fovea centralis.

name: Low self-esteem
description: Persistent, excessively negative, and critical thoughts of one's personal abilities, attributes, or any feature related to the self and self-attitude. The affected individual believes they are a lesser being compared to others in their social peer group.

name: Blepharochalasis
description: Blepharochalasis is characterized by recurrent, non-painful, nonerythematous episodes of eyelid edema. It has been divided into hypertrophic and atrophic forms. In the hypertrophic form recurrent edema results in orbital fat herniation through a weakened orbital septum. Most patients who have blepharochalasis present in an atrophic condition with atrophy of redundant eyelid skin and superior nasal fat pads.

name: Prominent metopic ridge
description: Vertical bony ridge positioned in the midline of the forehead.

name: Posteriorly rotated ears
description: A type of abnormal location of the ears in which the position of the ears is characterized by posterior rotation (the superior part of the ears is rotated towards the back of the head, and the inferior part of the ears towards the front).
synonyms: Ears rotated toward back of head

name: Median cleft upper lip
description: A type of cleft lip presenting as a midline (median) gap in the upper lip.

name: Abnormal aortic valve morphology
description: Any abnormality of the aortic valve.

name: Hyperconvex fingernails
description: When viewed on end (with the finger tip pointing toward the examiner's eye) the curve of the fingernail forms a tighter curve of convexity.

name: Generalized amyotrophy
description: Generalized (diffuse, unlocalized) amyotrophy (muscle atrophy) affecting multiple muscles.

name: Fetal pyelectasis
description: Mild pyelectasis is defined as a hypoechoic spherical or elliptical space within the renal pelvis that measures at least 5mm and not more than 10 mm. The measurement is taken on a transverse section through the fetal renal pelvis using the maximum anterior-to-posterior measurement.

name: Abnormal hand bone ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any bone of the skeleton of hand.
synonyms: Abnormality of the mineralisation and ossification of bones of the hand
Abnormal maturation of the hand bones

name: Abnormal urinary purine level
description: Any deviation from the normal amount of a purine compound in the urine. Purines are aromatic heterocyclic compounds containing a purine moiety, which is formed a pyrimidine-ring ring fused to an imidazole ring. Two of the four deoxyribonucleotides (deoxyadenosine and deoxyguanosine) and two of the four ribonucleotides (adenosine, or AMP, and guanosine, or GMP) are purines.

name: Alveolar ridge overgrowth
description: Increased width of the alveolar ridges.
synonyms: Hyperplasia of alveolar process of jaw

name: Third degree atrioventricular block
description: Third-degree atrioventricular (AV) block (also referred to as complete heart block) is the complete dissociation of the atria and the ventricles. Third-degree AV block exists when more P waves than QRS complexes exist and no relationship (no conduction) exists between them.

name: Sporadic
description: Cases of the disease in question occur without a previous family history, i.e., as isolated cases without being transmitted from a parent and without other siblings being affected.

name: Cloverleaf skull
description: Trilobar skull configuration when viewed from the front or behind.

name: Convulsive status epilepticus
description: A type of status epilepticus characterized by a prolonged bilateral tonic-clonic seizure, or repeated bilateral tonic-clonic seizures without recovery between.

name: Abnormality of von Willebrand factor
description: Decreased quantity or activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

name: Renal cell carcinoma
description: A type of carcinoma of the kidney with origin in the epithelium of the proximal convoluted renal tubule.
synonyms: Cancer starting in small tubes in kidneys

name: Weakness due to upper motor neuron dysfunction
description: Paralysis of voluntary muscles means loss of contraction due to interruption of one or more motor pathways from the brain to the muscle fibers. Although the word paralysis is often used interchangeably to mean either complete or partial loss of muscle strength, it is preferable to use paralysis or plegia for complete or severe loss of muscle strength, and paresis for partial or slight loss. Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts is related to a lesion in the corticospinal, corticobulbar or brainstem descending (subcorticospinal) neurons.
synonyms: Paralysis due to lesions of the principle motor tracts

name: Pulmonic stenosis
description: A narrowing of the right ventricular outflow tract that can occur at the pulmonary valve (valvular stenosis), below the pulmonary valve (infundibular stenosis), or above the pulmonary valve (supravalvar stenosis).

name: Deep plantar creases
description: The presence of unusually deep creases (ridges/wrinkles) on the skin of sole of foot.
synonyms: Deep wrinkles in soles of feet

name: Cavernous hemangioma
description: The presence of a cavernous hemangioma. A hemangioma characterized by large endothelial spaces (caverns) is called a cavernous hemangioma.
synonyms: Collection of dilated blood vessels that forms mass

name: Premature loss of primary teeth
description: Loss of the primary (also known as deciduous) teeth before the usual age.

name: Abnormality of the internal auditory canal
description: An abnormality of the Internal acoustic meatus, i.e., of the canal in the petrous part of the temporal bone through which the cranial nerve VII and cranial nerve VIII traverse.
synonyms: Abnormality of the internal acoustic meatus

name: Rickets
description: Rickets is divided into two major categories including calcipenic and phosphopenic. Hypophosphatemia is described as a common manifestation of both categories. Hypophosphatemic rickets is the most common type of rickets that is characterized by low levels of serum phosphate, resistance to ultraviolet radiation or vitamin D intake. There are several issues involved in hypophosphatemic rickets such as calcium, vitamin D, phosphorus deficiencies. Moreover, other disorder can be associated with its occurrence such as absorption defects due to pancreatic, intestinal, gastric, and renal disorders and hepatobiliary disease. Symptoms are usually seen in childhood and can be varied in severity. Severe forms may be linked to bowing of the legs, poor bone growth, and short stature as well as joint and bone pain. Hypophosphatemic rickets are associated with renal excretion of phosphate, hypophosphatemia, and mineral defects in bones. The familial type of the disease is the most common type of rickets.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Complete or partial duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb. Depending on the severity, the appearance on x-ray can vary from a notched phalanx (the duplicated bone is almost completely fused with the phalanx), a partially fused appearance of the two bones, or two separate bones appearing side to side.
synonyms: Duplication of the outermost bone of the thumb
Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanx of the thumb

name: Gingival fibromatosis
description: The presence of fibrosis of the gingiva.

name: Abnormal epiphysis morphology
description: An anomaly of epiphysis, which is the expanded articular end of a long bone that developes from a secondary ossification center, and which during the period of growth is either entirely cartilaginous or is separated from the shaft by a cartilaginous disk.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of end part of bone

name: Migraine without aura
description: Repeated headache attacks lasting 4-72 h fulfilling at least two of the following criteria: 1) unilateral location, 2) pulsating quality, 3) moderate or severe pain intensity, and 4) aggravation by or causing avoidance of routine physical activity such as climbing stairs. Headache attacks are commonly accompanied by nausea, vomiting, photophobia, or phonophobia.

name: Cerebral hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage into the parenchyma of the brain.

name: Abnormal circulating methionine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of methionine in the blood circulation.

name: Asymmetric growth
description: A growth pattern that displays an abnormal difference between the left and the right side.
synonyms: Uneven or disproportionate growth of one body part compared to another

name: Joint contracture of the 3rd finger
description: Chronic loss of joint motion in the 3rd finger due to structural changes in non-bony tissue. The term camptodactyly of the 3rd finger is used if the distal and/or proximal interphalangeal joints are affected.

name: Narrow vertebral interpedicular distance
description: A reduction of the distance between vertebral pedicles, which are the two short, thick processes, which project backward, one on either side, from the upper part of the vertebral body, at the junction of its posterior and lateral surfaces.

name: Abnormal total hemolytic complement activity
description: Any deviation from the normal total hemolytic complement activity in the circulation.

name: Multiple joint dislocation
description: Dislocation of many joints.

name: Abnormal sex determination
description: Anomaly of primary or secondary sexual development or characteristics.

name: Right ventricular hypertrophy
description: In this case the right ventricle is more muscular than normal, causing a characteristic boot-shaped (coeur-en-sabot) appearance as seen on anterior- posterior chest x-rays. Right ventricular hypertrophy is commonly associated with any form of right ventricular outflow obstruction or pulmonary hypertension, which may in turn owe its origin to left-sided disease. The echocardiographic signs are thickening of the anterior right ventricular wall and the septum. Cavity size is usually normal, or slightly enlarged. In many cases there is associated volume overload present due to tricuspid regurgitation, in the absence of this, septal motion is normal.

name: Short sternum
description: Decreased inferosuperior length of the sternum.

name: Carious teeth
description: Caries is a multifactorial bacterial infection affecting the structure of the tooth. This term has been used to describe the presence of more than expected dental caries.

name: Neoplasm of the peripheral nervous system
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm (tumor) of the peripheral nervous system.
synonyms: Tumor of the peripheral nervous system
Tumour of the peripheral nervous system

name: Abnormal atrioventricular connection
description: An abnormality of the circulatory connection between atria and ventricles.

name: Obesity
description: Accumulation of substantial excess body fat.

name: Large iliac wing
description: Increased size of the ilium ala.

name: Abnormality of the endocrine system
description: An abnormality of the endocrine system.

name: Impaired distal proprioception
description: A loss or impairment of the sensation of the relative position of parts of the body and joint position occurring at distal joints.

name: Decreased glomerular filtration rate
description: An abnormal reduction in the volume of fluid filtered out of plasma through glomerular capillary walls into Bowman's capsules per unit of time.

name: Subcutaneous hemorrhage
description: This term refers to an abnormally increased susceptibility to bruising (purpura, petechiae, or ecchymoses).

name: Abnormal odontoid tissue morphology
description: An abnormality of an odontoid tissue.
synonyms: Abnormality of hard tissues of teeth

name: Abnormal esophagus physiology
description: Any physiological abnormality of the esophagus.

name: Abnormal CSF metabolite concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal range of concentration of a metabolite in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Abnormality of the costochondral junction
description: Any anomaly of the costochondral junction. The costochondral junctions are located between the distal part of the ribs and the costal cartilages, which are bars of hyaline cartilage that connect the ribs to the sternum.

name: Night sweats
description: Occurrence of excessive sweating during sleep.

name: Antenatal onset
description: Onset prior to birth.

name: Tachycardia
description: A rapid heartrate that exceeds the range of the normal resting heartrate for age.

name: Angular cheilitis
description: A type of inflammation of the lips involving one or both of the corners of the mouth.
synonyms: Inflammation of corners of the mouth
Red and sore corners of the mouth

name: Thin eyebrow
description: Decreased diameter of eyebrow hairs.

name: Abnormal vascular physiology
description: Abnormality of vascular function.

name: Abnormal fundus morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the fundus of the eye.

name: Hypoplasia of the zygomatic bone
description: Underdevelopment of the zygomatic bone. That is, a reduction in size of the zygomatic bone, including the zygomatic process of the temporal bone of the skull, which forms part of the zygomatic arch.

name: Increased proteinogenic amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of a proteinogenic amino acid in the urine. These are the 23 alpha-amino acids that are precursors to proteins, and are incorporated into proteins during translation. The group includes the 20 amino acids encoded by the nuclear genes of eukaryotes together with selenocysteine, pyrrolysine, and N-formylmethionine.

name: Irregularly shaped sperm tail
description: Irregular or changing caliber (diameter) along the tail of the sperm.

name: Onychomycosis
description: A fungal infection of the toenails or fingernails that tends to cause the nails to thicken, discolor, disfigure, and split.

name: Abnormal circulating acylcarnitine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of an acylcarnitine, which is produced by reversible esterification of the 3-hydroxyl group of carnitine.

name: Premature birth
description: The birth of a baby of less than 37 weeks of gestational age.

name: Cerebral hamartoma
description: The presence of a hamartoma of the cerebrum.

name: Abnormal response to ACTH stimulation test
description: An anomalous response to stimulation by administration of the adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH stimulation normally stimulates the adrenal glands to release cortisol and adrenaline.
synonyms: Abnormal response to adrenocorticotropic-hormone stimulation test
Abnormal response to corticotropin stimulation test

name: Small foramen magnum
description: An abnormal narrowing of the foramen magnum.

name: Vitreous floaters
description: Deposits of various size, shape, consistency, refractive index, and motility within the eye's vitreous humor, which is normally transparent.

name: Abnormal platelet membrane protein expression
description: Presence of reduced amount of a membrane protein on the cell membrane of platelets. This feature is typically measured by flow cytometry.

name: Myelomeningocele
description: Protrusion of the meninges and portions of the spinal cord through a defect of the vertebral column.

name: Branchial fistula
description: A congenital fistula in the neck resulting from incomplete closure of a branchial cleft.

name: Punctate keratitis
description: A type of keratitis characterized by inflammation in pinpoint areas of the corneal epithelium.

name: Prolonged bleeding following procedure
description: Prolonged or protracted bleeding following an invasive procedure or intervention.

name: Abnormal gallbladder morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the gallbladder.

name: Pneumothorax
description: Accumulation of air in the pleural cavity leading to a partially or completely collapsed lung.

name: Abnormal 3rd metacarpal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the third metacarpal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 3rd long bone of hand

name: Intrauterine growth retardation
description: An abnormal restriction of fetal growth with fetal weight below the tenth percentile for gestational age.

name: Generalized clonic seizure
description: Generalized clonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by sustained bilateral jerking, either symmetric or asymmetric, that is regularly repetitive and involves the same muscle groups.

name: Intrahepatic biliary atresia
description: Atresia in the intrahepatic bile duct.

name: Patchy alopecia
description: Transient, non-scarring hair loss and preservation of the hair follicle located in in well-defined patches.

name: Abnormality of the middle ear ossicles
description: An abnormality of the middle-ear ossicles (three small bones called malleus, incus, and stapes) that are contained within the middle ear and serve to transmit sounds from the air to the fluid-filled labyrinth (cochlea).

name: Epidermoid cyst
description: Nontender, round and firm, but slightly compressible, intradermal or subcutaneous cyst measuring 0.5-5 cm in diameter. Epidermal cysts are intradermal or subcutaneous tumors, grow slowly and occur on the face, neck, back and scrotum. They usually appear at or around puberty, and as a rule an affected individual has one solitary or a few cysts.

name: Abnormal cellular phenotype
description: An anomaly of cellular morphology or physiology.

name: Conjunctival icterus
description: Conjunctival icterus is a condition where there is yellowing of the whites of the eyes. This is most commonly seen in patients who have liver disease.
synonyms: Yellowing of the whites of the eyes

name: Accelerated skeletal maturation
description: An abnormally increased rate of skeletal maturation. Accelerated skeletal maturation can be diagnosed on the basis of an estimation of the bone age from radiographs of specific bones in the human body.

name: Inappropriate crying
description: Uncontrolled episodes of crying occur without any apparent motivating stimuli.

name: Iris transillumination defect
description: Transmission of light through the iris as visualized upon slit lamp examination or infrared iris transillumination videography. The light passes through defects in the pigmentation of the iris.

name: Abnormal delivery
description: An abnormality of the birth process.

name: Irregular capital femoral epiphysis
description: Irregular surface of the normally relatively smooth capital femoral epiphysis.
synonyms: Irregular end part of innermost thighbone

name: Thickened helices
description: Increased thickness of the helix of the ear.

name: Micropenis
description: Abnormally small penis. At birth, the normal penis is about 3 cm (stretched length from pubic tubercle to tip of penis) with micropenis less than 2.0-2.5 cm.

name: Abnormal chromosome morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of a chromosome, which is a thread like molecule consisting of DNA and proteins (chromatin) that contains DNA sequences for genes and other genetic elements in linear order.

name: Visual hallucination
description: Visual perception in the absence of a visual stimulus.

name: Hypoglycemia
description: A decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Abnormal nephron morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the nephron.

name: Abnormal cerebral subcortex morphology
description: An abnormality of the cerebral subcortex.

name: Abnormal hamate bone morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the hamate bone, which is the ulnar-most bone located within the distal row of carpal bones, neighboured by the capitate bone radially.

name: Secretory diarrhea
description: Watery voluminous diarrhea resulting from an imbalance between ion and water secretion and absorption.

name: Malformation of the hepatic ductal plate
Increased intracranial pressure
description: An increase of the pressure inside the cranium (skull) and thereby in the brain tissue and cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Senile plaques
description: Senile plaques are extracellular deposits of amyloid in the gray matter of the brain.

name: Abnormal renal physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the kidney.

name: Frontal hirsutism
description: Excessive amount of hair growth on forehead.

name: Breech presentation
description: A position of the fetus at delivery in which the fetus enters the birth canal with the buttocks or feet first.
synonyms: Feet or buttocks of fetus positioned near opening of uterus
Feet or buttocks of foetus positioned near opening of uterus

name: Unbalanced atrioventricular canal defect
description: Anatomic features of unbalanced atrioventricular septal defect (AVSD) include varying amounts of ventricular hypoplasia, as well as malalignment of the atrioventricular junction. In complete AVSD, the common AV valve can be situated either equally over the right and left ventricles (balanced) or unequally over the ventricles (unbalanced).

name: Elevated circulating long-chain acylcarnitine concentration
description: Concentration of long-chain acylcarnitine in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal. Acylcarnitines are classified according to the number of carbon atoms in the acyl-chain. Long-chain acylcarnitines have between thirteen and twenty carbon atoms in the acyl-chain (C13-C20),

name: Recurrent bronchopulmonary infections
description: An increased susceptibility to bronchopulmonary infections as manifested by a history of recurrent bronchopulmonary infections.
synonyms: Recurrent infections in bronchi and lungs

name: Fibrosarcoma
description: A fibroblastic sarcoma is a malignant tumor derived from fibrous connective tissue and characterized by immature proliferating fibroblasts or undifferentiated anaplastic spindle cells.

name: Abnormal hand morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the hand.

name: Impaired arachidonic acid-induced platelet aggregation
description: Abnormal response to arachidonic acid as manifested by reduced or lacking aggregation of platelets upon addition of arachidonic acid.

name: Agenesis of incisor
description: Agenesis of incisor.

name: Persistent open anterior fontanelle
description: The anterior fontanelle generally ossifies by around the 18th month of life. A persistent open anterior fontanelle is diagnosed if closure is delayed beyond this age.

name: Abnormality of the thenar eminence
description: An abnormality of the thenar eminence, i.e., of the muscle on the palm of the human hand just beneath the thumb.

name: Carotid artery stenosis
description: Narrowing of the carotid arteries.

name: Subcapsular cataract
description: A cataract that affects the region of the lens directly beneath the capsule of the lens.

name: Neoplasm of the parathyroid gland
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the parathyroid gland.

name: Late first trimester onset
description: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth in the first trimester during the early fetal period, which is defined as 11 0/7 to 13 6/7 weeks of gestation (inclusive).

name: Alexia
description: An acquired type of sensory aphasia where damage to the brain leads to the loss of the ability to read.

name: Esophageal carcinoma
description: The presence of a carcinoma of the esophagus.

name: Respiratory paralysis
description: Inability to move the muscles of respiration.

name: Ectopic kidney
description: A developmental defect in which a kidney is located in an abnormal anatomic position.

name: Abnormal Sharpey fiber morphology
description: An abnormality of Sharpey's fibers (bone fibers, or perforating fibers), which are a matrix of connective tissue consisting of bundles of strong collagenous fibers connecting periosteum to bone.

name: Renal sodium wasting
description: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the urine in the presence of hyponatremia.

name: Abnormal fetal central nervous system morphology
description: An anomalous structural finding of the fetal central nervous system. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Pectus carinatum
description: A deformity of the chest caused by overgrowth of the ribs and characterized by protrusion of the sternum.

name: Abnormality of complement system
description: An abnormality of the complement system.

name: Nail-biting
description: Habitual biting of one's own fingernails.

name: Recurrent Neisserial infections
description: Recurrent infections by bacteria of the genus Neisseria, including N. meningitidis (one of the most common causes of bacterial meningitis).

name: Absent frontal sinuses
description: Aplasia of frontal sinus.

name: Severe expressive language delay
description: A severe delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

name: Metaphyseal sclerosis
description: Abnormally increased density of metaphyseal bone.
synonyms: Increased bone density in wide portion of long bone

name: Recurrent thrombophlebitis
description: Repeated episodes of inflammation of a vein associated with venous thrombosis (blood clot formation within the vein).

name: EEG with irregular generalized spike and wave complexes
description: EEG shows spikes (<80 ms) and waves, which are recorded over the entire scalp and do not have a specific frequency.
synonyms: EEG with irregular generalised spike and wave complexes

name: Renal fibrosis
description: Renal fibrosis is the consequence of an excessive accumulation of extracellular matrix that occurs in virtually every type of chronic kidney disease.

name: Abnormal EKG
description: Abnormal rhythm of the heart.

name: Helicobacter pylori infection
description: A recurrent infection of the GI tract with helicobacter pylori, a gram-negative, microaerophilic bacterium usually found in the stomach.

name: Abnormal dermoepidermal junction morphology
description: Any anomaly of the structure of the acellular zone that is between the dermis and the epidermis and which functions to bind the epidermis to the dermis and to serve as a selective barrier allowing the control of molecular and cellular exchanges between the two compartments.

name: Abnormal tarsal ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of any of the tarsal bones, seven bones of the foot comprising the calcaneus, talus, cuboid, navicular, and the cuneiform bones.

name: Axonal loss
description: A reduction in the number of axons in the peripheral nervous system.

name: Short distal phalanx of the thumb
description: Hypoplastic (short) distal phalanx of the thumb.
synonyms: Hypoplastic/small distal phalanx of the thumb
Short outermost bone of the thumb

name: Abnormal hindbrain morphology
description: An abnormality of the hindbrain, also known as the rhombencephalon.

name: Abnormal cardiomyocyte morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of cardiomyocytes, which are terminally differentiated muscle cells in the heart that are interconnected end to end by gap junctions, which allows coordinated contraction of heart tissue.

name: Diaphyseal undertubulation
description: Tubulation refers to the size and shape of tubular bones. In children and adolescents, the modeling process regulates normal bone growth. Final shaft (tube) diameter depends on appositional bone growth and the equilibrium between periosteal and endosteal bone resorption and formation. Undertubulation refers to a broad, widened form of the shafts (diaphyses) of long bones.
synonyms: Thickening of shaft or central part of long bones

name: Thick upper lip vermilion
description: Height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the midline more than 2 SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased height of the vermilion of the upper lip in the frontal view (subjective).
synonyms: Increased height of upper lip vermilion
Increased volume of upper lip vermilion
Thick vermilion border of upper lip
Thick red part of the upper lip

name: Gait ataxia
description: A type of ataxia characterized by the impairment of the ability to coordinate the movements required for normal walking. Gait ataxia is characteirzed by a wide-based staggering gait with a tendency to fall.
synonyms: Inability to coordinate movements when walking

name: Abnormal ventricular septum morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the interventricular septum.

name: Intraalveolar phospholipid accumulation
description: Accumulation of amorphous PAS-positive material in the space between alveolar macrophages, sometimes as condensed form (oval bodies) are typically found in alveolar proteinosis.
synonyms: Detection of PAS-positive extracellular material in broncho-alveolar lavage

name: Mitral valve calcification
description: Abnormal calcification of the mitral valve.

name: Decreased body weight
description: Abnormally low body weight.

name: Short thorax
description: Reduced inferior to superior extent of the thorax.
synonyms: Shorter than typical length between neck and abdomen

name: Increased aspartate family amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of an aspartate family amino acid in the urine.

name: Short digit
description: One or more digit that appears disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot, whereby either the entire digit or a specific phalanx is shortened.

name: Decreased circulating alkaline phosphatase activity
description: Concentration or activity of alkaline phosphatase outside the upper or lower limtis of normal in the blood circulation.

name: Hypermagnesemia
description: An abnormally increased magnesium concentration in the blood.

name: Overlapping fingers
description: A finger resting on the dorsal surface of an adjacent digit when the hand is at rest.

name: Increased overbite
description: Maxillary teeth cover the mandibular teeth when biting to an increased degree. The feature is defined as a vertical overlap of the maxillary incisors over the mandibular incisors that exceeds 2 mm.
synonyms: Increased overlap of upper and lower incisors

name: Periorbital edema
description: Edema affecting the region situated around the orbit of the eye.

name: Spastic paraparetic gait
description: A type of spastic gait in which the legs are usually slightly bent at the hip and in an adducted position. The knees are extended or slightly bent and the feet are in a plantar flexion position. This posture requires circumduction of the legs during walking. The gait may appear stiff (spastic gait disorder) or stiff as well as insecure (spastic ataxic gait disorder). In spastic paraparetic gait, each leg appears to be dragged forward. If the muscle tone in the adductors is marked, the resulting gait disorder is referred to as scissor gait.

name: Hyperpigmentation of the skin
description: A darkening of the skin related to an increase in melanin production and deposition.

name: Abnormal arachnoid mater morphology
description: An abnormality of the Arachnoid mater.

name: Rheumatoid factor positive
description: The presence in the serum of an autoantibody directed against the Fc portion of IgG.

name: Short term memory impairment
description: A deficit in the retention of pieces of information (memory chunks) for a relatively short time (usually up to 30 seconds).

name: Lower limb spasticity
description: Spasticity (velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone and hyperexcitable tendon reflexes) in the muscles of the lower limbs, hips, and pelvis.

name: J-shaped sella turcica
description: A deformity of the sella turcica whereby the sella extends further anterior than normal such that the anterior clinoid process appears to overhang it, giving the appearance of the letter J on imaging of the skull.

name: Retinal vein occlusion
description: Blockage of the retinal vein.

name: Recurrent enteroviral infections
description: Increased susceptibility to enteroviral infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of enteroviral infection.

name: Abnormal temporal bone morphology
description: Abnormality of the temporal bone of the skull, which is situated at the sides and base of the skull roughly underlying the region of the face known as the temple.

name: Hypoplastic iliac wing
description: Underdevelopment of the ilium ala.

name: Narrow palpebral fissure
description: Reduction in the vertical distance between the upper and lower eyelids.

name: High myopia
description: A severe form of myopia with greater than -6.00 diopters.

name: Abnormality of the musculature of the hand
Acne inversa
description: A chronic skin condition involving the inflammation of the apocrine sweat glands, forming pimple-like bumps known as abscesses.

name: Onychogryphosis of toenails
description: Thickened toenails.

name: Abnormal renal corticomedullary differentiation
description: An abnormality of corticomedullary differentiation (CMD) on diagnostic imaging such as magnetic resonance imaging, computer tomography, or sonography. CMD is a difference in the visualization of cortex and medulla.

name: Foot joint contracture
description: Contractures of one or more joints of the feet meaning chronic loss of joint motion due to structural changes in non-bony tissue.
synonyms: Contractures involving the joints of the feet
Joint contractures involving the joints of the feet

name: Complex febrile seizure
description: A febrile seizure that has any of the following features: focal semiology (or associated with post-ictal neurologic abnormalities beyond drowsiness, such as a Todd's paresis), prolonged seizure beyond 15 minutes, or recurring (occurring more than once) in a 24 hour period.

name: Wide nose
description: Interalar distance more than two standard deviations above the mean for age, i.e., an apparently increased width of the nasal base and alae.

name: Curly eyelashes
description: Abnormally curly or curved eyelashes.

name: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
description: An abnormality of the hematopoietic system.
synonyms: Abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues

name: Babinski sign
description: Upturning of the big toe (and sometimes fanning of the other toes) in response to stimulation of the sole of the foot. If the Babinski sign is present it can indicate damage to the corticospinal tract.

name: Transverse terminal limb defect
description: A congenital anomaly that appears as an amputation at different levels of the extremity. The limb is missing the terminal (distal) segment(s), with preservation of all the segment(s) proximal to the missing segment.

name: Peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis
description: Stenosis of a peripheral branch of the pulmonary artery.

name: Abnormal nasal dorsum morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasal dorsum, also known as the nasal ridge.
synonyms: Abnormality of the dorsum of nose
Abnormal morphology of dorsum of nose
Deformity of the dorsum of the nose
Malformation of the dorsum of nose

name: Postaxial polydactyly
description: A form of polydactyly in which the extra digit or digits are localized on the side of the fifth finger or fifth toe.

name: Intussusception
description: An abnormality of the intestine in which part of the intestine invaginates (telescopes) into another part of the intestine.

name: Abnormal parietal bone morphology
description: Any abnormality of the parietal bone of the skull.
synonyms: Abnormality of the parietal bone of skull

name: Cutaneous amyloidosis
description: The presence of amyloid deposition in the superficial dermis.

name: Nasal congestion
description: Reduced ability to pass air through the nasal cavity often leading to mouth breathing.

name: Hydrocele testis
description: Accumulation of clear fluid in the between the layers of membrane (tunica vaginalis) surrounding the testis.

name: Delayed cranial suture closure
description: Infants normally have two fontanels at birth, the diamond-shaped anterior fontanelle at the junction of the coronal and sagittal sutures, and the posterior fontanelle at the intersection of the occipital and parietal bones. The posterior fontanelle usually closes by the 8th week of life, and the anterior fontanel closes by the 18th month of life on average. This term applies if there is delay of closure of the fontanelles beyond the normal age.

name: Abnormal morphology of the vestibule of the inner ear
description: A morphological abnormality of the vestibule, the central part of the osseous labyrinth that is situated medial to the tympanic cavity, behind the cochlea, and in front of the semicircular canals.
synonyms: Morphological abnormality of the vestibule of the inner ear

name: Ectopic anus
description: Abnormal displacement or malposition of the anus.

name: Slow decrease in visual acuity
synonyms: Slow decrease in sharpness of vision

name: Squared iliac bones
description: A shift from the normally round (convex) appearance of the iliac wing towards a square-like appearance.

name: Abnormal upper limb epiphysis morphology
synonyms: Abnormal shape of end part of upper limb long bones
Abnormality involving the epiphyses of the upper limbs
Abnormality of upper limb epiphysis morphology
Epihyseal plate abnormality of the upper limbs

name: Supranuclear gaze palsy
description: A supranuclear gaze palsy is an inability to look in a particular direction as a result of cerebral impairment. There is a loss of the voluntary aspect of eye movements, but, as the brainstem is still intact, all the reflex conjugate eye movements are normal.

name: Decreased circulating adenosylcobalamin concentration
description: The concentration of adenosylcobalam in the blood circulation is below the lower limit of normal. Adenosylcobalamin is one of the active forms of vitamin B12.

name: Zonular cataract
description: Zonular cataracts are defined to be cataracts that affect specific regions of the lens.

name: Dental crowding
description: Changes in alignment of teeth in the dental arch
synonyms: Inadequate arch length for tooth size

name: Intracranial hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring within the skull.

name: Coarse hair
description: Hair shafts are rough in texture.

name: Abnormal macular morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the macula lutea, which is an oval-shaped highly pigmented yellow spot near the center of the retina.

name: Orthopnea
description: A sensation of breathlessness in the recumbent position, relieved by sitting or standing.

name: Incoordination
description: A deficit in coordination of mulscle movements. Coordination is defined as the orchestrated movement of multiple body parts as required to accomplish intended actions, like walking.

name: Portal vein thrombosis
description: Thrombosis of the portal vein and/or its tributaries, which include the splenic vein and the superior and inferior mesenteric veins.

name: Large foramen magnum
description: An abnormal increase in the size of the foramen magnum.

name: Broad columella
description: Increased width of the columella.

name: Cerebral cavernous malformation
description: A cerebral cavernous malformation (also known as cavernoma, cavernous angioma, cavernous hemangioma) is a collection of structurally abnormal slow-flow capillaries predominantly in the central nervous system. These are multiple mulberry-like distended caverns of dilated thin-walled capillaries without the normal intervening brain parenchymal architecture. Often, individual cavernomas are surrounded by hemosiderin representing remote oozing due to the abnormal capillaries.

name: Partial atrioventricular canal defect
description: A specific combination of heart defects including a primum atrial septal defect and cleft anterior mitral valve leaflet. There is not an inlet ventricular septal defect present. There are two valve annuluses and two valve orifices.
