name: Perimembranous ventricular septal defect
description: A ventricular septal defect that is confluent with and involves the membranous septum and is bordered by an atrioventricular valve, not including the type 3 VSDs.

name: Abnormal diaphysis morphology
description: An abnormality of the structure or form of the diaphysis, i.e., of the main or mid-section (shaft) of a long bone.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of shaft of long bone
Abnormality involving the diaphyses of the limbs
Abnormality of shaft of long bone of the limbs
Anomaly of the limb diaphyses morphology

name: Jejunal atresia
description: A developmental defect resulting in abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the jejunum.

name: Complete duplication of phalanx of hand
description: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the hand. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accessory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, is a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also referred to as Hyperphalangism.

name: Elevated circulating catecholamine level
description: An abnormal increase in catecholamine concentration in the blood.

name: Paroxysmal supraventricular tachycardia
description: An episodic form of supraventricular tachycardia with abrupt onset and termination.

name: Apneic episodes in infancy
description: Recurrent episodes of apnea occurring during infancy.

name: Restrictive cardiomyopathy
description: Restrictive left ventricular physiology is characterized by a pattern of ventricular filling in which increased stiffness of the myocardium causes ventricular pressure to rise precipitously with only small increases in volume, defined as restrictive ventricular physiology in the presence of normal or reduced diastolic volumes (of one or both ventricles), normal or reduced systolic volumes, and normal ventricular wall thickness.

name: Constipation
description: Infrequent or difficult evacuation of feces.

name: Abnormality of canine
description: An abnormality of canine tooth.

name: Reflex seizure
description: Seizures precipitated by exogenous stimuli.

name: Precocious puberty in females
description: The onset of puberty before the age of 8 years in girls.

name: CSF lymphocytic pleiocytosis
description: An increased lymphocyte count in the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Periauricular skin pits
description: Benign congenital lesions of the periauricular soft tissue consisting of a blind-ending narrow tube or pit.

name: Back pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the back.

name: Abnormal tubular basement membrane morphology
description: Abnormal structure of the basement membrane of the renal tubulus.

name: Abnormal blood zinc concentration
description: An abnormality of zinc ion homeostasis.

name: Hypoplasia of the cochlea
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the cochlea.

name: Abnormal visual field test
description: Abnormal result of a test designed to test an individual's central and peripheral vision by determining the ability of the individual to perceive objects at differing locations of the visual field.

name: Abnormal humerus morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the structure of the humerus (i.e., upper arm bone).

name: Neurofibrillary tangles
description: Pathological protein aggregates formed by hyperphosphorylation of a microtubule-associated protein known as tau, causing it to aggregate in an insoluble form.
synonyms: Neurofibrillary tangles composed of disordered microtubules in neurons

name: Elevated plasma citrulline
description: An increased concentration of citrulline in the blood.

name: Abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb
description: An abnormal morphology of the olfactory bulb (bulbus olfactorius), which is involved in olfaction, i.e. the sense of smell.

name: Oculomotor nerve palsy
description: Reduced ability to control the movement of the eye associated with damage to the third cranial nerve (the oculomotor nerve).

name: Subcutaneous lipoma
description: The presence of subcutaneous lipoma.

name: Cerebral palsy
description: Cerebral palsy describes a group of permanent disorders of the development of movement and posture, causing activity limitation, that are attributed to nonprogressive disturbances that occurred in the developing fetal or infant brain. The motor disorders of cerebral palsy are often accompanied by disturbances of sensation, perception, cognition, communication, and behavior, by epilepsy, and by secondary musculoskeletal problems.

name: Abnormality of the lymphatic system
description: An anomaly of the lymphatic system, a network of lymphatic vessels that carry a clear fluid called lymph unidirectionally towards either the right lymphatic duct or the thoracic duct, which in turn drain into the right and left subclavian veins respectively.

name: Hypoplastic spleen
description: Underdevelopment of the spleen.

name: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis
description: Segmental accumulation of scar tissue in individual (but not all) glomeruli.

name: Abnormal lymphocyte morphology
description: An abnormality of lymphocytes.
synonyms: Abnormality of cells of the lymphoid lineage

name: Aplasia cutis congenita on trunk or limbs
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the trunk or the limbs.

name: Neonatal respiratory distress
description: Respiratory difficulty as newborn.

name: Abnormal factor VIII activity
description: A deviation from the normal activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

name: Sensory seeking
description: Unusual interest in sensory aspects of the environment.

name: Abnormal heart valve physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of a cardiac valve.

name: Nephrolithiasis
description: The presence of calculi (stones) in the kidneys.

name: Mitochondrial depletion
description: An abnormal reduction in mitochondrial DNA content of cells.

name: Right aortic arch with mirror image branching
description: The aortic arch crosses the right mainstem bronchus and not the left mainstem bronchus, but does not result in the creation of a vascular ring. The first branch is the left brachiocephalic artery which divides into the left carotid artery and left subclavian artery, the second branch is the right carotid artery, the third branch is the right subclavian artery.

name: Chorioretinal dysplasia
description: Abnormal development of the choroid and retina.

name: Punctate cataract
description: A type of cataract with punctate opacities of the lens.

name: Exaggerated startle response
description: An exaggerated startle reaction in response to a sudden unexpected visual or acoustic stimulus, or a quick movement near the face.

name: Reticular hyperpigmentation
description: Increased pigmentation of the skin with a netlike (reticular) pattern.

name: Redundant skin
description: Loose and sagging skin often associated with loss of skin elasticity.

name: Urethral stenosis
description: Abnormal narrowing of the urethra.

name: Cutis gyrata of scalp
description: The presence of convoluted folds and furrows formed from thickened skin of the scalp, resembling cerebriform pattern. The scalp has convoluted and elevated folds, 1 to 2 cm in thickness. The convolutions generally cannot be flattened by traction.
synonyms: Furrows in thickened skin on top of scalp
Thickened folds on top of scalp

name: Small hand
description: Disproportionately small hand.

name: Typified by age-related disease onset
description: Description of conditions in which age of onset is typically later in life and in which penetrance is dependent on the age of the subject.

name: Abnormal circulating T4 concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of thyroxine in the blood. Thyroxine (also known as T4) is the main hormone secreted by the thyroid gland into the blood. It can be converted into the active form triiodothyronine (also known as T3).

name: Eversion of lateral third of lower eyelids
Abnormal fetal morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the fetus.

name: Genital tract atresia
description: Congenital occlusion of a tube in the genital tract.

name: Olivopontocerebellar hypoplasia
description: Hypoplasia of the cerebellum, pontine nuclei, and inferior olivary nucleus.

name: Fetal pleural effusion
description: Fetal pleural effusion is the accumulation of excess fluid in the layers of tissue (pleura) lining the lungs and wall of the chest. It may be primary, also termed hydrothorax, occurring as an isolated finding or it may be secondary, most commonly resulting from non-immune hydrops.

name: Dyslexia
description: A learning disorder characterized primarily by difficulties in learning to read and spell. Dyslectic children also exhibit a tendency to read words from right to left and to confuse letters such as b and d whose orientation is important for their identification. Children with dyslexia appear to be impaired in phonemic skills (the ability to associate visual symbols with the sounds they represent).

name: Abdominal situs inversus
description: A left-right reversal (or mirror reflection) of the anatomical location of the viscera of the abdomen.

name: Chronic oral candidiasis
description: Chronic accumulation and overgrowth of the fungus Candida albicans on the mucous membranes of the mouth, generally manifested as associated with creamy white lesions on the tongue or inner cheeks, occasionally spreading to the gums, tonsils, palate or oropharynx.

name: Recurrent protozoan infections
description: Increased susceptibility to protozoan infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of protozoan infection.

name: Lacrimal duct atresia
description: A developmental disorder of the lacrimal drainage system that most often affects the lacrimal ostium and resulting in non-opening of the nasolacrimal duct. It usually results from a non-canalization of the nasolacrimal duct.

name: Decreased mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration
description: A reduction from the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell). A reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) may indicate a hypochromic anemia, but the MCH may be normal if both the total hemoglobin and the red blood cell count are reduced.

name: Parkinsonism with favorable response to dopaminergic medication
description: Parkinsonism is a clinical syndrome that is a feature of a number of different diseases, including Parkinson disease itself, other neurodegenerative diseases such as progressive supranuclear palsy, and as a side-effect of some neuroleptic medications. Some but not all individuals with Parkinsonism show responsiveness to dopaminergic medication defined as a substantial reduction of amelioration of the component signs of Parkinsonism (including mainly tremor, bradykinesia, rigidity, and postural instability) upon administration of dopaminergic medication.
synonyms: Parkinsonism with favourable response to dopaminergic medication

name: Hyperextensibility of the knee
description: The ability of the knee joint to extend beyond its normal range of motion (the lower leg is moved beyond a straight position with respect to the thigh).

name: Shortened QT interval
description: Decreased time between the start of the Q wave and the end of the T wave as measured by the electrocardiogram (EKG).

name: Abnormal hallux phalanx morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of the phalanges of the hallux

name: Distal amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy affecting muscles in the distal portions of the extremities.
synonyms: Distal amyotrophy, especially of the hands and feet
Distal muscle atrophy, upper and lower limbs

name: Focal hyperkinetic seizure
description: A focal seizure characterized at onset by predominantly proximal limb or axial muscles producing irregular sequential ballistic movements, such as pedaling, pelvic thrusting, thrashing, rocking movements.

name: Radial head subluxation
description: Partial dislocation of the head of the radius.

name: Generalized tonic seizure
description: A generalized tonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by bilateral limb stiffening or elevation, often with neck stiffening without a subsequent clonic phase. The tonic activity can be a sustained abnormal posture, either in extension or flexion, sometimes accompanied by tremor of the extremities.

name: Left superior vena cava draining to coronary sinus
description: A persistent left superior vena cava (PLSVC) that drains into the right atrium via the coronary sinus. This is the case in 80-92% of cases of PLSVC and results in no hemodynamic consequence.

name: Abnormal lip morphology
description: An abnormality of the lip.

name: EEG with generalized slow activity
description: Diffuse slowing of cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Diffuse mesangial sclerosis
description: Thickening and scarring (sclerosis) of the mesangium (a structure in the glomerulus). The sclerosis affects a large portion of the mesangium across multiple glomeruli. Histologic features include an increase in the mesangial matrix, thickened glomerular basement membrane, tubular casts, and interstitial inflammation. Diffuse mesangial sclerosis presents with nephrotic syndrome at birth or within the first year of life. Glomeruli are small and condensed in appearance, with early lesions showing increased loose mesangial collagen that progress to sclerosis with dense collagen without hypercellularity. Podocytes do not show hyperplasia but may be immature and cobblestone-like. Electron microscopy shows extensive foot process effacement without deposits, but increased collagen within mesangial areas.

name: Abnormal natural killer cell morphology
description: An anomaly of the natural killer cell, which is a lymphocyte that can spontaneously kill a variety of target cells without prior antigenic activation via germline encoded activation receptors. It also regulates immune responses via cytokine release and direct contact with other cells.

name: Ankle clonus
description: Clonus is an involuntary tendon reflex that causes repeated flexion and extension of the foot. Ankle clonus is tested by rapidly flexing the foot upward.

name: Visual impairment
description: Visual impairment (or vision impairment) is vision loss (of a person) to such a degree as to qualify as an additional support need through a significant limitation of visual capability resulting from either disease, trauma, or congenital or degenerative conditions that cannot be corrected by conventional means, such as refractive correction, medication, or surgery.

name: Generalized myoclonic-atonic seizure
description: A generalized myoclonic-atonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by a myoclonic jerk followed by an atonic motor component.

name: Toenail dysplasia
description: An abnormality of the development of the toenails.

name: T-wave inversion
description: An inversion of the T-wave (which is normally positive).

name: Wide nasal ridge
description: Increased width of the nasal ridge.
synonyms: Increased width of dorsum of nose

name: Craniofacial asymmetry
description: Asymmetry of the bones of the skull and the face.

name: Elevated circulating hepatic transaminase concentration
description: Elevations of the levels of SGOT and SGPT in the serum. SGOT (serum glutamic oxaloacetic transaminase) and SGPT (serum glutamic pyruvic transaminase) are transaminases primarily found in the liver and heart and are released into the bloodstream as the result of liver or heart damage. SGOT and SGPT are used clinically mainly as markers of liver damage.

name: Young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at the age of between 16 and 40 years.

name: Retinal pigment epithelial atrophy
description: Atrophy (loss or wasting) of the retinal pigment epithelium observed on fundoscopy or fundus imaging.

name: Abnormal cortical bone morphology
description: An abnormality of compact bone (also known as cortical bone), which forms the dense surface of bones.

name: Osteomyelitis
description: Osteomyelitis is an inflammatory process accompanied by bone destruction and caused by an infecting microorganism.

name: Unilateral renal agenesis
description: A unilateral form of agenesis of the kidney.

name: Encephalopathy
description: Encephalopathy is a term that means brain disease, damage, or malfunction. In general, encephalopathy is manifested by an altered mental state.

name: Decreased amplitude of sensory action potentials
description: A reduction in the amplitude of sensory nerve action potential. This feature is measured by nerve conduction studies.

name: Pelvic girdle amyotrophy
description: Atrophy of the muscles of the pelvic girdle (also known as hip girdle), i.e., the gluteal muscles, the lateral rotators, the adductors, the psoas major and the iliacus muscle.

name: Systemic lupus erythematosus
description: A chronic, relapsing, inflammatory, and often febrile multisystemic disorder of connective tissue, characterized principally by involvement of the skin, joints, kidneys, and serosal membranes.

name: Aortic root aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the aortic root.
synonyms: Bulge in wall of root of large artery that carries blood away from heart

name: Erythroid hyperplasia
description: Increased count of erythroid precursor cells, that is, erythroid lineage cells in the bone marrow.
synonyms: Bone marrow biopsy shows erythroid hyperplasia
Bone marrow smear shows erythroid hyperplasia

name: Recurrent maladaptive behavior
description: A repeating behavior that is either immediately unproductive or has negative long-term consequences. This includes harmful coping mechanisms such as addictive behavior and failure to control impulses and compulsions.

name: Excessive salivation
description: Excessive production of saliva.

name: Medulloblastoma
description: A rapidly growing embryonic tumor arising in the posterior part of the cerebellar vermis and neuroepithelial roof of the fourth ventricle in children. More rarely, medulloblastoma arises in the cerebellum in adults.

name: Macular drusen
description: Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye. This class refers to the presence of Drusen in the macula.

name: Abnormal meningeal morphology
description: An abnormality of the Meninges, including any abnormality of the Dura mater, the Arachnoid mater, and the Pia mater.

name: Abnormal portal venous system morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the portal venous system, which comprises all of the veins draining the abdominal part of the digestive tract, including the lower esophagus but excluding the lower anal canal. The portal vein conveys blood from viscera and ramifies like an artery at the liver, ending at the sinusoids. Tributaries of the portal vein, which make up the portal venous system, are the splenic, superior mesenteric, left gastric, right gastric, paraumbilical, and cystic veins.

name: Absent sperm flagella
description: Sperm cells lacking flagella.

name: Bifid scrotum
description: Midline indentation or cleft of the scrotum.

name: Late onset
description: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms after the age of 60 years.

name: Cupped ear
description: Laterally protruding ear that lacks antihelical folding (including absence of inferior and superior crura).

name: Retinal vascular tortuosity
description: The presence of an increased number of twists and turns of the retinal blood vessels.

name: Adipose tissue loss
description: A reduction in the amount of adipose tissue (fat) compared with the amount previously present in an individual.

name: Biconvex vertebral bodies
description: Presence of abnormal convexity of the upper and lower end plates of the vertebrae, i.e., an exaggerated bulging out of the upper and lower vertebral end plates.

name: Hyperplasia of the maxilla
description: Abnormally increased dimension of the maxilla, especially relative to the mandible, resulting in a malocclusion or malalignment between the upper and lower teeth or in anterior positioning of the nasal base, increased convexity of the face, increased nasolabial angle, or increased width (transverse dimension of the maxilla.

name: Hypoesthesia
description: Decreased ability to perceive touch.

name: Abnormal occipital bone morphology
description: Abnormality of the occipital bone of the skull.

name: Inability to walk
description: Incapability to ambulate.

name: Bulbous nose
description: Increased volume and globular shape of the anteroinferior aspect of the nose.

name: Frontalis muscle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the frontalis muscle (which is located on the forehead).

name: Aphasia
description: An acquired language impairment of some or all of the abilities to produce or comprehend speech and to read or write.

name: Abnormal circulating proteinogenic amino acid derivative concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a compound that is derived from an amino acid.

name: Widened subarachnoid space
description: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater.

name: Malar prominence
description: Prominence of the malar process of the maxilla and infraorbital area appreciated in profile and from in front of the face.

name: Polyembolokoilamania
description: Habitual insertion of foreign bodies into bodily orifices.

name: Abnormal breath sound
description: An anomalous (adventitious) sound produced by the breathing process.

name: Substantia nigra gliosis
description: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the substantia nigra.

name: Inertia
description: Reduction of goal-directed behaviors linked to the impairment in frontal executive functions (planning of an action for example).

name: Pseudohypoaldosteronism
description: A state of renal tubular unresponsiveness or resistance to the action of aldosterone.

name: Woolly hair
description: The term wooly hair refers to an abnormal variant of hair that is fine, with tightly coiled curls, and often hypopigmented. Optical microscopy may reveal the presence of tight spirals and a clear diameter reduction as compared with normal hair. Electron microscopy may show flat, oval hair shafts with reduced transversal diameter.

name: Neoplasm of the nervous system
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the nervous system.

name: Lobulated tongue
description: Multiple indentations and/or elevations on the edge and/or surface of the tongue producing an irregular surface contour.

name: Incomplete partition of the cochlea
description: Incomplete formation of the cochlear partition. The scala vestibuli and scala tympani separated by the cochlear partition, except in the apical turn where the two scalae are in continuity via the helicotrema.

name: Polyneuropathy
description: A generalized disorder of peripheral nerves.

name: Multiple lentigines
description: Presence of an unusually high number of lentigines (singular: lentigo), which are flat, tan to brown oval spots.

name: Ulnar bowing
description: Bending of the diaphysis (shaft) of the ulna.

name: Abnormal glomerular basement membrane morphology
description: Any abnormal sttructure of the glomerular basement membrane.

name: Pituitary dwarfism
description: A type of reduced stature with normal proportions related to dysfunction of the pituitary gland related to either an isolated defect in the secretion of growth hormone or to panhypopituitarism, i.e., a deficit of all the anterior pituitary hormones.

name: Abnormal subclavian artery morphology
description: Any anomaly of a subclavian artery.

name: Carotid artery dilatation
description: A dilatation (balooning or bulging out of the vessel wall) of a carotid artery.

name: Elevated total serum tryptase
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of total tryptase (alpha and beta tryptase) in the blood circulation.

name: Flared lower limb metaphysis
description: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the leg.
synonyms: Flared metaphysis of lower limb bone

name: Shortening of all distal phalanges of the fingers
description: Hypoplasia of all of the distal phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Shortening of all outermost bones of the fingers

name: Deep-set nails
description: Deeply placed nails.

name: Abnormality of skin adnexa physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the skin adnexa (skin appendages), which are specialized skin structures located within the dermis and focally within the subcutaneous fatty tissue, comprising three histologically distinct structures: (1) the pilosebaceous unit (hair follicle and sebaceous glands); (2) the eccrine sweat glands; and (3) the apocrine glands.

name: Fibular hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the fibula.

name: Paronychia
description: The nail disease paronychia is an often-tender bacterial or fungal hand infection or foot infection where the nail and skin meet at the side or the base of a finger or toenail. The infection can start suddenly (acute paronychia) or gradually (chronic paronychia).

name: Elevated circulating parathyroid hormone level
description: An abnormal increased concentration of parathyroid hormone.

name: Oligosacchariduria
description: Increased urinary excretion of oligosaccharides (low molecular weight carbohydrate chains composed of at least three monosaccharide subunits), derived from a partial degradation of glycoproteins.

name: Distal upper limb amyotrophy
description: Muscular atrophy of distal arm muscles.

name: Prolonged bleeding after dental extraction
description: Prolonged bleeding post dental extraction sufficient to require medical intervention.

name: Intestinal atresia
description: An abnormal closure, or atresia of the tubular structure of the intestine.

name: Urethral atresia
description: Congenital anomaly characterized by closure or failure to develop an opening in the urethra.

name: Epiphyseal stippling
description: The presence of abnormal punctate (speckled, dot-like) calcifications in one or more epiphyses.
synonyms: Speckled calcifications in end part of bone

name: Neoplasm of the adrenal gland
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the adrenal gland.

name: Abnormally low-pitched voice
description: A persistent (minutes to hours) abnormal decrease in the pitch of the voice for the context or social situation or significantly different from the baseline of the individual.

name: Neoplasm of the lung
description: Tumor of the lung.

name: Protruding ear
description: Angle formed by the plane of the ear and the mastoid bone greater than the 97th centile for age (objective); or, outer edge of the helix more than 2 cm from the mastoid at the point of maximum distance (objective).

name: Halitosis
description: Noticeably unpleasant odors exhaled in breathing.

name: Status epilepticus
description: Status epilepticus is a type of prolonged seizure resulting either from the failure of the mechanisms responsible for seizure termination or from the initiation of mechanisms which lead to abnormally prolonged seizures (after time point t1). It is a condition that can have long-term consequences (after time point t2), including neuronal death, neuronal injury, and alteration of neuronal networks, depending on the type and duration of seizures.
synonyms: Repeated seizures without recovery between them

name: Mitral stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the orifice of the mitral valve.

name: Abnormal circulating arginine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of arginine in the blood circulation.

name: Generalized myoclonic seizure
description: A generalized myoclonic seizure is a type of generalized motor seizure characterized by bilateral, sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

name: Dysmetria
description: A type of ataxia characterized by the inability to carry out movements with the correct range and motion across the plane of more than one joint related to incorrect estimation of the distances required for targeted movements.

name: Abnormal nail attachment
description: An anomaly of the connection of the nail to the nailbed.

name: Nevus flammeus of the forehead
description: Naevus flammeus localized in the skin of the forehead.

name: Abnormal nail morphology
description: Abnormal structure or appearance of the nail.

name: Capillary malformation
description: A capillary malformation is a flat, sharply defined vascular stain of the skin. It may cover a large surface area or it may be scattered and appear as little islands of color. In a capillary maformation, the predominant vessels are small, slow-flow vessels (i.e., arterioles and postcapillary venules).

name: Ivory epiphyses
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: Increased bone density in end part of bone

name: Hyperextensible skin
description: A condition in which the skin can be stretched beyond normal, and then returns to its initial position.

name: Narrow jaw
description: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 standard deviations below the mean (objective); or an apparently decreased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).

name: Abnormal incisor morphology
description: An abnormality of morphology of the incisor tooth.

name: Retinal hole
description: A small break in the retina.

name: Abnormal fetal skin morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the skin of the fetus or newborn. Terms in this subhierarchy are restricted to findings that can only be observed in the prenatal period. Other HPO terms can also be used to describe fetal phenotypes.

name: Diastema
description: Increased space between two adjacent teeth in the same dental arch.

name: Underfolded helix
description: Underdevelopment of the helix that either affects the entire helix, or is localized.

name: Glomerular sclerosis
description: Accumulation of scar tissue within the glomerulus.

name: Abnormal number of dense granules
description: A deviation from the normal count of dense granules per thrombocyte.

name: Panic attack
description: A sudden episode of intense fear in a situation where there is no danger or apparent cause.

name: Abnormality of hair pigmentation
description: An abnormality of hair pigmentation (color).

name: Shortening of all phalanges of the toes
description: Developmental hypoplasia (shortening) of all phalanges of the foot.

name: Supernumerary tooth
description: The presence of one or more teeth additional to the normal number.

name: Neoplasm of the skeletal system
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skeleton.

name: Increased circulating creatine kinase MB isoform
description: An increased concentration of the MB isoform of creatine kinase in the blood circulation.

name: Localized hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth with a localized distribution.

name: Hypoplastic iris stroma
description: Underdevelopment of the stroma of iris.

name: Flushing
description: Recurrent episodes of redness of the skin together with a sensation of warmth or burning of the affected areas of skin.

name: Autoimmune neutropenia
description: Abnormal decrease of the absolute number of neutrophils in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group, accompanied by the detection of anti-neutrophil antibodies.
synonyms: Neutropenia in presence of anti-neutropil antibodies

name: Agenesis of premolar
description: Agenesis of premolar tooth.

name: Joint subluxation
description: A partial dislocation of a joint.

name: Cupped ribs
description: Wide, concave rib end.

name: Metabolic acidosis
description: Metabolic acidosis (MA) is characterized by a fall in blood pH due to a reduction of serum bicarbonate concentration. This can occur as a result of either the accumulation of acids (high anion gap MA) or the loss of bicarbonate from the gastrointestinal tract or the kidney (hyperchloremic MA). By definition, MA is not due to a respirary cause.

name: Absent skin pigmentation
description: Lack of skin pigmentation (coloring).

name: Myopathic facies
description: A facial appearance characteristic of myopathic conditions. The face appears expressionless with sunken cheeks, bilateral ptosis, and inability to elevate the corners of the mouth, due to muscle weakness.

name: Heterophoria
description: Heterophorias are latent deviations that are controlled by fusion. In certain circumstances (specific visual tasks, fatigue, illness, etc.), fusion can no longer be maintained and decompensation occurs.

name: Urinary retention
description: Inability to completely empty the urinary bladder during the process of urination.

name: Deep anterior chamber
description: Increased depth of the anterior chamber, i.e., the anteroposterior distance between the cornea and the iris is increased.

name: Increased total monocyte count
description: Abnormal increase of absolute number of monocytes in the blood, per microlitre, compared to a reference range for a given sex and age-group.

name: Thymus hyperplasia
description: Enlargement of the thymus.

name: Antalgic gait
description: To avoid pain weight is put on the affected leg for as short a time as possible, resulting in a limp. The patients appear to be walking as if there were a thorn in the sole of the foot. To reduce the load on the affected leg the patients lift and lower their foot in a fixed ankle position.

name: Bilateral coxa valga
description: The presence of bilateral coxa valga.

name: Mesomelia
description: Shortening of the middle parts of the limbs (forearm and lower leg) in relation to the upper and terminal segments.
synonyms: Disproportionately short middle portion of limb

name: Epispadias
description: Epispadias is a urogenital malformation characterized by the failure of the urethral tube to tubularize on the dorsal aspect. Unlike in hypospadias, where the meatus is on the ventral aspect, children with epispadias have a wide-open urethral plate on the dorsum. It is commonly seen as a component in the spectrum of bladder exstrophy-epispadias-complex. Isolated epispadias constitutes less than 10 percent of the total cases of epispadias.

name: Abdominal obesity
description: Excessive fat around the stomach and abdomen.

name: Abnormal circulating apolipoprotein concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration in blood of an apolipoprotein, i.e., of a protein that binds lipids to form lipoprotein and is thereby responsible for the transport of lipids in the blood and lymph circulation.

name: Abnormal circulating insulin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of insulin in the body.

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 5th finger
synonyms: Abnormality of the middle bone of little finger
Abnormality of the middle bone of pinkie finger
Abnormality of the middle bone of pinky finger

name: Abnormality of the biliary system
description: An abnormality of the biliary system.

name: Prominent digit pad
description: A soft tissue prominence of the ventral aspects of the fingertips or toe tips.

name: Recurrent bacterial infections
description: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of bacterial infection.

name: Diminished ability to concentrate
description: The inability to focus or concentrate on a specific task, activity, or object. The subject may find themselves unable to grasp or understand written text and re-reads frequently without understanding. Familiar tasks or activities are severely compromised due to the lack of ability to concentrate. Thinking through multi-step problems is typically very difficult or impossible, leading to avoidance of such activities.

name: Abnormal cerebellar vermis morphology
description: An anomaly of the vermis of cerebellum.

name: Aplasia of the proximal phalanges of the hand
Abnormality of the distal phalanges of the toes
synonyms: Abnormality of the outermost bone of the toes

name: Subcortical band heterotopia
description: A form of subcortical heterotopia with mislocalized gray matter within the white matter.It is defined as longitudinal bands of gray matter located deep to the cerebral cortex and separated from it by a thin layer of normal appearing white matter. It is part of the lissencephaly spectrum.

name: Hirsutism
description: Abnormally increased hair growth referring to a male pattern of body hair (androgenic hair).

name: Dark urine
description: An abnormal dark color of the urine.

name: Demyelinating motor neuropathy
description: Demyelination of peripheral motor nerves.

name: Hypoglycorrhachia
description: Abnormally low glucose concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: Low glucose levels in cerebral spinal fluid

name: Hyporeflexia
description: Reduction of neurologic reflexes such as the knee-jerk reaction.

name: Narrow internal auditory canal
description: Reduction in diameter of the internal auditory canal.

name: Hypermetropia
description: An abnormality of refraction characterized by the ability to see objects in the distance clearly, while objects nearby appear blurry.

name: Absent outer dynein arms
description: Absence of the outer dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, which normally are situated outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Metaphyseal widening
description: Abnormal widening of the metaphyseal regions of long bones.
synonyms: Broad wide portion of long bone

name: Abnormal tongue morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the tongue.

name: Increased circulating cortisol level
description: Overproduction of the hormone of cortisol by the adrenal cortex, resulting in a characteristic combination of clinical symptoms termed Cushing syndrome, with truncal obesity, a round, full face, striae atrophicae and acne, muscle weakness, and other features.

name: Knee pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the knee.

name: Abnormal circulating phenylalanine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of phenylalanine in the blood circulation.

name: Duplication of the distal phalanx of hand
description: This term applies if one or more of the distal phalanges of the hand are either partially duplicated, depending on severity leading to a broad or bifid appearance of the phalanges, or completely duplicated.
synonyms: Duplication of the outermost bone of hand
Partial/complete duplication of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormal third toe morphology
description: An anomaly of the third toe.

name: Abnormal fourth toe morphology
description: An anomaly of the fourth toe.

name: Aplasia of the distal phalanges of the toes
description: Absence of the distal phalanges of the toes.
synonyms: Absent outermost bone of the toes

name: Reduced attention regulation
description: An abnormality in one's ability to control their attention towards a specific subject or task can include difficulties in changing or maintaining attention.

name: Abnormal trabecular bone morphology
description: Abnormal structure or form of trabecular bone.

name: Abnormal circulating dicarboxylic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a dicarboxylic acid in the blood circulation.

name: Bifid uvula
description: Uvula separated into two parts most easily seen at the tip.

name: Short fourth metatarsal
description: Short fourth metatarsal bone.

name: Symptomatic seizures
description: A seizure that occurs in the context of a brain insult (systemic, toxic, or metabolic) and may not recur when the underlying cause has been removed or the acute phase has elapsed.

name: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism
description: Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism is characterized by reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) and results from the absence of the gonadal stimulating pituitary hormones: follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

name: Abnormal pattern of respiration
description: An anomaly of the rhythm or depth of breathing.

name: Saccadic oscillation
description: An involuntary abnormality of fixation in which there is an abnormal saccade away from fixation followed by an immediate corrective saccade.

name: Abnormal electrophysiology of sinoatrial node origin
description: An abnormality of the sinoatrial (SA) node in the right atrium. THe SA node acts as the pacemaker of the heart.

name: Excessive daytime somnolence
description: A state of abnormally strong desire for sleep during the daytime.
synonyms: More than typical sleepiness during day

name: Broad jaw
description: Bigonial distance (lower facial width) more than 2 SD above the mean (objective); or an apparently increased width of the lower jaw (mandible) when viewed from the front (subjective).

name: Multinodular goiter
description: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to multiple nodules in the thyroid gland.

name: Recurrent patellar dislocation
description: Patellar dislocation occurring repeated times.

name: Abnormal thalamus morphology
description: An abnormality of the thalamus.

name: Abnormality of the palpebral fissures
description: An anomaly of the space between the medial and lateral canthi of the two open eyelids.
synonyms: Abnormality of the opening between the eyelids

name: Ventricular fibrillation
description: Uncontrolled contractions of muscles fibers in the left ventricle not producing contraction of the left ventricle. Ventricular fibrillation usually begins with a ventricular premature contraction and a short run of rapid ventricular tachycardia degenerating into uncoordinating ventricular fibrillations.

name: Perisylvian polymicrogyria
description: Polymicrogyria (an excessive number of small gyri or convolutions) that is maximal in perisylvian regions (the regions that surround the Sylvian fissures), which may be symmetric or asymmetric and may extend beyond perisylvian regions. The Sylvian fissures often extend posteriorly and superiorly.

name: Leg dystonia
description: A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the legs.

name: Breast hypoplasia
description: Underdevelopment of the breast.

name: Abdominal pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) and perceived to originate in the abdomen.

name: Closed neural tube defect
description: A type of neural tube defect that is covered by skin.

name: Neonatal onset
description: Onset of signs or symptoms of disease within the first 28 days of life.
synonyms: Onset in first weeks of life

name: Epilepsia partialis continua
description: Epilepsia partialis continua (also called Kojevnikov's or Kozhevnikov's epilepsia) is a type of focal motor status epilepticus characterized by repeated stereotyped simple motor manifestations such as jerks, typically of a limb or the face, recurring every few seconds or minutes for extended periods (days or years).

name: Stroke-like episode
description: No consensus exists on what a stroke-like episode is, but these episodes can be functionally defined as a new neurological deficit, occurring with or without the context of seizures, which last longer than 24 hours.

name: Optic disc pallor
description: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disc (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression.

name: Gastrointestinal hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage affecting the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Self-mutilation
description: Deliberate harm to one's body resulting in tissue damage, without a conscious intent to die.

name: Neoplasm of the skin
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the skin.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to protein vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against proteins in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Polydactyly
description: A congenital anomaly characterized by the presence of supernumerary fingers or toes.
synonyms: More than five fingers or toes on hands or feet

name: Widened cerebral subarachnoid space
description: An increase in size of the anatomic space between the arachnoid membrane and pia mater in the region surrounding the cerebrum.

name: Abnormal foveal morphology on macular OCT
Recurrent urinary tract infections
description: Repeated infections of the urinary tract.

name: Abnormality of the hypothalamus-pituitary axis
description: Abnormality of the pituitary gland (also known as hypophysis), which is an endocrine gland that protrudes from the bottom of the hypothalamus at the base of the brain. The pituitary gland secretes the hormones ACTH, TSH, PRL, GH, endorphins, FSH, LH, oxytocin, and antidiuretic hormone. The secretion of hormones from the anterior pituitary is under the strict control of hypothalamic hormones, and the posterior pituitary is essentially an extension of the hypothalamus, so that hypothalamus and pituitary gland may be regarded as a functional unit.

name: Death in infancy
description: Death within the first 24 months of life.

name: Chronic noninfectious lymphadenopathy
description: A chronic form of lymphadenopathy that is not related to infection.

name: Bilateral polymicrogyria
description: Polymicrogyria that affects all or some of both cerebral hemispheres.

name: Long toe
description: Toes that appear disproportionately long compared to the foot.

name: Recurrent paroxysmal headache
description: Repeated episodes of headache with rapid onset, reaching a peak within minutes and of short duration (less than one hour) with pain that is throbbing, pulsating, or bursting in quality.

name: Chin with H-shaped crease
description: H-shaped crease in the fat pad of the chin.

name: NREM parasomnia
description: A parasomnia that occurs during non-rapid eye movement (NREM) sleep.

name: Intra-epidermal blistering
description: A type of blistering in which the lesions are located within the epidermis with loss of cell-cell adhesion of keratinocytes. In simplex EB, cleavage occurs in the basal layer, which is the innermost layer of the epidermis and consists of a single layer of basal germinative cells (mostly epidermal Keratinocytes) that proliferate and thereby produce new cells for other epidermal layers. As the cells move towards the upper layers of the epidermis they mature and eventually form cornified cells. The suprabasal cell layer lies directly above the basal layer and is composed of five to ten layers of cells.

name: Abnormal circulating haptoglobin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of haptoglobin in the blood circulation.

name: Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis
description: Unilateral ptosis with associated upper eyelid contraction and contraction of either the external or the internal pterygoid muscle. It is thought to occur because of congenital miswiring of a branch of the fifth cranial nerve into the branch of the third cranial nerve supplying the levator muscle. In Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis, elevation and even retraction of the affected eyelid is triggered by chewing, suction, lateral mandible movement, smiling, sternocleidomastoid contraction, protruding tongue, Valsalva maneuver and even by breathing.

name: Orchitis
description: Testicular inflammation.

name: Macular atrophy
description: Well-demarcated area(s) of partial or complete depigmentation in the macula, reflecting atrophy of the retinal pigment epithelium with associated retinal photoreceptor loss.

name: Hypoplastic pelvis
description: Underdevelopment of the bony pelvis.

name: Myelin outfoldings
description: The presence of excessive redundant myelin in the peripheral nerve sheath.
synonyms: Excessive focal folding of myelin sheaths

name: Ventricular escape rhythm
description: A ventricular escape rhythm occurs whenever higher-lever pacemakers in AV junction or sinus node fail to control ventricular activation. Escape rate is usually 20-40 bpm, often associated with broad QRS complexes (at least 120 ms).

name: Coronary artery atherosclerosis
description: Reduction of the diameter of the coronary arteries as the result of an accumulation of atheromatous plaques within the walls of the coronary arteries, which increases the risk of myocardial ischemia.
synonyms: Plaque build-up in arteries supplying blood to heart

name: Abnormal circulating nitrogen compound concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a nitrogen compound in the blood circulation.

name: Basal ganglia cysts
synonyms: Cystic lesions in the basal ganglia

name: Cubitus valgus
description: Abnormal positioning in which the elbows are turned out.

name: Abnormal male reproductive system physiology
description: An abnormal functionality of the male genital system.

name: Abnormality of the outer ear
description: An abnormality of the external ear.

name: Abnormal auditory canal morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the external acoustic tube (also known as the auditory canal).

name: Micromelia
description: The presence of abnormally small extremities.
synonyms: Smaller or shorter than typical limbs

name: Abnormal 5th finger phalanx morphology
description: Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th (little) finger.
synonyms: Abnormality of the little finger bone
Abnormality of the phalanges of the 5th finger
Abnormality of the pinkie finger bone
Abnormality of the pinky finger bone

name: Achilles tendon contracture
description: A contracture of the Achilles tendon.

name: Kyphoscoliosis
description: An abnormal curvature of the spine in both a coronal (lateral) and sagittal (back-to-front) plane.

name: Ankylosis
description: A reduction of joint mobility resulting from changes involving the articular surfaces.

name: Recurrent hypoglycemia
description: Recurrent episodes of decreased concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Class III obesity
description: Obesity with a body mass index of 40 kg per square meter or higher.

name: Granulomatosis
description: A granulomatous inflammation leading to multiple granuloma formation, which is a specific type of inflammation. A granuloma is a focal compact collection of inflammatory cells, mononuclear cells predominating, usually as a result of the persistence of a non-degradable product and of active cell mediated hypersensitivity.

name: Impaired lymphocyte transformation with phytohemagglutinin
description: Normal peripheral blood lymphocytes, when stimulated by phytohemagglutinin (PHA) are cytotoxic for homologous and heterologous cells but not for autologous cells in monolayer culture. The cytotoxic effect is thought to be indicative of the immunological competence of the lymphocytes.

name: Adenomatous colonic polyposis
description: Presence of multiple adenomatous polyps in the colon.

name: Abnormal elasticity of skin
description: Any abnormal increase or reduction in skin elasticity.

name: Concentric hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
description: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with an symmetrical and concentric pattern of hypertrophy.

name: Absent pubic hair
description: Absence of pubic hair.

name: Rieger anomaly
description: A congenital malformation of the anterior segment characterized by iridicorneal malformation, glaucoma, iris stroma hypoplasia, posterior embryotoxon, and corneal opacities.

name: Gastrointestinal desmoid tumor
description: Benign, slow-growing tumors without any metastatic potential. Despite their benign nature, they can damage nearby structures causing organ dysfunction. Histologically they resemble low-grade fibrosarcomas, but they are very locally aggressive and tend to recur even after complete resection. There is a tendency for recurrence in the setting of prior surgery and the most common localisation of these tumors is intraabdominal from smooth muscle cells of the instestine.

name: Abnormality of dental eruption
description: An abnormality of tooth eruption.

name: Abnormal fibula morphology
description: An anomaly of the calf bone (fibula), one of the two bones of the calf.

name: Basal ganglia gliosis
description: Focal proliferation of glial cells in the basal ganglia.

name: Lamellar cataract
description: A congenital cataract in which opacity is limited to layers of the lens external to the nucleus (i.e., the perinuclear region), i.e., between the nuclear and cortical layers of the lens.

name: Appendicular hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia of one or more limbs.

name: Abnormal circulating leptin concentration
description: An abnormal concentration of leptin in the blood.

name: Microcephalic sperm head
description: Decreased size of the head of sperm.

name: Left anterior fascicular block
description: Conduction block in the anterior division of the left bundle branch of the bundle of His.

name: Dilatation of the bladder
description: The presence of a dilated urinary bladder.

name: Telangiectasia of the skin
description: Presence of small, permanently dilated blood vessels near the surface of the skin, visible as small focal red lesions.

name: Intestinal perforation
description: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the intestine.

name: Acute kidney injury
description: Sudden loss of renal function, as manifested by decreased urine production, and a rise in serum creatinine or blood urea nitrogen concentration (azotemia).

name: Head-banging
description: Habitual striking of one's own head against a surface such as a mattress or wall of a crib.

name: Hypernatremia
description: An abnormally increased sodium concentration in the blood.

name: Peptic ulcer
description: The term peptic ulcer refers to acid peptic injury of the digestive tract, resulting in mucosal break reaching the submucosa. Peptic ulcers are usually located in the stomach or proximal duodenum, but they can also be found in the esophagus or Meckel's diverticulum. Infection with Helicobacter pylori and the use of non steroidal antiinflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or aspirin are the main risk factors of both gastric and duodenal peptic ulcers.
synonyms: Sore in the lining of gastrointestinal tract

name: Broad hallux phalanx
description: An increase in width in one or more phalanges of the big toe.

name: Recurrent hand flapping
description: A type of repetitive behavior in which the affected individual repeatedly waves the hands and/or arms rhythmically.

name: Abnormal subcutaneous fat tissue distribution
synonyms: Abnormal fat tissue distribution below the skin

name: Intestinal pseudo-obstruction
description: A functional rather than mechanical obstruction of the intestines, associated with manifestations that resemble those caused by an intestinal obstruction, including distension, abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, constipation or diarrhea, in an individual in whom a mechanical blockage has been excluded.

name: Abnormal bone structure
description: Any anomaly in the composite material or the layered arrangement of the bony skeleton.

name: Cochlear malformation
description: The presence of a malformed cochlea.

name: Reduced von Willebrand factor activity
description: Decreased activity of von Willebrand factor. Von Willebrand factor mediates the adhesion of platelets to the collagen exposed on endothelial cell surfaces.

name: Pulmonary cyst
description: A round circumscribed space within a lung that is surrounded by an epithelial or fibrous wall of variable thickness. A cyst usually has a thin and regular wall (less than 2 mm) and contains air, although some may contain fluid.

name: Thyroid adenoma
description: The presence of a adenoma of the thyroid gland.

name: Feeding difficulties
description: Impaired ability to eat related to problems gathering food and getting ready to suck, chew, or swallow it.

name: White hair
description: Hypopigmented hair that appears white.

name: Clinodactyly of the 4th toe
description: Bending or curvature of a fourth toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Abnormality of the acoustic reflex
description: An abnormality in the reflexive contraction of the middle-ear muscles in response to sound stimulation.

name: Abnormal paranasal sinus morphology
description: Abnormality of the paranasal (cranial) sinuses, which are air-filled spaces that are located within the bones of the skull and face and communicate with the nasal cavity. They comprise the maxillary sinuses, the frontal sinuses, the ethmoid sinuses, and the sphenoid sinuses.
synonyms: Abnormality of the sinuses of the head

name: Non-motor seizure
description: A seizure with clinical manifestation but without motor signs (other than possible behavior arrest) as its initial clinical manifestation. The electrographic onset may be generalized, focal, or unknown.

name: Metrorrhagia
description: Bleeding at irregular intervals.

name: Submucous cleft palate
description: A cleft of the muscular portion of the palate that is covered by mucous membrane.

name: Recurrent otitis media
description: Increased susceptibility to otitis media, as manifested by recurrent episodes of otitis media.

name: Dry hair
description: Hair that lacks the luster (shine or gleam) of normal hair.

name: Psychotic mentation
description: A pattern of thinking and perceiving characterized by a loss of contact with reality, leading to significant changes in thoughts, perceptions, and behaviors.

name: Rectal abscess
description: A collection of pus in the area of the rectum.

name: Horizontal nystagmus
description: Nystagmus consisting of horizontal to-and-fro eye movements.

name: Abnormal Descemet membrane morphology
description: Abnormality of Descemet's membrane, which is the basement membrane of the corneal endothelium.

name: Large intestinal polyposis
description: The presence of multiple polyps in the large intestine.

name: Elevated circulating follicle stimulating hormone level
description: An elevated concentration of follicle-stimulating hormone in the blood.
synonyms: Increased circulating follicle stimulating hormone level

name: Absent inner and outer dynein arms
description: Complete absence of the dynein arms of respiratory motile cilia, that is, absence of the inner and the outer dynein arms, which normally are situated inside and outside of the peripheral microtubules of motile cilia. This feature is usually appreciated by electron microscopy.

name: Abnormal lens morphology
description: An abnormality of the lens.

name: Hypoplasia of the frontal lobes
description: Underdevelopment of the frontal lobe of the cerebrum.

name: Polysplenia
description: Polysplenia is a congenital disease manifested by multiple small accessory spleens.

name: Lip telangiectasia
description: Telangiectasia (that is, the presence of small dilated superficial blood vessels) of the lips.

name: Abnormal cry
description: Any anomaly of the vocalizing of an infant's crying, i.e.,the typically loud voice production that is accompanied by tears and agitation.

name: Anorexia
description: Anorexia, or the loss of appetite for food, is a medical condition.

name: Abnormality of the bladder
description: An abnormality of the urinary bladder.

name: Abnormal ilium morphology
description: An abnormality of the ilium, the largest and uppermost bone of the pelvis.

name: Glucagonoma
description: An endocrine tumor of the pancreas that secretes excessive amounts of glucagon.

name: Vertebral compression fracture
synonyms: Compression fracture of a vertebral body

name: Spastic tetraplegia
description: Spastic paralysis affecting all four limbs.

name: Pointed chin
description: A marked tapering of the lower face to the chin.

name: Neoplasm of the small intestine
description: The presence of a neoplasm of the small intestine.

name: Abnormal 3rd finger morphology
description: An anomaly of the third finger.

name: High-frequency sensorineural hearing impairment
description: A form of sensorineural hearing impairment that affects primarily the higher frequencies.

name: Anisometropia
description: Inequality of refractive power of the two eyes.

name: Long neck
description: Increased inferior-superior length of the neck.

name: Aggressive behavior
description: Behavior or an act aimed at harming a person, animal, or physical property (e.g., acts of physical violence; shouting, swearing, and using harsh language; slashing someone's tires).

name: Abnormal blood inorganic cation concentration
description: An abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis.
synonyms: Abnormality of divalent inorganic cation homeostasis

name: Uncombable hair
description: Hair that is disorderly, stands out from the scalp, and cannot be combed flat.

name: Prostate cancer
description: A cancer of the prostate.

name: Neoplasm of head and neck
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the head and neck region with origin in the lip, oral cavity, nasal cavity, paranasal sinuses, pharynx, or larynx.

name: Abnormal vestibular function
description: An abnormality of the functioning of the vestibular apparatus.

name: Chorea
description: Chorea (Greek for 'dance') refers to widespread arrhythmic involuntary movements of a forcible, jerky and restless fashion. It is a random-appearing sequence of one or more discrete involuntary movements or movement fragments. Movements appear random because of variability in timing, duration or location. Each movement may have a distinct start and end. However, movements may be strung together and thus may appear to flow randomly from one muscle group to another. Chorea can involve the trunk, neck, face, tongue, and extremities.

name: Abnormal respiratory motile cilium physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the respiratory motile cilia.

name: Selective tooth agenesis
description: Agenesis specifically affecting one of the classes incisor, premolar, or molar.
synonyms: Failure of development of a tooth

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin concentration
description: The concentration of an interleukin (a class of cytokines) is outside the limits of normal.

name: Mesoaxial hand polydactyly
description: The presence of a supernumerary finger (not a thumb) involving the third or fourth metacarpal with associated osseous syndactyly.

name: Ovarian carcinoma
description: A malignant neoplasm originating from the surface ovarian epithelium.

name: Wide pubic symphysis
description: Abnormally increased width of the pubic symphysis is the midline cartilaginous joint uniting the superior rami of the left and right pubic bones.

name: Abnormality of the Achilles tendon
description: An abnormality of the Achilles tendon.

name: Flared metaphysis
description: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones.
synonyms: Flared wide portion of long bone
marked metaphyseal flaring of long bones

name: Recurrent tonsillitis
description: Inflammation of the tonsils that has occurred repeatedly. The definition of recurrent may vary somewhat, but the criteria used recently as a measure of severity were five or more episodes of true tonsillitis per year, symptoms recurring for at least a year, and episodes that are disabling and that prevent normal functioning. In some cases recurrent tonsillitis may be related to immunosusceptibility. Evidence exists for a genetic predisposition for recurrent tonsillitis.

name: Hypoplastic nipples
description: Underdevelopment of the nipple.

name: Abnormal large intestine physiology
description: A functional anomaly of the large intestine.

name: Choriocarcinoma
description: A malignant, trophoblastic and aggressive cancer, usually of the placenta. It is characterized by early hematogenous spread to the lungs and belongs to the far end of the spectrum of gestational trophoblastic disease (GTD), a subset of germ cell tumors.

name: Metopic synostosis
description: Premature fusion of the metopic suture.

name: Multiple exostoses
description: Presence of more than one exostosis. An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.

name: Abnormal lacrimal gland morphology
description: Abnormality of the lacrimal gland, i.e., of the almond-shaped gland that secretes the aqueous layer of the tear film for each eye.

name: Erythematous plaque
description: A plaque (a solid, raised, plateau-like (flat-topped) lesion greater than 1 cm in diameter) with a red or reddish color often associated with inflammation or irritation.

name: Increased red blood cell mass
description: The presence of an increased mass of red blood cells in the circulation.

name: Occipital encephalocele
description: A type of encephalocele (that is, a a protrusion of part of the cranial contents including brain tissue through a congenital opening in the cranium, typically covered with skin or mucous membrane) in the occipital region of the skull. Occipital encephalocele presents as a midline swelling over the occipital bone. It is usually covered with normal full-thickness scalp.
synonyms: Brain tissue sticks out through back of skull

name: Pancreatic adenocarcinoma
description: The presence of an adenocarcinoma of the pancreas.

name: Persistent pupillary membrane
description: The presence of remnants of a fetal membrane that persist as strands of tissue crossing the pupil.

name: Malignant neoplasm of the central nervous system
description: A tumor that originates in the pineal gland, has moderate cellularity and tends to form rosette patterns.

name: High forehead
description: An abnormally increased height of the forehead.

name: Toe clinodactyly
description: Bending or curvature of a toe in the tibial direction (i.e., towards the big toe).

name: Elfin facies
description: This is a description previously used to describe a facial form characterized by a short, upturned nose, wide mouth, widely spaced eyes, and full cheeks. Because of the imprecision in this definition it is preferable to describe these features precisely. This term is retained because it was often used in the past, but it should not be used for new annotations.

name: Progressive gait ataxia
description: A type of gait ataxia displaying progression of clinical severity.

name: Recurrent bacterial skin infections
description: Increased susceptibility to bacterial infections of the skin, as manifested by recurrent episodes of infectious dermatitis.

name: Abnormality of vitamin K metabolism
description: Vitamin K is a fat-soluble vitamin with a role in promoting the coagulation cascade.

name: Elevated maternal circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
description: Increase in the levels of maternal serum alpha-fetoprotein levels during pregnancy.

name: Cervical spinal canal stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing of the cervical spinal canal.

name: Short 5th toe
description: Underdevelopment (hypoplasia) of the fifth toe.

name: EEG with spike-wave complexes
description: Complexes of spikes (<70 ms) and sharp waves (70-200 ms), which are sharp transient waves that have a strong association with epilepsy, in cerebral electrical activity recorded along the scalp by electroencephalography (EEG).

name: Epigastric pain
description: Pain that is localized to the region of the upper abdomen immediately below the ribs.

name: Abnormal CSF homovanillic acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of homovanillic acid (HVA) in the cerebrospinal fluid. HVA is a metabolite of dopamine.

name: Proximal lower limb muscle weakness
description: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles of the legs.
synonyms: Proximal muscle weakness in lower limbs

name: Absent axillary hair
description: Absence of axillary hair.

name: Long thorax
description: Increased inferior to superior extent of the thorax.

name: Primary peritoneal carcinoma
description: A type of cancer that originates in the peritoneum. It is to be distinguished from metastatic cancer of the peritoneum. Peritoneal cancer can occur anywhere in the abdominal space, and affects the surface of organs contained inside the peritoneum.

name: Swan neck-like deformities of the fingers
description: A swan neck deformity describes a finger with a hyperextended PIP joint and a flexed DIP joint. The most common cause for a swan neck-like deformity is a disruption of the end of the extensor tendon. Conditions that loosen the PIP joint and allow it to hyperextend, for example conditions that weaken the volar plate, can produce a swan neck deformity of the finger. One example is rheumatoid arthritis. Another cause are conditions that tighten up the small (intrinsic) muscles of the hand and fingers, for example hand trauma or nerve disorders, such as cerebral palsy, Parkinson's disease, or stroke.

name: Abnormal skull base morphology
description: An abnormality of the base of the skull, which forms the floor of the cranial cavity and separates the brain from other facial structures. The skull base is made up of five bones: the ethmoid, sphenoid, occipital, paired frontal, and paired parietal bones, and is subdivided into 3 regions: the anterior, middle, and posterior cranial fossae. The petro-occipital fissure subdivides the middle cranial fossa into 1 central component and 2 lateral components.

name: Positive infectious agent test
description: Any kind of test for an infectious agent in a specimen positive.

name: Choroid plexus cyst
description: A cyst occurring within the choroid plexus within a cerebral ventricle.

name: Reduced consciousness
description: Abnormally diminished level of attention, responsiveness, or wakefulness.

name: Subcutaneous nodule
description: Slightly elevated lesions on or in the skin with a diameter of over 5 mm.
synonyms: Growth of abnormal tissue under the skin

name: Renal Fanconi syndrome
description: An inability of the tubules in the kidney to reabsorb small molecules, causing increased urinary loss of electrolytes (sodium, potassium, bicarbonate), minerals, glucose, amino acids, and water.

name: Esophageal neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the esophagus.

name: Limb-girdle muscle atrophy
description: Muscular atrophy affecting the muscles of the limb girdle.

name: Delayed eruption of teeth
description: Delayed tooth eruption, which can be defined as tooth eruption more than 2 SD beyond the mean eruption age.

name: Vertical nystagmus
description: Vertical nystagmus may present with either up-beating or down-beating eye movements or both. When present in the straight-ahead position of gaze it is referred to as upbeat nystagmus or downbeat nystagmus.

name: Basilar impression
description: Abnormal elevation of the floor of the posterior fossa including occipital condyles and foramen magnum.

name: Abnormality of the upper limb
description: An abnormality of the arm.

name: Drusen
description: Drusen (singular, 'druse') are tiny yellow or white accumulations of extracellular material (lipofuscin) that build up in Bruch's membrane of the eye.

name: Abnormal vestibulo-ocular reflex
description: An abnormality of the vestibulo-ocular reflex (VOR). The VOR attempts to keep the image stable on the retina. Ideally passive or active head movements in one direction are compensated for by eye movements of equal magnitude.

name: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
description: Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.

name: Fatigable weakness of swallowing muscles
description: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in swallowing that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Neoplasm of the eye
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the eye.

name: Vascular tortuosity
description: Abnormal twisting of arteries or veins.

name: Fatigable weakness of respiratory muscles
description: A type of weakness of the muscles involved in breathing (respiration) that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Stuttering
description: Disruptions in the production of speech sounds, with involuntary repetitions of words or parts of words, prolongations of speech sounds, or complete blockage of speech production for several seconds.

name: Erythromelalgia
description: Recurrent episodes of redness, burning pain, and warmth of the extremities following exposure to heat or exercise with symptoms predominantly involving the feet.

name: Abnormality of the dentition
description: Any abnormality of the teeth.

name: Cortical dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the cerebral cortex.

name: Nystagmus-induced head nodding
description: Head movements associated with nystagmus, that may represent an attempt to compensate for the involuntary eye movements and to improve vision.

name: Furrowed tongue
description: Accentuation of the grooves on the dorsal surface of the tongue.

name: Abnormal upper lip morphology
description: An abnormality of the upper lip.

name: Microphthalmia
description: A developmental anomaly characterized by abnormal smallness of one or both eyes.
synonyms: Decreased size of globe of eye

name: Molar tooth sign on MRI
description: An abnormal appearance of the midbrain in axial magnetic resonance imaging in which the elongated superior cerebellar peduncles give the midbrain an appearance reminiscent of a molar or wisdom tooth.
synonyms: Molar tooth sign on brain imaging

name: Arachnoid hemangiomatosis
description: The presence of multiple hemangiomas in the arachnoid.

name: Long nose
description: Distance from nasion to subnasale more than two standard deviations above the mean, or alternatively, an apparently increased length from the nasal root to the nasal base.

name: Thinning of Descemet membrane
description: A reduction in the thickness of Descemet's membrane.

name: Midline defect of the nose
description: This term groups together three conditions that presumably represent different degrees of severity of a midline defect of the nose or nasal tip.

name: Abnormal dentin morphology
description: Any abnormality of dentin.

name: Recurrent pharyngitis
description: An increased susceptibility to pharyngitis as manifested by a history of recurrent pharyngitis.

name: Reduced antigen-specific T cell proliferation
description: Impaired proliferation and expansion of a T cell population following activation by an antigenic stimulus.

name: Patchy changes of bone mineral density
description: Patchy (irregular) changes in bone mineral density. These changes can either be patchy reduction or increase of mineral density as seen on x-rays. Depending on the pathomechanism and the underlying disease, these changes can either appear solely as reduction or increase or as a combination of both (patches of bone showing an increased density while others are affected by reduction of mineral density).

name: Rapidly progressive
description: Applies to a disease manifestation that quickly increases in scope or severity over the course of time.

name: Pericarditis
description: Inflammation of the sac-like covering around the heart (pericardium).
synonyms: Swelling or irritation of membrane around heart

name: Metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of the metaphyses.
synonyms: Irregular wide portion of a long bone

name: Low frustration tolerance
description: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs when a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration, characterized by crying or temper tantrums in children, or aggressive or other maladaptive behaviors.

name: Abnormal embryonic development
description: An anomaly in the development of the embryo, that is, of the early developmental stage of development that follows the fertilization of an egg by sperm.

name: Abnormal shoulder physiology
description: Anopmalous function of the shoulder. The shoulder is a ball-and-socket joint that is made up of humerus, scapula and clavicle, which are connected by the sternoclavicular joint (SC), the acromioclavicular joint (AC), the glenohumeral joint (GH), and the scapulothoracic joint (ST). The GH, AC and SC joints link the upper extremity to the axial skeleton at the thorax and enable movement at the shoulder joint: flexion, extension, and rotation of the arm.

name: Testicular adrenal rest tumor
description: Testicular adrenal rest tumor (TART) is a abenign tumor of the testis. TART generally occurs multiply and bilaterally within the rete testis. Histologically, TART resemble adrenocortical tissue, which led to the name. The tumous are not encapsulated and consist of sheets or confluent cords of large polygonal cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm.

name: Sparse medial eyebrow
description: Decreased density/number and/or decreased diameter of medial eyebrow hairs.

name: Recurrent meningitis
description: An increased susceptibility to meningitis as manifested by a medical history of recurrent episodes of meningitis.

name: Soft tissue neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) that arises from the soft tissue. The most common types are lipomatous (fatty), vascular, smooth muscle, fibrous, and fibrohistiocytic neoplasms.

name: ST segment elevation
description: An electrocardiographic anomaly in which the ST segment is observed to be located superior to the isoelectric line.

name: Pseudoepiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
description: A secondary ossification center in the phalanges of the hand that is distinct from the normal epiphysis that does not contribute to the longitudinal growth of a tubular bone.

name: Retinal detachment
description: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium.

name: Aplasia involving bones of the lower limbs
synonyms: Absent bones of the lower limbs

name: Abnormal pulse
description: An anomaly of the rhythmic throbbing of an artery that reflects the widening of the artery as blood flows through it and is caused by successive contractions of the heart.

name: Trophic changes related to pain
