description: Trophic changes is a term used to describe abnormalities in the area of pain that include primarily wasting away of the skin, tissues, or muscle, thinning of the bones, and changes in how the hair or nails grow, including thickening or thinning of hair or brittle nails.

name: Abnormality of lens shape
description: An abnormal shape of the lens.

name: Beaking of vertebral bodies
description: Anterior tongue-like protrusions of the vertebral bodies.

name: Shoulder contracture
description: Lack of full passive range of motion (restrictions in flexion, extension, or other movements) of the shoulder joint resulting from structural changes of non-bony tissues, such as muscles, tendons, ligaments, joint capsules and/or skin.

name: Abnormal metabolism
description: An abnormality in the function of the chemical reactions related to processes including conversion of food to enter, synthesis of proteins, lipids, nucleic acids, and carbohydrates, or the elimination of waste products.

name: Undetectable electroretinogram
description: Lack of any response to stimulation upon electroretinography.

name: Gastrointestinal infarctions
synonyms: Death of digestive organ tissue due to poor blood supply

name: Disproportionate tall stature
description: A tall and slim body build with increased arm span to height ratio (>1.05) and a reduced upper-to-lower segment ratio (<0.85), i.e., unusually long arms and legs. The extremities as well as the hands and feet are unusually slim.

name: Optic disc coloboma
description: A cleft of the optic nerve that extends inferiorly.

name: Epiretinal membrane
description: An epiretinal membrane is a thin sheet of fibrous tissue that can develop on the surface of the macular area of the retina and cause a disturbance in vision. An epiretinal membrane area can develop on the thin macular area of the retin. An epiretinal membrane is also sometimes called a macular pucker, premacular fibrosis, surface wrinkling retinopathy or cellophane maculopathy.

name: Panniculitis
description: Inflammation of subcutaneous adipose tissue.

name: Decreased circulating carnitine concentration
description: Concentration of carnitine in the blood circulation below the lower limit of normal.

name: Abnormal DLCO
description: An abnormal amount of oxygen passes into the blood from the lungs and/or an abnormal amount of carbon dioxide passes from the blood into the lungs.
synonyms: Abnormal transfer factor of the lung for carbon monoxide

name: Vitreous hemorrhage
description: Bleeding within the vitreous compartment of the eye.

name: Respiratory insufficiency due to defective ciliary clearance
Seesaw nystagmus
description: Seesaw nystagmus is a type of pendular nystagmus where a half cycle consists of the elevation and intorsion of one eye, concurrently with the depression and extortion of the fellow eye. In the other half cycle, there is an inversion of the ocular movements.

name: Juvenile cataract
description: A type of cataract that is not apparent at birth but that arises in childhood or adolescence.

name: Abnormal uvea morphology
description: An abnormality of the uvea, the vascular layer of the eyeball.

name: Skin nodule
description: Morphologically similar to a papule, but greater than either 10mm in both width and depth, and most frequently centered in the dermis or subcutaneous fat.
synonyms: Growth of abnormal tissue on or under the skin

name: Coronal cleft vertebrae
description: Frontal schisis (cleft or cleavage) of vertebral bodies.

name: Abnormality of thumb phalanx
description: A structural anomaly of one or more phalanges of the thumb.

name: Chorioretinal atrophy
description: Atrophy of the choroid and retinal layers of the fundus.

name: Joint hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring within a joint.

name: Small pituitary gland
description: An abnormally decreased size of the pituitary gland.

name: Joint dislocation
description: Displacement or malalignment of joints.

name: Hypersplenism
description: A malfunctioning of the spleen in which it prematurely destroys red blood cells.

name: Trismus
description: Limitation in the ability to open the mouth.

name: Dysuria
description: Painful or difficult urination.

name: Proximal muscle weakness
description: A lack of strength of the proximal muscles.
synonyms: Weakness in muscles of upper arms and upper legs

name: Abnormal renal tubular epithelial morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the renal tubular epithelial cells (RTEC), a layer of cells in the outer layer of the renal tubule. These cells play a role in the absorption of substances such as glucose and amino from the primary urine.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin in multiple or solitary non-inflammatory, well-demarcated, oval or circular ulcers with a diameter of about 1 to 2 cm. Aplasia cutis congenita most commonly occurs on the scalp, but may present in the face, trunk, or limbs.
synonyms: Absence of part of skin at birth

name: Meckel diverticulum
description: Meckel's diverticulum is a congenital diverticulum located in the distal ileum.

name: Abnormal rectum morphology
description: An abnormaltiy of the rectum, the final segment of the large intestine that stores solid waste until it passes through the anus.

name: Iridodonesis
description: Tremulousness of the iris on movement of the eye, occurring in subluxation of the lens.

name: Short nail
description: Decreased length of nail.

name: Early young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at an age of greater than or equal to 16 to under 19 years.

name: Short distal phalanx of finger
description: Short distance from the end of the finger to the most distal interphalangeal crease or the distal interphalangeal joint flexion point. That is, hypoplasia of one or more of the distal phalanx of finger.
synonyms: Hypoplasia of the distal phalanges of the hand

name: Osteolysis involving bones of the upper limbs
Abnormal glycosylation
description: An anomaly of a glycosylation process, i.e., a process involved in the covalent attachment of a glycosyl residue to a substrate molecule.

name: Absent speech
description: Complete lack of development of speech and language abilities.

name: Abnormal superior cerebellar peduncle morphology
description: An anomaly of the superior cerebellar peduncle.
synonyms: Abnormality of the superior cerebellar peduncle

name: Decreased specific antibody response to protein-conjugated polysaccharide vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against protein-conjugated polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Tortuous cerebral arteries
description: Excessive bending, twisting, and winding of a cerebral artery.

name: Gonadoblastoma
description: The presence of a gonadoblastoma, a neoplasm of a gonad that consists of aggregates of germ cells and sex cord elements.

name: Abnormality of the vertebral column
description: Any abnormality of the vertebral column.

name: Elevated urinary carboxylic acid
description: An increased amount of carboxylic acid in the urine.

name: Posterior blepharitis
description: A type of blepharitis that affects the meibomian glands and meibomian gland orifices. This abnormality can be associated with a spectrum of appearances ranging from meibomian seborrhoea (foaming meibomian gland secretions) and meibomianitis (inflamed meibomian glands), to chalazia.

name: Down-sloping shoulders
description: Low set, steeply sloping shoulders.

name: Abnormal protein O-linked glycosylation
description: An anomaly of protein O-linked glycosylation, i.e., of the process in which a carbohydrate or carbohydrate derivative unit is added to a protein via the hydroxyl group of a serine or threonine residue.

name: Opisthotonus
description: Opisthotonus is defined as a dramatic abnormal posture due to spastic contraction of the extensor muscles of the neck, trunk, and lower extremities that produces a severe backward arching from neck to heel. In most cases, the trunk is elevated off the ground by a few inches. It is usually sudden in onset and can be sustained or repetitive. It can be considered a variant of decerebrate posturing involving a hyperextension of the neck, back, and limbs.

name: Laryngeal carcinoma
description: A carcinoma of the larynx.

name: Fetal ultrasound soft marker
description: An finding upon obstetric ultrasound examination performed at around 16 to 20 weeks of gestation that is abnormal but not clearly identifiable as a fetal anatomic malformation or growth restriction. Such findings are known as soft markers since they are associated with increased risk for fetal aneuploidy or other disorders.

name: Ventricular tachycardia
description: A tachycardia originating in the ventricles characterized by rapid heart rate (over 100 beats per minute) and broad QRS complexes (over 120 ms).

name: Hypocholesterolemia
description: An decreased concentration of cholesterol in the blood.

name: Anaphylactic shock
description: An acute hypersensitivity reaction due to exposure to a previously encountered antigen.

name: Elevated urinary 3-hydroxybutyric acid
description: An increased amount of 3-hydroxybutyric acid in the urine.

name: Peripheral opacification of the cornea
description: Reduced transparency of the peripheral region of the cornea.

name: Truncus arteriosus
description: A single arterial trunk arises from the cardiac mass. The pulmonary arteries, aorta and coronary arteries arise from this single trunk with no evidence of another outflow tract.

name: Abnormality of the metopic suture
description: The frontal suture divides the two halves of the frontal bone of the skull in infants and children and generally undergoes fusion by the age of six. A persistent frontal suture is referred to as a "metopic suture".

name: Abnormality of the hepatic vasculature
description: An abnormality of the hepatic vasculature.

name: Cephalohematoma
description: Hemorrhage between the skull and periosteum of a newborn resulting from rupture of blood vessels that cross the periosteum.

name: Abnormal circulating long-chain fatty-acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a long-chain fatty acid in the blood circulation.

name: Increased level of hippuric acid in urine
description: An increase in the level of hippuric acid in the urine.
synonyms: Increased level of N-benzoylglycine in urine

name: Pulmonary hemorrhage
description: Pulmonary hemorrhage is a bleeding within the lungs. Older children and adults may spit blood or bloody sputum. Neonates, infants and young children usually do not spit up blood. Anemia, pulmonary infiltrates, increasingling bloody return on BAL and the presence of hemosiderin-laden macrophages in broncho-alveolar lavage (BAL) fluid or lung biopsy can diagnose lung bleeding. Alveolar macrophages contain phagocytosed red blood cells and stain positive for hemosiderin, a product of hemoglobin degradation, after about 48-72 hours following pulmonary hemorraghe. Previous or recurrent bleeding can thus be distinguished from fresh events. A differentiation into local or diffuse is of importance. Also differentiate if pulmonary hemorrhage is due to a primary lung disorder or a manifestation of a systemic disease.

name: Abnormal heart rate variability
description: Any abnormality in the variability of the time interval between successive heartbeats.

name: Spoken word recognition deficit
description: Reduced ability of lexical discrimination, which refers to the process of distinguishing a stimulus word from other phonologically similar words. Lexical discrimination can be defined as the process of correctly identifying words in the mental lexicon to match the phonological input of a stimulus.

name: Dementia
description: A loss of global cognitive ability of sufficient amount to interfere with normal social or occupational function. Dementia represents a loss of previously present cognitive abilities, generally in adults, and can affect memory, thinking, language, judgment, and behavior.

name: Calcification of falx cerebri
description: The presence of calcium deposition in the falx cerebri.

name: Hyperkeratosis
description: Hyperkeratosis is a histopathological term defining a thickened stratum corneum and may be present in many different skin conditions, with many possible overlaps. Hyperkeratosis refers to the increased thickness of the stratum corneum, the outer layer of the skin. Hyperkeratosis is subclassified as orthokeratotic or parakeratotic. Orthokeratotic hyperkeratosis refers to the thickening of the keratin layer with preserved keratinocyte maturation, while parakeratotic hyperkeratosis shows retained nuclei as a sign of delayed maturation of keratinocytes.

name: Abnormal small intestine morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the small intestine.

name: Reduced factor XIII activity
description: Decreased activity of coagulation factor XIII (also known as fibrin stabilizing factor). Activated Factor XIII cross-links fibrin polymers solidifying the clot.

name: Pituitary corticotropic cell adenoma
description: A type of pituitary adenoma that produces adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH).

name: Reduced protein S activity
description: An abnormality of coagulation related to a decreased concentration of vitamin K-dependent protein S. Protein S is a cofactor of protein C.

name: Bifid ribs
description: A bifid rib refers to cleavage of the sternal end of a rib, usually unilateral. Bifid ribs are usually asymptomatic, and are often discovered incidentally by chest x-ray.

name: Viral infection-induced rhabdomyolysis
description: Rhabdomyolysis induced by a viral infection.

name: Sudden death
description: Rapid and unexpected death.

name: X-linked dominant inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that is observed for dominant traits related to a gene encoded on the X chromosome. In the context of medical genetics, X-linked dominant disorders tend to manifest very severely in affected males. The severity of manifestation in females may depend on the degree of skewed X inactivation.

name: Osteoarthritis
description: Degeneration (wear and tear) of articular cartilage, i.e., of the joint surface. Joint degeneration may be accompanied by osteophytes (bone overgrowth), narrowing of the joint space, regions of sclerosis at the joint surface, or joint deformity.

name: Past medical history
description: In a medical encounter, the physician generally will interview the patient about his or her current problem, and may perform additional testing. The past medical history (PMH) in contrast records information about the patient's medical, personal and family history that might be relevant to the presenting illness or to provide optimal clinical management. The PMH generally includes (if relevant) other major illnesses, hospitalizations, surgeries, injuries, allergies, gynecologic and obstetric history, family history, personal history including occupational history, alcohol and drug use, etc.

name: Malar rash
description: An erythematous (red), flat facial rash that affects the skin in the malar area (over the cheekbones) and extends over the bridge of the nose.

name: Arm dystonia
description: A type of dystonia (abnormally increased muscular tone causing fixed abnormal postures) that affects muscles of the arms.

name: Absence of secondary sex characteristics
description: No secondary sexual characteristics are present at puberty.
synonyms: No secondary sexual characteristics at puberty

name: IgA deposition in the glomerulus
description: The presence of immunoglobulin A deposits in the glomerulus.

name: Abnormal ascending aorta morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the portion of the aorta that arises from the base of the left ventricle and extends upward to the aortic arch and from which the coronary arteries arise.

name: Increased circulating globulin level
description: An abnormally elevated concentration of globulins in the blood.

name: Adult onset sensorineural hearing impairment
description: The presence of sensorineural deafness with late onset.

name: Bulimia
description: A form of anomalous eating behavior characterized by binge eating is followed by self-induced vomiting or other compensatory behavior intended to prevent weight gain (purging, fasting or exercising or a combination of these).

name: Dry skin
description: Skin characterized by the lack of natural or normal moisture.

name: Abnormality of the extraocular muscles
description: An abnormality of an extraocular muscle.

name: Stereotypic movements of face and head
description: Abnormal movements of face and head.

name: Abnormal relationship
description: The state of having abnormal relationships with others. This does not describe specific aspects of one's social aptitudes but rather a state which may come about from these aptitudes, such as lacking peer relationships, lacking close friends, or having a relational network that is abnormal given one's cultural context.

name: Hypogonadism
description: A decreased functionality of the gonad.

name: Partial albinism
description: Absence of melanin pigment in various areas, which is found at birth and is permanent. The lesions are known as leucoderma and are often found on the face, trunk, or limbs.
synonyms: Congenital partial albinism on face, trunk, or limbs

name: Ankyloglossia
description: Short or anteriorly attached lingual frenulum, associated with limited mobility of the tongue.

name: Decreased circulating gonadotropin concentration
description: A reduction of the circulating level of a gonadotropin, that is, of a protein hormone secreted by gonadotrope cells of the anterior pituitary of vertebrates. The primary gonadotropins are luteinizing hormone (LH) and follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH).

name: Ectodermal dysplasia
description: Ectodermal dysplasia is a group of conditions in which there is abnormal development of the skin, hair, nails, teeth, or sweat glands.

name: Vitritis
description: Inflammation of the vitreous body, characterized by the presence of inflammatory cells and protein exudate in the vitreous cavity.

name: Abnormal pulmonary alveolar system morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the pulmonary acinus, alveolar parenchyma, or alveoli.

name: Generalized weakness of limb muscles
description: Generalized weakness of the muscles of the arms and legs.

name: Ankle weakness
description: Reduced strength of the muscles that lift or otherwise move the foot at the ankle.

name: Abnormal mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration
description: A deviation from the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell). A reduced mean corpuscular hemoglobin (MCH) may indicate a hypochromic anemia, but the MCH may be normal if both the total hemoglobin and the red blood cell count are reduced.

name: Palpitations
description: A sensation that the heart is pounding or racing, which is a non-specific sign but may be a manifestation of arrhythmia.

name: Airway hyperresponsiveness
description: An increased sensitivity of the airways to an inhaled constrictor agonist, a steeper slope of the dose-response curve, and a greater maximal response to the agonist.

name: Cervical spinal cord atrophy
description: Atrophy of the cervical segment of the spinal cord.

name: Elliptocytosis
description: The presence of elliptical, cigar-shaped erythrocytes on peripheral blood smear.

name: Uterine leiomyoma
description: The presence of a leiomyoma of the uterus.

name: Gastrointestinal arteriovenous malformation
description: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries and that is located in the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Recurrent spontaneous abortion
description: Repeated episodes of abortion (Expulsion of the product of fertilization before completing the term of gestation) without deliberate interference.

name: Atlantoaxial abnormality
description: An anomaly of the atlantoaxial joint, i.e., of the joint between the first (atlas) and second (axis) cervical vertebrae.

name: Muscle fiber splitting
description: Fiber splitting or branching is a common finding in human and rat skeletal muscle pathology. Fiber splitting refers to longitudinal halving of the complete fiber, while branching originates from a regenerating end of a necrotic fiber as invaginations of the sarcolemma. In fiber branching, one end of the fiber remains intact as a single entity, while the other end has several branches.

name: Abnormality of the urinary system physiology
Elevated circulating alpha-fetoprotein concentration
description: Concentration of alpha-fetoprotein in the blood circulation above the upper limit of normal.

name: Meningitis
description: Inflammation of the meninges.

name: Pituitary prolactin cell adenoma
description: A type of pituitary adenoma originating in prolactin secreting cells. This kind of adenoma is characterized by overproduction of prolactin, and may cause loss of menstrual periods and breast milk production in women.

name: Hair follicle neoplasm
description: An uncontrolled autonomous cell-proliferation originating in a hair follicle, which is an epidermal adnexal structures responsible for hair growth.

name: Supernumerary cusp
description: Additional cusps of a dental crown.

name: Oocyte maturation arrest
description: Oocyte maturation arrest (OMA) can manifest as failed in vitro fetilization/intracytoplasmic sperm injection (IVF/ICSI) attempts using affected oocytes.

name: Hypotension
description: Low Blood Pressure, vascular hypotension.

name: Large joint hypermobilty
description: The capability that a large joint (or a group of joints) has to move, passively and/or actively, beyond normal limits along physiological axes. Large joints include shoulders, elbows, hips, knees, and ankles.

name: Male reproductive system neoplasm
description: A neoplasm that affects the male reproductive system.

name: Abnormality of the ankle
description: An anomaly of the joint that connects the foot with the leg.

name: Concave nail
description: The natural longitudinal (posterodistal) convex arch is not present or is inverted.

name: Hypochromic anemia
description: A type of anemia characterized by an abnormally low concentration of hemoglobin in the erythrocytes.

name: Abnormal peripheral nervous system physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of the part of the nervous system that consists of the nerves and ganglia outside of the brain and spinal cord.

name: Alkalosis
description: Depletion of acid or accumulation base in the body fluids.

name: C1-C2 vertebral abnormality
description: Any abnormality of the atlas and the axis.

name: Retinal hamartoma
description: A hamartoma (a benign, focal malformation consisting of a disorganized mixture of cells and tissues) of the retina.

name: Abnormal thalamic size
description: Deviation from the normal range of size of the thalamus.

name: Chin with horizontal crease
description: Horizontal crease or fold situated below the vermilion border of the lower lip and above the fatty pad of the chin, with the face at rest.

name: Abnormal midbrain morphology
description: An abnormality of the midbrain, which has as its parts the tectum, cerebral peduncle, midbrain tegmentum and cerebral aqueduct.

name: Wheezing
description: A high-pitched whistling sound associated with labored breathing.

name: Small anterior fontanelle
description: Abnormally decreased size of the anterior fontanelle with respect to age-dependent norms.

name: Abnormal ankle morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the ankle.

name: Regional abnormality of skin
description: An abnormality of the skin that is restricted to a particular body region.

name: Abnormal ovarian physiology
description: Any anomaly of ovarian function.

name: Pulmonary opacity
description: Opacity refers to any area that preferentially attenuates the x-ray beam and therefore appears more opaque than the surrounding area. It is a nonspecific term that does not indicate the size or pathologic nature of the abnormality.

name: Abnormality of dental structure
description: An abnormality of the structure or composition of the teeth.

name: Abnormal muscle glycogen content
description: Any anomaly in the amount of glycogen in muscle tissue.

name: Absent foveal reflex
description: Lack of the foveal reflex, which normally occurs as a result of the reflection of light from the ophthalmoscope in the foveal pit upon examination. The foveal reflex is a bright pinpoint of light that is observed to move sideways or up and down in response to movement of the opthalmoscope.

name: Recurrent oral herpes
description: Recurrent episodes of oral herpes, typically characterized by blisters or ulcers on the gums, lips and/or tongue caused by herpes virus.

name: Tooth abscess
description: A pocket of pus located within a region of a tooth.

name: Unilateral renal hypoplasia
description: One sided hypoplasia of the kidney.

name: Decreased neutrophil oxidative burst
description: Abnormal decrease of neutrophil oxidative burst, commonly measured through oxidation of dihydrorhodamine (DHR) using flow cytometry or through nitroblue tetrazolium test (NBT) using optical microscopy, upon stimulation with phorbol-12-myristate-13-acetate (PMA), E. coli or other ligands.
synonyms: Reduced reactive oxygen species production in neutrophils

name: High anterior hairline
description: Distance between the hairline (trichion) and the glabella (the most prominent point on the frontal bone above the root of the nose), in the midline, more than two SD above the mean. Alternatively, an apparently increased distance between the hairline and the glabella.

name: Peripheral hypomyelination
description: Reduced amount of myelin in the nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis in the peripheral nervous system.

name: Esophoria
description: A form of strabismus with both eyes turned inward to a relatively mild degree, usually defined as less than 10 prism diopters.

name: Long hallux
description: Increased length of the big toe.

name: Enamel hypomineralization
description: A decreased amount of enamel mineralization. Hypomineralized enamel has a brown discoloration and brittle aspect.
synonyms: White spot lesions of tooth enamel

name: Nephrogenic diabetes insipidus
description: A form of diabetes insipidus caused by failure of the kidneys to respond to vasopressin (AVP).

name: Abnormal labia morphology
description: An anomaly of the labia, the externally visible portions of the vulva.

name: Specific learning disability
description: Impairment of certain skills such as reading or writing, coordination, self-control, or attention that interfere with the ability to learn. The impairment is not related to a global deficiency of intelligence.

name: Hepatic fibrosis
description: The presence of excessive fibrous connective tissue in the liver. Fibrosis is a reparative or reactive process.

name: Abnormal pons morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the pons.

name: Short toe
description: A toe that appears disproportionately short compared to the foot.

name: Delayed pubic bone ossification
description: Delayed maturation and calcification of the pubic bone.

name: Abnormal zygomatic bone morphology
description: An abnormality of the zygomatic bone.

name: Abnormal thymus morphology
description: Abnormality of the thymus, an organ located in the upper anterior portion of the chest cavity just behind the sternum and whose main function is to provide an environment for T lymphocyte maturation.

name: Postterm pregnancy
description: A pregnancy that extends to 42 weeks of gestation or beyond.

name: Partial absence of specific antibody response to tetanus vaccine
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against a tetanus antigen, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Increased circulating beta-2-microglobulin level
description: Elevated concentration of beta-2-microglobulin in the blood.

name: Lissencephaly
description: A spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration that subsumes the terms agyria, pachygyria and subcortical band heterotopia. See also neuropathological definitions for 2-, 3-, and 4-layered lissencephaly.
synonyms: Fewer or absent grooves in brain

name: Minicore myopathy
description: Multiple small zones of sarcomeric disorganization and lack of oxidative activity (known as minicores) in muscle fibers.

name: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibers
description: A reduced number of large myelinated nerve fibers.
synonyms: Decreased number of large peripheral myelinated nerve fibres
Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibers
Loss of larger myelinated nerve fibres

name: Abnormal respiratory epithelium morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the pseudostratified ciliated epithelium that lines much of the conducting portion of the airway, including part of the nasal cavity and larynx, the trachea, and bronchi.

name: Large earlobe
description: Increased volume of the earlobe, that is, abnormally prominent ear lobules.

name: Schwannoma
description: A benign nerve sheath tumor composed of Schwann cells.

name: Downslanted palpebral fissures
description: The palpebral fissure inclination is more than two standard deviations below the mean.
synonyms: Downward slanting of the opening between the eyelids

name: Abnormal vestibulocochlear nerve morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the vestibulocochlear nerve. The vestibulocochlear nerve consists of the vestibular and cochlear nerves, also known as cranial nerve eight (CN VIII). Each nerve has distinct nuclei within the brainstem. The vestibular nerve is primarily responsible for maintaining body balance and eye movements, while the cochlear nerve is responsible for hearing.
synonyms: Abnormality of the VIIIth cranial nerve

name: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
description: Episodes of atrial fibrillation that typically last for several hours up to one day and terminate spontaneously.

name: Subarachnoid hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage occurring between the arachnoid mater and the pia mater.

name: Short thumb
description: Hypoplasia (congenital reduction in size) of the thumb.

name: Reduced vital capacity
description: An abnormal reduction on the vital capacity, which is defined as the total lung capacity (volume of air in the lungs at maximal inflation) less the residual volume (i.e., volume of air in the lungs following maximal exhalation) of the lung.

name: Glutaric aciduria
description: The concentration of glutaric acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Congenital abnormal hair pattern
description: A congenital abnormality of the distribution of hair growth.

name: Abnormality of the crus of the helix
description: An abnormality of the crus of the helix, which is the horizontal piece of cartilage located outside the ear canal that divides the upper and lower parts of the ear.
synonyms: Abnormality of the crus of the ear

name: Capillary fragility
description: Reduced resistance to rupture of capillary blood vessels. Capillary fragility may manifest as a bleeding diathesis with spontaneous ecchymoses (bruises).

name: Foot oligodactyly
description: A developmental defect resulting in the presence of fewer than the normal number of toes.

name: Type 1 muscle fiber predominance
description: An abnormal predominance of type I muscle fibers (in general, this feature can only be observed on muscle biopsy).

name: Abnormal urinary organic compound level
description: The amount of an organic compound in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is outside the limits of normal. An organic compound is defined here as a chemical compound that contains a carbon-hydrogen or carbon-carbon bond, although some other definitions exist. Examples of organic compounds includes alkanes, alkenes, alkynes, aromatic compounds, alcohols, ketones, aldehydes, carboxylic acids, and esters.

name: Abnormal atrial arrangement
description: Abnormality of the spatial relationship of the atria to other components of the heart.

name: Large cafe-au-lait macules with irregular margins
description: Large hypermelanotic macules with jagged borders.

name: Axillary freckling
description: The presence in the axillary region (armpit) of an increased number of freckles, small circular spots on the skin that are darker than the surrounding skin because of deposits of melanin.

name: Testicular atrophy
description: Wasting (atrophy) of the testicle (the male gonad) manifested by a decrease in size and potentially by a loss of fertility.

name: Kinetic tremor
description: Tremor that occurs during any voluntary movement. It may include visually or non-visually guided movements. Tremor during target directed movement is called intention tremor.

name: Tracheal calcification
description: Calcification (abnormal deposits of calcium) in the tracheal tissues.

name: Thick nasal alae
description: Increase in bulk of the ala nasi.

name: Increased arm span
description: Increased length of the arm span (length from one end of an individual's arms measured at the fingertips to the other when raised parallel to the ground at shoulder height at a one-hundred eighty degree angle).

name: Muscle fibrillation
description: Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole as ascertained by electromyography (EMG). If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG.

name: Foam cells
description: The presence of foam cells, a type of macrophage that localizes to fatty deposits on blood vessel walls, where they ingest low-density lipoproteins and become laden with lipids, giving them a foamy appearance.

name: Dysgenesis of the basal ganglia
description: Structural abnormality of the basal ganglia related to defective development.

name: Abnormal neutrophil physiology
description: Any functional abnormality of neutrophils.

name: High-output congestive heart failure
description: A form of heart failure characterized by elevated cardiac output. This may be seen in patients with heart failure and hyperthyroidism, anemia, pregnancy, arteriovenous fistulae, and others.

name: Increased cerebral lipofuscin
description: Lipofuscin (age pigment) is a brown-yellow, electron-dense, autofluorescent material that accumulates progressively over time in lysosomes of postmitotic cells, such as neurons and cardiac myocytes. This term pertains if there is an increase in the accumulation of lipofuscin (also known as autofluorescent lipoprotein) more than expected for the age of the patient.

name: Temporal optic disc pallor
description: A pale yellow discoloration of the temporal (lateral) portion of the optic disc.

name: Abnormality of the pulmonary veins
description: An abnormality of the pulmonary veins.

name: Absent thumbnail
description: Absence of thumb nail.

name: Ureteral stenosis
description: The presence of a stenotic, i.e., constricted ureter.

name: Persistence of hemoglobin F
description: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent.

name: Lenticonus
description: A conical projection of the anterior or posterior surface of the lens, occurring as a developmental anomaly.

name: Abnormality of the protein C anticoagulant pathway
description: An anomaly of the protein C anticoagulant pathway, which serves as a major system for controlling thrombosis, limiting inflammatory responses, and potentially decreasing endothelial cell apoptosis in response to inflammatory cytokines and ischemia. A natural anticoagulant system denoted the protein C pathway exerts its anticoagulant effect by regulating the activity of FVIIIa and FVa. The vitamin K-dependent protein C is the key component of the pathway. Activated protein C (APC) cleaves and inhibits coagulation cofactors FVIIIa and FVa, which result in downregulation of the activity of the coagulation system. The endothelial protein C receptor stimulates the T-TM-mediated activation of protein C on the endothelial cell surface. The two cofactors, protein S and the intact form of FV, enhance the anticoagulant activity of APC.

name: Hepatomegaly
description: Abnormally increased size of the liver.

name: Congenital blindness
description: Blindness with onset at birth.

name: Abnormal cardiac ventricle morphology
description: An abnormality of a cardiac ventricle.

name: Lactic acidosis
description: An abnormal buildup of lactic acid in the body, leading to acidification of the blood and other bodily fluids.

name: Photophobia
description: Excessive sensitivity to light with the sensation of discomfort or pain in the eyes due to exposure to bright light.
synonyms: Extreme sensitivity of the eyes to light

name: Broad neck
description: Increased side-to-side width of the neck.

name: Dyspnea
description: Difficult or labored breathing. Dyspnea is a subjective feeling only the patient can rate, e.g., on a Borg scale.

name: Exudative retinal detachment
description: A type of retinal detachment arising from damage to the outer blood-retinal barrier that allows fluid to access the subretinal space and separate the neurosensory retina from the retinal pigment epithelium.

name: Exostoses
description: An exostosis is a benign growth the projects outward from the bone surface. It is capped by cartilage, and arises from a bone that develops from cartilage.
synonyms: Formation of new noncancerous bone on top of existing bone

name: Abnormal jaw morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the jaw, the bony structure of the mouth that consists of the mandible and the maxilla.

name: Limited hip movement
description: A decreased ability to move the femur at the hip joint associated with a decreased range of motion of the hip.

name: Hypoplastic ilia
description: Underdevelopment of the ilium.
synonyms: Small wings of the pelvic girdle

name: Absent toe
description: Aplasia of a toe. That is, absence of all phalanges of a non-hallux digit of the foot and the associated soft tissues.

name: Corneal neovascularization
description: Ingrowth of new blood vessels into the cornea.
synonyms: New blood vessel formation in cornea

name: Pulmonary embolism
description: An embolus (that is, an abnormal particle circulating in the blood) located in the pulmonary artery and thereby blocking blood circulation to the lung. Usually the embolus is a blood clot that has developed in an extremity (for instance, a deep venous thrombosis), detached, and traveled through the circulation before becoming trapped in the pulmonary artery.
synonyms: Blood clot in artery of lung

name: Volvulus
description: Abnormal twisting of a portion of intestine around itself or around a stalk of mesentery tissue.

name: Glioblastoma multiforme
description: A tumor arising from glia in the central nervous system with macroscopic regions of necrosis and hemorrhage. Microscopically, glioblastoma multiforme is characterized by regions of pseudopalisading necrosis, pleomorphic nuclei and cells, and microvascular proliferation.

name: Abnormal myelination
description: Any anomaly in the process by which myelin sheaths are formed and maintained around neurons.

name: Intermediate young adult onset
description: Onset of disease at an age of greater than or equal to 19 to under 25 years.

name: Epicanthus inversus
description: A fold of skin starting at or just below the medial aspect of the lower lid and arching upward to cover, extend in front of and lateral to the medial canthus.

name: Cardiovascular calcification
description: Abnormal calcification in the cardiovascular system.

name: Frontal polymicrogyria
description: A type of polymicrogyria with a gradient of severity (anterior more severe than posterior) extending from frontal poles posteriorly to precentral gyrus and inferiorly to frontal operculum.

name: Anti-neutrophil elastase antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies (immunoglobulins) in the blood circulation that react against neutrophil elastase.

name: Tremor by anatomical site
description: Tremor classified by the affected body part.

name: Abnormal tragus morphology
description: An abnormality of the tragus.

name: Cerebellar cortical atrophy
description: Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellar cortex.

name: Increased intervertebral space
description: An increase in the vertical distance between adjacent vertebral bodies, observed as an increase in the intervertebral disk space.

name: Abnormal uvula morphology
description: Abnormality of the uvula, the conic projection from the posterior edge of the middle of the soft palate.

name: Nodular goiter
description: Enlargement of the thyroid gland related to one or more nodules in the thyroid gland.

name: Persistent EBV viremia
description: Persistent presence of Epstein-Barr virus in the blood.

name: Myositis
description: A general term for inflammation of the muscles without respect to the underlying cause.

name: Germinoma
description: A type of undifferentiated germ cell tumor that may be benign or malignant.

name: Impaired glucose tolerance
description: An abnormal resistance to glucose, i.e., a reduction in the ability to maintain glucose levels in the blood stream within normal limits following oral or intravenous administration of glucose.

name: Abnormal serum bile acid concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of serum bile acid concentration.

name: Recurrent Klebsiella infections
description: Increased susceptibility to Klebsiella infections, as manifested by recurrent episodes of Klebsiella infection.

name: Thyroid agenesis
description: The congenital absence of the thyroid gland.

name: Ambiguous genitalia
description: A genital phenotype that is not clearly assignable to a single gender. Ambiguous genitalia can be evaluated using the Prader scale: Prader 0: Normal female external genitalia. Prader 1: Female external genitalia with clitoromegaly. Prader 2: Clitoromegaly with partial labial fusion forming a funnel-shaped urogenital sinus. Prader 3: Increased phallic enlargement. Complete labioscrotal fusion forming a urogenital sinus with a single opening. Prader 4: Complete scrotal fusion with urogenital opening at the base or on the shaft of the phallus. Prader 5: Normal male external genitalia. The diagnosis of ambiguous genitalia is made for Prader 1-4.

name: Coronary artery stenosis
description: Abnormal narrowing of the coronary artery.

name: Long upper lip
description: Increased width of the upper lip.
synonyms: Increased vertical length of upper lip

name: Decreased circulating ceruloplasmin concentration
description: Decreased concentration of ceruloplasmin in the blood.

name: Leber optic atrophy
description: Degeneration of retinal ganglion cells and their axons.

name: Ectrodactyly
description: A condition in which middle parts of the hands and/or feet (digits and meta-carpals and -tarsals) are missing giving a cleft appearance. The severity is very variable ranging from slightly hypoplastic 3rd toe/fingers over absent 2nd or 3rd toes/fingers as far as oligo- or monodactyl hands and/or feet.

name: Abnormal nasal bone morphology
description: An abnormality of the nasal bone, comprising the left nasal bone and the right nasal bone.

name: Nonprogressive
description: Applies to a disease manifestation that does not increase in scope or severity over the course of time, i.e., that does not worsen with age.

name: Abnormal serum anion gap
description: Any deviation from the normal value of the serum anion gap, which is calculated from the electrolytes measured in the chemical laboratory, is defined as the sum of serum chloride and bicarbonate concentrations subtracted from the serum sodium concentration.

name: Impairment in personality functioning
description: A maladaptive personality trait characterized by moderate or greater impairment in personality (self /interpersonal) functioning.

name: Abnormality of upper lip vermillion
description: An abnormality of the vermilion border, the sharp demarcation between the lip (red colored) and the adjacent normal skin.
synonyms: Abnormality of the red part of the upper lip
Anomaly of the upper lip vermillion
Deformity of the upper lip vermillion
Malformation of the upper lip vermillion

name: Bradykinesia
description: Bradykinesia literally means slow movement, and is used clinically to denote a slowness in the execution of movement (in contrast to hypokinesia, which is used to refer to slowness in the initiation of movement).

name: Autoimmunity
description: The occurrence of an immune reaction against the organism's own cells or tissues.

name: Abnormal circulating glycine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of glycine in the blood circulation.

name: Symphalangism of the 5th finger
description: Fusion of two or more bones of the 5th finger.

name: Abnormal basal ganglia MRI signal intensity
description: A deviation from normal signal on magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the basal ganglia.

name: Abnormal glucose homeostasis
description: Abnormality of glucose homeostasis.

name: 3-Methylglutaconic aciduria
description: An increased amount of 3-methylglutaconic acid in the urine.

name: Vocal cord paresis
description: Decreased strength of the vocal folds.
synonyms: Hoarse voice due to vocal cord paresis
Vocal cord paresis in severe cases

name: Abnormal circulating antimullerian hormone concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal range of the antimullerian hormone, a peptide produced by the granulosa cells of follicles. Anti-Mullerian hormone (AMH), also known as Mullerian inhibiting substance, is produced by the granulosa cells of small antral follicles of the ovary. AMH has an inhibiting role in the ovary, contributing to follicular arrest. AMH levels in women are low until the age of 8, rise rapidly until puberty and decline steadily from the age of 25 until menopause, when AMH production ceases.

name: Abnormal blood glucose concentration
description: An abnormality of the concentration of glucose in the blood.

name: Anterior synechiae of the anterior chamber
description: Adhesions between the iris and the cornea.

name: Cardiac rhabdomyoma
description: A benign tumor of cardiac striated muscle.

name: Aplasia cutis congenita of scalp
description: A developmental defect resulting in the congenital absence of skin on the scalp.

name: Abnormality of renal excretion
description: An altered ability of the kidneys to void urine and/or specific substances.

name: Prolonged neonatal jaundice
description: Neonatal jaundice refers to a yellowing of the skin and other tissues of a newborn infant as a result of increased concentrations of bilirubin in the blood. Neonatal jaundice affects over half of all newborns to some extent in the first week of life. Prolonged neonatal jaundice is said to be present if the jaundice persists for longer than 14 days in term infants and 21 days in preterm infants.
synonyms: Prolonged yellowing of skin in newborn

name: Premature adrenarche
description: Onset of adrenarche at an earlier age than usual.

name: Tooth malposition
description: Abnormal alignment, positioning, or spacing of the teeth, i.e., misaligned teeth.

name: Abnormality of the philtrum
description: An abnormality of the philtrum.

name: Hemivertebrae
description: Absence of one half of the vertebral body.

name: Supernumerary spleens
description: The presence of two or more accessory spleens.

name: Dyscalculia
description: A specific learning disability involving mathematics and arithmetic.

name: Ethylmalonic aciduria
description: The concentration of ethylmalonic acid in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Abnormal morphology of the choroidal vasculature
Generalized-onset seizure
description: A generalized-onset seizure is a type of seizure originating at some point within, and rapidly engaging, bilaterally distributed networks. The networks may include cortical and subcortical structures but not necessarily the entire cortex.

name: Hypoplastic acetabulae
description: Underdeveloped acetabulae.

name: Esophageal varix
description: Extreme dilation of the submucusoal veins in the lower portion of the esophagus.

name: Hypercoagulability
description: An abnormality of coagulation associated with an increased risk of thrombosis.

name: Extractable nuclear antigen positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against extractable nuclear components that are referred to as extractable because they can be extracted from cell nuclei with saline solution.

name: Retinopathy of prematurity
description: An avascular or abnormally vascularized retina that occurs in premature infants and can lead to blindness.

name: Stooped posture
description: A habitual positioning of the body with the head and upper back bent forward.

name: Reduced factor VII activity
description: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VII. Factor VII is part of the extrinsic coagulation pathway, which is initiated at the site of injury in response to the release of tissue factor (fIII). Tissue factor and activated factor VII catalyze the activation of factor X.

name: Congenital contracture
description: One or more flexion contractures (a bent joint that cannot be straightened actively or passively) that are present at birth.

name: Sparse body hair
description: Sparseness of the body hair.

name: Increased axial length of the globe
description: Abnormal largeness of the eye with an axial length > 2.5 standard deviations from population mean.
synonyms: Increased front to back length of eyeball

name: Short palpebral fissure
description: Distance between the medial and lateral canthi is more than 2 SD below the mean for age (objective); or, apparently reduced length of the palpebral fissures.

name: Middle age onset
description: A type of adult onset with onset of symptoms at the age of 40 to 60 years.

name: Abnormal platelet aggregation
description: An abnormality in the rate and degree to which platelets aggregate after the addition of an agonist that stimulates platelet clumping. Platelet aggregation is measured using aggregometer to measure the optical density of platelet-rich plasma, whereby platelet aggregation causes the plasma to become more transparent.

name: Tubulointerstitial nephritis
description: A form of inflammation of the kidney affecting the interstitium of the kidneys surrounding the tubules.

name: Progressive distal muscle weakness
description: Progressively reduced strength of the distal musculature.

name: Hyperactive renin-angiotensin system
description: An abnormally increased activity of the renin-angiotensin system, causing hypertension by a combination of volume excess and vasoconstrictor mechanisms.

name: Choanal stenosis
description: Abnormal narrowing of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture).
synonyms: Narrowing of the rear opening of the nasal cavity

name: Abnormality of the pineal gland
description: An anomaly of the pineal gland,a small endocrine gland in the brain that produces melatonin.

name: Episodic pain
description: Intermittent pain, i.e., pain that occurs occasionally and at irregular intervals.

name: Bilateral conductive hearing impairment
description: A bilateral type of conductive hearing impairment.

name: Skeletal muscle atrophy
description: The presence of skeletal muscular atrophy (which is also known as amyotrophy).
synonyms: Neurogenic muscle atrophy, especially in the lower limbs

name: Abnormal Eustachian tube morphology
description: A structural anomaly of the Eustachian tube (ET). The ET is a biomechanical valve between the nasopharynx and the middle ear. Physiologically, it controls the passive adaptation of the middle ear air pressure to the ambient air pressure primarily via direct muscular actions of the soft palate. In the closed state it protects the middle ear. Inadequate function of the ET causes middle ear ventilation disorders.

name: Parathyroid carcinoma
description: A malignancy of the parathyroid glands. Parathyroid carcinoma usually secretes parathyroid hormone, leading to hyperparathyroidism.

name: Type E brachydactyly
description: In type E brachydactyly, shortening of the fingers is mainly in the metacarpals and metatarsals.

name: Delayed early-childhood social milestone development
description: A failure to meet one or more age-related milestones of social behavior.

name: Abnormal sarcomere morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the sarcomere, which is unit of a myofibril in a muscle cell, composed of an array of overlapping thick and thin filaments between two adjacent Z disks.

name: Medial flaring of the eyebrow
description: An abnormal distribution of eyebrow hair growth in the medial direction.

name: Cleft lip
description: A gap in the lip or lips.

name: Obsessive-compulsive trait
description: The presence of one or more obsessive-compulsive personality traits. Obsessions refer to persistent intrusive thoughts, and compulsions to intrusive behaviors, which the affected person experiences as involuntary, senseless, or repugnant.

name: Abnormality of the periorbital region
description: An abnormality of the region situated around the orbit of the eye.
synonyms: Abnormality of the region around the eye
Abnormality of the region around the eye socket

name: Abnormal naive T cell proportion
description: Any abnormality in the proportion of naive T cells relative to the total number of T cells.
synonyms: Abnormal proportion of naive T cells
Abnormal proportion of naive thymus-derived, alpha-beta T cells

name: Hypoplasia of the primary teeth
description: Developmental hypoplasia of the primary teeth.

name: Abnormal muscle fiber-type distribution
description: Ay deviation from the normal distribution of fiber types in skeletal muscle. The skeletal muscle groups of the mammalian body are made up of bundles of muscle fibers. These fibers can be assigned to different Types, with characteristic movement rates, response to neural inputs, and metabolic styles. Skeletal muscle fibers are broadly classified as slow-twitch (type 1) and fast-twitch (type 2). Multiple fiber types are generally intermingled within a single muscle group, and different muscle groups have varying proportions of fiber types

name: Abnormal parathyroid morphology
description: A structural abnormality of the parathyroid gland.

name: Abnormal fetal physiology
description: Any functional anomaly of the fetus.

name: Adult onset
description: Onset of disease manifestations in adulthood, defined here as at the age of 16 years or later.

name: Hypergonadotropic hypogonadism
description: Reduced function of the gonads (testes in males or ovaries in females) associated with excess pituitary gonadotropin secretion and resulting in delayed sexual development and growth delay.

name: Single fiber EMG abnormality
description: Abnormality in single fiber EMG recording, a technique that allows identification of action potentials (APs) from individual muscle fibers.

name: Abnormal heart morphology
description: Any structural anomaly of the heart.

name: Displacement of the urethral meatus
description: A displacement of the external urethral orifice from its normal position (in males normally placed at the tip of glans penis, in females normally placed about 2.5 cm behind the glans clitoridis and immediately in front of that of the vagina).
synonyms: Displacement of the external urethral orifice
Displacement of the male external urethral orifice

name: Increased mean corpuscular volume
description: Larger than normal size of erythrocytes.

name: Vertigo
description: An abnormal sensation of spinning while the body is actually stationary.

name: Frontal balding
description: Absence of hair in the anterior midline and/or parietal areas.

name: Abnormal CSF serine family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of serine-family amino acids in the cerebrospinal fluid.
synonyms: Abnormal serine-family amino acid levels in cerebrospinal fluid

name: Abnormal 5th metacarpal morphology
description: Any abnormality of the fifth metacarpal bone.
synonyms: Abnormality of the 5th long bone of hand

name: Hip dysplasia
description: The presence of developmental dysplasia of the hip.

name: Avascular necrosis of the capital femoral epiphysis
description: Avascular necrosis of the proximal epiphysis of the femur occurring in growing children and caused by an interruption of the blood supply to the head of the femur close to the hip joint. The necrosis is characteristically associated with flattening of the femoral head, for which reason the term coxa plana has been used to refer to this feature in the medical literature.

name: Abnormal subarachnoid space morphology
description: Abnormality in the space in the meninges beneath the arachnoid membrane and above the pia mater that contains the cerebrospinal fluid.

name: Talipes calcaneovalgus
description: Talipes calcaneovalgus is a flexible foot deformity (as opposed to a rigid congenital vertical talus foot deformity) that can either present as a positional or structural foot deformity depending on severity and/or causality. The axis of calcaneovalgus deformity is in the tibiotalar joint, where the foot is positioned in extreme hyperextension. On inspection, the foot has an "up and out" appearance, with the dorsal forefoot practically touching the anterior aspect of the ankle and lower leg.

name: Abnormal gonadotropin-releasing hormone concentration
description: A deviation from the normal circulating concentration of the normal gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GnRH). Intermittent GnRH secretion from the hypothalamus acts upon its receptor in the anterior pituitary to regulate the production and release of the gonadotropins, follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH) and luteinizing hormone (LH).

name: Recurrent respiratory infections
description: An increased susceptibility to respiratory infections as manifested by a history of recurrent respiratory infections.

name: Myopathy
description: A disorder of muscle unrelated to impairment of innervation or neuromuscular junction.

name: Hand tremor
description: An unintentional, oscillating to-and-fro muscle movement affecting the hand.

name: Hyperoxaluria
description: Increased excretion of oxalates in the urine.
synonyms: Increased level of oxalate in urine

name: Abnormal growth hormone level
description: Any deviation from the normal level of growth hormone (GH) in the blood circulation. GH or somatotropin is a peptide hormone that stimulates growth, cell reproduction, and cell regeneration. Its secretion from the pituitary is regulated by the neurosecretory nuclei of the hypothalamus, which can release Growth hormone-releasing hormone (GHRH or somatocrinin) and Growth hormone-inhibiting hormone (GHIH or somatostatin) into the hypophyseal portal venous blood surrounding the pituitary. GH is secreted in a pulsatile manner, which is one of the reasons why an isolated measurement of its blood concentration is not meaningful.

name: Porokeratosis
description: A clonal disorder of keratinization with one or multiple atrophic patches surrounded by a clinically and histologically distinctive hyperkeratotic ridgelike border called the cornoid lamella.

name: Profound hearing impairment
description: A profound (essentially complete) form of hearing impairment.

name: Increased mean corpuscular hemoglobin concentration
description: An elevation over the normal range of the average amount of hemoglobin per red blood cell (27 to 31 picograms/cell).

name: Pollakisuria
description: Increased frequency of urination.

name: Excessive shyness
description: Atypically high degree of awkwardness or apprehension experienced when approaching or being approached by others.

name: Elevated circulating thyroid-stimulating hormone concentration
description: Increased concentration of thyroid-stimulating hormone (TSH) in the blood circulation.

name: Nausea and vomiting
description: Nausea is a commonly encountered symptom that has been defined as an unpleasant painless subjective feeling that one will imminently vomit. Vomiting has been defined as the forceful expulsion of the contents of the stomach, duodenum, or jejunum through the oral cavity. While nausea and vomiting are often thought to exist on a temporal continuum, this is not always the case. There are situations when severe nausea may be present without emesis and less frequently, when emesis may be present without preceding nausea.

name: Myoclonic seizure
description: A myoclonic seizure is a type of motor seizure characterized by sudden, brief (<100 ms) involuntary single or multiple contraction of muscles or muscle groups of variable topography (axial, proximal limb, distal). Myoclonus is less regularly repetitive and less sustained than is clonus.

name: Abnormality of pancreas physiology
description: An anomaly of the function of the pancreas.

name: Foot dorsiflexor weakness
description: Weakness of the muscles responsible for dorsiflexion of the foot, that is, of the movement of the toes towards the shin. The foot dorsiflexors include the tibialis anterior, the extensor hallucis longus, the extensor digitorum longus, and the peroneus tertius muscles.

name: Squamous cell carcinoma
description: The presence of squamous cell carcinoma of the skin.

name: Abnormal optic nerve morphology
description: Abnormality of the optic nerve.

name: Increased total eosinophil count
description: Increased count of eosinophils in the blood.

name: Abnormality of urine catecholamine level
description: An abnormal amount of urinary catecholamine concentration.

name: Hyperkalemia
description: An abnormally increased potassium concentration in the blood.

name: Nephrocalcinosis
description: Nephrocalcinosis is the deposition of calcium salts in renal parenchyma.
synonyms: Too much calcium deposited in kidneys

name: Abnormal subpleural morphology
description: Any structural anomaly located between the pleura and the chest wall.

name: Abnormal epiphyseal ossification
description: An abnormality of the formation and mineralization of an epiphysis.
synonyms: Abnormality of the mineralisation or ossification of the epiphyses
Abnormal maturation of the end part of a bone

name: Bone-marrow foam cells
description: The presence of foam cells in the bone marrow, generally demonstrated by bone-marrow aspiration or biopsy. Foam cells have a vacuolated appearance due to the presence of complex lipid deposits, giving them a foamy or soap-suds appearance.
synonyms: Large vacuolated foam cells ('NP cells') on bone marrow biopsy
Large vacuolated foam cells on bone marrow biopsy

name: Anuria
description: Absence of urine, clinically classified as below 50ml/day.

name: Cleft palate
description: Cleft palate is a developmental defect of the palate resulting from a failure of fusion of the palatine processes and manifesting as a separation of the roof of the mouth (soft and hard palate).
synonyms: Cleft of hard and soft palate

name: Abnormal blood folate concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of folate in the blood circulation.

name: Spherophakia
description: Spherophakia is a rare congenital condition that presents with weak zonules around a more spherical crystalline lens with an increased anteroposterior thickness of the lens, and highly myopic eye. The lens zonules are developmentally hypoplastic and abnormally weak and due to non-attachment of the posterior zonules to the equatorial zone of the lens, the lens changes its normal shape to spherical.

name: Abnormal respiratory system physiology
description: Abnormal function of the respiratory system.

name: Hyperacusis
description: Over-sensitivity to certain frequency ranges of sound.

name: Phimosis
description: The male foreskin cannot be fully retracted from the head of the penis.

name: Hyperesthesia
description: Increased sensitivity to stimulation, excluding the special senses, which may refer to various modes of cutaneous sensibility including touch and thermal sensation without pain, as well as to pain.

name: Abnormal blood transition element cation concentration
description: An abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of transition element cation.
synonyms: Abnormality of transition element cation homeostasis

name: Aplasia of the ovary
description: Aplasia, that is failure to develop, of the ovary.

name: Hypernatriuria
description: An increased concentration of sodium(1+) in the urine.

name: Foamy urine
description: Urine has an increased amount of frothy fine bubbles.

name: Folliculitis
description: Inflammatory cells within the wall and ostia of the hair follicle, creating a follicular-based pustule.

name: Female reproductive system neoplasm
description: A neoplasm that affects the female reproductive system.

name: Sepsis
description: Sepsis is defined as life-threatening organ dysfunction caused by a dysregulated host response to infection.

name: Extramedullary hematopoiesis
description: The process of hematopoiesis occurring outside of the bone marrow (in the liver, thymus, and spleen) in the postnatal organisms.

name: Recurrent pneumonia
description: An increased susceptibility to pneumonia as manifested by a history of recurrent episodes of pneumonia.

name: Progeroid facial appearance
description: A degree of wrinkling of the facial skin that is more than expected for the age of the individual, leading to a prematurely aged appearance.

name: Rectovaginal fistula
description: The presence of a fistula between the vagina and the rectum.
synonyms: Abnormal connection between rectum and vagina

name: Increased urinary porphobilinogen
description: The concentration of porphobilinogen in the urine, normalized for urine concentration, is above the upper limit of normal.

name: Brain neoplasm
description: A benign or malignant neoplasm that arises from or metastasizes to the brain.

name: Mitten deformity
description: Fusion of the hands and feet by a thin membrane of skin (scarring) seen in forms of dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa and leading to a "mitten" hand deformity.

name: Accessory spleen
description: An accessory spleen is a round, iso-echogenic, homogenic and smooth structure and is seen as a normal variant mostly on the medial contour of the spleen, near the hilus or around the lower pole. This has no pathogenic relevance.

name: Abnormal emotional state
description: A disturbance in the experience or expression of emotion, characterized by alterations in valence, intensity, frequency, or duration. It may also involve emotional responses that are mismatched, exaggerated, or incongruent relative to internal expectations or external contextual stimuli, such as experiencing negative affect in response to neutral or positive events.

name: Abnormal alpha granules
description: Defective structure, size or content of alpha granules, platelet organelles that contain several growth factors destined for release during platelet activation at sites of vessel wall injury.

name: Neonatal hypotonia
description: Muscular hypotonia (abnormally low muscle tone) manifesting in the neonatal period.
synonyms: Low muscle tone, in neonatal onset

name: EEG with focal spikes
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration less than 80 msec.

name: Moderate albuminuria
description: The presence of moderately increased concentrations of albumin in the urine, defined as and albumin-creatinine ratio (ACR) of 30 to 299 mg/gm (3.4 to 34 mg/mmol).

name: Abnormality of the proximal phalanx of the thumb
description: An anomaly of the shape or form of the proximal phalanx of the thumb.

name: Abnormal placental size
description: A deviation from normal size of the placenta.

name: Pancreatic aplasia
description: Aplasia of the pancreas.

name: Abnormality of the thyroid gland
description: An abnormality of the thyroid gland.

name: Neoplasm of the breast
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the breast.

name: Metacarpophalangeal joint contracture
description: A chronic loss of joint motion in metacarpophalangeal joints due to structural changes in muscle, tendons, ligaments, or skin that prevents normal movement.

name: Abnormal circulating valine concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal circulation of valine in the blood circulation.

name: Colon perforation
description: A hole (perforation) in the wall of the colon.

name: Elevated circulating creatine kinase concentration
description: An elevation of the level of the enzyme creatine kinase (also known as creatine phosphokinase (CK; EC 2.7.3.2) in the blood. CK levels can be elevated in a number of clinical disorders such as myocardial infarction, rhabdomyolysis, and muscular dystrophy.

name: Increased sulfur amino acid level in urine
description: An elevated level of a sulfur-containing amino acid in the urine.
synonyms: Increased sulfur-containing amino acid level in urine
Increased sulphur amino acid level in urine

name: Abnormal fallopian tube morphology
description: An abnormality of the fallopian tube.

name: Abnormal 5th finger morphology
description: An abnormality affecting one or both 5th fingers.

name: Broad metacarpals
description: Abnormally broad metacarpal bones.

name: Megakaryocyte dysplasia
description: The presence of micro-megakaryocytes, hypo-lobed, or non-lobed nuclei in megakaryocytes of all sizes and multiple, widely-separated nuclei.

name: Ivory epiphyses of the phalanges of the hand
description: Sclerosis of the epiphyses of the phalanges of the fingers, leading to an increased degree of radiopacity (white or ivory appearance) in X-rays.
synonyms: Increased bone density of end part of the hand bones

name: Abnormal circulating interleukin 10 concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal range of the concentration of interleukin 10 in the blood circulation.

name: Hypoplastic frontal sinuses
description: Underdevelopment of frontal sinus.

name: Exodeviation
description: A manifest or latent ocular deviation in which one or both eyes tends to deviate temporally.

name: Brachydactyly
description: Digits that appear disproportionately short compared to the hand/foot. The word brachydactyly is used here to describe a series distinct patterns of shortened digits (brachydactyly types A-E). This is the sense used here.

name: Neoplasm of the genitourinary tract
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the genitourinary system.

name: Male sexual dysfunction
description: A problem occurring during any phase of the male sexual response cycle that prevents the individual from experiencing satisfaction from the sexual activity

name: Progressive visual loss
description: A reduction of previously attained ability to see.

name: Erosion of oral mucosa
description: Loss of the superficial layer of the oral mucosa usually resulting in a shallow or crusted lesion.

name: Arteriovenous fistula
description: An abnormal connection between an artery and vein.

name: Fatiguable weakness of proximal limb muscles
description: A type of weakness of a skeletal muscle of proximal part of a limb that occurs after a muscle group is used and lessens if the muscle group has some rest. That is, there is diminution of strength with repetitive muscle actions.

name: Bowing of the arm
description: A bending or abnormal curvature affecting a long bone of the arm.

name: Dysmenorrhea
description: Pain during menstruation that interferes with daily activities.

name: Sensory axonal neuropathy
description: An axonal neuropathy of peripheral sensory nerves.

name: Bone marrow hypercellularity
description: A larger than normal amount or percentage of hematopoietic cells relative to marrow fat.

name: Low hanging columella
description: Columella extending inferior to the level of the nasal base, when viewed from the side.
synonyms: Extension of the columella below the ala nasi
Columella extends below the ala nasi

name: Macroscopic hematuria
description: Hematuria that is visible upon inspection of the urine.

name: Polygenic inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that depends on a mixture of major and minor genetic determinants possibly together with environmental factors. Diseases inherited in this manner are termed complex diseases.

name: Severely increased total eosinophil count
description: Severe increase in circulating eosinophils, usually characterized as more than 1500 eosinophils per microlitre.

name: Myopic astigmatism
description: A condition where one or both of the two principal meridians focus in the front of the retina when the eye is at rest.

name: Central Y-shaped metacarpal
description: A central Y-shaped metacarpal is the result of a partial fusion of two central metacarpals (i.e., metacarpals 2-4) of the hand, with the two arms of the Y pointing in the distal direction. Central Y-shaped metacarpals may be seen as a result of a central polydactyly with partial fusion of the duplicated metacarpal.
synonyms: Y-shaped central long bones of hand

name: Megakaryocyte nucleus hyperlobulation
description: The presence of megakaryocytes in the bone marrow whose nuclei are more lobulated than expected for the size of the nucleus.

name: Abnormal T-wave
description: An abnormality of the T wave on the electrocardiogram, which mainly represents the repolarization of the ventricles.

name: Communicating hydrocephalus
description: A form of hydrocephalus in which there is no visible obstruction to the flow of the cerebrospinal fluid between the ventricles and subarachnoid space.

name: Type I diabetes mellitus
description: A chronic condition in which the pancreas produces little or no insulin. Type I diabetes mellitus is manifested by the sudden onset of severe hyperglycemia with rapid progression to diabetic ketoacidosis unless treated with insulin.

name: Misalignment of incisors
description: Misaligned incisor.

name: Aplasia of the musculature
description: Absence of the musculature.

name: Urethral fistula
description: The presence of an abnormal connection between the urethra and another organ or the skin.

name: Phonic tics
description: Tics are defined as movements or sounds that resemble physiological motor behaviors, but are typically inopportune to social context and appear sudden, repetitive, and often exaggerated. Tic vocalizations commonly termed vocal or phonic tics may include any possible sound (eg, sniffing, coughing, throat clearing, whistling, or grunting), word, or sentence and are most commonly encountered within the spectrum of primary tic disorders, as Tourette syndrome.

name: Reduced factor VIII activity
description: Reduced activity of coagulation factor VIII. Factor VIII (fVIII) is a cofactor in the intrinsic clotting cascade that is activated to fVIIIa in the presence of minute quantities of thrombin. fVIIIa acts as a receptor, for factors IXa and X.

name: Abnormal glomerular mesangium morphology
description: An abnormality of the mesangium, i.e., of the central part of the renal glomerulus between capillaries.

name: Abnormality of vitamin metabolism
description: An anomaly in the metabolism of a vitamin.

name: Abnormal epidermal morphology
description: An abnormality of the morphology of the epidermis.

name: Metaphyseal spurs
description: Bony outgrowths that extend laterally from the margin of the metaphysis.

name: Urinary bladder sphincter dysfunction
description: Abnormal function of a sphincter of the urinary bladder.

name: Decreased specific antibody response to vaccination
description: A reduced ability to synthesize postvaccination antibodies against toxoids and polysaccharides in vaccines, as measured by antibody titer determination following vaccination.

name: Hypoplastic nasal bridge
synonyms: Decreased size of bridge of nose

name: Persistent head lag
description: The Premie-Neuro and the Dubowitz Neurological Examination score head lag in the same manner. Scoring for both is as follows: 0 = head drops and stays back, 1 = tries to lift head but drops it back, 2 = able to lift head slightly, 3 = lifts head in line with body, and 4 = head in front of body. This term applies if head lag persists beyond an expected age at a level of 0 or 1. Persistent head lag beyond age 4 mo has been linked to poor outcomes.

name: Multiple bladder diverticula
description: Presence of a many diverticula (sac or pouch) in the wall of the urinary bladder.

name: Osteochondritis dissecans
description: A joint disorder caused by blood deprivation in the subchondral bone causing the subchondral bone to die in a process called avascular necrosis. The bone is then reabsorbed by the body, leaving the articular cartilage it supported prone to damage. The result is fragmentation (dissection) of both cartilage and bone, and the free movement of these osteochondral fragments within the joint space, causing pain and further damage.

name: Abnormality of the middle phalanx of the 2nd finger
Laryngeal dystonia
description: A form of focal dystonia that affects the vocal cords, associated with involuntary contractions of the vocal cords causing interruptions of speech and affecting the voice quality and often leading to patterned, repeated breaks in speech.

name: Compensatory head posture
description: A compensatory head posture occurs when the head is deviated out of the normal primary straight head position in order to compensate for an ocular problem.

name: Anisopoikilocytosis
description: A type of poikilocytosis characterized by the presence in the blood of erythrocytes of varying sizes and abnormal shapes.

name: Moyamoya phenomenon
description: A noninflammatory, progressive occlusion of the intracranial carotid arteries owing to the formation of netlike collateral arteries arising from the circle of Willis.

name: Amblyopia
description: Reduced visual acuity that is uncorrectable by lenses in the absence of detectable anatomic defects in the eye or visual pathways.

name: Posterior pituitary dysgenesis
description: Abnormal development of the neurohypophysis during embryonic growth and development.

name: Pyridoxine-responsive sideroblastic anemia
description: A type of sideroblastic anemia that is alleviated by pyridoxine (vitamin B-6) treatment.

name: Acanthosis nigricans
description: A dermatosis characterized by thickened, hyperpigmented plaques, typically on the intertriginous surfaces and neck.

name: Distichiasis
description: Double rows of eyelashes.

name: Cystoid macular edema
