description: Cystoid macular edema (CME) is any type of macular edema that involves cyst formation.

name: Lower-limb metaphyseal irregularity
description: Irregularity of the normally smooth surface of one or more metaphyses of a bone of the leg.

name: Cervical myelopathy
description: A collection of pathologic conditions that result from progressive spinal cord dysfunction secondary to cord compression in the cervical spine.

name: Focal clonic seizure
description: A focal clonic seizure is a type of focal motor seizure characterized by sustained rhythmic jerking, that is regularly repetitive.

name: Tip-toe gait
description: An abnormal gait pattern characterized by the failure of the heel to contact the floor at the onset of stance during gait.

name: Female sexual dysfunction
description: A problem occurring during any phase of the female sexual response cycle that prevents the individual from experiencing satisfaction from the sexual activity

name: Echogenic fetal bowel
description: Echogenic bowel is defined as fetal bowel with homogenous areas of echogenicity that are equal to or greater than that of surrounding bone.

name: Abnormal blood ion concentration
description: Abnormality of the homeostasis (concentration) of a monoatomic ion.

name: Aplasia of the pectoralis major muscle
description: Absence of the pectoralis major muscle.

name: Genu valgum
description: The legs angle inward, such that the knees are close together and the ankles far apart.

name: Secondary microcephaly
description: Head circumference which falls below 2 standard deviations below the mean for age and gender because of insufficient head growth after birth.
synonyms: Development of small head that was not present at birth

name: Gait disturbance
description: The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk.

name: Retinal thinning
description: Reduced anteroposterior thickness of the retina. This phenotype can be appreciated by retinal optical coherence tomography (OCT).

name: Third trimester onset
description: This term refers to a phenotypic feature that was first observed prior to birth during the third trimester, which is defined as 28 weeks and zero days (28+0) of gestation and beyond.

name: Menorrhagia
description: Prolonged and excessive menses at regular intervals in excess of 80 mL or lasting longer than 7 days.

name: Abdominal aortic aneurysm
description: An abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the abdominal aorta.

name: Narrow foot
description: A foot for which the measured width is below the 5th centile for age; or, a foot that appears disproportionately narrow for its length.

name: Photosensitive tonic-clonic seizure
description: Generalized-onset tonic-clonic seizures that are provoked by flashing or flickering light.

name: Relative macrocephaly
description: A relatively mild degree of macrocephaly in which the head circumference is not above two standard deviations from the mean, but appears dysproportionately large when other factors such as body stature are taken into account.

name: Pilomatrixoma
description: Pilomatricoma is an asymptomatic slowly growing benign cutaneous tumor, differentiating towards the hair matrix of the hair follicle. It is covered by normal or hyperemic skin, and usually varies in size from 0.5 to 3 cm.

name: Abnormal mitochondrial shape
description: An anomaly in the surface contour of mitochondria.

name: Abnormality of the mitochondrion
description: An anomaly of the mitochondrion, the membranous cytoplasmic organelle the interior of which is subdivided by cristae. The mitochondrion is a self replicating organelle that is the site of tissue respiration.

name: Cystinuria
description: An increased concentration of cystine in the urine.

name: Slow saccadic eye movements
description: An abnormally slow velocity of the saccadic eye movements.

name: Irregular iliac crest
description: Irregularity of the iliac crest, which is the superior border of the wing of the ilium.

name: Upper extremity joint dislocation
description: Displacement or malalignment of one or more joints in the upper extremity (arm).

name: Abnormal posterior pituitary morphogenesis
description: An abnormality of the neurohypophysis, which is also known as the posterior lobe of the hypophysis.

name: Centrocecal scotoma
description: A scotoma (area of diminished vision within the visual field) located between the central point of fixation and the blind spot with a roughly horizontal oval shape.

name: Barrel-shaped chest
description: A rounded, bulging chest that resembles the shape of a barrel. That is, there is an increased anteroposterior diameter and usually some degree of kyphosis.

name: Lens subluxation
description: Partial dislocation of the lens of the eye.

name: Non-midline cleft of the upper lip
description: Clefting (gap or groove) of the upper lip affecting the lateral portions of the upper lip rather than the midline/median region.
synonyms: Non-midline cleft of the upper lip
Paramedian cleft of the upper lip

name: Coombs-positive hemolytic anemia
description: A type of hemolytic anemia in which the Coombs test is positive.

name: Amelia
description: Congenital absence (aplasia) of one or more limbs.

name: Abnormality of the calf
description: An abnormality of the calf, i.e. of the posterior part of the lower leg.

name: Cerebral calcification
description: The presence of calcium deposition within the cerebrum.
synonyms: Abnormal deposits of calcium in the brain

name: Perinuclear antineutrophil antibody positivity
description: The presence of autoantibodies in the serum that react against proteins predominantly expressed in perinuclear region of neutrophils.

name: Abnormal circulating iron concentration
description: The concentration of iron in the blood circulation is outside the limits of normal.

name: Chromosome breakage
description: Elevated rate of chromosomal breakage or interchanges occurring either spontaneously or following exposure to various DNA-damaging agents. This feature may be assayed by treatment of cultured lymphocytes with agents such as chemical mutagens, irradiation, and alkylating agents.
synonyms: High frequency of chromosome breaks in lymphocytes

name: Myokymia
description: Myokymia consists of involuntary, fine, continuous, undulating contractions that spread across the affected striated muscle.

name: Tinnitus
description: Tinnitus is an auditory perception that can be described as the experience of sound, in the ear or in the head, in the absence of external acoustic stimulation.

name: Waddling gait
description: Weakness of the hip girdle and upper thigh muscles, for instance in myopathies, leads to an instability of the pelvis on standing and walking. If the muscles extending the hip joint are affected, the posture in that joint becomes flexed and lumbar lordosis increases. The patients usually have difficulties standing up from a sitting position. Due to weakness in the gluteus medius muscle, the hip on the side of the swinging leg drops with each step (referred to as Trendelenburg sign). The gait appears waddling. The patients frequently attempt to counteract the dropping of the hip on the swinging side by bending the trunk towards the side which is in the stance phase (in the German language literature this is referred to as Duchenne sign). Similar gait patterns can be caused by orthopedic conditions when the origin and the insertion site of the gluteus medius muscle are closer to each other than normal, for instance due to a posttraumatic elevation of the trochanter or pseudarthrosis of the femoral neck.

name: Staring gaze
description: An abnormality in which the eyes are held permanently wide open.

name: Neck pain
description: An unpleasant sensation characterized by physical discomfort (such as pricking, throbbing, or aching) localized to the neck.

name: Hyperpigmented papule
description: A papule (circumscribed, solid elevation of skin with no visible fluid, varying in size from a pinhead to less than 10mm in diameter at the widest point) that exhibits increased pigmentation (is darker) compared to the surrounding skin.

name: Hemiplegia
description: Paralysis (complete loss of muscle function) in the arm, leg, and in some cases the face on one side of the body.
synonyms: Paralysis on one side of body

name: Abnormal circulating glutamine family amino acid concentration
description: Any deviation from the normal concentration of a glutamine family amino acid in the blood circulation.

name: Gastroparesis
description: Decreased strength of the muscle layer of stomach, which leads to a decreased ability to empty the contents of the stomach despite the absence of obstruction.

name: Thickened nuchal skin fold
description: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold (NF) measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. An NF measurement greater than 5 mm at 14 to 17+6 weeks of gestation, or 6 mm at 18 to 28 weeks has been associated with a markedly increased risk for Down syndrome.

name: Pancreatic endocrine tumor
description: A neuroendocrine tumor originating in a hormone-producing cell (islet cell) of the pancreas.

name: Smooth philtrum
description: Flat skin surface, with no ridge formation in the central region of the upper lip between the nasal base and upper vermilion border.

name: Decreased specific pneumococcal antibody level
description: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against pneumococci.

name: Typified by somatic mosaicism
description: Description of conditions in which affected individuals typically display somatic mosaicism, i.e., genetically distinct populations of somatic cells in a given organism caused by DNA mutations, epigenetic alterations of DNA, chromosomal abnormalities or the spontaneous reversion of inherited mutations. In many conditions typified by somatic mosaicism, constitutive mutation is lethal and cases are exclusively or predominantly mosaic.

name: Pancreatic hypoplasia
description: Hypoplasia of the pancreas.

name: Intramuscular hematoma
description: Blood clot formed within muscle tissue following leakage of blood into the tissue.

name: Inheritance qualifier
description: The terms in this hierarchy can be used to specify the context in which inheritance of a disease is typically observed.

name: Congenital stationary night blindness
description: A nonprogressive (i.e., stationary) form of difficulties with night blindness with congenital onset.

name: Straight clavicles
description: An abnormally straight configuration of the clavicle, a tubular bone which normally is doubly curved .

name: Pulmonary artery stenosis
description: An abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches.

name: Abnormal maxilla morphology
description: An abnormality of the Maxilla (upper jaw bone).
synonyms: Abnormality of the upper jaw bone
Abnormality of the upper jaw bones
Deformity of the upper jaw bones
Malformation of the upper jaw bones

name: Sirenomelia
description: A developmental defect in which the legs are fused together.

name: Laryngeal stenosis
description: Stricture or narrowing of the larynx that may be associated with symptoms of respiratory difficulty depending on the degree of laryngeal narrowing.

name: Soft tissue sarcoma
description: A type of sarcoma (A connective tissue neoplasm formed by proliferation of mesodermal cells) that develops from soft tissues like fat, muscle, nerves, fibrous tissues, blood vessels, or deep skin tissues.

name: Arteriovenous malformation
description: An anomalous configuration of blood vessels that shunts arterial blood directly into veins without passing through the capillaries.

name: Abnormal left ventricular outflow tract morphology
description: An abnormality of the outflow tract of the left ventricle.
synonyms: Abnormality of the left ventricular outflow tract

name: Abnormal magnesium concentration
description: An abnormality of magnesium ion homeostasis.

name: Hyperammonemia
description: An increased concentration of ammonia in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating ornithine concentration
description: Deviation from the normal concentration of ornithine in the blood circulation.

name: Abnormal lung lobation
description: A developmental defect in the formation of pulmonary lobes.

name: Multiple pulmonary cysts
description: The presence of multiple lung cysts.

name: Ovoid vertebral bodies
description: When viewed in lateral radiographs, vertebral bodies have a roughly rectangular configuration. This term applies if the vertebral body appears rounded or oval.

name: Amniotic constriction ring
description: Annular constrictions around the digits, limbs, or trunk, occurring congenitally (sometimes causing intrauterine autoamputation) and also associated with a wide variety of disorders. Constrictive amniotic bands are the result of primary amniotic rupture, which can lead to entanglement of fetal tissue (especially limbs) in fibrous amniotic strands.

name: 2-3 finger cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the second to the third fingers that extends distally to at least the level of the proximal interphalangeal joints.

name: Cerebral amyloid angiopathy
description: Amyloid deposition in the walls of leptomeningeal and cortical arteries, arterioles, and less often capillaries and veins of the central nervous system.

name: Inverted nipples
description: The presence of nipples that instead of pointing outward are retracted inwards.

name: Craniosynostosis
description: Craniosynostosis refers to the premature closure of the cranial sutures. Primary craniosynostosis refers to the closure of one or more sutures due to abnormalities in skull development, and secondary craniosynostosis results from failure of brain growth.

name: Developmental glaucoma
description: Glaucoma which forms during the early years of a child's life is called developmental or congenital glaucoma.

name: Peripheral cyanosis
description: Bluish discoloration of the distal extremities in the absence of cold temperature or stress. Peripheral cyanosis can involve hands, fingertips, or toes, and sometimes circumoral and periorbital areas. Mucous membranes are generally not involved.

name: Abnormality of the tongue
description: Any abnormality of the tongue.

name: Piezogenic pedal papules
description: Flesh-colored or yellowish papules, 2 mm or larger, that are responses to internal mechanical pressure and weakness in the connective tissue in the dermis, appear commonly over the medial aspect of the heel, but in some cases on the wrists. They are thought to represent herniations of adipose tissue through the plantar fascia retinaculum.

name: Short femur
description: An abnormal shortening of the femur.

name: Abnormal renal tubule morphology
description: An abnormality of the renal tubules.
synonyms: Morphologic abnormality of the renal tubules

name: Inflammatory abnormality of the eye
description: Inflammation of the eye, parts of the eye or the periorbital region.

name: Abnormal PR interval
description: An anomaly of the PR interval, which is the portion of the ECG from the onset of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex. A normal PR interval in adults is 0.12-0.2 seconds.

name: Nodular regenerative hyperplasia of liver
description: Diffuse benign transformation of the hepatic parenchyma into small regenerative nodules with minimal or no fibrosis.

name: Crackles
description: Crackles are discontinuous, explosive, and nonmusical adventitious lung sounds normally heard in inspiration and sometimes during expiration. Crackles are usually classified as fine and coarse crackles based on their duration, loudness, pitch, timing in the respiratory cycle, and relationship to coughing and changing body position.

name: Clubbing of fingers
description: Terminal broadening of the fingers (distal phalanges of the fingers).

name: Peripheral retinal atrophy
synonyms: Wasting of the outer part of the retina

name: Lichenification
description: Thickening and hardening of the epidermis seen with exaggeration of normal skin lines.

name: Abnormal proximal phalanx morphology of the hand
synonyms: Abnormality of the innermost finger bones of the hand
Abnormality of the proximal phalanges of the hand

name: Abnormal sweat homeostasis
description: An abnormality of the composition of sweat or the levels of its components.

name: Left bundle branch block
description: A conduction block of the left branch of the bundle of His. This manifests as a generalized disturbance of QRS morphology on EKG.

name: Hepatoblastoma
description: A kind of neoplasm of the liver that originates from immature liver precursor cells and macroscopically is composed of tissue resembling fetal or mature liver cells or bile ducts.

name: Abnormal circle of Willis morphology
description: An anomaly of the circle of Willis, also known as the cerebral arterial circle.
synonyms: Abnormality of the cerebral arterial circle

name: Recurrent pancreatitis
description: A recurrent form of pancreatitis.

name: Abnormality thigh musculature morphology
synonyms: Abnormality of the musculature of the thigh

name: Prostatitis
description: The presence of inflammation of the prostate.

name: Tetraplegia
description: Paralysis of all four limbs, and trunk of the body below the level of an associated injury to the spinal cord. The etiology of quadriplegia is similar to that of paraplegia except that the lesion is in the cervical spinal cord rather than in the thoracic or lumbar segments of the spinal cord.

name: Parietal foramina
description: The presence of symmetrical and circular openings (foramina) in the parietal bone ranging in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters wide.
synonyms: Persistent foramina of the parietal bones
Symmetrical, oval defects in the parietal bone

name: Atlantoaxial dislocation
description: Partial dislocation of the atlantoaxial joint.

name: Non-Mendelian inheritance
description: A mode of inheritance that depends on genetic determinants in more than one gene.

name: Agammaglobulinemia
description: A lasting absence of total IgG and total IgA and total IgM in the blood circulation, whereby at most trace quantities can be measured.

name: Biliary tract neoplasm
description: A tumor (abnormal growth of tissue) of the biliary system.

name: EEG with focal sharp waves
description: EEG with focal sharp transient waves of a duration between 80 and 200 msec.

name: High palate
description: Height of the palate more than 2 SD above the mean (objective) or palatal height at the level of the first permanent molar more than twice the height of the teeth (subjective).

name: Spasticity
description: A motor disorder characterized by a velocity-dependent increase in tonic stretch reflexes with increased muscle tone, exaggerated (hyperexcitable) tendon reflexes.
synonyms: Involuntary muscle stiffness, contraction, or spasm

name: Deviation of the 2nd finger
description: Displacement of the 2nd finger from its normal position.

name: Abnormal lumbar spine morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the lumbar vertebral column.

name: Peripheral axonal degeneration
description: Progressive deterioration of peripheral axons.

name: Schistocytosis
description: The presence of an abnormal number of fragmented red blood cells (schistocytes) in the blood.

name: Abnormal circulating dehydroepiandrosterone concentration
description: A deviation from the normal concentration of dehydroepiandrosterone in the circulation.

name: Increased urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
description: An increased level in the urine of an alpha-amino acid which is not a member of the group of 23 proteinogenic amino acids.
synonyms: Abnormal urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level
Elevated urinary non-proteinogenic amino acid level

name: Eye of the tiger anomaly of globus pallidus
description: The presence, on T2-weighted magnetic resonance imaging, of markedly low signal intensity of the globus pallidus that surrounds a central region of high signal intensity in the anteromedial globus pallidus, producing an eye-of-the-tiger appearance. The sign is thought to represent iron accumulation in the globus pallidus.

name: Abnormal carpal morphology
description: An abnormality affecting the carpal bones of the wrist (scaphoid, lunate, triquetral, pisiform, trapezium, trapezoid, capitate, hamate).

name: Short hard palate
description: Distance between the labial point of the incisive papilla to the midline junction of the hard and soft palate more than 2 SD below the mean (objective) or apparently decreased length of the hard palate (subjective).

name: Coloboma
description: A developmental defect characterized by a cleft of some portion of the eye or ocular adnexa.

name: Gastric ulcer
description: An ulcer, that is, an erosion of an area of the gastric mucous membrane.

name: Auditory hallucination
description: Perception of sounds without auditory stimulus.

name: Abnormality of body mass index
description: Anomaly in the weight-to-height squared ratio, calculated by dividing the individual's weight in kilograms by the square of the individual's height in meters and used as an indicator of obesity and underweight compared to averages.

name: Abnormal internal carotid artery morphology
description: An abnormality of an internal carotid artery.

name: Decreased specific anti-polysaccharide antibody level
description: The presence of normal overall immunoglobulin levels with deficiency of specific immunoglobulins directed against bacterial polysaccharides.
synonyms: Depressed antibody response to polysaccharide antigens

name: 3-4 toe cutaneous syndactyly
description: A soft tissue continuity in the anteroposterior axis between the toes 3 and 4.

name: Posterior polar cataract
description: A polar cataract that affects the posterior pole of the lens.

name: Flat forehead
description: A forehead with abnormal flatness.

name: Supernumerary nipple
description: Presence of more than two nipples.

name: Unilateral ptosis
description: A unilateral form of ptosis.

name: Abnormal B cell morphology
description: A structural abnormality of B cells.

name: Oculomotor apraxia
description: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancelation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex.
synonyms: Defective or absent horizontal voluntary eye movements

name: Sclerosing cholangitis
description: Cholangitis associated with evident ductal fibrosis that develops as a consequence of long-standing bile duct inflammatory, obstruction, or ischemic injury; it can be obliterative or nonobliterative.

name: Abnormal hemoglobin
description: Anomaly in the level or the function of hemoglobin, the oxygen-carrying protein of erythrocytes.

name: Frontal upsweep of hair
description: Upward and/or sideward growth of anterior hair.

name: Abnormal corneal endothelium morphology
description: Abnormality of the corneal endothelium, that is, the single layer of cells on the inner surface of the cornea.

name: Septate vagina
description: The presence of a vaginal septum, thereby creating a vaginal duplication. The septum is longitudinal in the majority of cases.

name: Jaw hyperreflexia
description: Increased intensity of muscle tendon reflexes in jaw.

name: Hip flexor weakness
description: Reduced ability to flex the femur, that is, to pull the knee upward.

name: Normal pressure hydrocephalus
description: A form of hydrocephalus characterized by enlarged cerebral ventricles and normal cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) pressure upon lumbar puncture.

name: Glomerulonephritis
description: Inflammation of the renal glomeruli.

name: Abnormal cardiac ventricular function
description: An abnormality of the cardiac ventricular function.

name: Palmoplantar cutis laxa
description: Loose, wrinkled skin of hands and feet.
synonyms: Excessive wrinkled skin of palms and soles
Increased wrinkles of palms and soles
Wrinkled skin of hands and feet

name: Aortic valve stenosis
description: The presence of a stenosis (narrowing) of the aortic valve.

name: Abnormal pulmonary interstitial morphology
description: Abnormality of the lung parenchyma extending to the pulmonary interstitium and leading to diffuse pulmonary fibrosis.
synonyms: Abnormality in area between air sacs in lung

name: CNS hypomyelination
description: Reduced amount of myelin in the central nervous system resulting from defective myelinogenesis.

name: Abnormal circulating IgA concentration
description: An abnormal deviation from normal levels of IgA immunoglobulin in blood.

name: Buphthalmos
description: Diffusely large eye (with megalocornea) associated with glaucoma.

name: Confusion
description: Lack of clarity and coherence of thought, perception, understanding, or action.

name: Glossoptosis
description: Posterior displacement of the tongue into the pharynx, i.e., a tongue that is mislocalised posteriorly.

name: Abnormality of extrapyramidal motor function
description: A neurological condition related to lesions of the basal ganglia leading to typical abnormalities including akinesia (inability to initiate changes in activity and perform volitional movements rapidly and easily), muscular rigidity (continuous contraction of muscles with constant resistance to passive movement), chorea (widespread arrhythmic movements of a forcible, rapid, jerky, and restless nature), athetosis (inability to sustain the muscles of the fingers, toes, or other group of muscles in a fixed position), and akathisia (inability to remain motionless).

name: Abnormality of facial musculature
description: An anomaly of a muscle that is innervated by the facial nerve (the seventh cranial nerve).

name: Allergy
description: An allergy is an immune response or reaction to substances that are usually not harmful.

name: Degeneration of anterior horn cells
synonyms: Degeneration of alpha-motor neurons in anterior horn cells of the spinal cord
Degeneration of spinal cord anterior horn cells
Loss of spinal cord anterior horn cells
Progressive loss of anterior horn cells
Spinal cord anterior horn cell degeneration

name: Chylothorax
description: Accumulation of excessive amounts of lymphatic fluid (chyle) in the pleural cavity.

name: Interhemispheric cyst
description: Cystic collection (sac-like, fluid containing pocket of membranous tissue) located in the interhemispheric fissure, with or without communication with the ventricular system.

name: Abnormal pelvic girdle bone morphology
description: An abnormality of the bony pelvic girdle, which is a ring of bones connecting the vertebral column to the femurs.
synonyms: Abnormal shape of pelvic girdle bone
Abnormality of pelvic girdle bone morphology

name: Abnormal urinary nucleobase concentration
description: A deviation from the normal level of a nucleobase in the urine. Nucleobases are nitrogen-containing biological compounds that form nucleosides: adenine (A), cytosine (C), guanine (G), thymine (T), and uracil (U).

name: Absent toenail
description: Congenital absence of the toenail.

name: Hooded eyelid
description: Eyelid partly covered by skin when eyes are open.

name: Abnormal circulating vitamin E concentration
description: Concentration of vitamin E in the blood circulation outside of normal limits.

name: Adrenal hyperplasia
description: Enlargement of the adrenal gland.

name: Thin vermilion border
description: Height of the vermilion of the medial part of the lip more than 2 SD below the mean, or apparently reduced height of the vermilion of the lip in the frontal view. The vermilion is the red part of the lips (and confusingly, the vermilion itself is also often referred to as being equivalent the lips).

name: Proximal placement of thumb
description: Proximal mislocalization of the thumb.
synonyms: Attachment of thumb close to wrist

name: Verrucae
description: Warts, benign growths on the skin or mucous membranes that cause cosmetic problems as well as pain and discomfort. Warts most often occur on the hands, feet, and genital areas.

name: Flared lower limb metaphysis
description: The presence of a splayed (i.e.,flared) metaphyseal segment of one or more long bones of the leg.
synonyms: Flared metaphysis of lower limb bone

name: Stroke
description: Sudden impairment of blood flow to a part of the brain due to occlusion or rupture of an artery to the brain.

name: Insomnia
description: Persistent difficulty in starting or maintaining sleep, or waking up earlier than desired, despite having adequate opportunities and conditions for sleep.

name: Androgen insufficiency
description: Insufficient amount of androgenic activity.

name: Venous thrombosis
description: Formation of a blood clot (thrombus) inside a vein, causing the obstruction of blood flow.

name: Lacrimation abnormality
description: Abnormality of tear production.

name: Abnormal right ventricle morphology
description: An abnormality of the right ventricle of the heart.

name: High-frequency hearing impairment
description: A type of hearing impairment affecting primarily the higher frequencies of sound (3,000 to 6,000 Hz).

name: Ophthalmoparesis
description: Ophthalmoplegia is a paralysis or weakness of one or more of the muscles that control eye movement.
synonyms: Weakness of muscles controlling eye movement

name: No social interaction
description: Lack of intentional participation in interactions with another person.

name: Decreased urine output
description: A decreased rate of urine production.

name: Pulp calcification
description: Pulp calcifications may appear as punctate calcifications, irregular, roughly spherical mineralized masses in any part of the pulp. It may occur isolated or associated to calcifications elsewhere such as the carotid arteries and kidneys. The diagnosis pulp calcifications can be established using radiological studies.

name: Ectopia lentis
description: Dislocation or malposition of the crystalline lens of the eye. A partial displacement (or dislocation) of the lens is described as a subluxation of the lens, while a complete displacement is termed luxation of the lens. A complete displacement occurs if the lens is completely outside the patellar fossa of the lens, either in the anterior chamber, in the vitreous, or directly on the retina. If the lens is partially displaced but still contained within the lens space, then it is termed subluxation.

name: Glycosuria
description: An increased concentration of glucose in the urine.

name: Nasogastric tube feeding in infancy
description: Feeding problem necessitating nasogastric tube feeding.

name: Absent facial hair
description: Absence of facial hair.

name: Abnormal clitoris morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the clitoris.

name: Increased circulating gonadotropin level
description: Overproduction of gonadotropins (FSH, LH) by the anterior pituitary gland.

name: Paroxysmal involuntary eye movements
description: Sudden-onset episode of abnormal, involuntary eye movements.

name: Oxycephaly
description: Oxycephaly (from Greek oxus, sharp, and kephalos, head) refers to a conical or pointed shape of the skull.

name: Abnormal cardiac atrium morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of a cardiac atrium.

name: Focal aware non-motor seizure
description: A focal non-motor seizure in which awareness is retained throughout the seizure.

name: Focal aware seizure
description: A type of focal-onset seizure in which awareness is preserved. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile.
synonyms: Focal seizure without impairment of awareness
Focal seizure without impairment of consciousness or awareness
Focal seizures without impairment of consciousness or awareness
Partial seizure without impairment of awareness

name: Fragile nails
description: Nails that easily break.

name: Abnormality of the knee
description: An abnormality of the knee joint or surrounding structures.

name: Dystrophic toenail
description: Toenail changes apart from changes of the color of the toenail (nail dyschromia) that involve partial or complete disruption of the various keratinous layers of the nail plate.

name: Dilation of Virchow-Robin spaces
description: Increased dimensions of the Virchow-Robin spaces (also known as perivascular spaces), which surround the walls of vessels as they course from the subarachnoid space through the brain parenchyma. Perivascular spaces are commonly microscopic, and not visible on conventional neuroimaging. This term refers to an increase of size of these spaces such that they are visible on neuroimaging (usually magnetic resonance imaging). The dilatations are regular cavities that always contain a patent artery.

name: Hypopigmented macule
description: A white or lighter patch of skin that may appear anywhere on the body and are caused by decreased skin pigmentation.

name: Developmental cataract
description: A cataract that occurs congenitally as the result of a developmental defect, in contrast to the majority of cataracts that occur in adulthood as the result of degenerative changes of the lens.
synonyms: Clouding of the lens of the eye at birth

name: Immotile sperm
description: A lack of mobility of ejaculated sperm.

name: Cholestasis
description: Impairment of bile flow due to obstruction in bile ducts.
synonyms: Slowed or blocked flow of bile from liver

name: Laryngeal stridor
description: An abnormal high-pitched noisy sound, occurring during inhalation or exhalation caused by the incomplete obstruction in the throat.

name: Torsade de pointes
description: A type of ventricular tachycardia characterized by polymorphioc QRS complexes that change in amplitue and cycle length, and thus have the appearance of oscillating around the baseline in the EKG.

name: Prominent veins on trunk
description: Prominent thoracic and abdominal veins.

name: Intestinal fistula
description: An abnormal connection between the gut and another hollow organ, such as the bladder, urethra, vagina, or other regions of the gastrointestinal tract.

name: Clonus
description: A series of rhythmic and involuntary muscle contractions (at a frequency of about 5 to 7 Hz) that occur in response to an abruptly applied and sustained stretch.
synonyms: Involuntary rhythmic muscular contractions and relaxations

name: Dysmetric saccades
description: The controller signal for saccadic eye movements has two components: the pulse that moves the eye rapidly from one point to the next, and the step that holds the eye in the new position. When both the pulse and the step are not the correct size, a dysmetric refixation eye movement results.

name: Abnormal caudate nucleus morphology
description: Any structural abnormality of the caudate nucleus.

name: Elevated serum 11-deoxycortisol
description: Increased concentration of 11-deoxycortisol in the circulation. 11-deoxycorticosterone, which is also known as simply deoxycorticosterone and 21-hydroxyprogesterone, is a steroid hormore that is produces in the adrenals and is a precursor to aldosterone.

name: Abnormal corpus striatum morphology
description: Abnormality of the striatum, which is the largest nucleus of the basal ganglia, comprising the caudate, putamen and ventral striatum, including the nucleus accumbens.

name: Dysgammaglobulinemia
description: Selective deficiency of one or more, but not all, classes of immunoglobulins.

name: Orthokeratotic hyperkeratosis
description: A form of hyperkeratosis characterized by thickening of the cornified layer without retained nuclei.

name: Abnormal eyelid morphology
description: An abnormality of the eyelids.

name: Right aortic arch
description: Aorta descends on right instead of on the left.

name: Retinopathy
description: Any noninflammatory disease of the retina. This nonspecific term is retained here because of its wide use in the literature, but if possible new annotations should indicate the precise type of retinal abnormality.

name: Psychic epileptic aura
description: Aura with affective, mnemonic or composite perceptual phenomena including illusory or composite hallucinatory events.

name: Ganglioneuroma
description: A benign neoplasm that usually arises from the sympathetic trunk in the mediastinum, representing a tumor of the sympathetic nerve fibers arising from neural crest cells.

name: Agenesis of maxillary incisor
synonyms: Failure of development of maxillary incisor
Failure of development of upper incisor

name: Expressive language delay
description: A delay in the acquisition of the ability to use language to communicate needs, wishes, or thoughts.

name: Cerebellar hemorrhage
description: Hemorrhage into the parenchyma of the cerebellum.

name: Macrodontia
description: Increased size of the teeth, which can be defined as a mesiodistal tooth diameter (width) more than 2 SD above mean for age. Alternatively, an apparently increased maximum width of the tooth.

name: Cardiac shunt
description: Pattern of blood flow in the heart that deviates from the normal circuit of the circulatory system.
